Reviews.Title: “Super stay!”
Reviews.Author: JayZeePittsburgh_pa
Reviews.Content: Tapatio Cliffs Resort was better than we expected. We had booked one of their signatgure suites for our 4-day stay in Phoenix and were delighted at how spacious the rooms were, with a commanding view of the nearby mountains from the balcony. The staff were all very attentive, particularly the concierge, who cheerfully provided pre-printed directions to all the sights we were interested in visiting. Food-wise, the breakfast buffet package is well worth purchasing, abundantly set with anything you'd want for breakfast, and then some, and make sure to book a table at Different Pointe of View atop the mountain for one of the finest dinners you'll ever have anywhere. Recreationally, the resort boasts several pools, nearby hiking trails up the mountain, and one of the finest golf courses (Lookout Mountain) in the area. All in all, it was a splendid place to kick back; I'd stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things.....”
Reviews.Author: redhead329
Reviews.Content: I travel ALOT and this by far has been one of my favorite resorts! Our room was excellent, seperate bedroom with 2 beds and a living room area. There was 6 of us, 3 adults and 3 kids and there was plenty of space. The scenery was amazing, the staff was excellent and the price of food was reasonable. Our kids loved the adventure of visiting all 8 pools! The only down side was the adult only pool area with swim up bar was deserted and not even open the hours that were posted. Highly recommend this resort to families that travel with more than the 'average 2 adults 2 kids' .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: BarbinWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Unique property build into side of hills. Walking the property is difficult in some areas (steep hills), however, they do provide a shuttle service. I am not sure about the times of pick up, etc because we did not use it. Many pools located throughout the complex, including an adult pool; refreshing for those who travel without children. Property is located next to a hiking trail that takes you to the Phoenix Mountain Preserves. Awesome large area for hiking and a great informational building is located there as well. The other thing I would like to mention is the restaurant, Point in Tyme. We had wonderful lunches and dinners there. Great food, great prices, wonderful atmosphere. We also enjoyed happy hour there a couple nights as well. Again, great appetizers and drink specials.

Reviews.Title: “Went for work, will be back for fun”
Reviews.Author: RSOdc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort for a conference. The views are breathtaking and I really enjoyed the layout of the resort. Bring your walking shoes if you do not have a car. The gym is nice, but pass it up and take a hike around the resort trail. Even just around the buildings will get your heart rate up with the hills. A Different Pointe of View and Point in Tyme were both excellent in my opinion. The view from A Different Point of View is what will bring me back. I cacn't wait to come back on vacation to play some golf and enjoy this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: lcb47
Reviews.Content: A friend and I (females in our early 20's) stayed at the Tapatio Cliffs Resort on the night of the 10th April. Check in: We arrived fairly late (after 9pm) and check in was quick and painless. The staff were friendly and gave good directions to our room (the resort is big and it took a while to find reception). The room: We stayed in a 2 Queen View Suite, one of the nicest categories as I understand. The suite was spacious, with a large living area and good sized bedroom. It was quite dated but clean. The water pressure in the shower was bad.The view was nice but not spectacular. The food: We ordered room service when we arrived which came quickly. The food was average/good but was pricey for what it was. We had breakfast at the Pointe in Thyme Grill the next day. Our waitress was lovely and very attentive but some of the other staff were less so. The man at the omelette station was positively grumpy, and I heard him complaining to another guest that he used to do night shifts and they had switched him to the morning, when he wasn't a "morning person". I am not used to encountering sullen staff in the US, but maybe he was just having a bad day. Spa: We had arranged spa treatments for the mornings and went over early in the hope of relaxing by the pool for half an hour beforehand. We had put on our swimsuits and asked for a robe to wear. We were told that robes were only available for guests having more than one treatment. After asking whether we could pay to "hire" one, we were begrudgingly given some. We then went to the pool but found the jacuzzi to be out of order. We asked the lady at the spa to point us towards the other nearby jacuzzi but were told to just sit and wait as she'd already told the ladies doing our treatments where we would be. The treatment itself (their signature massage) was pretty average and extremely expensive. I would not rebook. Summary: I don't think I would stay here again. The room served our purposes but was in need of updating. The spa was not the relaxing experience it should have been and the food was overpriced in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Family-friendly and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: fivefromco
Reviews.Content: We were drawn to this resort because it was more affordable than similar family resorts in the area. We weren't disappointed during our four-night stay. It's an older property (30 years) but well maintained. The room was predictable (we had a two-queen suite) and the service was friendly. Our three kids enjoyed swimming in the various pools. We didn't like the Pointe in Tyme restaurant; the cafe by the main pool was good (though slightly over-priced). We really enjoyed a dinner at Different Pointe of View, but if you go make sure to bring your wallet. We used the tennis courts, driving range at the golf course and the nearby hiking trails. A grocery store is one mile away and various restaurants are an easy drive. Bottom line: a good, relaxing place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ross M
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was extremely friendly. Our room had a great view (we stayed in a Mountainside Suite with a northern view). Even though the hotel is located in Phoenix, we found it to be very quiet with an isolated feel. Great for families and also for couples traveling alone. Has many pools including an "adult" pool with comfortable chairs, lots of umbrellas, food service right by the pool, and no kids allowed! Would definitely recommend for anyone. One downside was that there was not free wifi or internet -- we went to a Starbucks to use their free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Grossly Disappointing Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: californiadventurer
Reviews.Content: Noel G was right and we were very disappointed with our experience. We pre-paid to lock in AAA rates and were given a room on the southern end of the property. Upon check-in, we were not provided with a map of the property (needed to find out where the room, pool area, workout area and restaurants were). The wait staff in the Falls pool area was just that - we had to wait on ourselves and when we did finally order food, the guy came without our food asking if there was something we wanted to order. The workout room was in a separate area of the property than the other amenities, so not appealing. There wasn't a vending machine in our building so we went to two machines near the adult pool area and they didn't work. Ended up buying a beverage in the gift shop for $1 more than the vending machine price. A bird squawked above our room from 6:00am-6:30am daily and an abandoned housekeeping cart sat next to our building throughout the day. As you'll see in our pictures, our balcony with a less-than-desirable view had a huge pile of bird poop and the room had mismatched era furnishings. Hard to believe AAA has it as a 4-diamond resort; 3 at best.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential but....”
Reviews.Author: hulahunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in April 2012. We had stayed at this property 10 years ago and it is much larger than I remember. The hotel is built into the mountainside so it is very hilly and spread out. This time we had a room about as far from The Falls pool area as you could get. We took the complimentary shuttle from outside our building to the pool and back. You can call from your room or the call boxes located at each stop. It is pretty efficient and comes within 5 or 10 minutes of calling. The rooms are along the lines of Embassy Suites, with separate living room that has a sofa bed. Our sofa bed was pretty new and had a memory foam mattress rather than the old spring style pull out beds. Another nice feature in the room was the fact that the sink was separate from the shower area. Very helpful when you have a teen age daughter traveling with you. Our biggest complaint had to do with housekeeping. It seemed to be hit or miss. One day we went to the pool around 10:30 and came back to a dirty room at 2:30. After we showered , we called housekeeping to get the room cleaned. When we arrived home that night, a very basic cleaning had been done. They left the room with very little toilet paper (we ran out by morning in fact), they took the sheet from the sofa bed and didn't leave a new one, and we had no tissues. They also did not clean the floor during our stay. There was a small leaf on the bathroom floor that remained for the five nights. I could have picked it up, but I used it as a test to see if they vacuumed. The small leaf remained. We only had breakfast once and it was very good. The wait staff was efficient and courteous. Front desk staff was also pleasant. Workout room was fine. There were several treadmills and elliptical machines each with their own t.v. and there were headphones to use if you forget our own. Overal, property is fine. The problem is that there are so many great resorts in the Phoenix area and this one is nice, but not great. The parking can be limited depending on occupancy and where your building is located. If you aren't much for climbing very steep stairs or roads to get to your room, request one in the lower section when making your reservation. This property needs to be spruced up and housekeeping needs to get a little more with the program.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: cassandra s
Reviews.Content: Driving up to hotel, i was surprised to see how it was laid out. I suppose i was expecting an enclosed building, using other hiltons as my guide. The building are nicely painted and some are at the top of a hill(very steep). The only complaint we had, was that we requested a king bed, but they gave us a room with two doubles. But they were wonderful, they fixed the error and we got our king bed. They view from the room was beautiful. The pool areas are large enough to accomodated all of the hotel guests and not feel crowded. I recommend that you use th hotel shuttle(free). Only wished the hotel had a fridge.OMG! The beds are to die for. I think they filled the matteress and comforter with clouds!

Reviews.Title: “Wish It Would Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Noel G
Reviews.Content: There are a few things to know before booking your stay at this hotel. I have had very good experiences in the past with Hilton, but this resort was not very good. There are a lot of extra fee's associated with this hotel. They are as follows: to use the gym, sit in certain chairs in the pool area, to use the internet, to have shuttle service from the airport, 22% gratuity feel on every item purchased in the rest, pool area, and other services. The staff is a hit or miss. Our room did not get cleaned two out of five days. When I called and complained we discovered that the buttons on the phone didn't work. The lights attached to the bed didnt work. We went to check out paddles for ping pong and they only had one paddle. The girl said "sorry guess you won't be playing today.We don't know where they are." The water machine at the golf course was broken. It's the desert for goodness sake. Overall grounds were crapped out. Housekeeping leaves carts all over. The conference room smelled musty and they left there staff meeting notes for guests to see. No surprise they only had a 40% satisfaction guest rate for March. I was expecting a Hilton resort and this certainly did not live up to the Hilton reputation. Also, this hotel in a crappy neighborhood. Think Compton, CA. Stay in Scottsdale. It it worth the little extra money you may spend to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Main building rooms and grounds review”
Reviews.Author: auroraclubjazz
Reviews.Content: My reviews tend to be long and detailed… My family of four stayed at Tapatio twice in late March 2012 and early April. For our first leg of the trip, we were in the family pool section of the main building. On the return leg of our trip, we were in the adult pool section of the main building. Our Family pool room was on the fourth (top) floor on the side nearest to 7th St. The balcony faced 7th St. You can sit on the balcony (2 chairs and small table). However, there is constant traffic noise from the road, which is quite busy, so keeping your screen door open in cooler weather can be a problem for noise in the morning. The front of the room opens to an interior walkway that overlooks a patio area and the fenced off family pool area. Our Adult pool room was on the fifth (top) floor with the balcony overlooking the cliffs behind the resort. No road traffic noise, but fairly consistent noise from the gas-powered golf carts employees use to get around. The view facing into the resort was much nicer than the view racing the road. Both rooms were identical in layout. The door opens to a small living room with good-sized flat-screen TV, a full-size couch bed, a small writing desk and chair, and a sitting chair. There is also an honor bar that actually had room for some of our own stuff. The short hallway to the bedroom provides the access to the split bathroom, with the toilet and bath on one side (own separate door) and the sink/vanity on the other side of the short hallway. There are two sets of hallway doors – one as you enter the hallway from the living room, and another door to the bedroom. The bath area is large. Our bedroom had two very comfortable queen beds. The wall opposite to the bed has a bench built in, which worked well as a luggage rack, a smaller flat screen TV & dresser in an alcove, and a built in closet with a regular luggage rack. There is no safe in the room. The balcony is accessed by a sliding glass door and locking screen door from the bedroom. Lighting throughout the room was good, and the beds had reading lamps on the sides away from a center lamp. The room was very clean and well kept. We visited the Falls pool complex only once. We rented a cabana for $75 for the very first day since our room was not ready (we arrived at 11 AM) and the Cabana provided a place to change and call home and get out of the sun. We spent most of our time at the Family pool, as it was closer to our room, less crowded, and a tad bit warmer than the Falls pools. The family pool is salt-water, which I really appreciate as it doesn’t burn the eyes. The hot tub pool is adjacent and is good and hot. The family pool also has padded lounge chairs. Some guests are real slobs – leaving their used towels on chairs and empty plastic drink cups at tables when they leave, which makes it confusing to determine what chairs/tables are available for use. We checked out some of the other pools in the hillside sections – they are much smaller that the main building and Falls pools. Used room service and the restaurants several times. Fair prices. Room service pizza is good and not overpriced. About a mile north is a shopping area with restaurants, drug store, grocery stores etc. – but you need to drive to it. Good coffee in the lobby, along with tea, cereal, pastries and fruit. Great gift shop. The architecture and layout of the main building and of the resort is fascinating. It is fun to walk around and explore. Parking is tough – although there are parking lots all over, many of the stalls are very narrow. Our rental car company “upgraded” us to a too large sedan and we ended up getting a door scratch from a neighboring car. The parking areas closer to 7th street are much less crowded and have more space. My one complaint is with their early check-in process. I tried calling a day ahead and was told by the operator that we would have to go to the front desk to request early check in, give them a cell phone #, and could use the pool while we waited. So we arrived at 11 AM, gave them our # and headed off to the pool. At about 3:30 we still had not been called so I went to the front desk and they told me my room was not yet ready. I had to ask if another room was ready, and they said sure and got me right in. Not sure why when guests are waiting for a room, they stick with waiting for a pre-assigned room instead of offering them a vacant room. Almost all of the rooms are identical. Odd. If we happen to be in Phoenix again, I would not hesitate to stay at Tapatio, though I might try to get way up the hill for a change of pace, and also spring for the executive suite since the Hilton “book an upgrade at reduced rates if they are available – you will find out at check-in” gimmick has never worked for me.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: caroljoyj
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, well appointed, clean. I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Tapatio Cliffs Resort Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from taking our grandson to Spring Training. We stayed at Tapatio Cliffs four nights and found the accommodations family friendly and the staff very accommodating. This is an older property but well maintained with recent renovations. Dinner in the family restaurant was excellent. Scramble on 7th St. is a top choice for breakfast, also!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Arizona..”
Reviews.Author: Rchad
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with great scenary and pools galore but get your walking shoes ready. This is an extremely hilly property but free resort shuttles are provided. Great for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: njrwaterparkextrme
Reviews.Content: I love it it had an awesome pool and the food is great

Reviews.Title: “8 pools including a water slide - All-suites resort”
Reviews.Author: Brad H
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort for kids. (McDonlad's is one mile away.) They had at least one activity for kids every day by the pool. My only complaint is the rooms smell old and musty.

Reviews.Title: “Away from it all, but close enough to everything”
Reviews.Author: UtahCountyMickey
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, but well kept property. I loved being up in the mountains away from the bustle of the city, but I was close enough that I could drive 5 minutes to anything I needed. If you don't have a car, there isn't anything within walking distance. So you'll have to use the restaurants at the hotel. I didn't get a chance to use them, but everyone I talked to said they were great. The service staff was one of the best I've seen as I've traveled across the country.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed and fun pool!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaWh
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night with our family since we were headed to another resort out of Phoenix, but we enjoyed the pool complex very much. Our room wasn't ready at check-in time, so even though we had reserved a FallsView Suite, we ended up taking a room in the main building. It was smallish and had no view, but it met our needs. The bed was terrific and the sofa bed plenty comfortable for our two teens. We commented that it would be a good value resort to spend a few more days another time. The staff seemed quite overworked, and a few things needed maintenance in our room (TV not working, squeaky doors) but the front desk just attributed it to being very busy during spring break. We suggest they staff up for these times to provide a better experience. But overall we thought it was good value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: irishfaith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and I really liked the resort! The rooms were great - clean, comfortable, cozy. My room didn't have a refrigerator, but that was ok. They had several pools and it was very nice. I stayed in the main building - which I loved. Some people had to stay in other parts of the resort and they seemed VERY far away from the main building. I was very lucky and loved my location! I would stay here again and look forward to going back. The check in process was good, but they never told me how to get to my room or where to park. It was a little odd, I've never had a check-in process where I didn't know where to go or what to do afterwards. I heard the same story from several people at my conference. The restaurants on the property were not great. This is a major area of improvement for this resort. We sat at the various restaurants for 2+ hours still without food. I ordered room service twice and it was good - it arrived within 30 minutes both times, but it was expensive. Your best bet for this hotel is to eat off site. There are several good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: ddali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three night's recently. The resort is beautiful, pool area is very nice with good service. The room was spacious with a separate living area. It was all very clean and tastefully decorated. I highly recommend happy hour at pointe in time restaurant, it is a bargain especially for a resort like this. The food and drinks were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Magoo56
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Signature Suite for 3 days in March; thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The swimming pools / jacuzzis were terrific, especially the one buried in the cliffs near our suite. Breakfasts were great and affordable. The tennis courts need to be updated somewhat, but otherwise just fine. Service was outstanding. Really enjoyed and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I remembered”
Reviews.Author: rescuesport
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here more than 15 years ago and decided it was karma to return with my husband. The hotel has had a major make over but over all it was still old and tired. I requested a room with a view, submitted an upgrade request and if you can call peering between two buildings a view then I guess that's what we had. The property was load, to much car traffic within the complex near our room. The new pool area is nice but the other areas need updating. We enjoyed a nice dinner at the main restaurant, couldn't even get into the one on top of the hill with the view. The room was clean but even with a suite it was small and for $200 a night it was over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Near Local Amenities and Attractions”
Reviews.Author: tuanadaisy
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time staying at this hotel and enjoyed it considerably. Driving in however, we were a little put off by the surrounding area, the hotel seems out of place for the area, but once inside the resort you'd never know. Staff was very accommodating and we enjoyed the stsay greatly.

Reviews.Title: “Try shampooing the carpets”
Reviews.Author: Why0221
Reviews.Content: I carry status at Hilton, SPG and Marriott. I must tell you that there is a fundamental disconnect within Hilton when it comes to making a room smell good. I experience awful odor here as well as the El Conquistador in Tucson. What gives? Parking at night at this property is a total and complete joke. If they put you in one of the outer bldgs insist on the main bldg. I'd expect this kind of smell at a ocean resort. Not in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Great Desert Stay”
Reviews.Author: janfouroneone
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful for our trip. We even decided to stay extra days. Very comfortable large rooms, excellent service, beautiful grounds, wonderful pool seats all made a relaxing time. There are many trails winding around the property along with other fun things to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: rjding
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to visit many up scale hotel/vacation properties for more years than I will share with you. The service, friendlessness, and over all service from every person during our stay at this location was second to none. Regardless of where on the property we were the service was excellent from the front desk, wait staff, pool workers, van drivers, ect. Kudos all around.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: vcsmith
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on our first night and were greeted at the front desk by Zane. He was very helpfull and apoligized that our room ( last one available ) did not have a great view so he suggested that we check with "Helen" the next morning and try and get a view room as we were staying for 7 nights and traveled a long way. The next morning Helen did a great job for us and had the resort driver take us around the resort and show us a few different suites to choose from. We found a great spot and they even ensured that an adjoining room was left for my brother and his wife who were showing up in another day. The main pool area was really fantastic and we highly enjoyed hanging around the pool and soaking up the sun. I must say everyone at the resort was friendly and helpfull. Beware of the cost of the attached golf course and book via the concierce to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Getting to the Point on the Pointe”
Reviews.Author: LynnHeffernan
Reviews.Content: We have travelled around the world and have experienced many resorts. This resort's service was outstanding. The mountain views were stunning, especially at the Pointe of View Restaurant, where we had patio drinks and watched the sun set. We also had dinner there, a wonderful gourmet experience! The poolside food was very good as well. Just steps from the pool was a magnificent desert walk with many trials to follow. We walked the serene trials every morning. Rooms were spacious and but simple. Beds were extremely comfortable. My husband enjoyed his golf experience here. The course is highly rated and and has reasonable rates at twilight. We will return again to experience this desert oasis. Lynn and Regan

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mfosh55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days with our 6 year old and will without question be back. Pools are great, with plenty of activities for the kids. Clean rooms, food was awesome, great location. We had a couple real good waiters at the Falls pool that were right there when we needed them. Ver large property, if you have children, you may want to request being closer to pool. Other than that, you can't lose with this property!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: jjduffy
Reviews.Content: Excellent facilities for a great price. Look for discounts they can be had even in high season for a resort with 8+ pools, challenging desert golf couse, tennis, work out facilities and more. Staff is friendly, maid staff outstanding. Great value for a Phoenix Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Tapatio Cliffs was an excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: tericita123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Pointe Tapatio from March 4 - 9, 2012 and it was a positive and wonderful experience. The staff is helpful, friendly, courteous and the concierge helped us plan our daily adventures successfully. I was especially impressed with printed cards they handed out which had easy to follow directions to all the tourist spots I wished to visit. I recommend that you book a room high up on the cliff where it is quiet and the views are spectacular. You must experience the restaurant/lounge called, "THE POINTE OF VIEW" as the outdoor firepit and breathtaking views outweight the pricey (but delicious) menu! I appreciated the layout of the room because I stay up late and could watch TV in the living room and close two sets of doors leading to the bedroom so my friend could sleep without any TV noise. Being an avid hiker, I enjoyed the 51 miles of trails which begin right from the hotel! All the restaurant meals we experienced were quality and I will come back again. A great value considering the beautiful resort, views, incredible waterfall pool and relaxing ambience. I will be coming back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - AMAZING People”
Reviews.Author: VickyLynne
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Tapatio Clifs. Journeyed there with my college daughter on her spring break. The room was very spacious, clean, with neat features such as a lighted closet. I also liked that the bath area was completely separated from the sink/vanity area. This made it much easier for multiple people to get ready at the same time. The pools were simply lovely...lovely water features and plants all around. The adult pool had like 4" cushions on the lounges -- very comfortable. But what struck me the most was the friendliness of the staff. Everywhere you went they called out a warm greeting and wanted to know if they could do anything to make your stay more enjoyable. I truly don't know when I've had such a warm welcome from hotel staff. It really was amazing. My only negative about the property --- The 2 main restaurants are fine dining and expensive. The ones available for reasonable pricing do not have very extensive menus. Your choices are limited. This would be an area the property could definitely improve upon. I would HIGHLY recommend Tapatio Cliffs to you if you are going to be in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort in Phoenix yet in the middle of a desert preserve.”
Reviews.Author: Blake H
Reviews.Content: I am a long standing Hilton Diamond member and have been coming to the Pointe at least once a year for the past 20 years for both business as well as pleasure. Though we have traveled extensively and have stayed in very nice properties, the Hilton Point Tapatio is our very favorite. The resort has never looked better. The associates were as welcoming and hospitable as can be. We had a fire one evening and entertained some dear friends that happened to be in the area. Our remodeled signature room was the perfect venue for a relaxing and enjoyable evening. I am not sure what distinguishes a five diamond property from a four diamond but we have absolutely no suggestions for how things could be any nicer! B.Hamilton

Reviews.Title: “Fun Family Resort... Horrible Front Desk Experience”
Reviews.Author: Erin D
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is very nice, the rooms are a little worn but the pool areas and outside areas were great! Almost all the staff was wonderful! The concierge helped us find everything we needed it! Housekeeping helped us find the gym by basically walking us there and the Bellman/ Valet man from Minnesota was extremely friendly and patient with our endless amount of luggage. Everyone was great besides one young lady at the Front Desk. She wasn't wearing a nametage so I couldn't catch her name but she was young and had dirty blonde hair. Everything that came out of her mouth was rude when she was checking us out, she obviously didn't want us to return. We had an issue with the internet charge and she basically told us we were lying. She didn't even thank us or say have a great day when we left, I was appauld. If she really hates her job that much she should choose a different profession. What would have been a wonderful experience ended up being very dissapointing. I think we might choose to stay at the Fairmont Princess next time. Much better guest service!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need some updating.”
Reviews.Author: Gary J
Reviews.Content: If you have any health issues or are over 50 stay away from the rooms on the cliffs. Best restaurant is the one by the golf pro shop-Point in Tyme , ask for AJ as he's a great guy and server. The restaurant on the mountain top is quite expensive and has the most snobbish waiters in the state...time to rotate you staff management.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Jill M
Reviews.Content: The staff, the grounds and the suites are perfect for a wonderful vacation. The customer service we consistently receive at this resort is outstanding. The grounds are absolutely stunning and well kept. The suites are spacious and inviting. On top of that, when making reservations with small children in several rooms, the staff is incredibly thoughtful in their choice of locations for the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Booking through 3rd Party”
Reviews.Author: Johnny Q
Reviews.Content: In general, we had a fantastic time at the Pointe Hilton. The resort is set in a wonderful location and the service/amenities were top notch. Our only complaint was with the room. We booked a king suite through our credit card reward program. When we arrived at our room, we realized they had placed us in a suite for disabled persons. The resort appeared to be much less than full, so i figured it was a mistake and went to inquire at the front desk. When I arrived, I was told that it was not a mistake and that we were placed in that room because we must have booked with Priceline. I told the staff member that that wasn't the case and requested a different room. Unfortunately, I was told they were sold out and would have to stay there or move to a double queen. We ended up staying because our teenage daughter wanted a separate room. Ultimate, it was manageable, but not ideal. The room smelled a bit moldy, which is not a surprise given the layout of the bathroom. Because there is nothing to catch the water while showering, the water simply runs all over the bathroom floor and stays there much longer than desired. We were forced to take very quick showers or use multiple towels on the floor to try to keep the floor from being covered with water.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property: Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Speaker76
Reviews.Content: Over the past 20 years we have stayed at this resort six times at least. The resort and the people here never disappoint. Each suite is set in a creative location. Choose views of the city to the north or the south. Higher suites tend to be more spectacular. The Presidential suites are amazingly spacious and certainly worth the upgrade if you are traveling with kids or want a splurge of amenities. The full continental breakfast at the Pointe of Tyme is not to be missed. Often the front office staff is able to include it in your package, but is well worth an extra $15 upgrade for 2 persons (retail $17/person). The staff is amazingly helpful, from the first person you meet to the bell men, to the concierge, and to the cleaning staff. Each person seems genuinely happy to have you stay at their property. The property itself is not quite as dramatic (though is certainly quite beautiful and meticulously kept) as some of the Scottsdale or Camelback Resorts. But, what it lacks in ostentation, it makes up in beauty, peacefulness, attractive and varied pools, and a real "resort-desert" experience which embraces the locale without covering it up. Activities at the resort are varied for all: tennis or golf are excellent, as well as a great variety of hiking trails which start right at the resort. But to be honest, your best bet is to hang out at the resort: daytime lounging at the many pools, and evenings enjoying the views with a bottle of wine and cheese on your private balcony. When you drive to the resort approach it from the north: off Thunderbird Road, even if your Garmin advises an earlier exit off Highway 51. The trip will be easier and more scenic, as the neighborhoods south of the resort are not unsafe, but are full of empty storefronts, etc. Enjoy this resort: it is as good as any of the best in the metro area. We have stayed at the "best" and return happily to the Pointe Tapatillo.

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms - great property for families”
Reviews.Author: keepthelighton4me
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Pointe Hilton, as in the past I have always stayed at hotels in Scottsdale. This property is located a fair distance (20 min or so) from all of the restaurants/shopping available in Scottsdale. However, if you are not interested in any of that - this would not be a factor. It is an expansive property which many other reviewers have done a great job of describing (lots of hills, multiple pools, restaurants). I would not consider this a luxury resort, but there are quite a few pluses. The rooms are large (living room, bedroom, balcony) which is ideal for multiple guests. The multiple pools allow for are tailored to different audiences (adults only, family, large pool with bar, etc.) I had a facial at the spa and it was fantastic. There were a lot of kids and families - and I imagine this hotel is a great option for them. There were a few... opportunities. Went in search of ice one evening and we had to travel to four different ice machines until we found one that worked. Ran into several elevators that did not work. The pool staffing was stretched thin - so service was sporadic. (To their credit - they were hustling to keep up.) The carpet in the suite would be well served by a deep cleaning. Overall it was a good stay - but, I would really recommend this property for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for all”
Reviews.Author: Satphone
Reviews.Content: I have wrote a review in the past and it was accurate however last time I checked in I kept the map of the location and can add some additional incite to what one might ask for with regard to a room depending on what they want from their stay. First, parking is tight but there is no charge for it. If you drive a dually pickup you may need to park some distance from your room. Should you be in a compact sedan your odds of being closer to your room are much much better. I need to state again that the service from all of the staff is great and I have little doubt you would have any trouble getting help with your bags to the room. I have stayed in rooms near the resort lobby and the family pool and adult pool and they work well for groups with several or more rooms and those who enjoy spending time at the pool. Foot traffic and noise is higher in these areas but not bad overall. If you have young children this might be the best area to be in. The flip side of the above mentioned rooms is up on hill. I have stayed in building 7 on the top floor and that had a nice view overlooking the various pools and much of the resort as well as there is a spa just across the drive carved out in the side of the cliff that is very handy. Buildings 21, 19, 17 back up to the cliff and that is rather nice too. I have stayed on the top floor of building 19 and was able to walk out my door and down a few steps and I was in the desert. Should you want to go for an early morning walk that is very handy and also very cool. If you stay in some of these buildings it can be a bit of a hike to the restaurants but there are shuttles on the property as well. I do like the resort, it is not brand new however the service stands our as being far better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, friendly but layout hindered by building design”
Reviews.Author: dwcbuckeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid February for 3 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pools were a big hit with our kids which was one of the primary reasons we chose this hotel. Lookout mountain golf course was on the property and was exceptional. Be sure and go to pointe of view restaurant at the tippy top of the property, fantastic views. Overall good experience, but i would likely not go back to this hotel for the following reasons: location is really not close to any points of interest. You would need to drive for a good 15 minutes to get anywhere interesting. Also the properties layout does not have walkways or sidewalks to get around, so you need to walk in the street. Just not super convienent and there is a lot of great hotels in Phoenix to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RuthieSeattle
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay with our almost three year old. Nice suite with pull out couch, very comfortable and typical top notch Hilton service. Loved the falls pool, but there are pools everywhere! Drinks at pool spendy but good, as expected. Food was ok, nothing special, but we didn't try the fancy restaurant at the top of the hill either. Very quiet and secluded resort, situated right in the reserve with hiking right there! Nice neighborhood and centrally located. We will return on our next phoenix trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: IrishfFan
Reviews.Content: Loved this property - the grounds were gorgeous and the hotel staff was friendly. The hotel is built right into a mountain so the roads are really steep but I like to exercise and found I liked to walk around. I didn't try any of the restaurants but did hike up to the Different Pointe of View restaurant to check out the view and it was stunning. There is also a trailhead up there to pick up if you want to hike the mountain. The Falls Park pool area was awesome - lots of different options. I had my little daughter with me and she loved the pool. It was a lot of fun. The rooms are also all suites which was a nice perk. I wish I could have stayed longer. The only slightly annoying aspect was the check-in process - there was a huge line but they did the best they could with 3 agents. Other than that, I'd certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stop. You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: WishIWasTravlngNow
Reviews.Content: Staying here as I write this. It is just ok. Rooms are fine. Service is fine, but it is just ok and you can do better in this area. The hotel is about 30 years old. They have updated the rooms, but you can still tell it is an older property. Stucco walls, tacky pink buildings interspersed with neutral colors. Rooms are spacious, but a little awkward in some places, like the "toilet closet" where the door is almost too big for the space itself. The grounds are spacious, but I can't really tell where I am at in relation to things. There was no map in my room. There is a spa, but there was no spa information in my room, so I had to ask at the front desk. By the time I tried to get an appointment (once I had seen the services), the spa was closed. Got cozy in my PJs and wanted to watch a movie. Turned on the TV and couldn't find any movies, so I called the front desk. Was told that when they "upgraded" to the flat screen TVS (what hotel these days doesn't have flat screen TVS?), they didn't "turn on" the "On Demand." So my option was to go to the front desk and rent a DVD player. I could get my head around putting my clothes back on and doing that, but then I was told that the nearest movie place was "Red Box" (or something) and that it was not within walking distance of the hotel. Awesome. There goes my relaxing night. Not to be thwarted from my plans, I thought, "I will watch a movie on my computer, even though the screen is tiny!" So I tried to log on to wireless from the bedroom. As with what had happened earlier in the day, the wireless showed as "connected" but I could not access the Internet. So I called Tech Support. After 10 minutes of troubleshooting, he confirmed that I am indeed "connected" but that whatever I am "connected" to, wasn't connecting out. So he would need to call "the location" and have them address it. As promised, Maintenance showed up within 10 minutes (score for being prompt). They messed around with the back of my TV for a while, but alas, they could not fix the WiFi. They did helpfully remind me that I do have Internet access via the all cable, and here I now sit, writing this review. I DO have a connection (thank goodness), but it is not at all what I was hoping for. So. The resort is "fine". There are some nice pools, though I have not yet seen them. The people have been friendly enough. But I really do think you can do better with your money in this area. Not impressed. I want to be, but I'm not. Oh - last thing... it is a resort, but the "bar" is not anywhere near the lobby. Had to walk down a somewhat creepy (at night) walkway between a large conference building and the resort itself to get to "the bar". Once at the bar, it was fine, but then had to do the creepy walk back to civilization and my room. Again. Just not what I was hoping for here. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Pack Your Hiking Shoes!”
Reviews.Author: Imaginedoc
Reviews.Content: I need to make an initially statement on this hotel before going into details. This place was an engineering challenge and it's maintenance issues are reflective of that challenge. If you stay here, you'll understand why. The Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort is another very good Hilton property, but has an identity crisis. The rooms in the main hotel are up to date and quite nice, yet the rooms in the suites and outlying structures are quite dated and unkept, so beware if you make a reservation for a suite because you may be greatly disappointed. The resort itself is built into the side of a cliff, with the hotel at the base and the surrounding buildings (where the suites are located) built above it. This makes traversing the resort very challenging because all the activities are adjacent to the main hotel building. There are shuttles that will move guests between locations, but I found these to be very unreliable (it would sometimes take 30 minutes for them to arrive to pick us up). The parking was also an issue because in many cases you had to navigate and park on very steep hills and this is not easy to do, especially at night. For food and beverages, the resort offers several different options to choose from. The one 'must-see' in this resort is the Different Pointe of View restaurant located at the highest part of the property. From here you will enjoy a breathtaking view of the Phoenix valley while enjoying a good meal and cocktails with friends or colleagues. The grounds were clean but maintenance was an issue for simple things like handrails, elevators and signage-perhaps an indicator of how hard this hotel has been hit by the recession. The rooms (we had a suite) also showed signs of cheap repairs in that old, beat up wood work was simply painted over vs. replaced and this a disappointment. The staff of this hotel was it's saving grace for sure. They were pleasant and helpful despite any concerns I presented and provided assistance in any way they could. I would stay here again in the future, but would likely stay down in the hotel for the sake of convenience and to avoid a heavy leg workout trying to get around the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A WOW experience”
Reviews.Author: Ltnjoe
Reviews.Content: Was at this hotel for 2 days for an offsite conference with my organization and it was an excellent experience with all aspects of this Hotel. Though an older hotel, you would never know it by the looks of the rooms, all suites and all their facilities. The staff was extremely welcoming and professional and always at hand to provide assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Place - Strange Process”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it's my lack of familiarity with a "resort," but I found this property confusing. After I had made my reservation online, I was offered the opportunity for a "low cost" upgrade if the upgraded room was available upon check-in. At check in they had my original reservation, but made no mention what-so-ever about an upgrade. I mentioned that I had put in for one, and the check in clerk played with the computer for a while. (I must stress she was most courteous and helpful.) I told her I was confused by the "offering" on the web site, but that there were supposedly large suites available. She identified a classification of a room. As it turned out, there was an upgraded suite was available for an additional $29 per night. We were given our key, and told to go across the lobby to the gift shop and give our welcome letter to the shop proprieter for complimentary water, and the to see the concierge for directions to our room. (bouncy bouncy anyone?) We got our water, and the concierge explained how to find our room.... and off we went. The entire "resort" is built into a mountain (see other reviews) so the drive up and parking was different. The views are WONDERFUL. However, we noticed there was not one other car parked anywhere near the building where we were directed. This was ok by me as it made for easier parking. The suite was very very large. Nice "living room," nice bedroom, a bath suite at the end of the bedroom, a separate half bath off the living room "Kitchenette" area. BEWARE of the "Kitchenette." It is actually merely a wet bar with a full refrigerator of insanely high priced snacks and drinks. We found an information sheet about the "resort." For an additional $25, they will remove the stuff from your refrigerator. Also included in the information sheet was the ability to spend an additional $2.75 per day for access to the gym and a few other things that I would think would be included at the over $230 per night price. The suite was strange. It had been renovated as it had granite counters and flat panel TVs, and probably new furniture. (I personally found only the desk chair really comfortable...but I have a bad back and am fussy about chairs.) However, there were two thermostats on the wall and we could not figure out what they were for. As this was early February in Phoenix, we did not have to make too much use of the heating system, so we did NOT bother to ask for assistance. The bathroom fixtures had not been recently renovated. Driving up to the top of the hill, where there was a restaurant (which I believe we were told at check-in we needed to make reservations for if we wanted to eat there) and a parking lot. The view into the valley from this parking lot was ever bit as spectacular as the view one gets after hiking up (or walking up the road) at North Mountain. Simply wonderful. As we drove around the resort we seemed to think there is a main central building, and the various buildings up the hill. The "main" building appeared to be newer than the buildings up the hill. Perhaps if one is familiar with resorts, or plays gulf, this place may be more appreciated. Another strangeness: wifi was available in the lobby, but one had to pay $10 per day for wired wifi in the suite. For the view, and access to the Phoenix Mountain Parks (hiking trails), this place is great. Perhaps if you know somebody familiar with this place it might be great. As a member of Hilton's loyalty program, I am terribly disappointed in this property. If you can obtain a great rate, it may be worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, cliffside rooms. Fun golf course!”
Reviews.Author: SanMN
Reviews.Content: Nice resort. I book this resort based on the golf course review. Hotel, room was in unique setting. From my cliffside suite, it was cozy, not specutacular nor impressive, but I wasn't disappointed with the course; a fun, challenging course. Yardage off the tee was bit mixed (on a handful of holes, Championship tees were with the regular Men's tees). The course is in great shape. Greens were tight, moderately fast with angilations but fiar, readable, no optical illusions. I can definitely see myself playing the course again.

Reviews.Title: “Great access to the great outdoors”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort is in a location that will thrill the guest who is looking for easy access to desert hiking. The hotel is made up of multiple colorful Spanish style buildings. The entire property is integrated into a hillside making the rooms at the top a very long hike up a steep slope. This was no problem for us since the weather was beautiful and we came for hiking. The lobby and restaurants are at the bottom. The rooms are suite style and were clean and pleasant with a mini fridge. The furnishings were nothing special but the bed was very comfortable and pristine in white linens. The breakfast served in the Pointe of Tyme restaurant was buffet style or menu option and was very, very good. Excellent, friendly table service and nicely displayed buffet items which were of restaurant quality for the most part. The dinner menu at Pointe of Tyme did not disappoint either nor the service. The BEST part about the Tapatio is that there are hiking trails all over, with the North Mountain park just across the street by underpass. A very nice visitor center awaits with trail information and exhibits. A person can also hike up the slope from the top of the hotel property, or through the lowlands adjacent. We spotted coyotes on one hike. Many people seemed to be enjoying golfing but we enjoyed the more rugged terrain nearby while being able to return to a very nice room and a great meal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: PDXreviewer
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I met here for a well-deserved girls' weekend getaway. We found our room on Priceline for $80 per night, which was an excellent deal given all the amenities and fantastic service. Pros: Very friendly, responsive staff (especially Dick, Ed, Amanda, and Eric). Really, everyone from the shuttle drivers to the spa staff, to the breakfast waitstaff were friendly, professional, and very helpful. Great buffet breakfast, beautiful city and mountain views and comfortable outdoor seating at Another Pointe of View restaurant, fantastic pools and hot tubs, a substantial gift shop with everything you need, very nice bedding and extremely comfortable beds, excellent hiking trails with easy trail head access, convenient to a great restaurant called Scramble. Cons: Another family had two noisy dogs with them. They barked outside in the street in front of our room two out of the three mornings--loudly enough and long enough to wake us up. Be sure to request a room far from dogs if you don't want a doggie wake-up call. The cabanas require a rental fee of $95, which seemed silly to us given that the property was not crowded with pool guests. Perhaps the high cost was why we never saw anyone actually using the cabanas. A better deal is to hang out at one of the smaller pools which we had almost completely to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Diane F
Reviews.Content: For a recent work conference, Helen at the front desk, was most accommodating and helpful in moving me to a new room, after the room in the hills was most challenging for me after a recent surgery. She took care of all the details in getting my items moved to the new room so I wouldn't have to miss any of my conference. Thank you Helen!

Reviews.Title: “Gem on the hillside”
Reviews.Author: 3Mice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a conference; rooms are incredibly spacious. The property is built into and up a hillside, so unless you're staying in the main building, prepare for a bit of a trek up or downhill to get to where you need to go – however, even if you don't have a car, they offer a shuttle service which will take you to your room and back down to the main buildings. The restaurant that sits on the top of the hill offers amazing vistas – do go take a look from up there, even if just for a moment. Wasn't able to make use of the pools due to a cold weather snap, but they looked very nice. Would definitely return (roomy enough to stay with the entire family). Conference facility and food were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: jtdman37
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort for a company function. The staff was wonderful. The resort was probably a five star property 15 years ago, but has started to show its age. My room was large and very clean. The resort has a very "interesting" layout, and the bell hop mentioned taking a month to understand the layout completely. Some elevators don't go to the bottom floor and required you to travel out of the way. The views were great from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, not awful; a tad above average”
Reviews.Author: Ryan F
Reviews.Content: Pros: The rooms are clean and spacious. We had a balcony that gave a great view of the resort as well as Phoenix. Room service was very good. Cons: Room service was beyond overpriced. This is a VERY hilly resort. You are often walking up and down steep hills to get to your room or the pool. Subsequently, the parking is spotty. We had to park on a side street, on a hill, and walk to our room every day. A bit frustrating. We didn't use the pool or any of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing down time”
Reviews.Author: Brenda P
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided this hotel could provide the amenities and atmosphere that I was needing for a relaxing break this winter. I was not disappointed. The sleeping rooms were comfortable and roomy and ours had a great view. The spa experience was worth every penny, professional and knowledgeable staff provided terrific therapeutic massages. The resort is located within walking distance of state hiking trails that are well maintained and the visitor center provides maps and information about the area. All of the workout facility equipment was state of the art and the steam and dry saunas added to our overall enjoyment of the resort. The shuttle was great for getting around the resort especially when we had to walk uphill, I highly recommend using this amenity, we never had to wait for more than 2-3 minutes for a ride. I have to mention the great meals we enjoyed at the restaurant by the Golf Shop, the Point of View. we actually ate every meal there. Not only was the food terrific, we were well taken care of by the wait staff, especially A.J., he really made eating there a highlight of our trip. Thanks A.J. ! If I have one thing to recommend it would be making a visit to this restaurant a priority of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Third year we have returned!”
Reviews.Author: phoenixtraveler0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this resort the last 3 years in a row for one of our annual staycations. The reason we return year after year is due to the friendly, helpful customer service, fantastic views, comfortable and clean suite style rooms and tropical pool area. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this resort during an meeting I attended there. The hotel sprawls below and on the side of a hill with steep winding roads connecting the various buildings in an attractive manner. Guest rooms are in individual buildings across the property with an adjacent golf course and other typical resort amenities. We had a very comfortable room up on the hillside with an outstanding view from the doorway. The grounds are very attractive with many natural features. There are multiple swimming pools, excellent meeting facilities, and a large and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, ugly rooms”
Reviews.Author: curlyaggie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here as the conference I was attending was booked here. I had stayed at the sister property, Squaw Peak, 2 years prior, and remembered the rooms being very welcoming and serene. We came a day early to celebrate our anniversary and explore Phoenix. The disappointment began at checkin, when we were told that though we'd reserved a king bed, there were none available, unless we wanted by the service elevator. "But we have a queen." Fine. Get to the room--double doubles; the rooms are all promoted as "suites", but they were small and felt cramped. I had a visceral reaction to the ugly colors of the room--kind of a chartreuse yellow and avocado green. At $179/night, I decided to look for alternatives. Called the front desk, and they checked Squaw Peak, but it was booked. They offered to move us to a larger suite, which was acceptable. "And how about a bottle of champagne?" I said that would be lovely; however, it never arrived. I wanted to enjoy a sunset drink in the lounge at the top--A Different Pointe of View--but it was closed for "special events" 3 nights in a row. I did eat there with colleagues, and it was a delicious meal--really the bright spot of the week. It was fine for the conference, but my review is really geared to the rooms. I will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: klrchef
Reviews.Content: We are currently finishing a 3 night stay for R&R from our busy lives. Wonderful property, staff are all very hospitable and make you feel very welcome. Different Pointe of View was a marvelous dining experience with Ian providing first class service and enjoyable conversation, the Pork Belly is not to be missed. The shuttles up the hill were very timely and made it easy to get to the restaurant. We also met old friends at the Terrace Room for another very nice evening of nice wines and apps that were equally as good as DPV. In the interest of full disclosure I have to admit I had the Pork Belly again! Will absolutly stay at this resort next time we are in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “The Point of View Restaurant, menu, food and experience are world class.”
Reviews.Author: starr-travels
Reviews.Content: Sunsets, view, menu, preparation and service are outstanding - 5stars +. This was a pleasant surprise that will be remembered.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year Eve”
Reviews.Author: wdesalvo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the king suites for the weekend to celebrate ringing in the new year. Great location and superb suites. The staff was great. Once on the propery, they take you to any location. No need to hop in the car and drive from site to site. Great for the NYE celebration, pick up at room, deliver to restaurant and return after partying. Really nice resort!! The Terrace, below the Different Point of View restaurant, is a great place to sit in the evening and enjoy a relaxing drink w/ a great view ofPhoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location in the Valley and beautiful surroundings!”
Reviews.Author: maryk1968
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this resort! We arrived at about 1am ...about a 10-15 minute drive from the airport? Be sure to arrive with walking shoes on as the parking is usually on a hill...ours in particular was on a pretty steep grade. Our room was as described and we were happy to find the split bathroom...toilet shower on one side and sink area on the other. The only thing I would ask for is a lamp on the desk. I am an early riser and with pull out couch and both beds in use....there was nowhere for me to just sit and read without feeling I might wake someone. Gym was well equipped and there was a sauna and steam room. Be sure to wake up early for your workout then hit the top of the mountain for a sunrise treat! Water park was nice for my younger son...possibly lacking extra fun things for my teen. He would have faired better with friends along. I have family in Glendale and we had other relatives staying in Scottsdale. This was nicely located between.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View for 10 days”
Reviews.Author: J-and-B-007
Reviews.Content: We just returned to Toronto, Canada from a 10 day stay at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. We were impressed with the knowledgeable staff - in particular Anna and Ed. Our first room in the main building was a little noisy the first night. Our room was immediately changed to a quiet room, on higher ground overlooking the complex. The main dining area was just fine. The staff were extremely professional and the food was very good. The only unfortunate experience on this property was the restaurant at the top. The view was spectacular, the food was very basic. After the lobster bisque (which was ok) the rest of the meal was downhill. We paid alot of $$$ and had to wait 3 days for a reservation - what a disappointment. for the same $$$, we would go back to Mastro's Ocean Club in Scottsdale or J&G Steakhouse at the Phoenician - WOW!!!!

Reviews.Title: “huge resort that is in need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: induway
Reviews.Content: Like a middle-ager, this hotel looks better from afar than up close. Nestled in the hills, this is a HUGE resort - almost like a little city with its clusters of buildings. The PLUSES? - rooms are huge (our room was a suite with a huge sitting area and separate bedroom) - flat screen TVs in bedroom and sitting area - relative quiet The MINUSES? - HORRENDOUS wifi charges - $9.95 per day per connection. So if you have two people with computers that's almost $20/day. ridiculous - The water in the showers was lukewarm - even at the highest setting. - Half of the electrical outlets in our room did not work - when I called the front desk, they said someone from property management would come by to check - no one came - Pools seemed unclean - everything looked used and slightly grimy - especially in the Falls area. - The Falls area deck chairs, environs, tables were all in need of replacement. Also the Falls place is a just gross in general - too many people... it kind of smells and feels like a Spring Break hotel pool. It was not horrible, it was just meh. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Falls pool”
Reviews.Author: Justdeb55
Reviews.Content: We came with our 20 something children for a holiday getaway. We got exactly what we requested: 1 double and 1 king suite adjoining, perfect for the 5 of us. We enjoyed the pools, especially the falls daily. We got massages at the Spa, worked out in the gym and enjoyed the property. The resort is large and never felt crowded. The staff was friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views!”
Reviews.Author: Drifters52011
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 spent Christmas at the Tapatio Cliffs. We too were overwhelmed by the huge expanse of this property. The landscaping and numerous pools were all beautiful and sparkling clean. The walking paths made it easy to get to the lobby for a morning coffee but if you want to go the restaurant at the top of the resort call the shuttle. The view at night was breathtaking! We had breakfast and other meals/cocktails in the Pointe in Thyme restaurant. The food was actually good and the lounge menu prices were very reasonable and the portions meal sized. Our room was adequate, clean, and spacious enough for all of us to stay comfortably. I do wish there were 2 separate bedrooms however. Many of the rooms were unsold leaving us with a private pool and Jacuzzi right outside our door. The staff of this resort was more than accommodating and always friendly and helpful. It was a pleasure to stay here and I do have to say the great staff would make me return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “for active energetic people”
Reviews.Author: adkmts46er
Reviews.Content: because of the challenging terrain, which is also the allure of the location, this resort is for active and energetic people. We had a great value for Christmas weekend. About $120 for suite with view and breakfast coupons (good for $12 toward breakfast.) Nothing luxury about the rooms, but very comfortable, well kept. we had two televisions, although only one had digital cable. short hike down stairs to the sunset pool. just past the tennis courts, a hiking trail leads across the street to miles of easy to hard hiking choices. Excellent location for travel to other golf courses, Scottsdale, other parks. Very good service all around and very good food and menu choices at the main restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Water Playground Experience”
Reviews.Author: RockyPointRicardo
Reviews.Content: Hilton offered a great special price at this hotel for December so took advantage over the Christmas weekend. It is a massive, sprauling layout on the side of Lookout mountain with easy access to all of Phoenix. The hotel's exterior style shows its 25 year heritage but the interiors of the all suite rooms are well appointed with 2 flat screen tvs and an honor bar. The bathrooms also show their age but everythying is clean and very comfortable. There are multiple swimming pools all dedicated to each wing of the hotel. In addition, there is a mini water park with a huge pool and rock water slide and an outdoor restaurant. This hotel has always been known for it signiture restaurant, Different Point of View. It sits high up on the mountain with spectacular views to the south of downtown Phoenix. It is a very high end dinning experience with a great reputation. The stay was well worth the value however, the hotel is a bit large for my taste. It also has a golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: Bethany P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort for a conference I was attending. At first I found the resort a little overwhelming and somewhat confusing to navigate, but after a little walking around I quickly found my way. Every staff member I encountered each day provided exceptional service and everyone was friendly and helpful. The rooms, though not as modern as some I've stayed in, were quiet, comfortable and nicely appointed. I was especially grateful for the moisturizing bath products, as I was not accustomed to the dry desert air! You may want to make sure you have bottled water on hand to drink, as I found the taste of the tap water very unappealing, but didn't want to pay the expensive price for the bottle offered in the room. There is complimentary citrus flavored water in the hotel lobby most of the day, too. The conference facilities were very nice, as well. I didn't take advantage of the resort's pools, but I did venture out on the hiking trails a couple times. The concierge was helpful in providing directions -- and a complimentary bottle of water. I encountered bikers, horseback riders and other hikers on the trail and everyone was friendly and considerate. The restaurants on the property offer good variety and the food was very good. The resort is very picturesque and has lovely views. There are lots of little places to hide away, read a book, or in my case, catch up on things back at the office. The location is a little remote, so if you're looking for shopping, plan to arrange transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.....But....”
Reviews.Author: annbot
Reviews.Content: Well, I have wanted to stay at Tapatio Cliffs for a long time, and I can honestly say I was very impressed with some things, and very disappointed in some things. Did I like it? Yes. Parking was free, and accept one night when there was a function going on, very easy to come by. The area around the parking etc. is a bit steep, I was walking with a cane, and as long as I went slowly, I did fine. Check-in was very easy and quick. The problem I could see with check-in is with your car outside, the entrance way is a u-turn coming in, and the lanes are a bit narrow, so with a bigger car it takes a bit of maneuvering. Plus, coming in and going out from the hotel on 7th Street is a bit tricky because of the curves. The decorations were very nice. Especially the palm trees right outside from the lobby entrance. Our suitcases were taken out of the car and a very nice bell hop/attendant assisted me to the room with the cases. The service and the people were very wonderful. Here I was very impressed. Because we booked thru AARP, we received breakfast coupons. The restaurant was gorgeous, and the food was really yummy. I was impressed. We also ate here on Tuesday night, and the salmon was out of this world, and I ended up ordering it again thru room service. Service was excellent. Now to my but…I stayed here for 4/nts. I loved the bed. One of the most comfortable beds ever. I loved the TV’s . Yup, 2 of them. The bathroom/sink area was a bit strange. The toilet/bathtub/shower was to the right, and the one single sink area to the left. It was nice, but I felt it was somewhat inconvenient. There was a living room area, with a fold out couch. My son slept on this the first night and was very uncomfortable, plus, you could not sit upright on this couch because it was so slick, you slid down every time. The shower was fine, but the shower curtain was too short and water ran into the hallway area, so I was mopping it up with towels so we wouldn’t slip. On my arrival, I immediately had to use the restroom, and I found a black hair on the toilet. There was also a dip in the floor and the ceiling looked like it had had a leak or something, plus, it looked like the popcorn ceiling was in the process of being scrapped off. The heater/AC thumped loudly when it turned off. Very annoying. My husband used the hiking path behind the hotel in the preserve area, but found the path somewhat rocky and more suitable for a hike then a jog. The grounds were beautiful with fountains, and the pools were very nice. I didn’t use the heated pool because the weather was a bit cold this time of year. The gift shop was right off the lobby, and there was a Starbuck’s. The business center was fine. Printing was 50 cents/pg for B&W, and $1.50 for color. Internet was $5.00 min. @ .35/min. We were able to send a fax for free. WIFI in the room was $9.95/24hrs. I thought the per page price to be outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place- but I tried few amenities”
Reviews.Author: abondgal
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here on a staycation the 2nd weekend of December. The rooms were nice, and spacious. We stayed in a suite in the main building and really liked the central location to all the amenities. The resort charged an optional $2.25 per guest to use the amenities such as tennis court and fitness room. I thought this was an incredibly reasonable value. The fitness center was nice, but it seemed a bit small for the size of the resort. The in room coffee was delicious and all in all the rooms were a very nice value for the hotel price. Staff was incredibly friendly and helfpul and I slept like a baby in the black-out curtained rooms! My one complaine is that the location of the resort is a little off the beaten path if you are planning on hanging out in Scottsdale or visiting the busier parts of the city. It took us about 15-20 minutes driving out of the way to go do anything. The resort is perfect if you plan on staying, playing golf, or hiking around the area. Otherwise, I might suggest finding something a little more central. Unfortunatley it rained a few days of our stay so we weren't able to check out the pool either. I would try the resort again if a special was offered to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: catchersmom99
Reviews.Content: We Pricelined for a great rate. Sadly sometimes when you utilize the bid sites the customer service reflects your use of an outside vendor. This was not the case at the Pointe. From check in to check out we had fantastic service from all members of the staff. Special kudos the the evening valet and the front desk staff. Room service was prompt and delicious and the hot tub was great. Our room was not quite 5 star but it was clean and well furnished. I traveled with a family member who needs handicapped assistance and the Pointe was great with her. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne M
Reviews.Content: The king suites are spacious and well appointed. The staff was helpful and friendly. The property is well maintained although the parking is a bit tricky is some areas of the hotel. The lobby is bright and welcoming. Nice resort for a reasonable price. Would love to go back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Parking obstacle course”
Reviews.Author: NatalieP22
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, clean and spacious. Many rooms are partially underground so not a great view. The property is old but well maintained. The ISSUE is the parking... A mess. Everyone can park in front of their room, but what a challenge. One way narrow winding hilly streets that dead end with very tight turnaround opportunity. If you are not a great parker..you better not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mwbs1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at Tapatio and had multiple problems. On the first night we discovered the sofa bed did not have a sheet, the two lights on bed were burnt out, and the phone buttons did not work so we could not call the front desk . We also only had 3 towels for four people. Since we were so tired, we made due for the night with one blanket so our kids could go to sleep. The next day we went to the office and put in a request to have everything repaired and for extra towels and a sheet. We ended up getting the linens from the maid as we were going back to the room. We went out for the day and found that the lights were not replaced when we returned that night. The next morning as we were getting ready for the day our coffee pot quit working too. When we went down to ask to have the lights replaced again and report the coffee make not working the desk clerk looked at us and said "were you making two cups because I heard they can over heat?". She did not even offer an apology and the coffee make is made to make two cups. I wanted to say, "really, your are telling me that this is acceptable and it is my fault for using it as intended", but I stated only the fact that we had made two cups about 15 min. apart. She put in the repair orders without apology or acknowledging my statement that the lights had already been requested to be replaced the day before. We went out for the day and came back to a new coffee maker and working lights, but only three towels. Frustrated, we went down do the office on our way out to dinner and request more. Two hours later when we returned, we still did not have towels so we called down and asked again for towels. They were brought up in about 15 min. I noticed that my sinuses bothered me a lot after our first night. On our last day I figured out why, the air filter in the ceiling was completely caked with dust. I also noticed that the whole outer rim of carpet next to the base board was caked with dust. I was sickened, I couldn't leave quick enough. Lack of attention to maintenance and other details seem to be a common theme at Tapatio. Aside from our issues, we walked past the same two glasses in an ashtray for three days straight....who knows, they could still be there. My last complaints are that the design of the building is very low and heights are unmarked at entrance ways. When it was late at night the lighting is dark it is hard to see. My husband hit his head on the building leaving a huge bump. There should be a reflective strip placed inside the structure as you walk out towards the parking lot. Lastly, when paying for what it supposed to be a more upscale hotel, I prefer not to see employees drinking beer in the parking lot. It is not the behavior I want my children seeing either.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous food and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: ogogolby
Reviews.Content: Our visit began with the most courteous bellmen and continued throughout the visit. Everyone seems so happy to live in Phoenix. They are extremely pleasant and accommodating.
