If you're a golfer, the resort course is a gem - read just a little shy of Wolf Creek!. The teaching pro, Jeff, is top notch and actually shaved a couple of strokes from my game. Then the food. Whether room service, lunch in the lounge or dinner at one of two world class restaurants - absolutely fabulous! Never got to meet the chef de cuisine but would have loved to thank him personally. Suites are a little tired but all amenities worked fine with strong water pressure, immediate and constant hot water and great house keeping. We WILL return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property for Relaxing Stay near Airport”
Reviews.Author: StickerShock
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our short stay at this Hilton, although we didn’t spend too much time at the hotel. I would probably pick a different time of year to get the most out of the beautiful scenery, multiple pools, golf, tennis, etc. The hotel is fairly close to the Phoenix airport. We got a sub-$100 rate through Priceline. Our room was on the fourth floor of the main building. Our window overlooked the parking lot, but the walkways in front of the rooms overlook one of the pool areas. Prices for snacks at the lobby cafe were expensive. We got breakfast at a Starbucks about ½ mile away. I took a quick walk around the hotel property one morning, and the cliffside resort is really built right into a cliff. The views are spectacular, but some rooms are quite a walk. One great element of the resort is the Falls – a gated collection of pools, waterfalls, and bars off to the side of the property. I’m sure it’s very relaxing in good weather. Our room was a suite like all the other rooms at the resort, with a living room, bath/shower/toilet room, double sink room, and bedroom. It was very comfortable, not lavish, but a very nice size. If you don’t want to do a ton of walking, request a room in the main building near the lobby, and self-park your car in a lot next to the main building. Complimentary water bottles are a neat perk of being a Hilton Honors member.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: saleschick87
Reviews.Content: We were here for a weekend get away and were upgraded to a signature suite. The views were wonderful and the room was huge! However you could tell it has been a while since there were any updates done to the property. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable but several of the electrical outlets were almost out of the wall, there were areas where the paint really needed to be touched up....etc. We would stay there again but I really hope the make the updates so I can give it 5 stars next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandiM86
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night vacation November 3rd thru 7th. I went with my sister and my mom, for her 70th birthday. We kept saying, "Everyone who works here is so friendly!". The grounds keepers, shuttle drivers, waiters, spa workers, were always smiling and happily greeting us. Anna and Karen, the Concierges were so helpful with directions and tips. We stayed in building 7, which was great, close to the big pool, and main hotel restaurant which had a fabulous breakfast bufffet and excellent dinners and bar. We went to breakfast and then hiked the mountain preserve (which was right there) every morning. Then hung out at the big pool, which has a bar and food. If you have a physical disability, you should let the hotel know, because from most of the buildings it is a workout walking around the grounds. My mom is 70 and fit, so she was fine, but if you aren't, it could be tough. There are a couple buildings that are at the same level as the pool and restaurant. Also, they have a shuttle and when you call, they are there within a minute. We took it to the fancy restaurant up at the top of the property. Fabulous views, the lounge made the best martini ever, and great food. Perfect get away! One bedroom suite with two beds was perfect for the 3 of us. Very comfortable serenity beds!

Reviews.Title: “Severely Disappointed, Not 4-star quality.”
Reviews.Author: massasi
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of Pointe Tapatio Cliffs about an hour ago. I live in the south valley, and had to spend the day in the north valley, so my husband and I thought it would be nice to get dinner and stay overnight. We went to A Different Pointe of View, and I have to say it was exceptional. I wrote a separate review for the restaurant. Overall, dinner was excellent and I would definitely go back. I cannot say the same for the hotel. Before describing the problems I encountered, I will state that almost every employee was very nice, helpful, smiling and generally welcoming. I have nothing but the highest praise for the shuttle drivers who were prompt, entertaining and super nice both times we called them. The furnishings and decor in the room were comfortable and clean, but I would say the room itself was a 3 star at most (for a 4 star price, of course). I checked in at about 3PM and quickly left to attend a function. We returned to the room after dinner, at about midnight. It was extremely hot in the room. I live in Arizona, so I do not use the term "extremely hot" lightly. It had to have been almost 100 degrees. I couldn't say for sure, however, because the air conditioner unit was showing 75, which is how I presume it was last set. I cranked it down to 68, then we collapsed into bed. At 2AM, I awoke drenched in sweat. I got up to check the air conditioner, and it still said 68 but it was definitely NOT 68 in the room. I set it to fan-high instead of auto and tried to go back to sleep. After tossing and turning, awake, for about another half an hour, I got up again and checked the vent. I found the air was blowing - HOT. There was hot air... HOT AIR... blowing out of the vents when I set it to 68. There was no hot/cold function, just a temperature setting. I was so unbelievably tired I just turned the unit off and decided to open the window. Unfortunately, the windows at the front of the room don't open at all. The only window to open was to the balcony. Since no other windows would open, it took a while to get cool air into the room. Finally, around 3:15 I was able to get back to sleep (without any sheets or blankets, I might add). Luckily, we were right near the entrance to the resort, so every few minutes cars would drive by, or drunken guests would stumble about, or in general some very loud outside noise would rouse me. There was a brief respite between about 4:30 and 6:30, in which I almost got good sleep. Almost. Then the groundskeepers started their work, and I gave up even trying. I left the bedroom and went to make myself a cup of coffee. I added the creamers they provided, and wouldn't you know it, they were spoiled. A hundred little chunks of what should have been liquid creamer floated to the top of my coffee. Thanks, Hilton. No longer trusting anything in the room, I had to drive myself to the Starbucks on the corner. In discussing this with my husband, I decided I wanted to check out personally so I could let the front desk know about the a/c and hopefully get some sort of remediation. Or at the very least, an apology. No such luck. The petite blonde at the counter had a smile pasted to her face the whole time, but never once said the word "sorry" or "apologize." What she did say was that maintenance is available 24 hours. I attempted to explain to her that at 3AM when I am dead tired, I did not want to wait up for the maintenance man and then endure his repairs and lose the entire night of sleep, nor did I want to have to get up, pack all of my things again and move. She gave me "the look" and repeated maintenance is available 24 hours. I pointed out to her that unless they haven't rented that room in the past month, they had to have been aware of the air conditioner issue, so why would they stick us in there? She repeated that maintenance is available 24 hours. She was not only frustrating, she was condescending and rude, and if I had the time I would have waited to speak to the manager. Since I didn't, I've decided to write this review. Maybe they will see it and try to correct their issues. I realize that, had we been given any other room, I probably would have been very satisfied with my stay there. The way I see it, however, is that they take lackadaisical care of their property, renting rooms to people when they clearly must have known they were subpar, and then showed no interest in customer service or ensuring repeat business when the problems were brought to their attention. To imply my sleepless night was my own fault becuase I was too tired to spend the night with their maintenance team is beyond the pale. I will never stay at another Hilton, I will stick to Marriott from now on. I will also ensure I detail this encounter to everyone one I know. Just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: LeeFamily65
Reviews.Content: My family spent six days there in October. We checked in and was met by Jose who was very helpful in helping us navigate the massive resort. He took the time to explain the amenities and where we should park to get to our room. The pools were great for kids. My four old enjoyed the numerous pools on site. Room was functional with separate living area. The only negative is Hilton's policy of charging for Internet in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “"A Different Pointe of View"”
Reviews.Author: megruhot
Reviews.Content: This property is situated on a hill side overlooking Phoenix. If you have difficulty walking up and down hills this is not the place for you.They do provide a shuttle service but you have to wait for them to pick you up and then you are obliged to tip for every ride. Rooms are comfortable but smallish for an all suite hotel. Plenty of swimming pools and the five star restaurant at the top is fabulous but pricy. They have a wine cellar that is unbelievable and unrivaled. The staff was super nice and definitely should get a great rating for being so nice to the guests. Concierge staff were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there a week!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle327
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there from 10/22-10/28. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The room was clean and nice. The Falls pool area was fantastic and we spent most of our free time there. We did find a scorpion near the hot tub but hey this is Arizona what can you expect! The restaurants had great food. The hiking trails from the resort into the nearby mountain conservation are was a huge bonus. Overall we had a marvelous time and felt very at home and at ease there. My son cried when we left. Thanks for a memorable vacation and we hope to see you all again in January! Kyle

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the extras, but can't beat the October weather and central location”
Reviews.Author: Cyberintegrator
Reviews.Content: They have a extra package that includes for $2.50 a day you get access to the workout facilities? Never paid extra for this! Must pay rates for Internet access about $9.95. Seems more for families than couples. Do not recommend area for handicapped. Outside stucco deteriorating in places especially on steps. General Area economy outside the resort not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice... Really nice classic Hilton property.”
Reviews.Author: AZFoodCritic
Reviews.Content: Great property, quick check-in, very nice and large room, nice amenities. Great bed, clean, beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: Becky1102
Reviews.Content: Absolutely incredible property! The beauty of the resort is the location, set into the mountain. The Different Pointe of View restaurant and the Terrace are amazing at night,with fantastic food offerings and presentation - along with a view of the valley that is unparalled. We were in the Mountainside Suites which were beautifully located just below the restaurants and facing the fitness center and saltwater pool. Because the resort is set into the mountain, there is a lot of uphill and downhill walking, but there is a shuttle if you are not into the walking. The staff was very accomodating - friendly and helpful. We will absolutely return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay-cation for Friends Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: hoselady
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday evening for my friends wedding weekend. I was the MOH. The rehearsal was set for 5:30 at the "falls" which is their poolside venue. The bride had already checked into a "presidential suite" and was told she could get a ride anywhere on the property (this is a very large resort, it is spread out and built on the side of a mountain). The bride wasn't picked up as promised so she had to drive herself and we ran a tad bit late. The falls is a nice location off the main pools that say they closes at 5. The falls are basically a big waterfall with a flat area in front of it. The "falls" are pretty loud so you really need a mike to hear anything( not an issue just a bit of advise for any future brides). All went fine and the group headed to a local restaurant for the rehearsal dinner. We headed to check in at the front desk. We were greeted by the most proficient person I came across at the resort, Tyler. He was fast and courtesy and has the skills that most Hilton Hotels are known for. I asked how close we were to the bridal suite as I am the maid of honor. We were two buildings over which is quite a hike. Tyler did explain to me the resort was full due to a convention and several weddings so he would not be able to accommodate a request to move us closer. We checked out our room (a two room std suite) it was clean and you could tell that it had received some upgrades over the last few years and we had a very nice view from the little balcony looking north to all the evening lights. It had all the standards items (shampoo, conditioner and bar soap). The mini fridge was locked so unless you cut into it and then paid the service fee you couldn't use the fridge. All of the offerings are WAY overpriced. We went to the store bought a cheap styrofoam cooler and water and soda for our stay. No way will I pay 4.50 for a can of soda. No complimentary water either. My family stayed the night in our room and I stayed with the bride in her "presidential suite". Okay, so I have no idea what president would stay here because it was just a bigger room with a fireplace and a wet bar and a dining room table. Nothing special and not worth the extra money. I have been fortunate enough to travel in my lifetime and I have stayed at more than my fair share of nice places. I don't consider myself a "travel-snob". I like nice and clean and good value and service. I don't expect to have the staff "kiss my @%%" But, I do expect fast courtesy service and friendly personnel. I didn't see that happening here. Especially didn't see it happening for my friend the bride. I would have thought that the "wedding/planner or coordinator" person would have been a bit more professional, friendly and on the ball. The bride had to call her in the morning as she hadn't heard from her. The bride had me call the florist to find out "where the flowers were". The bride gave my teenage sons cell phone number as a contact person as he is very organized and would be a helper for the bride. At 4:00 my son grabs me and says the "Hilton wedding person" called and was asking where the cake was! She needed to know who was bringing it! I know for a fact the bride had given her the contact information. The coordinator told the bride she wouldn't be on property till 4:00pm and this was a 5:30 Wedding. At 4:30 some member of staff came to the room to grab the table favors, ceremony items and reception items. At 5:00pm a driver came in a van to get the bride, her ring bearer, flower girl and myself. We were at the falls at 5:05 and the pool was super active and things weren't totally set up. Again, this was a 5:30 wedding. The bride was very upset as she walked by and saw what was going on and was taken to a cabana nearby that had too much patio furniture shoved in it and was to wait their till the time. She was given a bottle of cold water. The bridal party including the groom was rushing around getting things set up. I put the pew bows on the chairs and set up the family photos on the table. The groom and the minister set up the sand ceremony items... it was a scramble and a joke! We started the wedding promptly at 5:30 and the bride looking lovely make her way pass the group of 5 drunk guys who were having fun still hanging by the suppose to be closed pool. I saw nothing less than 25 people just sort of hanging around. Curious on lookers and the like. The wedding was nice and the bride and groom exchanged vows. Then the wedding party went to the same cabana to wait for everyone else to head down to the reception area.... still an outdoor area adjacent to the main pool. I met Susan (I believe) and Tami one of the catering staff. They seemed to have it a bit more together. They were still setting up the area while the wedding was going on and my son had to show them exactly were things went. The appetizer were good. The bartender was fast and pleasant and made a wonderful margarita. The dinner was served on time and everything tasted good. Nothing special just good. The bride seemed to calm down as things started going and all went fine from there. We left at about 10:00pm and drove our car back up the hill to our room. Again, the parking here is a HUGE issue and the streets are small and curvy and dark. Lots of incline walking so if you have leg or hip issues or are an older person I would make sure you request a room off the main lobby as this will not be comfortable for you. We were a little hungry so we decided to order some room service. After having to make several attempts we got through. We order two burgers, a bowl of chowder and a dish of ice-cream. We got a call back after our order to say "what kind of fries did we want"? But when my husband asked what kind do you have he was told french fries?... yeah I'm not sure what that was all about but, surprise the food arrived Hot, and good... actually better than what was served at the wedding IMHO. It was a whopping 60.00 though! I think that is more than what the bride and groom paid..(45.00) a person I believe. I would say if you are looking for a hotel in the area its fine. The hotel says are a 4 star property....yeah, I am not sure. If you are a bride looking to have a wedding here... I would advise you to hire a professional wedding planner for the day to be their to handle the details. No bride needs to be freaking out over where things are! The resort it self is a little old and you can see it in certain things. for the most part it is maintained and if you liked to hike or horseback ride this could make it for you. I am an Arizona native and in the 80's this was THE PLACE its just a shame that they didn't move with the times such as other Arizona landmarks that have, The Biltmore, The Phoenician and even the Valley Ho. All of which are wonderful choices the Biltmore and Phoenician are a bit more but I think the Valley Ho has been running some great specials. All in all my friend is married and happy. I WOULD NOT recommend this for any brides to be unless you are on a seriously tight budget and want a resort wedding. Also Hilton fyi....at 139 per night free wi-fi in rooms would really make up for some of the lacking things!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but you must be ready to walk over several steeep hills to view the entire campus”
Reviews.Author: jbg79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a convention and found the location to be breath taking. Although the hotel appeared to be older, many renovations have occurred to bring it up to good standards. Excellent beds and nice spacious rooms. The only caution is that walking around the campus does require some stamina due to the very high sloping hills that the hotel is located. Very nice change when you live in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryofMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Took me some time to get used to the size of this property, seemed larger than it is due to being so spread out. Hotel staff were great, front desk especially helpful. Pool area very nice. Rooms are well set up for several travellers and there is a separate area to watch tv/doors etc and bedroom separation. Would stay another time for leisure.Food was very good, one of the best business buffets I've ever had...lots of healthy options!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, helpful, convenient and a good time.”
Reviews.Author: Nesses1
Reviews.Content: Thought it was relaxing and a great location to do other sight seeing activities. Everyone was helpful and friendly and the facilities were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Average Commercial Property...”
Reviews.Author: chgowanderer
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here for a wedding. The rooms although spacious with a living area separate from bathroom and from sleeping area had nothing extraordinary about them. We had an " PURE guestroom"-an allergy-friendly room providing improved air quality. However, the air filtration machine was annoyingly loud. Appointments were very utilitarian. The bedroom lighting was severely lacking in that there were no overhead lights and low light unless you wanted to leave the shades open (which is not an option in 100+ degrees nor if privacy is desired). Also, a simple "amenity" such as a trash can was only in the toilet area. Asked for extra towels which were provided but removed when not used immediately. The food offered by the restaurants was very average when compared to the surrounding restaurants. In addition, the hotel itself is a far drive from many places you might care to go. The hotel caters to business meetings and what goes with it. All in all, I would not stay here again if I was traveling to the Phoenix area. I would choose somewhere more conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel settled into the hillside -- 4 1/2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: LASTrafzer
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights here as part of a convention, and we were very happy with this hotel. The rooms are spacious and are suites, with a living area separate from bathroom separate from sleeping area. Fortunately, our room was situated not far from the lobby and the ballroom, which made for greater convenience. If we'd been in one of the more distant rooms, it might have been a problem just because of the nature of our visit. We ordered room service once -- quick, well prepared, a bit pricey (but then again, it WAS room service, so par for the course). The staff here is exceptionally gracious and friendly. I never saw a member of the staff without receiving a greeting, a smile, and an offer to help. That's not common enough and I really appreciated it. Used the workout room once, and it was clean and well maintained, though limited in its offering. Then again, it was more than sufficient for my uses. The only things that keep me from giving it a 5 star is that 1) some of our fellow convention people had bees in their rooms, and we had one .... hardly an infestation, but it was something on our mind and 2) it would have been nice to have a bit more variety in places to eat there. If I could give it 4 1/2 stars, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy S
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed at the Cliffs and the room was perfect. We have opposite sleep routines, and the floorplan is very good for the other person to hang out and not disturb the sleeping person. Lots of pool options and good walking throughout the campus for exercise. Actual exercise area was very good too. I'd hesitate during "family season" because I could see those pools really getting full of running kids, but during school time, it's a great gal pal getaway. Gift shop was the best I ever shopped! Good stuff at human prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with Fantastic Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pointe Hilton on business and had a fantastic stay. The hotel was very clean and the staff was amazing; very attentive to any requests I may have had. I stayed in a room right in front of the pool, which was very nice. The housekeeping staff keep a very clean resort. I heard from the front desk that they have a new room called PURE (Hypo Allergenic) rooms that I will definitely request next time I am there. I'm an allergy sufferer and know that next time I stay in the Phoenix area I will stay in one of their new PURE rooms. Overall, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Has turned into a dangerous dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: caitydid
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there numerous times before and enjoyed it; however, this time were set up right by the main pool area with bands and screaming for hours; ate at the buffet at the Cascades for $50 for 4 people for what you'd get at a cheap picnic. While attempting to retrieve my grandsons' clothing from the pool after eating the dinner, my son was assaulted by a drunk with the security staff then asking my room number in front of this group of drunks. If that wasn't enough with my heart condition, we were then subjected to the phone ringing non-stop for over 30 minutes beginning at 5:30 a.m., before having "security" knock on the door because we didn't answer a wake-up call we never placed! One of the most unenjoyable weekends we ever spent. The Pointe at Tapatio Cliffs has become a disgrace to the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: gp703
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay as part of a family visit to Phoenix. We had previously stayed at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak, and so we thought we would try the Tapatio Cliffs this time. With a Wednesday arrival in August, the resort was very empty. We had booked a Presidential Suite at a ridiculously cheap rate. The two room suite was spacious, and there was a pull-out sofa for our 5 year old. The staff was very accommodating. We noticed the bed was too soft for us the first night. i talked with the front desk (thanks Helen!), and housekeeping put in a board which helped tremendously. The breakfast was one of the best i have ever had at a US-based Hilton. The Hilton Honors breakfast benefit was worth $12.02 towards anything on the menu. The breakfast buffet at $16.00 was well worth the extra $4. For my wife they made her an omelet to order while I had from the buffet very good poached eggs with a chipotle pepper sauce on Indian fry bread. The fruit was outstanding and extremely fresh, and the service was very personal. The pools was fabulous. During the week it was very empty, but by the weekend it picked up. We missed the dive-in movie night. I would highly recommend the Hilton Tapatio Cliffs especially if you are a Hilton Honors Elite member.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, lovely rooms and grounds, difficult parking”
Reviews.Author: BonzoGal
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for four days and three nights in August, 2011. We had a 2 queen-bed suite in Building 8, which is in the upper/hillside section of the hotel. The room was nice: not palatial, but more than enough room. LOTS of drawers and storage space, which was welcome. 2 TVs, one remote control. No pay-per-view movies, just regular cable channels. Honor bar but no fridge space, which would be nice but isn't a deal-breaker. Very, very clean room and bathroom. Separate sink/mirror area from bathroom. Shower/tub, both nice and again very clean. Water pressure a little on the weak side but adequate. The beds were super firm and comfortable. A full length mirror is provided in the bedroom area, which is rare and very welcome in a hotel room. Eight, count 'em, 8 swimming pools here. The "Falls" area is the most popular with families and tends to get crowded on weekends. Even though our room overlooked this pool, we didn't hear any noise, not even during the most crowded times. There's a much smaller, quieter pool up the hill that overlooks the whole complex and is nice and peaceful. There's also one "adults only" pool that is located in the back of the main/lobby building, and is closed off from the louder areas. The staff here is super friendly - not just polite, but genuinely friendly. We had a problem with people in a room near ours and the front desk people found instant, creative solutions to our problem, and knocked some money off our bill for our inconvenience, which was much appreciated. Hotel restaurant staff is similarly nice- after buffet breakfast, our waitress asked if I'd like a free iced tea to go because it was so hot outside! Due to the extreme heat (113 F) during our stay, we were encouraged to call for a shuttle to get us around the grounds, and they always showed up within 2 minutes and were cheerful about taking us to the restaurants and pools. One downside: the buildings in the section we were in face the hillside and the road to reach them is narrow- picture a twisty, tiny road in a small European village. Now picture it lined with American-sized cars, SUVs and pickup trucks. It's difficult to navigate and REALLY difficult to park- you have to parallel park on a curved, narrow, dead-end road where there is no place to turn around. If you're in Building 7 or 8, you have to back down that narrow, curvy road to a driveway that turns into the downhill parking lot. If my 72 year old mother hadn't been with me I'd have parked in a more distant lot and just hiked up the hill, but due to the extreme heat and her age, we needed the car nearby. I parked in front of the room for two days, then in the downhill lot and brought the car back and forth through that road. (If I were the owners of this hotel I'd take out the parking spaces and make that section "bell service and shuttle-to-room only.") So parking was a hassle, but everything else was so nice I'd go back in a heartbeat. Plus I only swam in 4 of their 8 pools- have to make it to the other 4!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous as always - just a few comments”
Reviews.Author: smudge1794
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Tapatio for the past 10 years. It really is fabulous. The value for money cannot be rivalled and travelling with a family they make it easy and very affordable. The staff are superb especially Janet in the Falls Bar who has for the past 10 years gone above and beyond in her job to ensure we were made to feel very special - I hope management appreciates what a good job she does. We went to 2 other scottsdale hotels this trip and have found only one other employee who we would single out to be brilliant. Tapatio on the whole is a lovely suite hotel and they breakfats is fabulous, however some parts of the hotel although having undergone a facelift do look tired. We will be back Tapatio and thank you

Reviews.Title: “Serious of unfortunate events”
Reviews.Author: Colleen H
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we asked for a quiet room, they assigned us one with absolutely no view and in between the adult pool and family pool. Our television didn't work, so around 9 pm, two maintenance men came to repair the tv, but it wasn't able to be fixed, so the entire television had to be switched out. We placed a room service order, and one of the item was wrong, so they sent up a complimentary creme brulee, but we were so annoyed by this point in time, it didn't matter. When we settled in to go to sleep, we were unable to do so because the people at the pool were loud and rowdy until around 2 AM despite there being hours posted regarding what time the pool opens and closes. When we did finally fall asleep we were awoken around 6 with the sound of housekeeping carts rolling by. IT IS VERY NOISY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MidwestJA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the second time at this property. Hotel is spread out over the hills, if you have multiple rooms ask to get them close together. The rooms are nice with a sitting room and bedroom. Rooms were clean and well kept. Check in is lengthly and with only one clerk there was quite a line. Other clerks were in the vicinity but did not open up another check in desk. The restaurant is somewhat pricy but service, selection and food are good. Since it was August and temperatures hit 118 degrees one of the days we did not play the golf course. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th year and everything was just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bmacfie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend - the staff are attentive - above and beyond approach. Room was beautiful, resort is beautiful. Exceptional staff were John, Veronica and Janet at the Cascades. John makes the perfect Margarita. Children in our party were kept engaged and adults were pampered. It just was plain fun to be there. Be sure to stay Sat night for the "dive" in movie. I recommend the cabanas at the pool - it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: a1kx67
Reviews.Content: My in-laws stayed here and I wish they hadn't wasted their money. They put them in a room right next to the pool that was getting resurfaced so every morning they awoke to construction equipment and workers yelling. The room was overrun with crickets and when we asked for maintenance to spray they said they only do outside. The customary workout room is not provided so you better have a gym membership and drive 6 miles if you want to workout. Your guests might as well take a cab to visit you because of very limited parking. The garbage disposal reeked with sewage stench. This place and the staff were very disappointing. Avoid this place at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Maroalch
Reviews.Content: This was just an overnight fun trip with my teenage daughter and her friend and the first time I had ever stayed here, I usually stay at the Arizona Grand but was pleasantly surprise on how friendly all the staff was, very easy check in, the parking was full up where are room was and they immediately offered for me to park in the front lot and they would drive us up to our room, my daughter left her cell phone in their van which they found right away and drove it uo to our room as well. The transportation is so easy I never waited very long and each time the driver was very friendly. We only used the pool at the Falls Village and had a great time, room was clean, comfy bed, nice balcony, it is an older hotel and I saw some wear and tear in the carpeting, no big deal. Bottom line I would definitiely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our time at Tapatio Cliffs.”
Reviews.Author: D_Auterson
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've used this property and the second for my wife. We loved it! The location is great - just north of the city but very easy to get into and out of. We traveled in and out each day for dinner, meetings and to the convention center. Up and down N 9th street was direct and never crowded. The resort facilities were very good. Restaurant and pool were great. Breakfast buffet was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: chamcalidor
Reviews.Content: We don't have a pool at our house, so to get a break from the Arizona heat so we decided to treat ourselves to a weekend away in our own backyard. This resort is HUGE! The buildings are sprawled out across the hillside and most rooms offer wondeful views from the balconies. There are 8 different pools, so there's at least one close to most buildings. They offer a free shuttle service to get you around, which is almost a necessity if you want to go to a restaurant or pool on the other side of the property. The suites are very clean and the beds are extremely comfy. We had a suite with 2 queen beds. The bedroom seemed a little crowded because one of the beds actually stuck out so far that it partially blocked the doorway. I'm sure that would not be an issue with a king suite. Something that was kind of annoying to us was the location of the refrigerator. It was inside a cabinet and catty corner to a dresser in the sitting room, and was very difficult to access. To make things more complicated, the door opened up towards you instead of away from you, so you had to hang over the door and lean over it to reach your arm inside to get something. Another thing that we had an issue with was parking. There just isn't enough, period. If you are lucky enough to get a spot even remotely close to your room, don't move your vehicle! The spot won't be there when you get back. Finally, it would have been nice if they didn't charge for internet access. Come on Hilton, even the fast food joints offer it for free! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return again. The rates were affordable, and it is a much nicer property than many others in the area that are comparably priced.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: dpennebaker
Reviews.Content: stayed at the 7th street pointe had a excellent time., the room had a great view, we ate at the pointe in tyme bar food was outstanding, thepeople were nice , the bartender rick byrd , was one of the best experiences we had. Dr. D. Pennebaker D.C.

Reviews.Title: “Loud loud family pool”
Reviews.Author: tripcracker1
Reviews.Content: Not as nice as I was expecting... Hotel was at low occupancy and we got a room overlooking a parking lot.  The waterslide pool during the day was nice and not too crowded.    The rooms are sizable and the beds comfortable.The family pool at night was loud and crowded.  Internet was for one computer only... Nickel and dimed.. Even cost $ for the Gym.  Sad when a family goes to have a well deserved break at a place they imagine to be relaxing and it's just more stressful at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: postz1225
Reviews.Content: We were at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort for 9 days in July. Our room was very nice, large enough to comfortably accomadate 2 adults & 1 teenager. Pools were wonderful. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. Everyone from the van drivers to the concierge to the front desk were so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: zeusboy1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while on a business trip, July 26, 2011. It is huge! There are so many buildings, I got lost walking around trying to find my way back. They gave me a map, but I didn't have it with me. Employees on property was extremely courteous and professional. When booking, I requested a room that was "away from noise", which I'm glad that I did since when I got there I found out that they were hosting the Youth Soccer National Championships. There were hundreds of under 18 kids all over the property, but not many seemed to be roomed near me. They gave me a room towards the back of the property up against the cliffs with a great view of the valley and Phoenix. Shuttles will take you from your room to the lobby, and vise versa, when requested, which was nice since the walk was either extremely uphill or downhill. I don't know what the regular pricing for this hotel is during this time, but I got what I believed to be a great deal by booking my flight and this hotel together through Travelocity. A Super-8 was available for about $40 less, but that wouldn't have even been considered a motel compared to this. I only visited the pool near my room, since it was close and empty at the time, but they have various pools all over the property and a couple of huge ones behind the restaurant with water slides, bars, mist-ers, etc. Looks like it would have been a very nice place to take a vacation. Too bad my stay was so short.

Reviews.Title: “Average Property”
Reviews.Author: samranck
Reviews.Content: This is an average and somewhat dated Hilton property. The location is good and the parking is free; however, in many cases you will have to walk a considerable distance to your room from the parking lot. I stayed on the second story of a building and there was no elevator, which was not a big deal apart from making it difficult to get luggage up to the room. The room itself was clean, but overall average. Nothing overly spectacular for being a resort. If you are looking for a cheap, clean option in Phoenix this is a hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “July 2011 stay at the Tap.”
Reviews.Author: daokie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great polce for a family or a couple stay but was terrible for a goup that needed to travel between rooms as in a convention. There was limited transportation provided and made it impossible to schedule your time when depending on hotel provided transportation. That being said, the rest of the hotel, other than being a little over priced, was good. The many pool and the view from the terrace of the Point of View Restuarant was better than average. The rooms are all suites and plenty big and very clean. Every employee I talked to was helpful and eager to solve any problems. The golf course employees were exceptional to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort with great amenities and wonderful staff but not for the 65+ crowd.....”
Reviews.Author: ILove70sMusic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this resort on account of the Elks organization. We really enjoyed everything about this resort from the fine restaurants to the superb staff. We had a fantastic breakfast every morning at the Pointe in Tyme restaurant. It was probably the best breakfast buffet I have ever had. We also had lunch a couple of time at The Falls pool area and we just loved the atmosphere with the large waterfall and humming birds. Ron was a great server and took good care of us. I also want to recognize the bellman and transportation staff who did an awesome job taking care of our needs as well as transporting us around property and taking me to Safeway and Walgreens on a couple occasions. DJ,TJ, Cole and Jason were all fantastic and a very friendly group of young men. My only complaint as well as others about this resort is the steep hills. Our room was in the "Cliffside Suites" at the most elevated part of of the property. I'm 70 years old and I can't hike up and down hills like I used to be able to and that got annoying really fast. We depended on the shuttle service to take us back and forth. Seniors beware of that when you book a room at this hotel. They don't call it Tapatio CLIFFS for nothing! I was also a little pissed with the ridiculous internet charges. I like to play online poker on my laptop before I go to bed but I had to skip on it because I wasn't going to pay those fees. With that being said this is still a fine property for families with children or young couples but not the elderly.

Reviews.Title: “Not much good to say”
Reviews.Author: elkmike
Reviews.Content: Checked in shortly before 3pm, was here with group, they seemed to make no effort to put me with that group, gave me a ADA room that I didn't need and hated (no tub). Night stand lamp didn't work. Their shuttle service is going to cause heat stroke or worse (if it hasn't already). Had me waiting outside for 31 minutes! Went to eat at Pointe in time on a Sunday, the hostess was bound determined that I was gonna sit at the bar (info I found out later is they do that to give bartender some business/tips as well) Later she said I didn't have to. Totally untrue! Parking was attrocious! For $13.95 plus tax daily, the high (ha ha) speed internet was horribly slow.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay near the Falls or longer than a week”
Reviews.Author: crimstidt
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay with the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliff, both trips on business. I will say this will probably be my last stay with this Resort. My first trip was only four nights so it was short enough that I didn’t spend enough time in the hotel to notice the little things that I noticed this time. This time around my room was directly across from The Falls waterpark and boy was that a terrible choice. They have dive in movies on the weekend that are so loud I could hear the entire movie in my room with the door shut. There was also a terrible high pitched noise that would randomly occur at points throughout the day and sometimes night. The Room service food was expensive and offered little to no variety. EVERYTHING was an extra charge. The internet was very expensive and slow enough that I was unable to watch Netflix without constant re-buffering. On my first night here I had to have the fridge replaced in my room because it had quit cooling. Luckily, the engineering staff was very quick and kind and remembered me from the first time I stayed and had a faulty TV remote. This resort is pretty to look at and nice for a weekend stay. If you don’t mind driving and have no issue eating the same food over and over, this resort may be perfect for you. I would not recommend for longer than a week or on a trip where it is imperative to do business from your hotel room. Pros: Large, Clean Rooms Room Service Several Pools Nice View Nice Toiletries Cons: Very expensive room service for very average tasting food Expensive Internet charges with average connection (unable to watch Netflix) Rooms near the elevator are very loud Terrible parking situation

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the hidden Holds to your bank account”
Reviews.Author: rking0729
Reviews.Content: I booked directly on the phone with the hotel, with a great Family Deal. "Splash Package"- A 2 room suite for 2 days with Kids activities, pool, waterslide, coupons. I was never told on the phone there would be 150.00 hold to my card. next day- I checked my confirmation in my Email- Again, NO mention of the 150.00 hold to my checking account ( 4 day hold) I called to confirm about the waterslide- A very nice person confirmed that the shuttle went back and forth to the Hilton Pointe hotels, Again NO Mention of the 150.00 hold Arrival day-- we check in , no problems NO MENTION OF THE 150.00 HOLD TO MY CARD. We get to our suite, ahhh.. we relax and settle in. I look at the little pamphlet that comes with the hotel stay. in teensy tiny writing it states.. " your bank card will have a hold of 75.00 per nights stay.." I go up to the front desk and mention the hold to my card, they answer.. Yes we have had this policy for 20 years.. I answer, that's poor customer service not to mention it at all to your customers, I also mention that Stay-cations are usually for people on a budget, with a certain amount of money to spend, and reserved for their trip. I mentioned that 150.00 was going to get my meals, fun and gas back home for my 11yr old daughter and I. He shrugged his shoulders. The front desk didn't seem to care, and again mentioned "their unwritten, unmentioned (3 times) Policy. Just be careful.. NOONE tells you hat you'll have a hold to your bank account, and they don't release the hold until the day after you check out. Then it's up to the bank when they credit it back to you.. Poor Customer Service!! Make sure you have cash on hand!!

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with lovely swimming pools - very expensive internet charges!”
Reviews.Author: Janey-Sue26
Reviews.Content: Nice resort hotel, a bit out of the way in Phoenix. All rooms are suites, basically an average hotel bedroom efficiently split into 2 rooms. All the rooms have balconies, however some have very high barriers on the balconies or are tucked in odd corners, so check out the room before you take it. We got a great rate on the room, however $12 for internet is ridiculously high! Free parking, always a pleasant change in a city. Only had '4 star' restaurants on site - bit strange considering it's not an expensive hotel. Overall, good stay and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great.”
Reviews.Author: kristint724
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Our room definitely showed some wear and tear and smelled funny. The refrigerator looked like it was from the 1980s. Our air conditioning in the living area of the suite was not cooling sufficiently. This hotel just did not have a luxury feel. The pool area was nice and my children enjoyed it. My husband enjoyed the fitness center, however we were surprised to find a ten dollar charge on our bill the next day. I found that to be ridiculous. That is an amenity that should be included with the resort. I have stayed at their sister property, Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak and it is much better than this one!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: BandR08
Reviews.Content: Everyone was extremely helpful and very friendly. Great pool, great views, but very tricky to park and drive to the rooms off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “I'd live there year-round if I could”
Reviews.Author: Batyal955
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 9 day stay for our annual family reunion. The staff treated us like royalty, and everything was done with a smile. The room was comfortable, and spacious, and clean. I cannot compliment the staff enough - from the valets to the front desk - from the concierge, Marian, to the pool waiters, Ron, Steve, and Danielle. EVERYone was eager to please and always had smiles on their faces. They went out of their way for us, and it was appreciated. The breakfast buffets were fantastic and delicious - it's a great resort for couples or families with children.

Reviews.Title: “A good way to get away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Brgurley
Reviews.Content: I had an overall wonderful experience! The Suite was of good quality for the price, and was located next to one of the many pools. At The Falls I had a great poolside experience. Ron was an excellent and friendly server, while AJ made an awesome strawberry Daiquiri. However my best goes out to Carri, who was a very kind and hard working employee. She had enough hospitality to fill one of the pools and you could tell how much she truly enjoyed taking care of the kids in Kids Korral.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: lordneil500
Reviews.Content: Great views, superb service, great rooms. Perfect for a romantic getaway

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the heat”
Reviews.Author: steelbender
Reviews.Content: Spacious 2-room suite. The walls are heavy and keep the room quiet. The resort has a large water park with pools and slide. We rented a cabana to get shade. Located next to the pool, it came with a refrigerator and ceiling fan. We really enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel_us
Reviews.Content: Great room, fantastic breakfast, very nice pool areas, and a friendly staff. Thank you for having shuttle service! Driving the property and parking can be a bit difficult, but it's not so bad if you use the shuttle service. They are quick and very nice. We hope to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: TarpleyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The warm and professional staff saw to our every need including shuttling us across the sprawling resort to our destinations. Each separate hotel building has its own private pool and hot tub and laundry room for guests. In addition, there is a beautiful large pool with private cabanas, waterfalls, fountains and a water slide. There are lots of features for families, yet as two adults we did not feel as though we were wandering through kiddy-land. They offer tennis courts, a golf course, a spa, and one of the finest restaurants in the state. The place was quiet. Our room was spacious with separate sleeping and living areas. The bed was comfortable. The bath and toilet were separated from the dressing and lavatories, which I like. Our room had a private balcony with a beautiful view. We would return to this resort. It would be a good destination for couples traveling together. ...and the price, it was half what we paid to stay at a resort in Sedona. Scottsdale offers a great shopping area with clustered galleries, trading posts and boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: kimslie
Reviews.Content: We checked in to this property on Thursday (utilizing HHonors points, a great value due to a special through their program). My husband is a frequent guest with Hilton and receives some nice perks due to his loyalty and status. We were actually upgraded to an Ambassador Suite, which is very, very nice, especially when traveling with children. Upon seeing our accomodations, we decided that one night wasn't going to be enough. The front desk staff (Jay Berry) was very helpful in extending our reservation for an additional night, keeping us in this larger suite. This morning, I visited the front desk again to be sure that our reservation was in place and exchange key cards, and was once again greeted by exceptional and friendly service. This morning I was assisted by both Jacci Jamie and Brandon Dusch. Once again, excellent & friendly service and made to feel most welcome here. The property has 8 swimming pools. Yesterday we visited the largest. The pool staff also, extremely helpful, showing us around, offering any needed assistance. Tonight they have an organized pool party, which our 13 year olds are looking forward too. There seems to be a very nice schedule of additional activities like that to participate in. Breakfast this morning was excellent as well. The buffet had every choice imaginable and the food was very high quality, fresh, hot and tasty. The restaurant is an easy walk from our (and really, all) suite. We will definitely be back. I'd recommend this resort for visitors to the area as well as locals, business travelers as well as family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Party and Excellent Party Planner at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixMichella
Reviews.Content: We had a birthday party for approx 25 guests at the pools at this location. We dealt with Jennifer Bryant, the party planner, at this hotel. She went above and beyond to help us and deal with our budget. She even stopped by at our party to see how it was going. I highly recommend this party host and this location. The location was spectacular with two beautiful pools, water slide, great cabanas and excellent food choices. My 13 year old and her guests were thrilled. I can't wait to plan another party with Jennifer Bryant and The Pointe Hilton at Tapatio Cliffs in Phoenix, Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and definitely a family friendly resort!”
Reviews.Author: NAUGuy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. We're from Flagstaff and just wanted to get away for the weekend. We normally stay at the Marriott Desert Ridge or Sheraton Wildhorse Pass whenever we go to Phoenix but we decided to give the Pointe Tapatio a try. The check in process was fairly easy. Alexis was very attentive and took care of our needs in a timely manner. From there we walked over to the concierge desk to get information on the hiking trails on property. The lady behind the desk I believe her name was Marion was more than helpful and she had a neat Irish accent. When we finally got to our room I must say we were a tad disappointed in the furniture. It was rather dated and looked like it belonged in my grandmother's living room. I wans't too fond of the popcorn ceiling either. I expect a four star resort to atleast have suites up to date with the 21st century. Besides that, the beds were ultra comfy and the suite was spacious nevertheless. After we spent some time in our suite and freshened up a bit we decided to throw on our bathing suits and head to The Falls pool area. It was a HOT day (as expected in Phoenix) and the pool sounded fantastic. As we entered the Falls we were greeted by the young ladys in the gift shop who all seemed very nice and happy to be at work. The pool was CROWDED but I guess that's expected on a 3 day weekend. Luckily we found a couple seats not too far from the waterslide. Speaking of the waterslide my kids really enjoyed it. They probably went on it atleast 50 times. The teenagers that patroled the waterslide were very nice. I forgot the guys name at the top but he would always socialize with us while we waited in line to go down the slide. Aside from the slide, they did have activities for the kids every half hour. My six year old really enjoyed all of the water activities. The two girls that ran the activities Katie and Carri did a great job interacting with the kids and the kids seemed to love them. Now on to the service. Our server was Anthony and I must say for the place to be so crowded, he did an excellent job attending to our needs. He was very polite and guest oriented. We decided to give the chicken nachos a try. The nachos were delivered by DJ. I noticed him from the bell desk. I guess he works multiple departments. Very nice kid with good mannerisms (yes ma'am, no ma'am, etc). I asked him for extra sour cream and salsa and it was delivered to me in a jiffy. We had no reason to walk up to the bar since our drinks were delivered to us so I can't comment on bar service. Later in the evening we did give the hiking trails a try. It was a very nice hike and it was safe for the most part. We did hike up to the restaurant at the top of the hill to check out the views and I must say I was very impressed with the scenic views of the city. We took a few pictures to show our friends back in Flagstaff. We did not get the opportunity to dine at one of the restaurants on property so I can't comment on that. However, I hear great things about the Different Point of View Restaurant and will definitely dine there my next trip back to Phoenix. Overall we just came to the resort to take advantage of the pools for a couple of days and we do recommend this resort to travelers looking for fun on a budget. Thanks Pointe Tapatio staff! We look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Unique resort with mini waterpark”
Reviews.Author: JKJK1234
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about this one... Pros: The resort was very unique and picturesque, built into the rocky cliffs. The staff in the lobby was fantastic; the doorman was friendly and chatty, the check-in staff were helpful and informative. We enjoyed the complimentary cactus lemonade available in the lobby. Our room (a mountainside suite) had a large king bedroom and a blacony with a lovely view of the area and the nightly sunset. Self-parking was available right next to our building. The waterpark was fun! We ate dinner at the waterpark restaurant then splashed one of the two big pools. (The waterslide closes at dusk, so be sure to try it out in the afternoon!) The price of our stay was very inexpensive compared to other resorts in the area. Also, location is convenient (about 20 min drive) to the airport when it was time to go. Cons: The resort is definitely older. Our room had a cumbersome layout, with a small sink area and small bathroom stuck in between the bedroom and living area. The room was very large, so it didn't make sense that the bathroom areas were so small. Our air conditioner was very loud - it would turn on & shut off with a loud clunk, waking me up a couple times in the night. We could also hear noise & people talking on the street below - these happened to be resort employees loading and/or unloading a van at 10:30 p.m. Overall, an average resort - but a good quick stopover for an afternoon at the pool. Considering the waterpark facility, the price was very good. A definite value. Hilton Honors members can get free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “great price on the room, but they keep adding and adding more costs”
Reviews.Author: azmom74
Reviews.Content: Expected so much more, will never go back nor send anyone there!! We took our family along with another family to this resort over the holiday weekend, to get away and relax, and enjoy, but that was not the case with this place. We thought we had got a great price on the rooms that included a breakfast package so everyone could eat for free. Well this was not the case. First the breakfast package that you pay for with the room is not a free breakfast. You get vouchers aka coupons for a free meal but you still have to pay tax on that meal, and tip.(I had no problem paying a tip, I work in a restaurant and always expect to tip) So you still end up paying over $40 for the breakfast for a family of 2 adults and 2 kids, and 1 infant(they charged for her too.) Also when we first arrived we didn't even receive enough vouchers for the breakfast so we spent over an hour total between the restaurant and the front desk trying to figure out why we did not receive enough vouchers to begin with, then when we got our bill to check out they charged our room for the same meals that were on the voucher, so again we had to spend time going to the front desk waiting in line for another 30mins, hearing other people having similar problems with added charges on the bill that was not theirs. Everything here is an extra charge so have lots of money with you to pay because you will need it. The employees are nice, they all say hi, the bellmen are great very nice and helpful, they warned us about the $10 fee for the fitness center per day, and told us to do the $2.25 per day package to keep that fee lower, but even when we did that we still had issues on being billed wrong as well even after I called and verified it, another trip to the front desk. Also if you can not walk up hills be ready to ride the shuttle they have, and again they expect a tip for the driver. Not impressed at all with a resort I had heard so much about!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not as I remembered.”
Reviews.Author: Satphone
Reviews.Content: The good or great first. The staff was all fantastic! From the nice woman who serviced our room to to the grounds keepers or facilities guys they were all very nice and said hello in passing etc. The rooms and experience and very some. Last time I was up on one the buildings on the hill and things were very calm and next to no noise. This time, perhaps due to our group we were next to one of the "Family pools" and in a larger building. The noise was significantly more and the traffic outside heavy. As the resort is in a small mountain valley the cell phone reception in the rooms was bad, very bad, had we been up on the hill this time I bet it would have been fine but those who had AT&T, T Mobil, Verizon, the old AllTel all had poor coverage in the rooms on the first floor. I went up to the 5th floor via a stair case and it was all fine. I took my laptop with my Verizon air card up and it rocked but in the room was dial up at best. Fees and the like... So it seems they will take care of you for a price... Internet and other things are all in the room for a huge price. I was sad to see that there was no fridge or microwave unless you wanted to pay to rent one. I think it is just sad that what was once a high end location to try and rent you a microwave for about what you can buy one for a a wallgreens. We were from at least in part from AZ and had coolers and did fine with the ice machines they have on the property. Sad part is you could be money ahead if you stayed even two nights if you got a Styrofoam cooler and filled your cooler with the ice and anything you wanted to keep cool. No microwave for popcorn in the room? Uhgggg, their call, just don't expect it. Parking can be an issue, if you get a nice spot enjoy it. Would go back as long as the price was right, Stephen.

Reviews.Title: “If you are expecting to be impressed, don't!”
Reviews.Author: carerick
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Arizona for fun and relaxation. With a tight budget we did our homework looking for a great place to stay in a great location with great facilities. We were surprised to find the Hilton's price so reasonable. We travel to the valley about every two years. We read the reviews of many of the Resorts to compare. We were disapointed to find out that many of the items listed on their website come as an extra charge. Internet access runs over $10 a day. If you want a microwave you're coughing up another $15 fee. Hey want to use the fitness center? Hand over another $10 a day. (unless you added the $ 2.25 special per day. You won't find this out unless you ask for this or read it on the fitness room window) They claim they are up front with their pricing on their website. If you want ice, take the chance roll the dice and if your lucky your building's ice machine works! Ours didn't ! The first night there we let the main desk know. They cheerfully replied they would send an employee up the hill with a bucket of ice immediately. What great service you might think! Wait, the employee showed up at our door to inform us that we would have to walk down the steep hill, to the next building, and fend for ourselves. This went on for our entire six days. They didn't bother to fix the machine or make sure we were cared for. . If you think you have access to all the pools shown, think again. You better check and see if the have rented any one of them out. The smaller pool that we liked best was taken over by a private group. The rooms were clean, but not until 4 pm. Just about the time we wanted to come back and get ready to go out for supper. We're definitely going back to Arizona, but not here!

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderfullll suprise!”
Reviews.Author: lmaglietto
Reviews.Content: This stay was arranged by our travel agent.We weren't sure what to expect -but- to our surprise - a beautiful setting with wonderful staff. I confess we are not huge world travelers but can appreciate exceptional service and surroundings. The front desk staff who assisted us on several occasions (Helen, Ester and Hannah) helped make our stay after a poor experience at the Grand Canyon Best Western, very memorable. Great job gang and thanks for helping make a great memory. Larry and sally

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this resort the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Terry1321
Reviews.Content: The staff at this resort are fantactic. From the time you check in the staff makes you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: forester74
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty much 80's and needs updating. Although it was a suite there was no table just a coffee table. I was most offended by the nickle-dime attitude. Internet fees are $12 per day. Want a microwave oven? Pay additional $15 to have one brought up. Refrigerator? Well, it will be full of $5 candy bars and $7 alcohol that will have to be removed and returned to the fridge if you want to put your own stuff in it. Oh, yeah, you better let them know or they will automatically charge you and restock. That said, the staff was very nice, maintenence was quick and the pools and slide were fun. Each area has a small private pool also close to the rooms. I think we will try another resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Vermin, roaches, bugs in bed, unwashed bed linens, filthy baths and floors”
Reviews.Author: clever7981
Reviews.Content: Four room changes 5 reasons: Noise, filth, mice, cockroaches, bugs on linen. Room 1: Landscaper blowers start at 7 a.m. Front desk stops blowers in front, guys just move to back. Speak with front desk mgr, apologize, insists on $75 credit we did not ask for, and had the bellman move us to different room while we go to the pool. Wowed. Room 2: Pull back shower curtain to find black hand print, scores of hairs, dirty film in tub and soft, mushy leftover soap scum in soap holder. Took wet towel and wiped down floor and around toilet. Startled when flipped over towel to find it completely black and covered with various detritus and filth. Performed same check in vanity tile area. Even worse. Draped towels over bath and called to ask for Gen. Mgr. Not there. They'll have him call in morning but will send a different manager. Opened sofa bed and found linens unchanged, mouse droppings on left side of sheet, hair, and food crumbs under top sheet. Mgr Joe shows up. He doesn't say much. Photographs filthy towels in bath, looks at towels used to wipe tables, counters and bedroom furniture. Says unacceptable, makes some calls to housekeeping, gets two innocent housekeepers to start changing beds. Asks if we want to stay the 30-45 minutes it will take to clean it up. Mgr Joe given two incredulous looks. On way to third room, Mgr Joe offers to buy breakfast the next morning since we've been put out. Put out? What we will be if we find carrion chewing vultures in the next room? Inconvenienced? Room 3: It's very late now; we are exhausted and creeped out. Paranoia is around the corner. Tempers are frayed. Mgr Joe has moved us 2 doors down. He asks if room okay. Room smells good, looks clean, we say it's fine. Drop bags. Start to check everything. Bath clean, bedroom linens clean, furniture and counters wiped down, tile floors clean. Carpets not vacuumed but we can live with that. We are numb and want to sleep. Open sofa bed. We jump out of skins as something scampers off sheets and under the bed. We look down to find more mice droppings, but worse, very small blackish dots that clearly move. They appear too small to be bed bugs. Bed contains more food crumbs and hair. Rip sheet off bed and throw it outside. One of us just wants to shut the door between dividing bedroom from the "vermin room" and go to sleep before having a nervous breakdown. The other demands an immediate departure and disposal of all clothing. Big fight ensues. One leaves, one stays. One that leaves gives in and returns. Forgot the car keys. Compromise occurs. One makes midnight trip to bathroom and finds dead silverfish in toilet. It's dead, right? Pee and flush. Next morning, the other flips on light in bathroom to see roaches scatter. Catches one under plastic cup. Call front desk. Ask to speak to GM who has not called us. He's still unavailable. Front desk is appalled and moves us to a fourth room "closer to the lobby area where you should be fine." Fine? Eric the "Safety" mgr, supervisor, or whatever, appears. He could not be less interested. He pokes around. Looks at cockroach under glass like, "So what? It's not even that big". Eric seems comatose. Or maybe just bored. He says nothing. Mgr Joe is gone. Bellman arrives to move us to 4th room. Like lemmings off a cliff, we follow. Room 4: Get to room. Looks clean. However, we are veterans now. We know where to look so we open up the sofa bed. Lying there, in sweet repose, is a large yellow cookie crumb, with smaller crumbs lazily adorning its edges. Crumbs are surrounded by lustrous, ebony strands of hair. We motion bellman over to look. He looks dutifully. We ask if he would want to sleep in that bed. He shuffles his feet awkwardly and stands at attention by the TV. He doesn't know what to say. He is again summoned to see the offending crumbs and hair. He is asked again whether he would want to sleep in that bed. He looks around to see if anyone else is around and seeing no one, says, "No Way! That's gross, man." We check out. Again, I ask for GM to call me. I am assured he will. He does not and has not. That was Thursday and Friday. It is now Tuesday. A few remarks: We are Hilton Honors members and we've stayed at the Pointe well over 30 times in 20 years. We've never used Priceline but this time a friend guaranteed the best rate using his "method" and got a great deal for us. Upside is great rate. Downside is that not even God can get a refund if things go south. Ok, we learned a lesson. We are not starry-eyed conventioneers from Ohio, who have never seen a gorgeous mountain sunset or been anywhere with nine pools. Neither are we never satisfied, hotel guests from hell. Hotels are staffed with people. People are human. Nothing is perfect. Even so, in over 25 years of global travel, our stay at the Pointe earned a place on our Top 5 Worst Hotels Ever list (Romania's Hotel Razvan taking first). To Management: There is no excuse, not one, ever, to have a mouse, cockroach, or other bug infestation and fail to act or disclose it. Employees who pretend not to notice problems, or fail to report problems to managers, suggest corporate culture issues. Minimizing problems and their effect on guests is not only arrogant; it is insulting. Denying there is a problem at all, when photographs exist, everyone is looking directly at the problem (mouse droppings, wet soap mush in the tub, black filthy floors, cockroaches, etc) and when clearly, the problem is recurring, is dishonest. Failing at least to appear, act, fake, or pretend to be interested in a guest's unhappy and disgusting experience, is unconscionable. Lastly, failing to contact unhappy guests, regardless of loyalty, or whether they carry HH cards, especially when a guest specifically requests it, is a sign of utter contempt. Nota bene: An online posting that starts with a template stating "We are disappointed" or "We are saddened" or "We apologize for..." is unnecessary, and its sincerity inherently suspect. A bellman already informed us not to expect anyone to care about our nightmarish experience unless we post in Trip Advisor. Another employee told us that the GM faithfully reads the Trip Advisor reviews and responds because the reviews are public. This is the same manager who never contacted us while we were there and still has not bothered to call. When we have more time, we will post this review in other travel forums to which subscribe or of which we are members (absent any spelling and grammar errors – haste and all that). *** Note: Night bellman, a college kid, provided excellent service. He was very knowledgeable about the property and available guest service. Sadly, we do not remember his name. Second, the front desk manager and staff are true professionals. Outstanding problem solving skills, excellent service, thoughtful hosts.***

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: missmandymarie412
Reviews.Content: This resort is impressive as soon as you drive up to it. The fountin and spanish style buildings are gorgeous set against the mountains. We were staying here as part of a large event in town and hadn't picked out the hotel ourselves but were glad we ended up here. Even with the amount of people checking in from the event, it was a breeze. The staff was very organized and helpful. Our room was really nice and spacious. We were near the main building and one of the many pools. There was a large sitting area with a TV, couch, chair, and desk with doors the opened into a large, updated bathroom and separate vanity area. The only issue I had with our room was that we were on the ground level of the hotel so our patio area was below ground level. We would have only had a view of the parking lot but being below ground level made the room a little dark. That's the only problem with being part of a large group reservation- you don't get to make your own reservation. Parking is a bit a problem at the resort. There is ample parking, it just seems like there are cars parked everywhere. Mainly along the curbs occasionaly blocking walking paths. The pools are awesome! They are the best part of the resort. Overall- wonderful resort with great rooms and pools!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: lmallo722
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Arizona for a week of recharging our batteries after a tough couple of months. Arizona is just what was needed. I was able to book this hotel after about an hour and half on the phone. The online reservation system accepted my reseravaton with e upgrade request, but never sent me an email with the actual reservation confirmation. The e upgrade came through. No one could explain it and even the supervisors couldn't make the reserves. Finally we called the property, directly, and they were able to make the reservations. Once we arrived at the property we were greeted at the front desk by friendly, helpful agents. The clerk was very nice and was even able to get us an upgrade to a king suite, after we told her about the reservation problems. All the rooms on the property are suites. Our room was close to the lobby and overlooking two of the many pools. My only complaints were with the rooms. The A/C was extremely noisy and we had the engineer come into fix it. Good A/C is a must when it is 102 degrees. There were mini bars in the rooms, but no fridges. There seemed to be a space for one, but it would have been nice to have a small fridge in the room. Also, in this day and age it seems amazing to me that a company as large as Hilton would still charge for WiFi. They had a daily rate, but no weekly rate. Rather than mess with it we would pack up our computer and take it to a local restaurant to plan our day. So the Pointe missed out on our using their restaurant for breakfast every day. There was a large group at the property for part of the week we were there. Everywhere we turned we were turned away because the group was having an event. The property needs to have a little more attention paid to cleanlieness. The large pool area had plates and food that would not be picked up for hours. The staff was always extremely friendly and would bend over backward to make sure you were having a great time. We went to dinner one night at the Different Pointe of View and it was lovely. The staff, from the cocktail lounge to the dining room were professional, friendly and helpful. The food was excellent and we had a beautiful evening. Do not miss the view from here, if even only for a drink. It was a good week and the hotel is a good value for the money. This hotel was very quiet. We were really surprised considering the amount of people that were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay with a few lumps”
Reviews.Author: graveljack
Reviews.Content: We took this trip to escape the Northwest damp weather and weren't disappointed. The first thing one must be aware of is this property is huge and spread out. Signage is almost non-existent and at first it is difficult to find your way around the grounds. Make sure and have a property map and start your explorations from the main reception area. Upon our arrival things started on the wrong foot. I had requested a suite with a view and was informed those rooms had been booked and we would be located down the bluff a short ways. When I asked if we would still have a view I was informed that we would. In deed we did, of the main parking lot. In the evening if one leaned way out onto the balcony a thin area of city lights could be seen so I guess the statement wasn't totally untrue. We found our room, with the aid of a map, and believe me when I say the parking is horrid. If you find a spot in the winding streets comprising the resort, take it, you don't know if you'll ever find another one. Entering our room to be honest, we almost turned around and left. The rooms (suite) are extremely dated with old mediterranean colors and satiny cloth. After the shock of the old fashioned color scheme wore off we explored the room and found to our delight that it was laid out perfectly for and extended stay. The living area, bathroom and bedroom were very private from each area. Each person could move about the suite without bothering their partner. And of course they have the wonderful Hilton beds. We did alot of sightseeing but still came back to the resort to take advantage of the great restaurants they offered. Choices were good and prices were reasonable In all I found the resort quite pleasurable with the exception of the parking situation. If you just utilize the resort and don't travel the parking situation shouldn't cause you grief. Hopefully the color schemes will come into the 21st century in the future.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: grimesd44
