Reviews.Content: After we landed and got our rental car from Sky Harbor Airport (in Phoenix as well), it was a beautiful drive to the hotel. Take rt 51 to get there, despite what the gps says. lol. We had heard about the restaurant on top of the mountain, since it was dusk we saw it from about 5 minutes away and knew we were getting close. Once there you pull up to a beautiful archway. There we met the first of may great employees of this hilton, he introduced himself with "welcome to the pointe hilton tapatio cliffs resort my name is Russ, let me show where you can go to check in and i will get your bags" i believe his name tag said bell captain. On several other occasion in which he went above and beyond to help us with directions and even places to eat. He made me feel welcomed immediately. As my girlfriend began the check in process (which was very quick and easy) Nicole at the front desk described in detail the hotel and all of its vast amenities. We decided we needed to pick up a few items from the store, which is when we spoke to Sydney, who coincidentally, my girlfriend spoke to when she made the reservation originally. So she suggested somewhere that was close by and easy to get to and Russ provided us with directions (that could've been followed blindfolded) because it dropped us off at the front door of the store that Sydney suggested. We then went to our room. It was at this time (because I am a smoker and preferred a balcony) we went back to the front desk to see if we could have our room changed. Nicole immediately checked if they had any of those rooms available and thankfully there were. Nicole and my girlfriend went and saw the room before Nicole was happy we had just the right room, even though her shift was about to end. She suggested my girlfriend go enjoy the pool (with me) while she made the keys for our new room. Not only did she instruct the night manager of the situation, she wrote us a personal note, which made us feel so attended to. We were very impressed.The rest of our stay was very much of the same, the night concierge, Karen, helping us get to the diamondback game, the girl at the desk (I think her name was Betty) who gave us the reader's digest version of what arizona had to offer. During the day the resort had 8 different pools and sunbathing areas. The family pool is were they have the mini water park, yes i said it, a water park!! it's a perfect blend of adult and family fun. there is a bar/restaurant called "cascades" good food and very reasonably priced. Steve our waiter was attentive and always there when we needed something, but never felt like he was lurking around. As i went down the 140 ft waterslide and ran like a kid back and forth, the lifeguard Matt was great with all the kids and adults that wanted to go down the slide. he heard my girlfriend talking about getting a picture of me coming out the bottom of the slide. so before i went, he radioed down to make sure the pool was clear before the next person went (which was me) and informed the girl at the bottom to tell my girlfriend to get ready. Sure enough she got the shot! There were much quieter pools for those who just wanna relax. The night before we left, we met with friends of ours who lived in phoenix for cocktails at the restaurant in the resort called "different pointe of view" we were taken aback by the breath taking views from the patio lounge. the sun was setting and you could see all of phoenix from above as it began to light up and was such a romantic view. The entirety of our trip was more of the same, every person we encountered was just as helpful and friendly as the next. a stellar vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed in this Hilton property....”
Reviews.Author: April1969
Reviews.Content: SO disappointed in the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. The rooms (at least in the main building) were downright dumpy. Broken light fixtures, windowless bathroom with no working lamps or fan, the cord in the phone in the bedroom would not stay connected (so you couldn't call the desk without having to hold it in place), toothpaste "over-spray" (read: spit) on the bathroom walls, we had to kill a cockroach in the bathroom within 5 minutes of getting into our room, etc. OH - and don't even ATTEMPT to try to pull out the sleeper-sofa. They had to send the handyman down, who wrenched on it for about 10 minutes to get it to pull out. (I had read elsewhere that this was a problem for other guests, but thought, "How hard could it be? It's a sleeper sofa!" Well, I was wrong). The most disturbing - as a Mom of two small children, is the huge 6"-8" gap at the bottom of the railings which line walkways and the balconies. A small child (ours is 18-months) could easily, EASILY slip through and fall. We were given a 4th floor room, but had to move to a ground floor room because it was the only one that didn't have this rail. The upside was the pool at the Waterfall area. There was ample room for us to spread out and relax. The gradual slope that the little ones can walk into the water themselves, was helpful so that they could splash without having to be held to get in and out of the water. Unfortunately, the photos for the Hilton site are FAR above and beyond what you actually get for the rooms. They fooled us. We actually ended up canceling the last two days of our stay and booked at another hotel. I was surprised that Hilton would allow one of their properties to have such low standards. Hope this helps someone else with making a decision!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous desert oasis!”
Reviews.Author: rosedene2011
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort over Easter and couldn't have been happier! The rooms are much more tasteful than the pics online and the resort itself is huge! So much to explore with little kids. We practically had the pools to ourselves most of the time which was an added bonus. They even had an Easter egg hunt for all the kids. We ate at Pointe in Thyme restaurant, very good and fresh and we ate pool side, perfect if you just want to lounge around. We were so comfortable and relaxed here that we recommend Tapatio Cliffs resort to everyone. They have a lot of shuttle services within the resort and off the resort. Our favourite was the set up of the rooms. It was so easy to put our son to bed and then sip our wine in the separate living area without waking him, super spacious! It's also a good idea to rent a car cause there is nothing within walking distance of the hotel, but just up or down the main road there are decent places to shop for food or eat out.

Reviews.Title: “At least I had a good pillow”
Reviews.Author: Bagels-Mom
Reviews.Content: As this hotel resort is built into the hillside, some of the building are quite far up the hills. The only way to get from place to place is to walk in the roads. No paths or short cuts. After hiking for 5 days this is not what I had in mind. True we could call for the van to pick us up if we wanted, but choose not to. One of our rooms had a very bad vibration in it, which could not be repaired. This made sleeping a challenge. We we're offered another set of rooms without a king bed even further up the hill, so tried to tough it out where we were. Our rooms were not made up till 5PM.??? Views.....there were none that we could see. I've never been to a 4 star property that told me I should drive to my room and if needed help with my bags call him and he would send a bellman. What a joke. On the bright side, the service at the pools was very nice and they did let us check out at 12:30. I do understand that this is not a $400 a night resort, but still.......they claim to be a 4 star resort. I didn't see it, or feel it.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: xmaclaugh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful three day vacation in the sun. The staff was fantastic and we enjoyed every aspect of the experience. The pools are very nice, food great and rooms clean, comfortable with great views. We ventured off property to Salute Italian Restaurant which was outstanding. The owner visited with us at the table and the food was incredible. We also went to Via Del Sorento for authentic Mexican food with great tequila! We will be back as it was an excellent trip!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!!”
Reviews.Author: berly24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made an impulsive decision to leave the MN snow behind and take off for the weekend. We did an Expedia search and found this resort. The reviews and pictures were good, so we took a chance. We were extremely happy with our choice. We had originally requested a King Suite, but one was not available when we checked in. We took a double queen. It had such a great view and plenty of room, that we canceled our request to move the next day if a king became available. They have EIGHT pools! Some are extrememly quiet and peaceful. Others have more action. All are great. The hotel is right next to the North Mountain Hiking trails. We could access the trail right outside our building. We took some great hikes each day. The restaurant serves a nice breakfast that was pretty reasonably priced compared to most hotel restaurants. Service everywhere was excellent! I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: chiwawa4556
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pointe Tapatio Cliffs for our wedding night and we wished that we could have stayed longer because our suite was amazing! It had a living room, dining room, a bathroom and a half, and a huge closet! The staff was very friendly and helpful and everything was very clean. We're looking forward to returning soon for a getaway weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: VnJnAnJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two young children (4 and 8) for one night. We had just finished a big driving tour of Puebloan sites of the Southwest (Canyon de Chelly, Chaco Canyon, Mesa Verde) and the Grand Canyon. We booked the hotel on priceline.com, and were absolutely delighted with the property! We stayed in a standard suite, which was nicely updated. The size of the rooms is great, and we liked the room layout. As some reviews mention, the property is older, and some aspects of the architecture/style could use updating, but this is a minor point. The important aspects, like room appointments and pool areas, are nicely updated. I am a bit of a snob when it comes to my bed linens, and the linens on the beds were great (nice thread count). My husband can be a bit high-maintenance about bed comfort, and he was totally pleased with the mattress. Also, as other reviewers have mentioned, the staff here is absolutely fantastic - super friendly and incredibly accommodating. As I mentioned, we stayed here as the last stop of a long road trip (two small kids in the car - yikes) and it was a really nice finish to the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Az”
Reviews.Author: Sojette
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors traveler my wife and I like to stay at the various Hilton properties when we visit the Phoenix area. This year we tired the Tapatio Cliffs. I always like to call the property directly ahead of time an ask about any events such as conferences. I was told it was a slow time but upon arrival on Saturday we found ourselves between 2 large conventions and numerous weddings. The lobby was crowded and very noisy and parking was difficult to find, but once at the desk Hannah did her best to right the situation. There was no upgrades available that first night but s he moved us to a quiet area and reserved an upgrade for the next morning. She really turned our initial impression around. Our room was great and the view excellent. We enjoyed the many pools and go early each day to hike. The hiking trails and nature preserve visitors center is out the back door and having access to the trails was great. You can do so much an never have to get in your car. The daily breakfast buffet at the pointe in tyme was excellent and the friendly staff welcomed us back each morning after our hike. Overall if you are looking for a place to relax and have things to keep you busy either by the pool,gym,golf or hiking this is the place. While not at the same level of the Boulders or Biltmore or the price point. You get a lot for your dollar and the low resort fee and access to outdoor activities make this a worth while vacation stop. Also many good value nearby places to eat to help you stay on budget. Try Salutes down the road. Ask for Vinny.

Reviews.Title: “Fun + Relaxation = Pointe Tapatio Cliffs”
Reviews.Author: Goede17
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiancé (I proposed to her while on the trip) recently stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs for a get-away out of Ohio for fun in the sun, and we were not disappointed. From the start, everyone from Charles Partier and his team to the pool staff, went above and beyond to truly make this a memorable experience. Allen from the Kids Corral would always welcome us into the pool, and stop off for daily conversation and things we should visit while in the area. I would have to agree with the prior write-up that the pools are the real attraction of the grounds, with 8 pools and a waterslide (that I would frequent many times a day) were a real highlight of each day. Rooms have recently been updated, and were very spacious and welcoming during our weeklong visit to Tapatio. I would have to also mention that the gift shop there at Tapatio Cliffs is stunning, we actually found more variety and better quality merchandise there, then we did while shopping locally. The attendant told us that the manager of the gift shop likes to bring in the “local flavor” which is shown by the variety of sculptures, pottery, picture frames and clothing. Great variety! We bought many pieces for both home and friends there. We are already planning our next trip out to Arizona next year, and we can only hope we can duplicate our stay at Pointe Hilton Tapatio!

Reviews.Title: “Great family destination!”
Reviews.Author: stroms5
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs for a family spring break vacation. This is our second stay at this resort and this visit was as good as the first. The rooms have been recently renovated and are very comfortable and spacious. The real attraction of this property are the pools. There are a total of 8 pools on the property. The main pool area is called the Falls Village and consists of 2 zero entry pools, one with a waterslide. There is also a golf course attached as well as nearby mountain trails. We look forward to another trip to Tapatio Cliffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: PJGAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before our wedding & on our wedding night. The staff was wonderful at check in and in the gift shop. I also visited the spa, and we dined at the Pointe in Tyme for breakfast. Our room was fantastic - we stayed in the grande suite in the main building. The only drawback was parking, which tended to be hard to find (the hotel was booked, so what can you do). We didn't have a chance to visit the pools, but the hotel grounds are beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in a beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: snicholso412
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort March 12-17. The weather was absolutely beautiful, as was the resort. We loved being able to hike the paths just a few steps from our room. Our only regret is that we were so busy exploring Phoenix, Sedona, and Scottsdale that we didn't get to fully explore and use the resort facilities. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: carolerubi
Reviews.Content: was with my two teenage daughters for a girls getaway... called to tell them we would be checking in late, and asked if we would still be guaranteed a suite with two queens and was told yes.... when we checked in , the woman at the desk told us we had a suite with one king... explained our situation and she told us the hotel was full, there was nothing she could do and that we shouldnt have been told that 2 queens was an option since we made our reservations online... fine, i can live with that , asked if we could change the next day and she said she would see what she could do. i went to the front desk in the morning and they were kind enough to switch us to a room with 2 queens.. that evening, when we were geting into bed, my 19 year old daughter showed me here stomach and shoulder which were lined with small bites that looked and felt like bedbug bites! we called the front desk and they sent security up right away, they stripped our beds and looked for bugs which they couldnt see.... nonetheless, they offered to switch our rooms again and said they would be up with someone to help us move our luggage. noone came so we went down to the front desk, same woman working as the night before... she proceeded to argue with me about the bedbug situation and said that there is no way that there could be bugs since security didnt see them , i happened to look this up online and know that it is not true,,, even one bug can bite and not be found on first glance, i also told her that my daughter was the only one of us to sit on the couch and she continued to argue with me and was really rude.. please know that i am easy to please and have never written a negative review in my life, i just couldnt believe that this woman would be so rude and argumentative with me, when we were being put out of our rooms at 11 pm, no bellman showed up and my daughter had bites on her belly and back which she asked me how did i not know that it wasnt a mosquito??? if it was , thats great! but we paid alot of money for this room and would expect the staff to be more gracious and apologetic!!! oh wait, we did get 3 free water bottles for our troubles.... the rest of our stay was fine... we left the property alot for other activities,,, stayed away from the big pool but was pleased with the family pool , the gym was nice. on the positive side, we all got massages... david was an excellent massage therapist... and karen the concierge was fabulous! friendly and helpful with great suggestions and alot of knowledge she even got my daughter a guest pass to use a 24 hr fitness that her son belongs to as my daughter is a college swimmer and needed to use a lap pool to train... she left us the pass under our door when we got back from a night out .... over all i was upset with the way Lisa at the front desk treated us... she seemed to have a real chip on her shoulder and was not what you would expect from a Hilton property...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and location slightly dowdy rooms”
Reviews.Author: blacmikOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 days in March 2011 First the positives: - most polite and cooperative hotel staff you will find anywhere - great location - reasonable prices - large well lit rooms - great hiking trails and golf course Negatives: - rooms are slightly run down and musty smelling. - if you are on the top floors you get some noise from the air-cons - you need a car

Reviews.Title: “Dump!”
Reviews.Author: dietdrp
Reviews.Content: This resort is old, dirty and its website of pictures and amenities is a complete misrepresentation of the real thing. The suite has popcorn ceilings, tile, curtains and carpet that look like they were taken off a clearance rack. They say they offer workout facilities until you get here and they tell you there is a fee to use the gym. There is nothing that warrants this resort receiving a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Julie_Cor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Very nice, clean resort. Loved the pool areas - adult and family pools were very quiet. Staff were efficient. Rooms were very clean. I didn't like being charged for internet access. Might have used the fitness center but $10/day??? Ate at the Different Pointe of View restaurant twice - fantastic!! Incredible views. Point in Thyme restaurant also very good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Wedding in a Perfect Setting and Location.”
Reviews.Author: azdjd
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her new husband picked this location for there all inclusive wedding on March 18, 2011 after comparing the Pointe Hilton to many other locations here in Phoenix, AZ. We would like to thank Mike Krohmer the Director of Catering for helping in selection of vendors for this occasion. It was a good feeling to hear nothing but compliments on the Ministor and Outdoor Ceremony location, To the Flowers, Cake, DJ, and the FOOD, which were all in an indoor and outdoor reception area. We would like to thank the Pointe Hilton and the entire staff for going the extra mile to make this a wedding day to remember for the Bride and Groom and all of the guests that attended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jrm523
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from Phoenix. We were out there for a wedding at another property, and decided to stay here prior. What a wonderful experience! So many pools to choose from and activities for all ages too. The all-suite rooms were very comfortable, nicely appointed and the mini bar prices were pretty reasonable, all things considered. We LOVED our time here, and look forward to returning, and this time will spend a week ! Great resort, great value, good food, and lots of choices! Oh, and very beautiful grounds!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great look, great feel”
Reviews.Author: Puer2ricn
Reviews.Content: Amazing resort with a really great feel to it. Would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: JEG633
Reviews.Content: Spent a short spring break trip at this hotel with my college daughter. We wanted to enjoy the Arizona sun, and have a nice resort setting with pools and areas to walk. The Pointe Hilton fit us perfectly. The facilities were very nice, the staff was helpful, and all of the rooms are nice sized suites. The price is less than 1/2 what you would pay in Scottsdale for the same thing. The location is decent, within the North Mountain Reserve. The only negative, is that is was a bit of a drive to get to some of the surrounding attractions, but only an extra 15 minutes or so. Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: DeniKS
Reviews.Content: While staying at the hotel we had the pleasure of meeting Russ the bell captain. It was later at night and he was actually on his way out of work. He saw us looking around and approached us even though he was on his way out, not even in uniform still, clearly his shiff was over. He answered all our questions and even made dinner reservations for us. This kind of service is hard to find now a days and deserves to be recognized!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, could use some updates.”
Reviews.Author: jbcockrum
Reviews.Content: My stay here was for business only so I didn't have a lot of time at the actual resort. Although, I will say all of the pools and the golf course looked very nice. My co-worker played a round of golf and said it was top 3 best golf courses he had ever been on. I really liked the gym, but it was a long ways away from my room, as this resort is very spread out. The only thing I can say bad about the place is the rooms could use an update. Carpet and furniture was kind of out of date and the television in the bedroom was not a flat screen. They could also stand to use an upgrade to some HD channels and better cable. The mini-bar and condiments in the room were very pricey, but that is standard. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What's Not to Like...?.”
Reviews.Author: vws
Reviews.Content: This is an update of the Tapatio review I left 3 years ago: What is there to dislike about the Tapatio? It is one of the best hotels in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and you can get a room for $99.00 until Jan. 5th (and around $220-50 after…good breaks for AAA members). We have stayed at the Phoenician, The Hyatt at Gainey Ranch, The Wigwam, etc. (Someone mentioned that they left the Tapatio because they thought it was not up to snuff, and they were going over to the Phoenician...just be aware that the Phoenician is about 3 times the cost of the Tapatio.) Of all those hotels, we often prefer to go to The Tapatio because: 1. Wonderfully friendly staff who go out of their way to say hello or to help you out. This includes the check-in staff, the hotel room-service delivery people, the gift shop people and the whole assortment of the people at the golf course. Someone commented in a post that “...the service people always had their hand out for a tip.” I have never felt pressured to give anyone a tip. However, at any resort tipping is just part of the deal. It is normal to tip: the bellboy, the waitresses, and anyone who does something special for you such as bring an extra pillow, etc. Also, at any golf course, it is proper to tip the person who cleans your clubs when you come in. 2. The rooms are suites. The first is, of course, the living room. That is separated from the bedroom by an ingenious system of doors on either side of the bathroom (The bathroom has a pass-through from the living room to the bedroom…basin and mirror on one side, toilet and bath on the other with a door.) which is between the two rooms…one that closes between the living room and the bathroom and one that closes between the bathroom and the bedroom; this allows people in one room to close off the other room but to still use the bathroom. Also, the T.V. on in one room can’t be heard in the other. I see in a couple of posts that people though the place needs up-grading. Actually, the hotel did one of those hugely expensive “re-dos” two years ago. Unfortunately, the colors they picked are a bit drab which gives the rooms a less that bright appearance. The beds have feather pillows and feather quilts. There is a wet bar and refrigerator in the living room. 2 wide screen t.v.‘s., and adequate lighting by each side of the bed. 3. There are two main restaurants. One is paneled with mahogany and is very handsome. Good food, reasonably priced for a resort. Great bar and a friendly atmosphere. Then there is their very slick “A Point of View” restaurant with terrific views of Phoenix/Scottsdale, but we have not eaten there. 4. You want pools? They’ve got pools. A huge water-wonderland set up with slides, etc. Two smaller pools are near the main part of the hotel…rarely busy (one is adults only), and one on top of the hill. Fitness center. And here is something outstanding: the hotel does not charge the usual $10-$12 a day “resort fee” which I have come to hate at all hotels. 5. GOLFERS! Listen up. The course is terrific. It is kept in first-class condition. The course has been called “the Phoenix areas best kept secret.” The staff was very accommodating. The course climbs up and up until the 9th (at which point you are 3 miles from the clubhouse) where you can see for miles in either direction. There are some pretty tricky holes where doglegs, water and thick desert flora abound. Deep traps. Undulating greens, Fun. I wasn’t paid to be this upbeat about the hotel! I just think it is great place. It isn’t going to all things to all people…but give it try. I think you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Mike Krohmer, Director of Catering made my business trip the best it could be!”
Reviews.Content: If you have a convention or business meeting, the service you will have with Mike Krohmer is going to be outstanding. He was flexible, caring and always followed up on my calls and questions. The constant changes from customers was very stressful for me but Mike handled it all and kept the service above my expectations. The facitity was great for all ranges of families with and without children. The Lookout Mountain golfing was great for my customers from the Midwest. The attention from the front desk was perfect and accomidating. Hilton can be proud of this facility and I recommend it to all. Sincerely, Douglas L. Weiss

Reviews.Title: “Update me - Please!”
Reviews.Author: topo-traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband I often choose to stay at Hilton properties and are usually pleased with our stay. This was not one of those experiences! On arrival, it was clear that the hotel was in need of massive renovation and updates. Thanks to our awards status, we were upgraded to a suite. We found the room spacious however, the furnishings were drab and outdated. The gym was small and packed with kids and a traveling soccer team – the same statement can be made about the pools. If you’re looking for a romantic get-away this is NOT the hotel for you. We did find the food good, however the spa was extremely overpriced for the quality of the hotel. One positive were the hiking trails across the street but you will have to drive as there’s a 4 lane highway separating the preserve from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: sharkdaddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference so it was not a place we chose. We were traveling with 2 dogs and they were pet friendly. We decided to upgrade our room to a suite for the comfort. The room was set up very nice, but when we walked in everything was brown and dingy. Because we had the dogs we were put at the top of the hill on the 4th floor and at the very end of the units. Not convenient for us. Our view from the bedroom balcony was very nice of the city. The bed was very comfortable. The furniture was very dusty and the carpet needed cleaning. I don't care that they use this room for travelers with dogs but when you pay over $200 a night I expect a clean room. Isn't that what you pay the pet fee for? We had room service one night and the cost was over the top for two salads and two plain pasta dishes with no drinks. $60 total. The staff was friendly and helped with whatever we needed. This hotel did have parking for their guests near the rooms but trying to get the luggage to the room was exahausting since everything is on steep hills. The room would have been quite if the hotel had not been packed with kids for a soccer meet. Constant door slamming.

Reviews.Title: “Most Caring Place I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: tcruzd
Reviews.Content: I ate at their restaurant, and was served by a waitress named Nik Ferugia, and she was the most caring individual I had the pleasure in meeting. Her attention to details and making sure I was completely satisfied, was exceptional. Never did I feel like I was being rushed, she made my lunch both enjoyable and interesting. Nik is an asset to this hotel, and I would certainly return due to her friendly smile, and warm personality. The food was outrageous as well, just a great place with great people working for them. Kudos to the management staff for locating such a warm, full of life individual like Nik!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit tatty and gets busy, but good facilities and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: philo88
Reviews.Content: If you get a sub $170 rate inc breakfast you can put up with the very tatty rooms (sofa bed so complicated we needed an engineer). The location isn't that great, either, and it seems crowded with conventions etc; but upsides are very helpful staff, a well-equipped and apparently free business centre (no charge for use of computers or copiers while we were there - the in-room internet is charged for are didn't work in our case), good facilities and an excellent breakfast with brilliant service. Breakfast is great, but expensive so get an inclusive package.

Reviews.Title: “The experience was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lorideyo
Reviews.Content: your staff treated us exceptionally well the girls at the front desk were very thorough with activities we could do while there, there was one wo was very nice and very well positioned in her job. Her name began with an S i think sindy beautiful and exceptionally good at her job.. The rooms were very nic. would recommend for any one going to arizona to try. Oh and the food was exceptional. Beautiful landscape. overall give a 9

Reviews.Title: “All resorts should be measured by the professionalism and service provided by this Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: SalesRepEdmonton
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort was chosen as the location for our company’s Global Conference. The three day Conference included providing meeting rooms, breakfast, lunch and dinners. Customers and staff traveled from all over the globe to attend the event. We were extremely impressed with how the management and staff of the resort provided excellent and timely service. From check in to departure we were treated with the utmost care and attention. The staff was polite and courteous. I would recommend that if you are planning a vacation or looking for a destination to hold an event that you consider The Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. You will find this resort to exceed your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “the place is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: roger3066
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member I had a couple of certificates for free nights at any Holton family hotel. My wife and I decided to go to Phoenix for a "do nothing but relax" weekend. I chose Tapatio Cliffs based on the website and we were not disappointed. The staff was great as were the accomodations (I upgraded to a Falls Village suite). In the afternoon, we stopped by the A Different Pointe of View restaurant to check it out and ran into and talked to Chef Anthony. We dined there Friday night and the food, staff and ambience were fantastic. The rest of the weekend was staying at the resort and relaxing - at the Tocaloma Spa, the whirlpools, pools and hiking. Totally recommend this place. We will come back. Also love the layout on the cliffs - not your average resort on a flat piece of land.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service if you can tolerate little maintenance issues”
Reviews.Author: echolakeguy
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent-we decided we wanted to change rooms (just wanted more room) and Brandon accommodated us far more than adequately. The room was huge and comfortable beds. Several very minor but noticeable maintenance issues (i.e.-cabinet door half off, loose shower handle, wobbly table legs). It all worked but should be fixed. You can see needed maintenance throughout the resort and that is the thing I noticed the most. The pools were excellent. Love the location unless you want quick access to downtown venues. I like being out a little. Nice mountain setting with some great views. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Best hotel in the area, and I have tried them all.”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Marl
Reviews.Content: Clean, Very comfortable rooms, Very comfortable stay. Very interesting grounds, and always clean rooms with no negatives. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Employees”
Reviews.Author: jan3smith
Reviews.Content: I came to this property as a part of a returning conference with a large group. I must say the front desk was fully staffed and ready for the major arrival of our group (over 300 check-ins). They were very fast and efficient in getting us in. Even though they had a lobby full of people they still had postitive attidues and smiles on their faces. They also took the time to try to accommodate our personal requests and didn't try to rush us off quickly just to get to the next person in line. While I was her for business I did take some time to tour the property. It is a very spread out and kind of confusing but very fun and beautiful to explore. There are hiking trails throughout the property and a hiking area across the way. Every employee I encountered on my tour were all so happy and full of smiles. Definitly felt welcomed. I will definitly come back when I'm not on business to relax and get away

Reviews.Title: “Best place in AZ”
Reviews.Author: bluesky071
Reviews.Content: Everything was amazing, all staff went above and beyond to make my friends and I feel welcome. The room was perfect and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough. Great pool areas and hiking.”
Reviews.Author: GrancyKC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days to get away from cold midwestern winter. Used HHonors points so can't speak to value of rooms. It was average or above throughout resort. The pool areas were very nice and big. Good breakfast at the grille there. The high end restaurant at the top of the hill was good, but the views were great. Not alot to walk to there. Plan on driving to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: BigBuba
Reviews.Content: The place is AWESOME from the desert veiws to the the roomservice food and the staff. My friend and I go there in the winter time to get away from the cold we ride are bikes on the great phoenix trail system wihich is right outside the property hike the hills that are 5 mins away(no driving).Anyone who love to hike or Mtn.Bike this is the Phoenix resort for you. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service and accommodation of my disability”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyGal
Reviews.Content: Confession here: I usually stay at Marriott properties when I travel for business, but my company booked this property for a sales meeting. It has been years since I stayed at a Hilton property and the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort won me over. I actually landed myself in a wheelchair last fall after a hiking accident. It's temporary until I recover, but nonetheless, terribly inconvenient. The folks at point Hilton Tapatio accommodated my every need. They helped me every day with giving me extra laundry bags so I could fill with ice to ice my ankle every night, the staff was proactive in helping me plate my food from the buffets, help me across doorway thresholds, and the shuttle to get around the property were invaluable--and you don't even need to be disabled to request them. I was in an ADA suite, which was gigantic! The room was equipped with everything at the right level so I could access and I had bars to hang on to. The one improvement that could be made is to the door. I found myself stuck on how to get inside my room when I don't have anyone around to help. It's very complicated when you're in a wheelchair. I had to ask a bell boy for help one time. Another time when I was alone I got the door open, had to hop out of my chair on one foot while holding the heavy door (heaven forbid if I should break my other leg while doing so). And then I had to figure out how to get the wheelchair in the door, since the breaks were on. Management should brainstorm about how to make this easier for those in ADA rooms, is all I'm saying. Otherwise, loved my room. The staff at the spa was equally accommodating and helpful, as were the valets at the Different Point of View restaurant and their staff. (I have to tell you, though, the handicap-accessible bathrooms at the Different Point of View restaurant aren't truly wheelchair accessible, as their decal on the outside of the door would suggest. I couldn't get my wheelchair into the handicap stall. My husband (who was traveling with me to assist) had to come into the ladies room with me to help me out. Oh well. Just sayin'. Could use some improvement there. Otherwise, I really enjoyed my stay and was only saddened by the fact that I was really limited in mobility. I wanted to tour the property, but really couldn't do so in my situation. I will have to come back sometime (maybe my company will book there again) and truly enjoy all the property has to offer. One more thing. The room service menu could use more choices. Would also like to see more variety, including choices with a southwest flair, since I was a visitor to Phoenix. Am looking forward to coming back again, though. And hopefully not in a wheelchair or on crutches.

Reviews.Title: “My Great Escape to the Desert”
Reviews.Author: 1ronman
Reviews.Content: The Mid-Atlantic was hit with a barrage of snowstorms just before the holiday season when I decided to escape. By chance, I stumbled on the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort, where I was greeted with courtesy, kindness and a grasp for customer service second to none. Dining options include room service, casual dining and the ultimate in fine dining. Other amenities include High-speed internet (for a daily fee), a heated pool and hot tub steps away, USA Today on your doorstep and daily housekeeping. Lookout Mountain is a not-very-long, yet extremely challenging golf course. If there’s one thing I would change, it would be having an in-room security safe. Instead, they offer a key, which accesses a safe behind the front desk. p.s. I’m returning for the third time in less than 40 days

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Slimbone
Reviews.Content: The staff here was very helpful, the bed was extremely comfortable (I *love* sleeping on a rock-hard mattress, and that's exactly what my bed was), and it had an an unbelievable quilt on top! Unfortunately, those are the only three positives that I can come up with for this hotel: 1. The furniture in the sitting-room (a love seat and some kind of arm chair) was *extremely* uncomfortable. There was a rolling office-type chair (great for using after you get tired of the other, uncomfortable furniture), but the back on it couldn't be locked in the upright position, so you can't lean back if you decide to watch TV while you're sitting in it. 2. The room didn't have a microwave in it. 3. The water in the shower didn't get hot. In fact, it never got above warm. 4. There was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. (This can be an issue if you don't have any spray air freshener!) I talked to the front desk staff, and they said that NONE of the rooms in the main building have exhaust fans in the bathrooms, only the bathrooms in the out-lying buildings do. Figure that one out! 5. The sliding glass door to the balcony had a broken latch, and couldn't be locked. (It would have taken very little effort for someone to climb up to the second floor and come in, either while we were away or while we were asleep.) 6. Helicopters! All day and ALL NIGHT!!! (I realize that the hotel can't control whether or not helicopters over fly your room, but that doesn't make them any less annoying, especially when they wake you from a sound sleep.) 7. Finally (and this is the one that I find truly amazing), after you pay the premium rate for staying at this place, they want to charge you for Internet access! I wanted to send a copy of this review to Hilton, but the corporate page for sending comments / feedback to Guest Relations only had a small area for entering text. I e-mailed them and asked for an address I could send this review to so that they could address these issues. The next person that I heard from was the manager at the hotel itself, who is responsible for these terrible conditions to begin with. When I e-mailed Corporate back, telling them I wanted to send my review directly to them, I didn't hear anything further, so I guess they're not really interested in the experiences that their customers have at their hotels. However, I really wanted to let them know about my experience, so I telephoned them and got an e-mail address that I can send this to; maybe now these issues will be corrected. My suggestion: Find somewhere else to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and accessability”
Reviews.Author: galfrmcal
Reviews.Content: Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort is an exceptional experience. Staff is continuously helpful and always courteous. Suites were skillfully laid-out, with bathroom between living room and bedroom that can be completely closed off from both. Good planning. A bedroom tv and a living room tv, wow!! Lovely grounds, lots to see in the resort and good restaurants, too. Resort is located conveniently close to Mayo Clinic, which is why we were in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel for a Quick Girls-Getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelgolucky2005
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pointe Hilton, and have nothing but good things to say. The grounds were great. Aside from the hotel being a little further away from the "downtown" feel, the hotel had many attractions that made it a great short trip for my girlfriends and I. The pools were beautiful, and heated in the winter! It was awesome! Not to mention the staff was great too! The few that stood out were Manager Shaun at the front desk, as well as Brady, and the Van Driver, I believe his name was Dick. These three gentleman in particular made our stay much more enjoyable. They were extremely attentive, and fulfilled our every wish ( and we sure did have a lot)! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice relaxing time without all the Scottsdale fluff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tomy_girl10
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Tapatio Cliffs 4 times now and have nothing but nice things to say about it. The rooms are clean, staff is wonderful, the suites are roomy and the walls thick enough that you do not hear any of your neighbors so you can get a good nights sleep. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: dsrtmanz
Reviews.Content: From the moment I pulled up my car to the time I checked out. Everyone was helpful and friendly. No invavise house keeping, they just magicaly cleaned my room when I was not there. I lost my IPOD security personally checked the room called me back. Housekeeping turn it in and it;s being shipped back to me. Room service was fast, hot , served with a smile and very tasty! I am a Hilton Honnors memeber and its stays like this that remind me why I no loger do biz with Marriott. Was shocked to see the biz center charged to use the internet. A dated concept.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly where did that condom wrapper come from”
Reviews.Author: silver33
Reviews.Content: Last evening about 15 minutes before our business dinner, as I was dressing, I looked down on the floor by the curtain in the bedroom of the suite and there it lay - - the wrapper. All I can say is that I certainly hope the contents of the wrapper were properly disposed...'cause this certainly wasn't. And, it wasn't there prior to the discovery - been in the room for the past four nights... So, gotta' think that either the maid was having safe sex in the room, or someone else with a room key was.... The staff assisted us in a galloping run in changing suites; have to give them credit there. But when we heard some remark about refunding us $30.00 for this "oops," I am not impressed. Am now sitting on the couch covered with what I hope are clean towels, wearing my socks and fully dressed. Cleanliness and proper inspection of the rooms is definitely not on the list of priorities here. Color us totally disappointed and grossed out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: xtremedream
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our family for a field hockey tournament that was being held in Phoenix. The hotel was beautiful and clean. The room was clean and spacious with a lovely view. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Yes, you had to walk a little around the property - but we enjoyed that. The pool (The Falls) was fabulous...with waterfalls, bar/food, music, water slide, etc. The restaurants were very good. The town itself was very clean, but nothing much to do there!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly to the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: b232nna
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely does not cater to the needs of its guests. No room service after 11 pm, which is difficult when traveling across time zones. Not for the mobility impaired: up 2 elevators and a staircase to my room. Not for the vegetarian. The hotel restaurant was flummoxed by my request for a vegetarian meal and had no idea how to accommodate the request. (Very slow on the drinks as well.) Not a professional finish to the staff: I've never before been greeted by a hotel doorman with "Hi, guy". Well, the rooms are clean anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not grand”
Reviews.Author: lcmego
Reviews.Content: We 'bought' a weekend at Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort at a silent auction for a charity, that included a Presidential Suite. Don't be fooled by that. They have 25 or more Presidential Suites and I don't think that is an appropriate name for the room. We were reassigned when I mentioned our voucher was THE Presidential Suite and told that they had multiple suites of this catagory. The lady at the desk who was very pleasant, told us this was one of their favorite rooms because of it's view. Well, if we stood leaning over our balcony, looked through buildings and a bit around our balcony, we could see a pool and a bit of the city and by gosh, a parking lot. It was a nice corner room that had another view of a building, and the last view was a mound that had a road on top of it, so we heard both cars going up and down and people on the stairs. (And stairs from the parking lot do not have rails, not for the faint of heart). Once in the room it was quite nice, however NOT presidential. The first thing I always look at is the tub, and this was NOT a tub that I wanted to sit in. It was an old ordinary tub/shower combination, similar to a rental apartment set up. There were 2 bathrooms which was a nice feature, too bad someone didn't take the time to put one of the sinks in properly, poor workmanship (husband's a general contractor) and one of the toilets ran every 20 minutes. We thought it was the neighbor's shower so didn't say anything. The amenities where typical of any room, shampoo, soap, lotion, but not a 'Presidential Suite'. The coffee maker was nice, too bad one of the mugs wasn't clean. It had a Hilton and a local things to do magazine. Too bad they were from 2008. Everything seemed to have a 'too bad'. Even the current letter in the room that offered something in the gift shop wasn't up to date. When I inquired, the lady told me they didn't have that special anymore. (Sheet was dated October 2010) She seemed a bit clueless about the letter from the room. Included in our package was golf. Mike, Dave, the pro shop gentleman, the snack cart lady and everyone else were wonderful even if the Marshall did seem a bit clueless about driving his cart around just as I was ready to hit. Best part of the trip. Would have been helpful to have a map of the course since we had never played there. We ate at the Pointe in Tyme and had a snack by a pool. I'll review the restaurant separately and Cascades Cafe was good but once again, 'too bad' they didn't get my order right. (Beef or chicken was the choice, I asked for beef, I got chicken). Kind of a hap-hazard operation in a lovely setting. Nice enough, but too many 'too bad'.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good, but looks are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: spchiro
Reviews.Content: This review has been a long time coming. I have stayed at this resort many times over many years, the last being several years ago. I stopped purposely due to events that have changed my view of this hotel for good. I am reminded that I have never written a review and wish to make amends and let those who wish to stay here know just how this resort has changed over the years. Back in the '80's, I first encountered the Pointe at Tapatio and found it to be a most luxurious and comforting hotel. I loved the beautiful spanish villas, the lush grounds, the sumptuous and relaxing suites with their separate living rooms. There was a quiet, a calm, a sense of all is right with the world. Staff were always attentive and concerned about my stay. Everything about the place spoke of style and luxury. I thoroughly enjoyed relaxing by the pool, swimming, dozing, letting the minutes tick by. Then something began to happen. As the years went by and the '80's became the '90's and on, the pricing began to change. I couldn't help but notice that the rate kept on decreasing. At first, I thought I had gone to heaven. On the other hand, events started to happen that turned this reverie of a resort into something else. On several occasions during one stay, we had to call security to break up several loud parties happening around the pool, then in several rooms. We had one incident where a drunk guest had fallen asleep on his TV remote after locking himself in his room. The remote kept the hotel channel on at high volume and we were woken up at 2am by the hugely loud noise coming from next door. It took security over an hour to break into his room and shut the TV off. We were relocated next to the garbage area, which had an ongoing noise problem of its own. On other occasions, and by that I mean every single visit in the '90's and into the early to mid 2000's, I personally had to re-route families out of the adult pool towards the family pool and that was met quite often with hostility. I did also call security to handle these events, but the annoyance of having the adult quiet broken up by a family kid party was real. On most of these occasions, and over the Labor Day Weekends, guests drank heavily and smoked in the pool, and were a rough, noisy crowd. We were told by management, and observed on several occasions, that the cops had to be called just about every weekend. They also revealed to us that on the weekends the guests were quite often locals who were taking advantage of the $79 rates for the use of the hotel. When you start to charge dirt cheap rates for such an incredible resort, you are going to attract the rowdies. I suppose that at some point upper management made a decision that they needed to attract more business. If that's the case, it's a shame that, by lowering the rates, they have run off those of us who had enjoyed the Pointe Tapatio as an oasis of serenity. I have read recent reviews that have mentioned the rough crowd that often frequents the adult pool. As long as this is the policy of this hotel, that being having rates that apparently attract a crowd who use the hotel as their partying ground, I will not be back. I have been to cheap hotels in my life where I knew what I was getting and knew that the crowd who could afford them were on the rowdy side. The Pointe Tapatio should not be brought down to that standard, but needs to raise the rates back up and find ways to market itself as the upscale resort that it presents itself to be. Until management will own up to the problem, I will never be back and I will not recommend this resort except for families.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it was a few years back”
Reviews.Author: Terriv
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the resort. Check in went smoothly at 3:00, I don't think the resort had more than 50 rooms booked this week. We were given a Cliffside room, which was nice, nice view, but if you have limited mobility at all, stay away. Parking is odd here due to being built into a mountainside, very hard to open the car door in this area of the resort due to hill parking. Don't bother trying to walk anywhere in the desert heat on the hills of the resort. Drive or use the free shuttle. I remember the rooms being brighter and having a slight southwestern decor. The room we received was rather dark, with dark green drapery, a dark sofa. Limited wall decor. The carpet was older looking, too dark for the area. It would have suited a colder Midwestern city much better than AZ. But it worked for our four night stay. The AC sounded like a semi driving by for the time it was running, but it kept the room cool. The overstocked refrigerator was placed in a strange location which inhibited getting into it easily. The Sunset pool was nice but the hot tub was too hot to use, probably an unsafe temperature. There were broken tiles on the steps neat the pool which I would consider unsafe. I requested the hot tub be turned down and ash trays made available and neither request was attended to. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which was nice and offered less expensive drinks than the gift shop. The Terrace Bar at the hilltop restaurant is very nice, but quite overpriced Two basic mixed drinks with a tip was $30. But it was worth the trip up there for the sunset and comfortable seating either inside or out. If it's cool enough at night, go up there and sit outside, great view and atmosphere. Hiking in the adjacent mountain at sunrise is a nice treat. Easy to moderate trails, great views, neat wildlife. A few nearby restaurants with decent pricing for all three meals. Scramble for breakfast and El Bravo for dinner are my recommendations. I may return if I have to stay for business again, but I would not pick this resort for a vacation as I have done in the past. It's getting too worn out for the prices.

Reviews.Title: “UGHH”
Reviews.Author: clark0084
Reviews.Content: The stay was fine, except for the fact I woke up to ants everywhere in the kitchen area.. Also they take forever to get back to you for charges they charged me that weren't mine! Only giving it a thumbs down for the after effects of this place...annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Astutefox
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positives things to say about this hotel: the lobby was very clean and staff were very helpful and courteous; the room was spotless, newly renovated and spacious; and the grounds were lovely-- nice pools, fitness room, and common areas; free shuttle service w/in the hotel. Our room was within walking distance to all the amenities and had a great view of the valley. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Meld37
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 2 week trip to the USA which ended with a 4 day stay to this hotel, as we have relatives in the area (but wanted our own accomodation) What a truly fabulous piece of paradise this hotel is in Phoenix! The customer service was incredible, possibly the best customer service we've ever experienced. We had a beautiful suite with the comfiest beds in the world and the bonus of a balcony. The girls loved the Falls and the water slide (which I went on once and it scared the life out of me!) and the waterfalls- poolside service etc. was flawless. There was some Friday evening poolside fun with a limbo/hula contest; our daughters had an incredible time and persuaded the DJ to play a few of their favourite Lady Gaga/Katy Perry tunes! We are returning to Phoenix to visit relatives again in the future and will definitely be staying here, but for longer next time! This is the most incredible hotel. Everything looked so beautiful and luxurious. The manager and staff all deserve a giant thumbs up for making our holiday even more perfect. This place has the WOW factor, for sure! Melissa, Gavin, Charlotte and Rebecca (from Biggleswade, UK)

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, lackluster service”
Reviews.Author: LizzyWTucson
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton had nice, clean and spacious rooms. The room must have been recently overhauled, because it looked up to date except for the jam packed mini bar fridge. I had to pull out all those $4 candy bars and mini booze bottles so I could stock the fridge with my family's stuff. The beds were very comfortable though, and we slept great. There are shuttles that run all over the property for guest transport. Service was timely, but the drivers were abrupt and not friendly to me and my kids. One driver began driving away as a guest outside was still asking him directions. We had to be constantly 'on alert' for the shuttles speeding around. We mainly went there for the pools, which were packed on Labor Day weekend. Many of the guests looked 'rough', full of tattoos, lots of smoking and attitude. The kids loved the water slide and Dive in Movie on Sat night. We were mis-informed of the movie start time by the concierge, and we were just told 'sorry' by the manager but nothing more than that. Overall, it is a nice room but I'll look elsewhere next time. Just wasn't comfortable with the other customers and the unfriendly staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: yankeegirl13
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Great suite with awesome views of the mountains. Staff was extremely helpful and very nice. Extended a 5pm checkout at no charge and helped with restaurant suggestions. Be sure to go to Aunt Chilada's while your in town...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this resort”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel022
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here previously and obviously thought it was nice enough to stay again. Well, this was probably the last time for me. I was told I was getting an upgrade, but the room was exactly the same as one I'd had before. No upgrade there. I got horrible directions to my room, so I was driving all around the resort to find it (which you don't want to do here-narrow little roads and parking) when there was a very easy way to get there, I later discovered. My room was over the pool, which was extremely noisy, and I'd asked for a quieter area due to the noise of my last stay. The room itself was clean and overall nice, but the fabric on the sofa was torn all over, the carpet was coming up, and the bathroom walls had literally been eaten away from water damage. Not so nice. I planned to order room service, but the dinner menu has maybe 6 options to choose from. I had to leave the property to get dinner. Did not plan on that at all. I will say that the bed was very comfortable, slept great, but otherwise I was not impressed and was disappointed for the price I paid. May be good for families with kids that are making use of the pool area, but anyone else, skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at the Pointe Tapatio”
Reviews.Author: Colorado_Rick
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay @ PHTC and once again, it was a VERY nice experience. The staff was friendly & helpful, the room was clean, the beds were comfy and the pools were warm but great. We stayed for four nights and had purchased the special that included breakfast @ the Pointe in Time every morning. The breakfasts were outstanding--plentiful & tasty. There were some glitches in the room, but nothing serious that required immediate attention: the water control valve in the tub was loose but still worked and the LG TV in the living room malfunctioned a couple of times but was OK if you turned it off & then back on again. The upper main pool in the Falls area was pretty much kid soup as you would expect, and with all the toddlers in diapers in it, we opted to stay by the lower pool, the adult pool or one of the smaller pools. The only recommendation I have for PHTC management is to get rid of the stupid mini-bar and install small refrigerators and microwaves instead. It's nice to have a cold drink when you get back to your room and not have to spend megabucks for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; great service; a great time.”
Reviews.Author: LUV2travel-notmuch$
Reviews.Content: We pre-paid our week at this resort and were anxious that we might encounter overcrowded facilities and unhelpful staff based on some of the Trip Advisor reviews posted in June. However, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were initially assigned a room in the Mountainside section of the property, but staff happily relocated us closer to main building when we requested this at check-in. We were cautioned that there would be some light construction occuring near our new room location (3047) and advised we could move again if this was an issue. We didn't hear the workers at all, but greatly appreciated the staff providing us this "heads up". The rooms nearest the main lobby are definitely the most convenient for enjoying all the property amenities. We had a few little room glitches - no inner handle on the bathroom door; toilet paper holder kept coming out of the wall - but the front desk was most responsive and got these fixed when we called. (What kind of hotel guest steals bathroom door handles???) We were really pleased to learn that our Hilton Honours membership allowed us some perks, including custom-made breakfast at one of the hotel restaurants. The reception and concierge staff were consistently helpful. Marion, at the concierge desk, gave exceptional service. The restaurant staff were great and remembered our preferences after the first couple of visits. The cleaning staff did a beautiful job every day. We only went over to the Falls pool one day and found that the number of guests was quite manageable at the upper pool (not near the bar), but moved our "lounging location" to the adult pool when we realized it was just as pleasant and hardly used by anyone. We were delighted that the Pointe in Time restaurant allowed us to credit our continental breakfast voucher to other menu options. Many hotel restaurants don't give this kind of flexibility. My omments in response to the critical Trip Advisor postings are these: Some of the younger staff didn't seem to have the confidence to confront guests who were breaking the rules. We observed people walking past the staff at the entrance to the Falls without showing hotel keys or providing names. There were 6 adults and 9 kids in the cabana next to us, despite the fact that the cabanas are supposed to be limited to 6 guests in total. Most guests seemed to have brought in their own food. So, although we had no difficulties while at the Falls, I could see how crowd control might become an issue on hot days. I would encourage hotel management to pair up younger staff with more experienced staff for a little coaching on handling difficult guests. I would also encourage managment to assign a staff member to tour the other pools on a periodic basis. There were a couple of times that we had kids in the adult pool, dogs at poolside and large group of younger guests haul in their cooler full of beer, which they proceeded to drink in the pool. It wasn't until a staff member arrived that the errant guests were asked, in the nicest way possible, to respect the rules for the pool area. This made for a more pleasant experience for those of us who were craving a quiet, refined poolside experience. However... we sometimes went several hours without seeing any hotel staff at the pool. We enjoyed staying at such a beautiful resort with such great staff for such a very, very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Too short!”
Reviews.Author: Denis_The_Thief
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay, the only problem was our stay was too short - only 2 nights! Excellent Suites. Had absolutely no major problems. Nice view from the Balcony (please see the photo) and the good news is that all rooms are suites. Had several Waterpools to choose from, all of which were nicely done. I wish I could give this place 4.5/5. The only things that could have been better was the vents were a little dusty and the small fridge was over-stocked with things. I read some of the previous comments here. It is true that it was difficult to park near the room but this place is literally built on a cliff which was part of its charm. So some of the units had little room for parking but I think with the Main Building, parking was close, so I suggest anyone with difficulty walking would need to request a suite in the Main Building. I also heard that the resort pools get quite busy during the weekends, we did not encounter any crowds although we stayed during the week. I can't say a whole lot about the service or front desk since we really didn't need anything but our impression was that everyone was quite friendly. I found it funny that they still operated the hot pools while it was over 100 degrees out! Denis Hosdil

Reviews.Title: “Fun and relaxing reward stay”
Reviews.Author: AZFamilyOf4
Reviews.Content: We used our HHonors points to stay for a night at this resort with our two teenage sons. We had a room at the top of the hill, which gave a secluded feel with a beautiful view of the north valley at night. If you are not up to the steep walking you can call for a free shuttle to take you around the grounds. The "falls" water recreation area is on the opposite site of the property from the hillside suites, so if your primary focus is the swimming with little ones you might want to stay on the other side, nearer to the water. The room was very clean and pleasant. The beds are amazing to sleep in. The bathroom was rather small, but the shower head was wonderful with good pressure. The bedroom area had an older tube style TV, but the sitting area had a nice HDTV. Overall this is a nice getaway spot with comfy rooms and a nice family atmosphere. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TripsAL0t
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the main building looks okay. The rest of the property looks like a dated motel. The lobby and the rooms are dated (and we stayed in a junior suite). Even found a dead roach near the front desk line! Service was mediocre at best. Cars park right up to room doors. Ours had cars parked only 8 feet away. The pool looked decent. Much of this property is built on VERY steep hills so it not a safe place for older folks. We decided to move hotels after 5 minutes in our room. I called the front desk right after we got to our room and asked if we can leave and get a refund for the rest of the stay since we will not be staying there. The person said that would be no problem. The next day at checkout I asked for a receipt of our refund, the rep said there was no refund. We had purchased a “package” and therefore they could not issue one. After several heated minutes with the manager, he refunded the rest of our stay. I had to threaten to get on travel advisor and name him personally and also cancel my charge on my credit card charge before he acquiesced. If you are looking for an average room with an above average pool, this may be a contender. The breakfast was also decent. I also liked the fact they didn’t charge for parking or had a mandatory “resort fee”. We stayed the first night and stayed at the Fairmont Princess in Scottsdale for the remainder of our stay. See my post there.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RESORT!!”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first night at the Hilton Scottsdale Resort and Villas, and our original plan was to drive back up to Flagstaff the next day. But afterour awful stay we knew we needed to stay another night at some place better. We decided to risk it and stay at another Hilton, and it was well worth it! We started off at check - in and I pulled up to what I thought was registration parking, I later realized I had passed the registration parking and was really pulling up to valet, but the valet guy, Dick, didn't even tell us we were in the wrong spot, welcomed my girl friend and I, and offered to watch my car while we check-in. I handed him the keys and walked inside to the lobby. (Dick was the nicest valet guy we have come in to contact with so far, not only was he very service oriented, he was generally nice! He didn't care that it was 110 degrees outside and he was stuck in the heat, he was nice and offered assitance and good advice!) There was tons of people in the lobby, and we were ready for a 20 minute wait to check-in. But we still werent discouraged, because we felt like we were at a resort in Mexico or something. Within about 2 minutes we were already being called to check - in. The check-in process was quick and easy, and the front desk agent (I forgot her name, but she was from Georgia) was very helpful, and gave us a bunch of advice and we got a really good room considering we had booked about 1 hour before. After getting all checked in we returned back to the front where Dick brought our car back around, and took my job of opening the door for my girlfriend and giving us tips of where to park. Parking at this resort is pretty hectic. If you want to park near the room its like parking in a busy city. Parallel parking along the side of the rooms. Its hard to picture but this resort is like a mini city, and there is tons of different buildings, and you just park parallel to the buildings out front. Luckily for us they also have a large central parking lot, because it was impossible to find parking near the room. But it wasn't a far walk. We got to the room and it was really nice. You walk in to the living room area, with a sofa (not sure if it pulls out into a bed or not, we didn't need it to so we didn't check), a desk, and a flat screen tv. You then pass through the bathroom and in to the bedroom. It had a king size bed which was pretty comfortable, a standard TV and then a balcony with some chairs and patio furniture. All of this was just $99 a night and this is the standard rate (and it was 4th of July weekend!). We headed down to the pool right away, or should I say pools! This resort has 8 pools on property. One for adults only with a swim up bar, one for families, one that is smaller and open 24 hours a day, another smaller one near the fitness room, another one that is hidden for relaxation, and then the main ones. The main pools were awesome, they were huge with waterfalls, there is also a waterslide and a water volleyball court. In the pool area there is a full service bar, and one of the main pools even shows movies somenights while you are swimming. The only downside is the pools were all very busy, but of course it was a holiday weekend. We ended up going to dinner and coming back around 830 and the pools were a lot more manageable, less people so more fun! We only stayed one night, but you could easily make a 5 day vacation at this hotel. Summary: Excellent staff and service from check in, to the random guy driving around in the Hilton van offering all and any assistance you could ever need. The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice and the pool is awesome. You feel like you are in Mexico at an expensive beach resort. Definitely worth the small fee of $99 a night.

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: wfc2002
Reviews.Content: I had come to Tapatio on a business trip away from my family. I cant say enough about the awesome staff at Tapatio. No matter what I needed or what concern I had the staff went the extra mile to accommodate my needs. Two of the Managers, Charles and Brandon, are the most professional and customer oriented managers I have ever met. I was at Tapatio for an extended stay and met the cleaning staff and the maintenance guy Dave who also went out of their way to maintain my room and make my home at Tapatio feel like I was home and all combined the Tapatio staff made me feel like I was a part of their family. Thank You Tapatio, I am looking forward to coming back and seeing you all again.

Reviews.Title: “Take a walk across the highway”
Reviews.Author: RusstyCowboy
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room up at the top of the hill with a view. Lots of hills to walk, so keep that in mind if you don't feel like walking on a steep incline. Room was very clean. Breakfast had lots of fresh fruit. Nice location, but not really close to anything work-related. BUT if you like to walk / hike, get out early and walk around the nature preserve across the highway. Miles of trails and some neat wildlife. You're still next to the city, but its a nice respite. Frustrating trying to print anything at the biz center. They try to charge you to use the PC / Printer. I hope this isn't a new trend at Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the charges”
Reviews.Author: Vipr
Reviews.Content: I booked the room because of the great price for a resort of this nature. I didnt expect a $6 bottle of water in my room. I didnt expect being charged $12 a day for internet. I didnt expect the wild charges for anything you do. To me the price was a fishing scam to charge exorbant prices for anything and everything. If your rich this shouldnt matter to you. If you are looking for a bargain dont be fooled by this resort. By the way, no microwave, no fridge, no simple things like shower cap, q-tips.. little things that most places have. Parking is insufficient to the point that your wheels will be damaged by the way it is set up. We were afraid to leave our room (wasnt sure what they would charge us for next) and I regret that we stayed here. Wow, charged an extra $75 per day as a security deposit?????

Reviews.Title: “Not For The Physically Challenged”
Reviews.Author: SkyDancer59
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mother for my brother's wedding as it took place at the hotel. If you are well off, perhaps you'll like this hotel. I found my stay there to be irritating and distasteful. The only bright spots during this stay were the girl who took care of our room and the guy who drove the van in the morning. Both were incredibly kind people and wonderful to interact with. Even though the girl had a disadvantage with the English language, she went out of her way to provide us with an item we were looking for at the last minute when my sister decided to color my hair the morning of the wedding. She was a stellar provider of our needs during our entire stay and had the most excellent customer service skills! The morning driver was equally kind and attentive, offering his knowledge about where things were in the area. (I found the resort to be quite remote from regular shops and restaurants, which became old very quick.) When we arrived at our hotel room, it seemed nice. There was a living room area with a large TV and a desk to work on your computer in the front of the room. The bathroom area separated it from the sleeping area which had two double beds (which provided a VERY nice night's sleep) with another large TV in case you want to watch something before going to sleep. Everything looked very nice, however, after getting to know and use the room I began to see how irritating the place was. We were told before coming to Phoenix that the rooms had a refrigerator in them. I liked that idea because I prefer raw, organic foods and they need a fridge. When we got there, we found out two very important things they DON'T tell you beforehand. #1) The fridge is PACKED with junk! Candy bars, soft drinks full of cane sugar, nothing of nutritional value with the exception of bottled water and a couple of very expensive teas. I'm not exaggerating when I say packed either. It was packed to the brim. #2) You are financially responsible for anything and everything that goes in or out of the refrigerator OR the top of the bar it sits under! That's right - if someone else comes in your room and eats a candy bar or drinks one of the bottles of water, you are financially responsible for that $3.50 candy bar or $6 bottle of water you could have gotten from the 7-11 for one or two dollars. The prices on everything in it were hideous! It deeply disturbs me that I have to be responsible for someone else's inventory that I didn't want in my room in the first place. I had written down the costs of the items in the bar, some which were $6-10 an item but I forgot to write this review when I returned home and have no idea where it went. I have no problem tipping someone at a restaurant 30% or more for exceptional service, but the markup on the bar items was ridiculous. My other complaint about the bar was it's location (pictures included). Who puts a bar with the door backwards so you can't actually get in it? With my mobility problems, I had to ask my mother to constantly squeeze back into the hole to get our things out. Seriously? You couldn't have a maintenance man move the hinges so people could actually get into the fridge? Who designs a room so the dresser is right on top of the refrigerator door anyway?
