My biggest irritation during the entire time we stayed there was the internet. While Starbucks offers free internet service nation-wide, the Starbucks at this resort (inside the main building) was not allowed to have it. You were forced to PAY every day for internet service. The cost? $11.95 (that's $12) a DAY for the privilege of internet access in your room. I pay $19.95 a month for 3 MBPS High Speed DSL at my home. I felt like I was paying $5.00 per gallon for gas all over again. Perhaps I'm more sensitive about this because where I live EVERYONE offers free Wi-Fi. McDonalds, Burger King, every coffee place like Starbucks and Panera Bread, the library, the hotels at the oceanfront - EVERYONE offers free Wi-Fi so even if you didn't have your own internet service, you could pretty much drive almost anywhere and pick it up. A hotel chain like the Hilton should NOT be charging for service like this, at the VERY least not half of what it costs per month for one day's connection to the internet. If you're doing something when your 24 hours runs out, forget about it. You don't get a reminder to pay again, you are simply cut off so that anything you were working on online is lost. That, to me, is horrid customer service. Of course when you have a complaint about the service, the Hilton just blames it on the carrier they contract so there's nothing to be done. Again, atrocious customer service in this area. My cell phone was not meant to be a laptop and I shouldn't have to try and make due with it because of a hotel's lack. Speaking of using the computer, the desk provided was a hazard (picture included). I managed to slam my ankle into the sharp corners at the bottom of it twice. It left some nice bruises. Be VERY careful if you're going to spend any time on your computer while there. Bring a LAN cable extension as you can't go wireless and the cord is too short to make it over to the sofa. One of the reasons I find this complex unfriendly to the physically challenged was, of all things, the shower curtain (picture included). Unlike other hotels who use plastic shower liners, the Hilton uses a flimsy sheer liner. I am vertically mobile, but I should probably be using a cane. I have issues with my hip joints and a painful condition in both feet (thanks to the 6-inch heels I used to wear in my corporate days). Taking a shower requires care so I don't slip and break something, consequently my showers take a little longer than most. When I stepped out of the shower the first time, there was a lake of water on the floor. The second time I used it, I specifically pointed the nozzle towards the wall of the bathtub and the water STILL leaked all over the floor (yes the liner was inside the tub). We finally just asked the maid to give us enough towels to pad the floor so it could soak up all the water that came off the sheer fabric shower liners during the showering process. I'm sorry, but I just don't get the whole "looks over functionality" lifestyle. The other reason I say this complex is unfriendly to the physically challenged is the whole hill theme. It's clear this resort was created by blasting holes in the hillside. The complex is full of very narrow winding, twisty roads (picture included) and you will swear the bridges connecting the buildings are going to scrape the top of the on-site van service. The roads are all one way, so regardless of whether or not your room is across the parking lot, you're going to take the long way home if your room is at the end of all the long, winding, twisty roads. These labyrinth of hills the rooms have been carved into is no place for the mobility challenged. The hills are steep (picture included) and unless your room is in the main building, it's quite a hike (picture of view across parking lot to main building included). The place the wedding took place had some nice photo opportunities, but I found the drunk guests loitering around the pool below disturbing. To be fair, the wedding was small. If you have designs on getting married there, keep that in mind. Getting delayed by some guy who's clearly had one too many and loud groups blocking the only route from the restroom back to where the wedding was set up was not a pleasant experience. The wedding reception was held in the Pointe In Tyme restaurant which was near the pool and the area the wedding was held. Again, another trek across the facility (not a problem for people in good physical shape). We had a "wedding dinner" and my food was cold by the time it got to me. I can't even remember what it tasted like. At this point I just didn't care. I didn't want to say anything to my brother as it was his special day. The waiters in the restaurant were very attentive when we first arrived, but I found them oddly missing after we were served dinner. Not being able to find someone to refill the water glasses at my end of the table I got up and got the water pitcher myself. We went there the next morning for the breakfast buffet and the food was good. Then again we were serving ourselves and it was kept warm at the buffet. The last thing I will say about the resort is that with the exception of the morning driver and the girl who took care of our room for us, the rest of the staff was abysmal. The girls at the front desk (specifically at night) could have walked right off of the "Mean Girls" movie set. I had walked to the front desk to meet my sister (her room was in the main building) so we could go somewhere as the cell phone reception in many places at the resort was spotty and not available at the time. The girl at the front desk told me she couldn't reveal the room number, which I understand. The haughty way that she relayed this to me was much less understandable. She said she would ring my sister for me and told me to go over to the white wall phone in front of the gift shop where she would transfer the call. I went over to the wall phone and waited and waited. Inasmuch as it was clear this was not a kind person, I didn't go back to try and sort it out with her. I had already walked all the way from my room over to the main building and was in a certain amount of pain from doing so. Having to deal with someone who treated hotel guests like they were inferior was not something I was going to get into. Normally, I am quite outspoken, but this was my brother's special day and I figured I ought not rock the boat until the I Do's had been spoken, least the front desk girl relay my immense displeasure over her behavior to someone working the wedding. The guy who was driving the van the night of the wedding reception was not very enjoyable either. Here was a man who was clearly financially oriented and I found it quite off-putting. In short, if you are a wonderfully, overly financially abundant, physically fit person you may enjoy the physical challenge and remote location of this hotel. If you're the type of person who looks down at others, you'll fit right in with the front desk staff. I, however, prefer customer service over EVERYTHING a hotel could offer. Without good customer service, your stay is a nightmare which is the category I put my stay at the Tapatio Cliffs Resort under. I will never stay there again and I would not recommend it to my friends who are generally kind people and would not want to experience what I did during my stay. I did learn one valuable lesson - never consider a hotel that doesn't provide free internet service. Before you wonder if this is a "Hilton" hotel chain problem, let me tell you I stayed at the Hilton in Dallas, Texas and the staff there were WONDERFUL! Whoever manages this hotel has made it the complete disappointment it was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but forget bringing kids in strollers.”
Reviews.Author: fishface74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend last month, along with our 18 month son. The resort is located on the edge of a less-than desirable part of Phoenix, and you might be slightly concerned on the drive from the airport to the property. Thankfully, the immediate surroundings are not reflected at the hotel. The check-in process was fast and smooth. The layout of the resort (more on this later) requires that you park, check-in and then make your way to one of the buildings that contain the guest rooms. We had booked a Presidential Suite and were assigned a room very close to the lobby area, but it still required a careful navigation of the property using the map provided at the front desk. Our room was located on the second floor, which is apparently the case with all king-bedded rooms. If you book queens or twins, you'll be on the ground floor. Not each building has an elevator, as was the case with ours. We have to carry our 6 pieces of baggage up the stairs, which is not the most pleasant of experiences in the Arizona heat. The room was absolutely huge, and in good condition. There was a large combined living/dining area, with a wet bar area. The furniture looked a bit dated, and the two sofas were certainly designed for longevity rather than comfort. The wet bar had a fridge filled with overpriced beverages, but with enough room for a quart of milk for our son. There was also a half bath off the living area. Storage space was abundant. An old, tube-style TV was contained in a large armoire, but there was not DVD player provided, which I thought I had read was included with a Presidential Suite. The bedroom also had loads of closet space to store your bits and pieces. Curiously, there was a mount for a flat panel TV attached to the wall, but no flat panel TV. There was a tube TV balanced precariously on a protruding ledge that made me a little bit nervous, what with having a fearless 18 month old explorer in the suite. Luckily, he never went near it. The bed was extremely comfortable. Off the bedroom was a very small patio area. We had no view - we were looking out at other buildings and the parking lot. I was very disappointed by this, especially as a Hilton Hhonors Diamond member - the hotel was not full, surely they could have given me a nice valley view? The en-suite bathroom was spacious and reasonably well appointed. The morning after we arrived, we decided to go and get some breakfast (which was comped, due to my Diamond status). We set out from the room, map in hand, baby in stroller, trying to figure our way through the maze that is this resort. Having navigated three lots of steps and 1 elevator (and only progressed about 100 feet from our room!) we gave up on trying to reach the restaurant on foot when we saw an enormous flight of steps in front of us. We returned to our rental car and drove. I know there is a transport service at the resort, but who wants to call, wait for them to arrive and then have to worry about holding on to an infant during a golf cart ride? Not a viable solution. Our whole stay was somewhat marred by the lack of maneuverability around this resort without a car. If you have young kids that need to be carried, or put in a stroller, this is NOT the place to stay. It's also very hilly, so if you do opt to carry or push your little one, be prepared to sweat in the Arizona sun. Having found the restaurant, we enjoyed a decent breakfast in quite nice surroundings. The dining room is dark and upscale. The service was friendly, and the food just about what you'd expect from a Hilton - nothing too imaginative or offensive. We decided not to return the next day, even though we had the free coupons. We opted, instead, for a latte and muffin from the Starbucks in the lobby. We rented a pool-side cabana for 2 of our 3 days there. I called about 5 days in advance and the gentleman who took my reservation was very effective - he inquired about whether we wanted a cabana in the sun or shade, explained that there were units at the upper pool (near the bar) or at the lower pool (much more suited to young kids). The cabana cost $30 on the Friday and (I think) $65 on Saturday. It included a newspaper, 4 bottles of water and a deck of cards (each day). There was a table and four regular chairs, two sun loungers, a TV and a fridge in each cabana - perfect for us with the bambino. The pool-side service was regular and speedy. You can order from the full bar menu and have it delivered to your cabana. On the second day, we weren't able to sign our check before we left, although the waiter already had our room number, so that wasn't an issue, or so we thought. They automatically add a gratuity (20%?) to the bill for everything you order pool-side. Imagine my surprise when I got a call that evening asking if I wanted to close out my check by adding a gratuity! I told the lady that called (the bar manager) that I was under the gratuity was automatically added. She said, yes, it was added, her mistake. I find it slightly suspect that the manager would make such a mistake, but I'll give her the benefit of the doubt. I can't comment too much on the pools, as we stayed close to the edge of the lower pool, which had a walk-in side, ideal for young kids. Our son loved it and he spent most of his time sitting in the shallow water, splashing away to his heart’s content. On our last day, an extremely diligent lady at the front desk went to great lengths to secure us a late check-out. I was truly impressed by her persistence and willingness to go above and beyond. I have to hand it to the staff at this resort - they were all excellent (with the possible exception of the pool bar manager, but like I said, I'll give her the benefit of the doubt!). I would return here when my kids are a little older. Right now, staying here is just too much work and it knocked some of the enjoyment out of our stay. Parking can also be an issue - be prepared to park some distance from your room and have to navigate the hills to reach your destination. As the saying goes, your mileage may vary. In fairness to the property, I will give it a 'recommend' rating, in acknowledgement of the fact that not all guest have to deal with strollers and we otherwise had a decent stay. Happy trails!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone deserves a second chance”
Reviews.Author: Second-chance2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort several years ago at the recommendation of a friend as well having had the pleasure of visiting the restaurant sitting on top of the hill, Different Pointe of view, and much to my surprise, our stay wasn't the experience one would expect staying at a Hilton, and to make matters worse, it wasn't the bad experience that was so bad as much as it was on how the staff didn't handle the issues that took place. Never being the one that likes to complain, not to mention not having the time to, I'm the type of consumer that simply moves on from an experience, good or bad, and decides on whether or not to return. Depending on the circumstances, I'm a firm believer that everyone should have a second chance, and that said, I am scheduled to stay at this resort again very soon and hope that our experience this time around is better than the last, and hopefully it'll change my recommendation status...

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: LORI04D
Reviews.Content: Seven of my friends and I plan a girls weekend once a year. We are all stay-at-home mothers of young children and we look forward to getting away and relaxing. We stayed two nights at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs this year and loved it! The resort was beautiful and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pools, BUT Rough, local crowd comes on the weekends & RUINS it for those paying to stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: foolishtoad1
Reviews.Content: We are HILTON VIP DIAMOND members, so wanted to choose a Hilton to get the points etc. We arrived on Friday and were able to do an early check in and went right to the pool. THE GOOD: This hotel had friendly staff that were helpful and warm/welcoming. The lady in the gift shop gave a great recommendation for authentic Mexican food. Thanks! The hotel is set amidst the cliffs hence the name, so you'll be walking uphill everywhere, which we liked. They do offer a complimentary shuttle around the resort, but we never saw anyone use it. I don't think this would be a very handicap friendly hotel. All rooms are suites w/1 bedroom or more and have balconies. This was a plus since we have two kids ages 2 & 6. It was nice to be able to put them to bed, and close the bedroom door so we could stay up. We had a wonderful dinner at their restaurant by the golf course, A Pointe in Thyme. Great value on the kids meals..only $6 for petite steak, salmon etc. Everything we ate was delicious. Love the bread. Friendly waiter and nice restaurant manager. We asked for a room near The Falls Water Pool area and were very close to it. The hotel has 2 nice size zero entry pools with built in benches inside, fountains, little grottoes and one super fast, tunnel waterslide (you have to ask them to turn it on sometimes). Our kids and us LOVED the pools and waterslide. We hung around the lower pool b/c it was quieter and offered more shade. We rented a cabana and enjoyed having friendly staff brings us drinks/food. Very relaxing and enjoyable except for the wkends. So we enjoyed ourselves until Sat. and Sun. THE BAD: Didn't know this, but the hotel offers $5.00 day pool passes to the local residents in Phoenix. So on the weekend the crowds at the pools were eclectic and quite honestly, we felt like we were on spring break w/rowdy college kids. Or at a cheap Las Vegas party hotel! It was a rough,rude, vulgar and bad language everywhere, bawdy, boisterous crowd. Not very family oriented on the weekend. In fact, a large group of what seemed like college age ppl were playing football in the pool. They were rough, hit my husband in the face w/the football almost hit my 2 year old. The person didn't even apologize for it. Not a classy crowd. Because of this we won't be back. Unfortunately, this really put a damper on what would have been a great stay. Because of this we won't be back and wouldn't recommend it to others unless you're going during the week only. Another BIG disappointment....we thought b/c of that episode we'd leave and go to the private pool right near our hotel room. Well, there were locals at that one too. There are several small, private pools around the hotel rooms that we thought only hotel stayers could go to. We were wrong and unhappily disappointed to meet more of that same rough, crowd at what we had hoped would be a peaceful escape. The hotel mgt. needs to eliminate the offer of day pool passes to locals and make the pools exclusively available to ppl staying at the hotel only. For what we payed we had hoped to enjoy the exclusivity. We tried to let mgt. know of our opinion, but played phone tag. The local couple we met told us they have been coming to the hotel pools for free for over a year. They said the staff just waves them in and doesn't charge them anymore. They also get free drinks which is a draw he said. Geesh! Another nuisance is it was hard to get a good nights sleep b/c every time the neighbors next to us flushed their toliet, or used the sink or shower, we could hear it loud and clear. Horribly loud! It's really a shame that what started out as a good retreat for us, ended in such disappointment. Especially at a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Husband had to drag me out - I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBs
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this resort for our anniversary and had one of the best vacations to date. The hotel was absolutely perfect and given the amazing rate we had on the room, it just made us love it all the more. The hotel and site is gorgeous and fun to walk around and explore. The room felt really new and clean and was serviced wonderfully each day. Slept so well there, too! We'd read reviews about noice or less than stellar service but we experienced the exact opposite. Everyone was very helpful and friendly all week and the whole thing was a peaceful, relaxing getaway for us. Highly recommend staying here - we would definitely return in a heartbeat. And make sure you dine at the Different Pointe of View restaurant - it was the best meal I've had in a year (the pork tenderloin tasted like bacon!) and the view and the food make it well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Salcolucci
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend there for our wedding anniversary. One night we had dinner at The Different Point of View. Excellent!The food, the wine and the service were all top shelve and I have to rate the view from there one shelve higher. We also had lunch at the restaurant by the golf course which was great. We met some golfers who stated the course was unbelievable and the view was to die for. (I am not a golfer so I have to take their word on that one) The pool and pool bar were the answers for a relaxing afternoon. I would not hesitate to go back and bring the kids or have a family reunion. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: poolLaPorte
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a five nights at the end of April and had a wonderful, relaxing time. My sister, who lives in Phoenix, came for the afternoons with me at the Hidden Valley pool and we pretty much had the pool to ourself. Everything was beautiful and most of the help were very helpful. One of the groundskeepers even walked me to the trail to get me started on the right path. Everytime we passed a houskeeper or groundskeeper they atleast said hello which was nice. The rooms were great with a seperate living room from the bedroom, don't usually have that in a hotel. There is so much to upkeep there so won't complain about anything. One thing strange was the bell man took my luggage out of the car only to find out I had to load it back in the car and drive to my room. He should have known better or atleast asked, too funny as then I had to drag it up the hill to my car after he took it out. Beautiful views. I will be back many times! The hotel let us use the mini fridge for a couple of items which was great and was happy they printed out boarding pass for me. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel. Beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: HeatherPA
Reviews.Content: Combination business/personal trip. Beautiful property but disappointed in service. Arrived on a Wednesday night around 9pm...business meetings on Thursday and Friday. Husband flew in to meet me for the weekend. No cell phone reception in the business rooms, very challenging. Some staff were very friendly and accommodating, while others (including the Sat/Sun daytime concierge) seemed bothered to be at work. Nice golf course, very challenging. Husband and I decided to enjoy dinner at the restaurant at the top of the cliff on Saturday night. We asked both the concierge and the bartender at the pool bar if we needed reservations. Both said no. We walked to the top of the cliff for dinner (very steep walk) and learned that the restaurant was booked until 9pm and the lounge/casual area was closed for a private party. Very disappointed and frustrated. Staff at the more casual restaurant near the golf course were very pleasant and accommodating and helped us to secure a reservation at the nicer restaurant for 8:30 p.m. Played golf on Saturday off-property due to a tournament at the hotel course. When we returned, husband asked concierge (bell boy was missing) to store his clubs until departure. She rolled her eyes, and pointed down the hall and had him take his own clubs back to the luggage room, and put them back into his travel bag himself. Very inappropriate. Bell boy came into luggage room while husband was back there and apologized up and down for the situation. Disappointing that the concierge treated him that way. Many pools were nice and clean, with plenty of towels. Overall, very average. Room was nice. View was nice. Hotel seemed old, dated. Service was spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, nice rooms, blahhh food”
Reviews.Author: Mandakate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls weekend, picking Tapatio because of the value, and because I'd had a very pleasant stay at another Hilton Pointe in the area years ago. The check in and check out were quick and easy, the staff was helpful and friendly (we even got a ride back to our room from the pool one night - I should have noted their names, but thanks guys!) The rooms were modest and clean, though a mini fridge would have been a really nice touch. The beds were VERY cozy. Location was ideal for us, as we were able to park our rental car right in front of our room, and easily get on the highway for our adventures to the Canyon, Sedona, and the Out of Africa park. Coming home after a long day of sightseeing and being able to pop in to one of many hot tubs was really a nice perk. The reason for the 4 star review is due to the dining. 17 dollars for a mediocre breakfast buffet is a little silly. So is 9 dollars for a vodka-cranberry in a little 8 oz glass. The food was good, but not THAT good. The "Pointe in Time" just seemed dark, dated, and overpriced, and unfortunately the nicer place is closed on Sundays. I was also disappointed to see that I had been charged full price for a few frozen drinks despite ordering them without alcohol (I've ordered virgin pina coladas at PLENTY of poolside bars and this is the first time I've been charged full price). For potential guests, there is plenty of off site dining as an alternative. I suggest heading 4 miles down the street to "Bobby Q's" for dinner. The prices and portions were fantastic, and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: teachsk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hilton properties and loved them all. This is, in my humble opinion, a very classy operation. From the landscaping to the super comfy beds and pillows to the countless staff members always greeting us with a smile and considerate inquiry. The pools were gorgeous and beautifully maintained. My sister's and I had so much fun that I called the GM R. Simon on my return to Chicago and spoke with his assistant Martha to compliment the property, I told Martha that I loved our stay there so much that I was treating my daughters to a long weekend there for a birthday celebration. Martha made sure that their stay was extra special, they had a ball as well. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “I never rate anything a "5"”
Reviews.Author: pkmedical
Reviews.Content: Though I did not chose this resort, I will definitely return. From the checkin to the restaurants, to the conference facilities to the staff, from the conference setting to the comfort of the rooms...this was a 5. The staff was remarkable. One genuinely felt welcome and appreciated...by every single one of them. I was speaking at a conference where the podium set up, the food, the quiet way assistance was rendered, the acoustics were all good. My husband joined me for our 45th Wedding Anniversary. We were treated by everyone as though they had always known us and couldn't do enough. I've traveled for many years and have never felt so appreciated as a guest. I

Reviews.Title: “Wow this place is AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: andrewlomuscio
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but I just had to write something about my experience here. Unbelievable service, hospitality and environment! The rooms were huge and the all down beds were SO comfy! What is so great about this place is the amenities between the spa, golf course, pools and jacuzzi's, and the restaurants you will never want to leave! The views of the mountains and city are simply spectacular! You must stay here if you are visiting Arizona!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place for a convention!”
Reviews.Author: JanLemmons
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton was a wonderful place for our convention. They did a great job accomodating the 300 children and their families that we brought. I have never been to a conference where the staff were as accommodating as this hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Kimmer21
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a relaxing get away with the comfort of everything i needed at my finger tips. I did not have to leave the property for any reason. I was able to enjoy all meals on sight with a variety of options. The room was clean, smelled fresh and had a relaxing feel to it. A nice breeze through the patio- I also witnessed a wedding take place on sight and just watching the staff cater to the wedding guests and bride and groom was awesome -- Although the public was still able to use the pool area near wedding ceremony, the way in which the staff handled it all was amazing

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, I miss the sun already!”
Reviews.Author: FredScott
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this Hotel last week and it was very nice. We loved our stay and if we come back to Arizona, we are definitely coming back at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio. Great view, numerous pools (there is like 8 of them), clean rooms, nice restaurant. Personnally, we really liked our little suite. The only cons were: 2 out of 5 restaurants were closed so we had to eat at the same one a lot. Everything cost something here, the local calls, internet access, gym, etc... But we did get a very good price for the quality of the hotel. One of the concierge, Sandra, wasn't friendly at all. I know we aren't the best in english, but you have to make an effort for your guests, everyone else did. Plus, she told us that there were only two companies who did the tour we wanted to do, which wasn't true. So we ended up calling the differents companies in our room.... Everyone else at the hotel was very nice, from the waiters, the desk clerks to the guy who handed out the towels at the pool. Finally, we recommend this hotel if you are travelling with your family or if you just want to relax with your partner! If you have a walking disability, I would pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Baby91
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. A very clean and friendly place. Restaurants are great and facilities. A little out of the way there is not much to walk to. But if you rent a car, it doesn't really matter. It is definitely worth it! The service is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: innhouse
Reviews.Content: From the moment I registered the reception was warm and welcoming. Since the hotel is built into theside of a mountain I felt I was on vacation versus business. The room was very comfotable with great pillows,which were large and not the size of a postage stamp. The buffet for breakfast is just what the doctor ordered. I'll certainly retun to the Pointe Hilton Tapatio.

Reviews.Title: “SKIP THIS HOTEL-DIRTY AND EXTREMELY DATED”
Reviews.Author: SEIBEJ
Reviews.Content: When you are getting a "great rate" -IE we got a Presidential suite for $200 night during Spring Training/Easter/Spring Break that should tell u something right there. We moved rooms 3 times. The first 2 were right up against the mountain, meaning zero natural light would have filtered in our room all day. Cold.dark rooms. Very motel like. The place is a virtual maze and you are lucky if you can find your room or even park anywhere close to it. One restaurant which lacks good food and service. Main pool was decent and the only thing half way normal. I asked for help with our bags from bell desk-they told me most people park by their room and unload themselves. So much for customer service. Our room was not available until six pm-check in was 4:00. Save your money. Anything in Scottsdale would have been way better.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: judyjoo
Reviews.Content: Although I realize Phoenix can be quite hot and barren, it was the opposite this spring, and the Hilton really showed off the beauty of the area. Our room was very nice, and well designed, with enough privacy for us and our two teens. The grounds were very pretty, and the pools and water park were a bonus. I hear the golfing is fantastic, too, although we don't golf. The resort is built into the cliffs,so all rock formations you see are real not landscaped. It is hilly, but since the weather was so perfect we didn't mind hiking around. There was a shuttle for those who'd rather not walk or whose rooms were far away from the lobby and pool areas. The North Mountain recreational area is close by, and my daughter and I hiked the mountain and had a great view of our resort. All the staff were very friendly with a slight exception of front desk-the weren't unfriendly, just blah. Wait staff great, housekeeping great, maintenance crew even said high while they were working on something and we walked by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: lakemansd
Reviews.Content: We were there for a wedding reception and had a block of rooms for the wedding. The service was great. The front desk worked hard to accommodate our needs. Room was wonderful. Beautiful setting. Reminded me a of a European city with the one way traffic. Food for the reception was wonderful as was the wait staff and the bar staff. The wife enjoyed her manicure and pedicure at the spa located on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was comfortable not special.”
Reviews.Author: pjc320
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days/Nights at the pointe hilton tapatio cliffs. The resort is very clean and in good repair. The room was very quiet, bed comfortable and the bathtub shower was very roomy and our room had a nice city view (most rooms do not have much of a view). The staff I came in contact with were nice and professional. I was only able to use the pool once durring our visit but it seemed to be clean with plenty of towels and lounge chairs. The parking was terrible there was no where close to the room if you came back late (after 8:00pm). The bedroom part of the suite was very small and not very conveniently laid out and no refrigerator at all. We booked the room on line at a rate of $179.00 per night when we went to check out the price had gone up to $199.00 we had our conformation sheet with us so they did adjust the price. Our stay at the tapatio cliffs was comfortable and worth the price but in the future we will search for a newer property thats better equiped and serves a complementy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: LAG28
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to our son's wedding just outside of Phoenix. The hotel went out of their way to help us. They helped us get a ride to the rehearsal dinner, rent a car for the wedding, provided us with champagne glasses for an after wedding gathering, etc. The concierge was incredible in suggesting where we could find cigars, champagne, a car wash, whatever it was we needed. Our room was great. A wonderful view looking north out of Phoenix with a small balcony to stand and consider the world from. It was quiet, private and yet very accessible. The Waterpark was a surprising plus. The groom, his dad and groomsmen found a spot where they could chat and smoke cigars without bothering others. It was a perfect setting on the wedding day for a little male bonding. Beautiful environment. Everything was top of the line. If you have a chance, stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Training Fun”
Reviews.Author: fluffmcgruff
Reviews.Content: Our family came to stay here for Spring Training Baseball. We booked early and got a package which included breakfast and Internet. Very relaxing trip. We hiked in the morning and watched baseball in the afternoons. The pools were great to come back to with a good book.

Reviews.Title: “Good weather, GREAT hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lanny44
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i traveled to phoenix this past week to search for an apartment. We move in September and wanted to get a good idea of places. We are moving from Columbus, it's spring break and the weather there was perfect so we came down for a business/leisure visit. The hotel was amazing, beautiful architecture, great location (in the mountains), ample pools and hot tubs, excellent service and the room was large and comfortable. The only negative i could find is that there were lots of teenagers and adolescents . The only problem was that they were all in the main pool area, but thankfully there is a pool inside our hotels courtyard. This was a great place to come home to after active Phoenician days, and i will be recommending this hotel to all my friends and family that come visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hiking in the desert before breakfast every day!”
Reviews.Author: snow-in-nh
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Phoenix to soak up some sun and we got so much more! I had read the reviews that said the resort was "dated" and it is older but lovely just the same. We got a package that included breakfast every day ( a $40.00 per day value)! It was a delicious top of the line buffet and we also got $100.00 to spend in the resort which we did easily by the pool and at the beautiful Point of View restaurant on the top of the cliffs. Go at sunset and have a drink on the beautiful patio! Gorgeous Views! I paid a little extra for a king bed with a view. I loved sitting on the balcony and taking in the view. The room was well laid out with a living room area seperate from the bed room. It was a little worn but clean. The bed was excellent! We loved going for a hike every morning. A trail lies just outside the tennis court gate and it takes you to miles and miles of beautiful trails and desert mountain scenery. The pool area with the waterfalls was very relaxing and the pool side cafe made excellent food and drinks. You will have to pay extra for things like internet and workout room so plan accordingly. Look for a package deal of some sort, they have many. Probably not a good place for someone with walking disabilities since it is built into a cliff but they might have rooms inside the main building. We drove from our room to the pool area parking and it worked out great. All in all we had a really nice stay here and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Try a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunholiday2009
Reviews.Content: The reception area is beautiful and the entrance to the property is very nice. Our room was a let down. We had a 2 queen suite. It was on the main floor close to the adult pool area. Our window looked straight at the lounging area and the loungers looked straight at us. There was a rowdy crowd in the evening/night that shut down when a small child asked them to around 11pm. The location of our room was very poor. When we entered our room it was stuffy. We promptly turned on the A/C but it remained stuffy for our two day stay. I was sure there would be mould under the dry wall. There was wireless internet in the lobby for 11.95 a day and dial up in the room for the same price. Despite being registered as 2 adults and 2 children, we had only 3 towels and not extra sheets for the pull out. I would choose a diffierent hotel for future stays in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel way exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: VincentVegaPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I had heard about how nice the resort was so I booked a room online for a weekend get away surprise for my wife and I. I booked a normal suite and added the option for a room upgrade if one was available for a nominal fee. When I arrived at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised at the view, cleanliness and size of the property. I checked in and received a room upgrade to the Presidential Suite. It was huge, by far the nicest room I had ever stayed in, my wife was very surprised. We had a terrific dinner at a Different Point of View and were able to enjoy the georgous views up top the mountain of the valley. The pool, waterfalls and rest of the property were very nice and we had a time we will both never forget. We can't wait to book our next getaway there!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Country Like Feeling”
Reviews.Author: JohanDesMoines
Reviews.Content: Very nice area among the hills. Wonderful scenery while taking long walks. Friendly and well trained staff. Lunches and snacks provided during the conference was delicious

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with great value”
Reviews.Author: jonesm99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs. The package we selected gave us a $100 resort credit and free breakfast. It was a great value because the breakfast is normally $20 each and it is fantastic! A full brunch every morning. We were able to use the $100 credit up quickly as well as my husband golfed at the resort and I went to the spa. My husband had a great day of golf and would highly recommend the course. I enjoyed the spa as well. It's not a luxurious spa, but it was still a very nice experience. Our room was nice as well. The bedroom was a little crammed as we were given a room with two double beds instead of one king bed. It wasn't too bad though because there's an extra sitting area. It's a bit of a hike if you walk up to your room after a day of golf or at the pool. They have shuttles that take you to the room if you're not up for the hike. It was unseasonably cold when we were there and we were only able to use the pool on one of the days, but it was great. I think there's 5 pools there, so lots of selection.

Reviews.Title: “We keep going back! A lovely place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: luvmesomesun
Reviews.Content: I think I have stayed at this resort around 12 times over the past 5 or so years, so I am declaring myself an expert! I was recently there with my family, I have also been there on a "girls" trip, as well as a memorable anniversery in which we got locked out for many hours on the balcony (long and funny story) This is not a sparkeling new resort, you will find caulk repairs in the bathroom, and popcorn cielings, however I think they make a good effort at keeping everything in good repair. The grounds are beautiful and you have a wide selection of smaller pools along with the big resort pools, the setting in the hills is just beautiful- however we usually request the main building so we arn't hiking uphill with a toddler. The room makeovers with new color scheme and bedding are very nice, the suites are good sized, all staff including grounds keepers seem friendly and unobtrusive. And basically we always look around at other places and come back to this one because it's a good value, more reasonably priced. For me the two things they could add that would make it a no brainer, are a very simple free breakfast, something to grab on your way out, and free wi fi, everyone has free wi fi, the airport, McDonalds, and low end hotels, people are used to it and expect it. And after reading reviews of people being upgraded for free... where's the love hilton! I'm a frequent shopper and a big fan! All and all, I haven't found a nicer place to spend time with my family, at a better price, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Too much like a run-down motel”
Reviews.Author: asvdjv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at Tapatio Cliffs, arriving on a Tuesday and leaving on Saturday. The resort is huge, with plenty of pools and plenty of rooms. However, our small building of rooms was packed, while much of the rest of the resort sat empty. Because the rooms are motel-style, and because the walls are paper-thin, we could hear EVERYTHING happening outside our door on the road (including doors slamming when the cars parked directly outside the doors to the rooms), outside our patio (again, on another road), next door to the right (including every word of a conversation this couple was having, even with our TV on), next door to the left (including their television program), and upstairs above us (every time they flushed their toilet, turned on their shower, used their sink, etc., it sounded like the pipes were going to burst). Seems to me that if the rooms are not very sound-proof, the hotel staff might want to spread people out so that it wouldn't be so loud, but that was most certainly not the case. There were many other issues that were disheartening, including a broken shower lever, dirty bedding, slightly torn fabric on the couch, rattling fan, no wi-fi included, receiving a 2 Queen bed room when we requested a 1 King room, etc., etc. We just felt like we were at a run-down motel. I had to keep reminding myself that we were in a Hilton. It wasn't the Hilton quality I'm used to. I did spend a day at the Falls pool area. It was pleasant. However, the hot tub was filthy -- bugs and dirt floating at the top and sunk to the bottom, and not just a little... A LOT -- and while I was sitting in it (sore muscles from tossing and turning in bed the two nights before drove me into the filth) a maintanence man came and started working on the controls, causing the bubbles to stop and start up again every time he tinkered with it. Frustrated, I left the hot tub to take a little nap in the sun, and another maintanence man came and started sawing tree branches in the pool area. Needless to say, the pool area cleared out quickly. One positive is that the people seemed friendly. In fact, one reason we were enticed by this hotel was that the GM responded to all reviews here on TripAdvisor. As aspiring B&B inkeepers, we have been to conventions where management has been encouraged to respond to reviews, to try to take the negative and say something positive about the hotel. We assume the same will happen with our review. We appreciate that touch, but what we'd appreciate more is that the things people repeatedly complain about on here would be changed/fixed/improved so that there wouldn't be so many negative comments to spin in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Good golf but didn't like the look of resort otherwise”
Reviews.Author: txmeg
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable, scenic, round of golf here, but were glad they did not have a golf package room for us to book. The pro shop staff were very pleasant. The resort itself looked old, and tired; buildings crowded together.

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: chavener95
Reviews.Content: Accomodation have greatly improved since 1996. My favorite is still the small secluded pools in the hillside. Very quiet, secluded, and nice in the evening. Plus, roomservice delivers up there. NICE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, gorgeous suites, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Trip32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a great rate at this hotel which included breakfast. (By the way the Hilton buffet breakfast is absolutely amazing - there was even smoked salmon on the buffet!) The staff at the front desk were very friendly and accomodating. My thanks, especially to Sydney and to Helen at the front desk who made us feel very welcome. We had booked a one room king suite and our first room was not in the main building but in one of the cliffside rooms - it was on the top floor and the balcony had a beautiful view. Apparently all of the king suites are on the top floors. The only problem with the rooms on the top floor is that the air conditioning units are on the roof and so we didn't sleep well that first night because the noise of the air conditioners kept us awake. Granted, this noise may not have bothered some people who are used to noise but we live in a very quite neighborhood. However, when we asked to switch rooms the next day, Helen was very accomodating. She gave us our pick of a couple of rooms available and we settled for a suite with two queen beds in the main building. Both the king suite and the queen suite were very spacious and comfortable - it looked as if they had been recently rennovated. Beds were comfortable and linens were of top quality. The pools at this resort are amazing - and they even have an "adult" pool with very comfortable loungers for those of us who want a relaxed environment. The pools were very nicely heated -- easy to get in. My husband played golf at the resort and he said the course was beautiful. We ate several times at the golf course restaurant on the property and the service and food was excellent and very reasonably priced. If you go, be sure to get up to the Point of View restaurant at the very top of the hillside resort and enjoy the view. The evening we were there the firepits were all alight to take the chill out of the air and the view is amazing as the sun goes down against the mountains. The day we were ready to leave there was a problem with our flight and we had to spend another night in Pheonix. They said they would match the rate we had paid for the previous three nights, which I thought was pretty amazing as I know the rates had gone up from the time we booked. As it turned out, we decided to stay closer to the airport as our flight the next day turned out to be very early in the morning; however, the fact that they were willing to extend our rate for another night because of our circumstances earns them top marks in my book. Helen knew we were scrambling to rebook flights, etc., and told us to take our time - they extended our check-out for us no problem, no charge. AAA rated this place four star -- I give it a five star rating. We also checked out their sister property at Squaw Peak while there and that place looks equally amazing - they said you could stay at one and play at the other and they even have a shuttle which will take you back and forth. I would highly recommend this hotel for the service, the friendliness of the staff, the golf course, the restaurants, the beauty of the surroundings - there are beautiful fountains everywhere, the beautiful pool areas - with waterfalls and a waterslide. It was an amazing place to call home for three nights. Next time we'll stay longer. Thanks again to all the staff in the reception area - although the weather wasn't that great, we received a warm welcome and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place for families”
Reviews.Author: SmulchY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to visit with a family. There are a lot of pools which is the real draw for kids. The property is rather large and on a hill side. So as is mentioned elsewhere, there's a bit of walking to expect. There are a number of different rooms: there is a main building which are near the entrance and surround a number of main pools. These seem like the original hotel. One thing to watch out for in this building: The courtyards have fountains in part to cut down on sound echoing. But they turn them off at night and not back on until 7am. However, staff start noisily doing their tasks at 6am, so you can hear a lot of annoying noises. We stayed here on two separate times during our trip. The first time we were 'upgraded' to a presidential suite in one of the hillside buildings. The problem here is that the room while very large, is dated in its decor. And while you have a dining room table and what should be a kitchen...its only got a sink, so there's not much use here unless you are ordering room service (we didn't). The hillside buildings are nice, its very pretty to navigate the winding, narrow roadways between them with their connecting bridges. But parking is a nightmare...do not expect to get a spot near your room, and if you're in a second floor room, you will be doing a bit of climbing. The pools are all heated - sort of. They claim 82 degrees but there were definite variations and in the 70-ish degree weather, only my daughter was enjoying the swimming. All that said, the staff is pleasant, the rooms are clean, the property is beautiful, and the hotel is a nice destination just north of phoenix to stay - a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect from every angle”
Reviews.Author: sdvander
Reviews.Content: My wife and I plus our dog stayed at Pointe Hilton Tapacio for 2 nights on our drive out to LaJolla, CA (from Atlanta). The hotel was beautiful... from heated pools to manicured grounds. The views were amazing. Our room was a King room and veri comfortable. There are GREAT hiking trails (flat or hilly - your choice) for the dog(s). ABsolutely amazing views. Our most favorite part was going to breakfast and having an omellette cooked by Grace at the omelette station. She remembered us from the morning prior, and made us feel like we were the only ones at the hotel. Being a HH Diamond member... I can tell you SHE made the day start off right. Very personable and helpful...and pretty perfect omellette too! My wife got a manicure and the price was very reasonable ($35 I think). Great location ... just far enough out, but 15 mins to anywhere in Phoenix. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: PennyA6
Reviews.Content: The setting is breathtaking, with the view of Phx at night.

Reviews.Title: “odd hotel- promsing, but definitely lacking consistency”
Reviews.Author: nevud
Reviews.Content: I went to Pointe Hilton with my dad, who had a conference there, and my mom. I had checked it out online ahead of time and thought it looked like a pretty nice place with a variety of restaurants. The idea of having a hotel built into the mountains sounds cool, but really it just made it complicated to get around. To get to the lobby from our room, we had to take 2 different elevators and a bridge- I like exercise, it was just annoying. But- they will take you anywhere on the grounds in the shuttle if you prefer. As far as I could tell there weren't any great views except from A Different Pointe of View restaurant. The rooms were ok- on the smaller side for a suite. A problem we experienced with the "motel" style layout was that you could hear a lot of things happening outside the room- maid carts rolling by and the stray cats making the most awful fighting noises in the middle of the night. The hotel website shows 5 or so places to eat. Actually, there were only 2 open this time of year and A Different Pointe of View is only open for dinner Tues-Sat. However, this restaurant was excellent! Definitely worth going to, even if you aren't staying at the hotel. It was some of the best food and presentation that I have ever had. We would have gone again Sunday, but it was closed. The other open restaurant, Pointe in Thyme, was open for breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks. The food was actually pretty good (standard breakfast, lunch and bar food) but the service was always off- even though we went there about 8 times. One time we sat at the almost empty bar for literally 12 minutes while the bartender made absoutely no effort to stop talking about grenadine with other patrons even though he clearly saw us. During meals, a different person came over each time and requests were rarely followed through with. However, they do have $3 happy hour drinks. The spa was nice- great service, but it is just a day spa, so no hot tub, sauna or anything. The gym was modern and free if you are a Hilton rewards member.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: kerganian
Reviews.Content: There is no place on earth like this hotel, you can request a suite that is like an apartment, you are secluded and the quality of restaurants , people and surroundings are beyond expectations!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisM21
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel. the rooms are very nice. the grounds are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Jodie_10
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Phoenix with our soccer team and stayed at the Tapatio...everything was awesome. First, the front desk put our entire team together in one building to help us with the logistics of keeping track of and transporting 18 teens to and from games and dinners. The breakfast that was provided every moring was over the top. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay memorable. Would definitely recommend this resort for anyone...from couples to large groups.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Made the Stay”
Reviews.Author: Janie79
Reviews.Content: I had a very unique experience at the hotel. I stayed 4 nights and moved three times. The first room was not suitable. The TV did not work in the bedroom and the sliding screen door fell off the track every time it was opened. I went to the front desk and spoke to Helen Hunt. Helen was extremely accommodating and pleasant. She moved me to another suite and upgraded me to an Ambassador Suite at no additional charge. The room was very nice. Then I was contacted by Delta airlines requesting me to extend my stay by one day because of the snow storm on the east cost. Shawn Kozak the front desk manager was great. I was unable to stay in the room I was in because of a new party arriving but he cheerfully moved me to the same level of suite and keeping me at my discounted rate. We had breakfast included with my stay which was very nice and a $100 hotel credit. There is no question that the hotel is not a new property but it is very well kept and the amazing staff made up for any short comings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect girls get away weekend”
Reviews.Author: alisononthego
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Pointe Hilton and had a great time. The rooms are large with a split bathroom which was perfect for 3 gals sharing a room. We wanted a place to visit and hang out and it was perfect. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the wonderful hiking trails accessible by a tunnel under the street, followed by a soak in the hot tub and even a couple rides down the water slide. We would do it again anytime. Totally recommend. Didn't like that you had to pay for internet, or to use the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Dream Vacation!!! We LOVED This Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the most wonderful time at this beautiful resort this past Christmas. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, starting with Shawn who was our initial contact via phone reservations, to the staff we met at the front desk upon our arrival. They all worked to ensure our vacation was perfect in every way. We loved the beautiful entryway and Christmas decorations, our room was immaculate and had incredibly gorgeous views of the city, the restaurants and food were absolute 5 star quality, and to top it all off, the prices were very fair and we felt we received a great value for our money! Stay in a hotel at Christmas? Absolutely, if it's this Merry Hotel!!!! We really felt right at home! Oh, and I forgot to mention nearby hiking trails, golfing, horseback riding, and the place my daughter loved the most - the multiple heated swimming pools with water falls and water slides. Yes, she was swimming in the middle of winter in a heated pool!!!! Thank you Shawn and staff, and everyone at the Pointe Tapatio who made this visit so special for us!!!! We look forward to seeing you all again, as we will most definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: dbe77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently traveled to Phoenix and stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. The property itself, built into an actual mountain, is breathtaking. While the rooms are spread out, they have magnificent views. We stayed in a presidential suite on one of the higher clusters of rooms up on the mountain. The room was very nice, with a fireplace, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, and patio overlooking the valley. We ate breakfast at A Pointe In Tyme, one of several restaurant at the resort. The service and food were excellent. My wife spoke very highly of the spa, and we enjoyed sitting out by one of the pools. One thing that I only discovered while at the hotel was it's proximity to a wonderful hiking/nature reserve. You literally walk off the property and you are there! It has several mountains, with different trails, and it showcased all the desert beauty Arizona has to offer! While it is a little bit of a pain having to walk the relatively far distance to the lobby (we drove), it is a small price to pay for the views you get by being high up on the mountain. We also felt that at this price point, the hotel should offer free high speed internet and free use of the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway weekend”
Reviews.Author: waj97
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here and really enjoyed it. The hotel is not perfect, but for the rate ($170 a night, including $50 resort voucher) I was happy with it. Pros: VERY comfortable bed, great pools and hot tubs (8+ to choose from), beautiful landscaping, ample free parking, quiet rooms, nearby hiking trail, tennis courts, exercise center Cons: room had some flaws - broken drawer on a dresser, banged up trim in the bathroom, but nothing major. Coupons for breakfast were not delivered to my room until the night before check out, but staff had already cheerfully provided replacements. To reach the parking areas, we had to navigate narrow roadways, which could have been a challenge if we had a larger car This is a huge, sprawling property, but there are shuttles and everything seems to be within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed at a motel!”
Reviews.Author: chefcrsh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travel a lot, and to Phoenix about once per year for a visit with my parents. Since we usually spend most of our time with them we usually stay in simple clean motels or simple room only hotels. But this year we decided to pamper ourselves as well. We do not mind spending for real luxury and service and have done so often. However this Hilton is a motel hiding out as a fake luxury resort. It has all the price of a high end resort but it has the worst service I have seen in years, a nickel and dime attitude to resort amenities that usually come standard with the room and it is run down and leaking (even after the 25M refit). When we arrived The bell attendant didn't even try to bell help us take the bags into lobby. The receptions seemed put out that we needed and expected to be taken to the room. So we asked my parents to take us in their car, then the bell service did not try to help take the bags back to the parked car. No in-room safe. No gym amenities included (extra charge for gym?!) Extra charge for local news paper (free international no one reads). No in room wifi and only very very expensive pay-as-you-go internet. No free lobby/bar wifi. While the Starbucks just down the street has free wifi. Room cleaning quite poor. Dead fly on coffee cup. Empty shampoo bottles left in tub (after 6 days up to 5 peices). Newspaper delivered on the ground outside the room (instead of hooked on door handle)two days running. I had an express mail from my office and it took me two days and talking to three departments trying to have it sent to my room. I finally had to drive myself to the security room to collect it. Three times talked to the "guest services" (in name) and they said they could not do it because it was in the security room and they could not be bothered to call and arrange for security to do it. Security never answered any direct calls from me, and the operator acted like every minute on the phone with this guest was just wasting her time. Lats night our room started flooding in a major way (from a rain storm coming through the patio doors). Within an hour a third of the bedroom carpet was soaked through. I called the operator and told him what was happening and he said "well, what do you want me to do?" After I got annoyed he said he would send "a team" to check it out quickly. The team consisted off one guy who said he couldn't do anything. I then told him to have reception call us with solutions. After about a half hour no one had called so I called and reception still had no clue what to do or what was going on. They said the desk manager was on another phone and I should call back. I insisted they call me back when they decided they were ready to provide service. About 5 minutes later a desk supervisor called me back and said she would move my room (finally). She then asked if I would need help with my stuff or would I just come to the desk to collect keys. Nice! While waiting for bell service the maintenance barged back into the room and upon seeing us moving our bags and stuff out of the flood said "oh they told me no one was in here." So, this is Hilton...one (out of nine) night left, never again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place and what great service, second to none!”
Reviews.Author: calamusman
Reviews.Content: My two day stay was completely enjoyable. No just the beauty but the staff became a "friend" upon my first saying hello...if in Phoenix make the stay at the Pointe!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hillside Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: FairwayFound
Reviews.Content: The room was a comfortable and roomy suite. My view was fantastic, There is much to do there if you are so inclined. Caveat - it is on a hillside and sum of the room may require an uphill hike. Parking is a problem if you want to be near your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nestled in the hills”
Reviews.Author: Happyatdisney
Reviews.Content: This is really a very sweet hotel that is literally nestled in the Tapatio Cliffs in Phoenix. While they call themselves a 4 star resort, frankly I would put them at 3 1/2. The grounds are very pretty and neatly manicured. The views were quite nice too with mountains all around. The resort looks like a motel, but on a much finer scale. The room was ok...every room is a suite with a balcony. It is not stunningly decorated nor is it plush, just a comfortable suite - good for 2-4 people. The hotel is not far from a lot of attractions, and there is not much traffic in Phoenix (well, coming from NY, I'd say there wasn't a lot of traffic). So driving everywhere was a breeze. There were a couple of things that were strange about the room, but did not alter my experience that much. We had two queen size beds, and one of the beds literally blocked almost half the entrance to get inside the room. The other was the vanity mirror in the bathroom (the one that magnifies your face so that you see every wrinkle and pore) - it was positioned for a 6 foot person, not an average 5"4 woman. But it wasn't such a big deal, so I didn't ask for another room. The lighting in the bathroom was dim, and when I called the front desk about that, someone came in minutes to change the bulb. We encountered friendly staff wherever we turned. Everyone was very nice and ready to help us make our stay as comfortable as possible. I have nothing negative to say about the resort's staff. The concierge had long hours, so that was a plus. The front desk were always smiling and attentive to your needs. As for parking - I see that was an issue with past reviews. It wasn't an issue for us. First of all, it's not a big deal if you don't find a parking spot right outside your suite. You might find one around the corner. Who cares if you have to walk for 2-3 minutes to your car? And the hotel has FREE valet parking to help you with parking as well. Furthermore, the resort is over 60 acres, so if you don't have a car or don't want to walk around to get somewhere, they have a free shuttle service that is available in minutes to take you wherever you want to go. The pool is very nice with several to choose from, the main being in the Falls area. There is a water slide and a jacuzzi. This hotel has a sister resort, Hilton Squaw Peak Pointe. That resort has a nice pool as well as a slide and a lazy river. YOU ARE ALLOWED TO VISIT THE OTHER HILTON RESORT FOR FREE if you stay at Tapatio Cliffs. We checked out the other premises during one afternoon because we wanted to see the lazy river....it wasn't worth it. It was very nice and relaxing but the current was weak. Either pool area in Tapatio Cliffs and Squaw Peak is acceptable. And I thought the slide was better and faster in Tapatio Cliffs. Phoenix is pretty and so is Scottsdale. Sedona is even better. I would stay in this resort again. The price was decent. The people were kind. And the views were quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 'resort' quality, nor worthy of Hilton name”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix_dream
Reviews.Content: We stayed at three different Hilton properties while recently in the Phoenix area. Staying here prompted me to write to the Hilton Honors program (we are Diamond members) to complain about the property and lack of service. So where to begin. In general, the resort is poorly designed and parking is abysmal. Room furnishings seem to date back to the early 80's (although the room was very clean and the beds very comfortable). They advertise their many pools yet several were closed when we were there, even though there was near-record warmth. Getting to the few open pools involved hiking up and down very hilly terrain. The television was out for most of the first day we were there. Our phone was out for two days (and only fixed after we complained twice). Unfortunately, so was the one elevator in our building for hours at a time, multiple times. In my late 50's, I had considerable difficulty not only marching up and down four flights of stairs, but try carrying luggage up and down! My biggest issue was that the front desk manager did not seem to care one whit. In fact, initially she did not even respond to our issues (we were told she would call us - she never did). We were ultimately offered a small amount of 'resort credit' which we could not apply to the room cost (we had asked for room compensation for all the issues we encountered). As we already had dining plans elsewhere, we ended up using it in the gift shop to purchase a very overpriced sweatshirt. I will NOT be staying here again, nor recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh, it was ok”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs before and was always impressed with it. This time, less so. First, check-in. I was assigned to Room 1114, but instead of simply giving me a map or explaining how to ge there, the girl at the front desk directed me to the concierge (despite no one being in line behind me). This led to some confusion. I told the concierge 1114, and showed her the key card brochure with the room number written there. She said 1014. I said again 1114, and again she said 1014. OK, I thought, there is no room 1114, maybe I'm in room 1014. The concierge pointed it out on the map, I walked through the rain to the car, drove to the parking, walked through the rain with my luggage to 1014 and tried the key. Nope. So I walked around a little looking for 1114. No room by that number. So I headed back to the lobby, a lot wetter. Apparently 1114 is actually up on the hill behind the resort. So I headed back out, drove up the hill and found the room this time. Guidance for the hotel: there's no reason the front desk can't point people to their rooms. Also, how about numbering rooms in a way that makes sense? I tried to make a spa appointment for that afternoon. The website says that they close at 7. Nope, I was told, they actually close at 5 during the winter. Not cool. The website (as of 12/10) is still incorrect. At other Hiltons, as a HHonors member, the internet charges have been waived. Not at Tapatio Cliffs. $11.95/day. So I connected via BlackBerry modem instead. So annoying when hotels charge for internet. The room was nice with a comfy bed. No complaints there. Had a great meal at the restaurant - highly recommended. Overall a nice place, although like most of Phoenix there's not much to do there when it's raining. However, the internet charges and service issues were enough that I likely won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks in Hospitality for Returning Guests”
Reviews.Author: ourtrips000
Reviews.Content: The location was a lovely mountain side resort. The hotel is great about providing a shuttle to take you to any part of the resort ,rather than climbing the numerous steps. If your older and don't wish to do a lot of climbing/stairs request a main floor room. We did not and it was a little tiring. The meals were very expensive so we bought a one week pass for the hotel shuttle to take us to and from the area mall where food was much more affordable & good choices. This is in a desert climate area and the hotel gives you each 1 bottle of water - free if you have signed up for and stayed with a Hilton previously. Would be nice if they'd give 1 ea. per day. 5 days and 1 bottle doesn't seem an adequate reward for returning customers. We were told when we booked we had the 'best possible rate' since we are seniors; but later found a rate on line that was $150.00 less for the same 5 night stay. Humm. Just saying... could be better and we won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The FALLS WATER VILLAGE”
Reviews.Author: Onefrombills
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a resort with such a great water park and than we had dinner at Different Pointe of View......WOW!!!!! The views were breath taking

Reviews.Title: “Super great value in the Valley of the Sun”
Reviews.Author: LeBonRobert
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's rule out who is not going to like this property first: If you are expecting a five star property like The Boulders or The Phoenician, then yes you will be disappointed. If you pay significantly less than a five star property and manage your expectations accordingly, you will be pleased with Tapatio Cliffs. PLUSSES: 1) VIEW. I requested the best view possible and got it. Keep in mind you can not be at the top of a cliff and not expect steep terrain. I read previous reviews that complained about this. You have two options....stay near the base of the resort OR use the cart service where you can be picked up and driven to and fro in a golf cart. 2) ALL SUITES. These are true suites meaning the living area and bedroom can be completely shut off from each other and have the bath in between. Bed and bedding very comfortable . 3) FITNESS. Fitness center has very new equipment. There are nine pools, tennis courts, 8 hole golf course, horseback riding and hiking trails all on property or property adjacent. Again one could get plenty of exercise just walking the property as it is built into the cliffs. 4) SERVICE. Every staff member was friendly and accommodating. Every request was honored without fail. This made up for any shortcomings in the property itself. MINUSES: 1) DINING choices. All of the restaurants and snack areas were not open during Thanksgiving week. Apparently this is a seasonal thing and you may want to check before you book. The dining we did partake on property was good to very good but maybe not exceptional. We did not eat at the fine dining establishment on property but the views alone merit a visit. 2) FACILITIES. Everything in the suite and on property seemed to be clean and well cared for. Again if you are going to compare this to a five star property you will nitpick the slight "wear" as noted in previous reviews. This is not a glamorous but a comfortable property. Lastly, we got an amazing deal on Travelzoo. The room rate was only $99, $50 of which was credited back DAILY to spend on anything except the room rate and tax. This covered our breakfast daily and some lunches. By bringing a few snacks, sodas and tea bags from the grocery, we were able to stretch that credit quite a bit. Also, opt infor the RESORT VALUE PACKAGE at check-in. For $2.25 per day per suite, this covers the fitness center, a daily newspaper, local phone calls and more. There will be something on the long list of amenities you will likely use and will come out way ahead. There were no hidden or unexpected charges at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: neillwells
Reviews.Content: This is an older property and it is showing its age but it has incredible views. The staff was friendly and efficient. The food at the conference was good and the facilities for the were very good. Do call ahead and pay to have the staff empty the mini bar/snacks. The prices are VERY high and an unsupervised kid could run up a very high tab in a hurry. $4 for a small package of m&ms) Got o one of the good grocey stores just down the hill west of the resort and stock up. The Safeway there also has stuff for drinks. There is no free wifi and limited TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Some remarks about the benefits for Diamond HHonors members, but furthermore a nice and relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: BA-traveler
Reviews.Content: Following the signs for ‘reception’ was rather confusing, but at least my sister and I saw some of the property before we could park near the front desk. At check-in were only young people and, although the young girl was friendly, I didn’t get automatically an upgrade for being Diamond HHonors! I find it always less when I have to ask for it, especially in a Hilton hotel. After some arguments (no, they were not sold out as I had been told, I had checked the Internet that morning and all rooms were still available), I got not exactly an upgrade, but could choose a suite with falls view. It was quiet in the resort and we could park next to our room. The falls are behind and could not be seen from our window, but we had a view from our balcony on a large pool site. The suite is great, it has a living room with working desk and chair, sofa and easy chairs, a bathroom with the sink outside and a bedroom of a proper size with a balcony. All furniture was good, the carpet clean and the sheets and towels were of good quality. In the room we also had a Lavazzo coffeemaker and a mini-bar, from which we took some items out to store our own things (and placed them all back when we left). It was very quiet at the major pool area and we had a nice and relaxing afternoon. There are plenty of sun beds to choose from and enough towels were available. In the evening we called the shuttle bus and had to wait about 10 minutes before we were picked up. We wanted to have a drink in the Pointe of View bar to see the magnificent view, but unfortunately, this location was not open for the public that evening, due to a private party. We found Pointe of View restaurant too expensive to have dinner so we had to call the shuttle again to bring us to the other restaurant Pointe in Time. The food in this restaurant was excellent and reasonable priced, we made a good choice. We walked back up a hill to our suite and my sister and I didn’t find that hard to do. For my Diamond Status I was given two vouchers for breakfast at Pointe in Time. This is one of the very few Hiltons that don’t have a breakfast buffet. The items are very pricey, be also aware that as soon you sit on your table, a waitress comes with coffee and juice. Accepting this will mean that half of the amount on your voucher is already taken! We found this out when we got the bill and made a protest. Being a Diamond Member for some years with 40-60 stays annually, I never ever had to pay in any other Hilton and there I had much and much more to choose from than here. Some days after our stay I found out that they had put an extra amount off my AMEX account. Since I couldn’t find an e-mail address of this hotel I wrote to the HHonors desk if they could find out why they charged me this amount. After some time I got a message that it was for items of the mini-bar. We didn’t use anything, so I wrote back, that we didn’t take anything out of the fridge, that we only rearranged the setting because we had own items in during our stay. Then I got a message that the amount would be taken of my account and so it did. Because it was a quiet period we paid about 100 US plus tax for staying in this hotel. Although I had some remarks, I would go again without any doubts if the rates of other Hiltons in the Phoenix area are on the high side and are very competitive here again.
