The setting is nice, the suite spacious, we had a good night sleep and our stay was further enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with the Right Room!”
Reviews.Author: SanTanArizona
Reviews.Content: Me and My husband stayed here for a relaxing vacation fairly close to home. When I booked a room here I requested a room with a view. When we arrived the line at the front desk was extremely long! We waited patiently, got our room key and were off to our room. After finding our room (lower down the hill fairly close to the large pool and also had a smaller pool right outside our door) we were Extremely disappointed! The elevator to the second floor was disgusting, the room had very little light coming in and the only view we had was of the parking lot on one side and the smaller overcrowded pool on the other side! Also the amount of noise coming from the pool was insane, there wasn't going to be much relaxing going on here. This room had the feel of a cheap apartment not a resort, so, I went back to the front desk and asked for another room! There was no room available but I was told that if we waited about 1-2 hrs there would be one available farther up the hill so we waited. In 1-2 hrs I received a call that a room was available and returned and picked up our room key. This room was as far up the hill as you could get, right below the different point of view restaurant. The parking for our room was at a steep angle and the feel was much better of this location. It seemed cleaner, newer and much more peaceful! No overcrowded swimming pools nearby and a great view! Our room was full of light, a peaceful hallway with interesting plants out front and a beautiful view from a large patio in the back. Our Suite had a flat screen tv, fridge, bar, desk, and comfy couch in the living room and a Comfy King bed & standard tv in the fairly large bedroom. The Bathroom was a bit weird, the vanity was located on one side of the hall, plenty of space on the granite countertop but a noisy air conditioner vent overhead... the shower/tub combo and toilet were on the other side in a pretty cramped space, when you open the door it nearly touches the toilet. It was really clean but could use some new fixtures in the shower/tub, they were really covered in hard water. The view from 'Different Point of View' is great, you can see downtown Phoenix from here. We didn't eat at the restaurant, just took a drive up to look around. We didn't do room service either so I can't comment on that. We ate out while staying here and it was quite a drive to find something. Make sure to plan ahead if you are going to eat out as options in this area are pretty slim. Overall we really liked our stay here and it was very relaxing, I would return to this resort as long as we got a room in the same location... the rooms lower down the hill are a big disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “A very beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: MrLehy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with my wife. This property was not busy at all on our stay! We stayed right at the end of Oct for three nights. We did not have any trouble with parking,(was able to park right at our room, which was in the main building), and every night we had the entire pool to ourselves. In many ways it almost felt like we owned the place! The rooms were very comfortable and modern and everything I`d expect from a resort of this caliber. I know others have knocked the fact you have to pay for internet and that the Alarm clocks don`t go very loud when using the radio. I`d like to have these peoples problems for just one day if this is their biggest problem in life. Get over it already! These things do not bother me. Yes the room we had did have a 32`` TV, and yes you have to the option of doing the payper view thing if you choose, And boo hoo you have to pay for the Disney channel. SHEESH GET OVER IT PEOPLE. Too many reviews I read, had people complaining about having to walk up the hill to dinner at A Different Point Of View. Well I`m here to tell the world about the shuttle that will take you right to the different point of view, just get the front desk to call them for you. But beware, have a pocket full of money and extra food back at your room, for they serve extremely SMALL portions! Not to knock it, by any means this was a fabulous dining experience. We did not eat at any other location on the property, and did not see too much of it either. We were just too busy doing other things in Pheonix. However, I could understand from other reviews, some peoples frustrations with parking, as it is very tight especially if you are in one of the units on the upper hillside. Very tight might be an understatement try EXTREMELY tight. And I shudder to think what it would be like when it is VERY busy! (I for one would not take a brand new car here when it is busy!) The staff we encountered was very friendly and helpful. We did not have to wait in line to check in, we walked right in and up to the desk. All in all We had a fabulous stay and would not hesitate to return again, ONLY if it was like it was this past weekend. I would not stay at a peak time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice; gracious and helpful staff made for an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Durgie
Reviews.Content: My teenage grandson and I spent 3 days at the resort and even though the weather did not fully cooperate, we really enjoyed our stay. The pools are heated and the pool areas are just spotless and inviting. The Pointe in Thyme restaurant is wonderful and the poolside restaurant was really good and so friendly and helpful. Nice place to visit for sure. I am a walker so I was definitely challenged with the layout of the resort, but the van service is prompt and always available if you choose not to walk to different areas of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelersnj
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at this resort for a long weekend get-a-way. We were given a presidential suite, 1 of 9 on the property I was told, used Hilton points for the stay. Resort literally built into a mountain range which is unique. It is a nice Southwestern Style resort, quite a few pools on property, a few very nice places to eat 1 of which has a nice view of the local valley, golf course on site and all the other amenities you would expect from a tourist style resort in the AZ valley. Fitness room is fantastic! Breakfast at Different Point of View was one of the finest we have had the eggs rule! Service overall here was stellar, everyone on property was more than willing to lend their hand, give information and go above and beyond to make the stay enjoyable. Jose the bellman was awesome! The property is a bit worn and dated BUT by no means should this deter you from choosing it, it is a nice place to stay for a few nights. We found some minor issues that were quickly resolved like the tub taking on more water than the Titanic due to clogged drains but they came up in full force and repaired and cleaned, aside from that we have only good things to say about Hilton Tapatio, it is located in a great area with all that you would need and more! They serve Starbucks in the main lobby, turn down service on weekends, plenty of towels......just a great stay! I would recommend this place for anyone that asks......

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: vlfair
Reviews.Content: I would like to give the Pointe a great review but unfortunately I can’t. I grew up on Phoenix and the Pointe was always someplace nice but I think maybe it is past its prime although the issues we encountered could easily be remedied. Pros: 1. It is very centrally located and convenient to two freeways and downtown. 2. The location itself is beautiful. 3. The pool seemed nice (but a little small). We did not use the pool but I did check it out. 4. We were able to get a Presidential Suite for a very reasonable price and the room itself was VERY large and more than met our needs. 5. Bell staff & concierge was otherwise very nice & knowledgeable. For the price we paid I guess I really should not complain much but it certainly was not a 4 star hotel. Cons/Issues: 1. We checked in at 9PM. The hotel is very convoluted and confusing. The bell desk told us the wrong building to go to and we drove around for 15 minutes in the dark (lugged our suitcases and 2 tired kids up and down stairs) before we found our room. Room numbering is completely erratic. (ie Room 2164 is in building 18 but 2163 is in building 20) 2. When we entered the room the desk chair was askew, the chairs for the table were on the table and the bathtub was half filled with water and there was a soaking wet towel in there. My daughter asked “why is the carpet wet?” I took off my shoes and realized that the carpet in the bedroom area was soaked. I don’t mean damp, I mean squishy, sloshy soaked. I called the front desk, who seemed completely unconcerned by the cause of the water and offered to send up a fan. I told them explicitly not to worry about it that night but that we’d be out all day the next day and to have it fixed. I explicitly stated that I had 2 small kids I needed to get into bed as it was nearly midnight their time. My husband noted that the carpet under the bed was dry and that there was a carpet cleaning machine outside another room down the way. I figured someone didn’t finish their job. At 10PM a worker knocked on the door and asked if he could come finish cleaning the carpet. I sent him away. Please remember, we checked in at 9PM, a full 5 hours after check-in time but our room was obviously not ready, yet we were sent to the room anyway. The carpet was dry by the next morning. 3. For 3 days the neighbors wine glasses sat empty on the walkway railing outside our door and housekeeping never took them. 4. Our room was VERY far away from the Falls pool. It was literally a hike down there and we were closer than a lot of other rooms. So if you're looking to enjoy the pool be prepared to walk (it is set in the side of a mountain so by "hike" I'm not kidding). There are smaller pools around the hotel as well. 5. Our room clearly was not part of the recent renovation as there was plenty of peeling paint, peeling wallpaper, stains on the table, peeling stain on the table, and closet doors that didn’t work right. 6. Last but not least, I was SHOCKED that Disney channel was only available On Demand as a pay channel. For kids there was only Cartoon Network or Nickelodeon for free so there was nothing age appropriate for my 6 year old to watch as she wound down for bed at 8-9PM, as both have gone pretty adult by that time. Seriously, if you’re going to tout yourselves as a family friendly resort, at least have some family friendly TV available for free. I’m not about to pay $3 to watch an episode of Phineas and Ferb. Noggin, Sprout or PBS Kids would even have been a good option to have available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the right price”
Reviews.Author: BDardeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in September 2009 just to relax and float in the pool. Mission accomplished. Yes, the resort is showing age in places and the suites are nothing special, but for the right price (we paid $105 a night with full breakfast included), it is great place for a getaway. We went during the week to avoid kids and crowds, and often had the place to ourselves. Parking might difficult when crowded if you want to park close to your suite. Be aware the place is built on a mountain, so there are steep incllnes to negotiate. If you expect this, it should not be a problem except for the elderly or lazy. There are 8 pools, you can get very private or public depending on your mood. Utilize the AJ's Fine Foods Market and Market Bistro (both a half mile from the resort) to save money on snacks, beer and lunches. The mountain trails adjacent to the resort are nice too. The free shuttle to their Squaw Peaks resort 10 minutes away is a good way to break up your visit (nice lazy river there) Negatives: No free wi-fi, the internet in the business center costs $5 for 12 minutes and is slow. Keep an eye out for scorpions, you are in the desert. Mini-fridge is stocked with overpriced useless stuff. Be ready to move the stuff around in there and you'll be fine. They charge $25 to clear the fridge out pre-arrival.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: SuperPags
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend and had a great time. Not only was it $59 a night for a suite but the room was awesome with a beautiful view. Our son loved the pool area. It was crowded but we still managed to have a good time and try out all the pools and the water slide. Food in the pool area was very expensive but that is to be expected at these resorts so when dinner time we ordered pizza and went and picked it up. Climbing the hills to get to our room was a bit of a trek but it was well worth it. Very pretty grounds. I hate that there is no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds, outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: dkj44
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds were beautiful. The workout room was great, as were the many pools on the property. We only ate breakfast in the dining room, but the food was good, staff was very attentive and the dining room decor was very comfortable. My only complaint about this hotel is that the rooms are seriously in need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: KCinKCK
Reviews.Content: This was an OK hotel, set into a picturesque setting but still convenient to other places. My husband and I travel often, usually preferring to stay in higher end hotels because of comfort and service and high quality restaurants. We are Hilton honors travelers, gold level. I think calling this one a "resort" is stretching it. I thought the rooms were small and not especially nicely appointed. The air conditioning, as mentioned by others, would not cool the room. And, the vents are up above the doorways, so they blow directly on the bed and couch. I thought the cabanas at the pool were a nice option, but the water slide wasn't open most of the time we were there. Service by the f&b attendants at the pool was spotty. Had a really nice gift shop with an unusually large variety of items, not just the usual things. I, too, find it ridiculous that Hilton charges for internet usage. Just because other hotels do doesn't mean it is OK. If Motel 6 can provide free internet, Hilton should be able to also. Unfortunately, it was "restaurant week" in town when we were there, so the Different Pointe of View was extremely crowded with people looking for bargain food. And, they had a weird menu to accommodate those people--part prix fixe and part not. My companions ordered from this prix fixe portion of the menu and all thought it was terrible (we all eat out at high end restaurants often). I ordered from the non-prix fixe portion and my food was very good. Breakfast in Pointe in Tyme was good but expensive, and service was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Limited”
Reviews.Author: melsuu
Reviews.Content: We did the "pay $109 a night and get $50.00 food and beverage credit." What they don't tell you is you can only use it for non-alcoholic beverages. Cleaning service was knocking on our door at 8:30 a.m. to clean our rooms. The Mexican food restaurant was very univiting and the staff was inadequate and rude. However, Point in Thyme was excellent - food was superb and staff was excellent. The rooms were nice and there is a Starbucks in the lobby. However, for a "resort" atmosphere, I didn't feel like I was at a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Woods49
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews from pbpman, KCtravels08 and eb4309 are accurate and give a good description of this hotel but will just add my own personal view. We are a family of 4 (16 & 11 year old kids) and have travelled to the Phoenix area many times and always in August ,we look for a decent hotel with good facilities and at a reasonable price and the Tapatio certainly ticked all the boxes for us. Suite was in an excellent location (Building 8) overlooking the Falls pools and with views of the mountains, was clean and well appointed with plenty of storage space. Our 16 year old took the sofa bed in the living area and slept really well. We asked about a fridge and were told to break the seal on the mini bar, remove non perishables and leave them where inventory could see them and we could fill with our own items. No problem and no charge, so don't know why others were charged. All chargable items were clearly marked. During the week this hotel is idyllic but at weekends is like a zoo, I don't mind people having a laugh and making some noise ,after all we are all on vacation ,but have to agree that Management should address the issue of people eating and drinking while sitting/standing in the pools. Not only is this unhygenic but just looks so tacky. The second half of our stay we found ourselves without a car (don't ask!!!) but thanks to Brian, Ray and the Bell desk team this was not as much of a problem as it could of been. One call to the desk and the hotel shuttle was outside our suite to take us to the local supermarket, shops and restaurants. Thanks guys we really did appreciate it. The staff in the golf pro shop were great, don't know if it was because it was quite or not but tennis courts, raquets, balls and table tennis equipment were all free and security even switched on court lights for us when it got dark. We booked golf lessons with the golf pro - Charlie - for our son, he was just brilliant. He taught him so much and allowed him to play on a course that was so beautiful most lads his age could only dream of playing. So overall for a family holiday I would recommend this hotel and we would definately return. Would I stay here if I was on a romantic getaway with my partner, no probably not, but then if his idea of a special treat was to book somewhere for $75 a night, I might not stay with him either!!! That was a joke by the way (or was it???).

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: pbpman
Reviews.Content: The girlfriend and I went to the Pointe for a weekend two-night stay and had a wonderful time. We took advantage of the $79/night rate. Yes this is a very touristy hotel. It should not be confused with a high-style resort, that is not what this is. No high-style resort would have a rate of less than $100/night. There were a lot of people, but they have eight pools so it wasn't impossible to find some privacy. We hung out at the adult pool which was not that highly populated. It was laid back during the day, but does tend to get a little wild/risque at night. Yes there is a bee issue, but it wasn't that uncomfortable. They come and go. It is something that should be addressed though. It's not fun having bees swarm you while you are trying to enjoy the sun. Had a late dinner at the Mexican restaurant the first night. The food there was OK. We ate lunch Saturday at the main pool at Cascade. The prices were a tad-high but the food was good. We had fun watching all the different kinds of people, and all the kids running around. Parking is a bit of the nightmare, but we knew this going in having read other reviews. We got a spot in front of our building and fortunately didn't have to move our car for the first full day. We did go out in the city on Saturday night, and as a result there was no spots available when we returned at about 1 a.m. Had to park the car behind the conference building and walk. The view at the Different Pointe of View restaurant at the top of the resort was worth the price in itself. You have to go at sunset. There are views of the city lights on one side, and sunset on the mountains on the other. Don't think you can get this type of view anywhere else. Had a great breakfast Sunday morning at the Pointe in Tyme Grille before departing. We liked our room. Had a second floor balcony overlooking the entrance to the hotel. Used the fridge for our own beverages, but didn't not drink or eat any of the over-priced beer and snacks that the hotel provided. I don't feel like there were any hidden fees. We knew going in that the internet would not be free, and they told us at the front desk at check-in that there was a cost involved with the fitness center. Who needs a fitness center though when you can get a nice workout hiking one of several trails in the area, and walking or running up and down the various inclines of the resort drives. Would have liked to have played some tennis or golf, but it was a tad hot. Definitely a resort I would check out again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Great Location, Somewhat Crowded”
Reviews.Author: eb4309
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Point Hilton for a "staycation." Overall, it is a very nice resort. The rooms are excellent - comfortable beds, very clean, nicely appointed. The location is fantastic: near hiking trails and North Mountain. The attached photo was taken on a hill just a short walk from the resort. Great views. The woman at the front desk was extremely nice. Our room keys did not initially work but her nice demeanor made up for it. The pools are nice and the waterslide is fun. We did not have dinner at the resort, but did order dessert from room service, which was very good. The only minor issue is that the pools are crowded. They are significantly less crowded than the Pointe Hilton at Squaw Peak, however, which appears to be aimed more at kids. Overall a nice stay. But, if you want peace and quiet by the pool, this might not be the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and packed mass holiday resort”
Reviews.Author: harmonie
Reviews.Content: In 2006 Tapatio Cliffs Resort was the first hotel on our first roundtrip through the Southwest. We kept such good memories from that first stay (partly due tot the free upgrade to a Presidential Suite...) that we decided on our third trip to spend again a night in this hotel. But... there will definitely not be a third time! Upon our arrival on a Friday afternoon in July it's queuing to find a parking place and again waiting in a long line to check in. Front Desk is very friendly, but no upgrade this time since the resort is sold out. The doorkeeper prohibits the use of a luggage trolley. These may onlu be used by their staff members. After 15 minutes waiting after a staff member, we are finally allowed to tak a trolley and bring our luggage to our room (provided we bring the trolley back to the main entrance). We received a room in the main building, right above the lobby. The room is a suite with a separate sitting room with beautiful furniture, giant flatscreen, desk and (sealed and highly priced) minibar. Even putting your own drinks in the minibar will cost you money....And don't be so naive to think that the bottles of water on the cupboard would be complimentary. A double door separates the sitting room from the sleeping and washing part of the suite (with another flatscreen and a balcony overlooking the parking lot). Our room also overlooks one of the inner patios with a fountain and a swimming pool. We are surprised and upset (from an hygienical point of view) to see people eating by the poolside (some being in the pool and putting their plate of Mexican food on the poolrim), others drinking beer and margaritas in the pool or even smoking inside the pool. Unbelievable! For the rest of the day (and this until 10,30 pm) a few adult couples booze one beer or margarita after another, causing incredible noise nuisance in this patio. Very unpleasant for other customers, but nobody of the hotel staff seems to bother about it. The large swimming pools by the falls look like the heart of a cheap mass holiday resort with loud music, hustle and bustle. Where the resort looked 3 years ago as a luxurious, soothing and comfortable Hilton resort, it now seems more to have become a crowdy mass holiday resort for faimilies with children. If not for the excellent dinner and superb view from the Different Point of View-restaurant, we would totally regret to have chosen this hotel. We'll certainly no longer recommend the hotel and definitely not come back again. .

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Hidden Fees - VERY DISAPPOINTED OVERALL”
Reviews.Author: joannieg
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in it was nothing but a nightmare. HIDDEN FEES FOR EVERYTHING including internet and fitness center. There was no cell phone reception which mean't I couldn't use my phone or air card for internet access. Had to pay $12.99 per day for internet. The place was infested with bees, and I could not even lay in the pool area because of it. My room had bees as well. Room was not clean and in desperate need of an update. Refrigerator was broken so they brought me another one, and put it in the middle of the living area (lets not forget the magazines they had to prop it up with because the feet were broken). Half of the place was closed due to low occupancy. Checked out 5 days early and went to the Marriott because I couldn't stand it anymore. I travel 90% for work and have never been in a worse place. Will never go to another Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Has its good points but badly in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: JDSnoho
Reviews.Content: Overwhelmingly average is what comes to mind, which is too bad, because this property does have its good points. Overall I agree with the reviews which say that you can do better elsewhere in Phoenix / Scottsdale. Golfers who want to stay and play for a reasonable price, and families who want a quick getaway where the kids can play in a pool, would find that this place suits them. Otherwise this property needs an update before I'd recommend it to anyone else. The "good": (1) main pool areas (esp. the one with the water slide) can be fun for families, but sometimes get very crowded. (2) the cabana area near the main pool is a nice place to have a drink on a hot day, with a good selection of beers on tap. (3) Lookout Mountain golf course is a (mostly) forgiving desert course, and is right next to the hotel. (4) Some reviews have expressed frustration about staff but my experience with the staff here was great - everyone was very friendly and attentive. (5) "Pointe in Time" restaurant is nice inside, but the food is mediocre at best and a touch expensive. The bad: (1) Rooms are long in the tooth and the air conditioner only went down to 80 degrees when it was 110 outside. Couldn't sleep very well as a result. (2) Shuttle service at the property is spotty. After a round of golf I waited for a half hour before getting a ride up the hill. And after golfing in 100+ degree weather I wasn't walking. To be fair I never went to the restaurant on top of the hill here, which many reviewers seem to have liked. Families living in the Southwest looking for a short getaway might like this property, and golfers looking for a place to stay and play that isn't too expensive also might like it. Other than that I probably wouldn't recommend it until they update it.

Reviews.Title: “best value under the summer sun”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: the pointe hilton hotels offer most probably the best summer deals of all resorts in the phoenix area. check their websites if you plan to visit during those undescribeble hot summer month. adjacent lookout mountain golf course is beautiful, yet challenging. must try. the resort appears like a small spanish/mexican village with narrow streets and their suites built up the hill (phoenix mountain preserve). the suites are freshly renovated and large with a bedroom, a sitting area, balcony and 2tv's. furthermore you'll find a fully stocked minibar and a small wet bar with coffee, tea etc. it offers various little hidden pools spread out the resort and 2 mainpools with (snack-)bar and slide in the centre. we tried the mexican and pointe in thyme restaurants, both offer good affordable food. room service is also ok and not too expensive. 2 supermarkets are just down the road (5min drive) for all extras. overall a fine resort especially when travelling with kids due to the given extras. we'll be back. p.s. welcoming and competent check in staff

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views...”
Reviews.Author: OSU22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort... Rooms were very clean and well maintained. Staff cleaned our room every day and made sure we had plenty of clean towels. Beds were very comfortable, t.v.'s good, lots of space, overall a very nice room, no complaints there. Parking was a mess... Very little parking and you could only go one way down the hills and then back up and around to try and squeeze into a space. Consider yourself lucky if you get a place close to the building that your room is in, that didn't happen to us too often. The pools were beautiful... until you got up close to the water. It was very cloudy and it just didn't seem clean. There was one pool right buy our suite that we used, it was small, but really clean. The others not so much. We decided to go to the "adult" pool one evening, big mistake, there were people drinking, smoking, eating and making out in the pool. It was like a night club scene as soon as the sun went down. Tried to return the next morning early, but left as soon as a man with open sores and scabs decided to "take a dip". We pretty much stuck to the presidential pool the rest of the trip. Overall, despite the pool situation, I would return, had no other issues except the cleanliness of the pools, but at least we found one that was clean, and actually saw hotel staff checking the chemicals, so that was nice. The pools would be great if they were just kept up and maintained properly. The views were spectacular and the hotel in itself is very pretty, built into the side of a mountain, it was really cool. We had a great time, and despite our issue with the pools, we enjoyed ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back again!”
Reviews.Author: zina
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old son and I had just left the Az. Grand Resort for a BDay party and came here for the better price overnight. We had heard that it was a nice place to stay and had nice pools. We arrived ready to check it all out. I have stayed at a lot of places...really fantastic to acceptable. But, I have never once waited in line just to check in as long as I did here. I know it was at least 30 minutes. They do have a kiosk that you can use to check in which was quicker (even with my son going back to the parking lot-getting my confirmation and coming back), but the conf did not include 2 Q beds. Receptionist did not apologize for wait or anything. We had brought our luggage, but were sent to another desk, told how to find our room-its a test, I know it-and sent back up the hill to our car. After going through the maze of cars parked on the trail (terribly packed)we found our room, plenty of parking. Rooms from outside look very shabby!! When we entered our room the coffee table looked like it had been chewed up by a dog on all 4 legs, also the TV did not work at all. Called operator and they sent someone down. Replaced table rather quickly...not sure when TV was fixed, but it was done by the time we returned. Bathroom area and tub was nice. Restaurant we wanted to eat at, The Works, was closed. Cafe by pool was very limited on food choices, same with the Mexican restaurant. We ordered family feast with pizza, salad and drink for $23 which came to $33 with gratuity, tax and delivery chg. Rediculous!! Best price for dinner at hotel even though only 2 of us eating. Smaller pool was really for adults only. The kids pool was fun but only 3 ft. deep...shallow for my 10 year old and myself. Not anything exciting at all. Plus, smokers all around the pool. It was bad. Once food arrived we got out of pool and moved as far from smokers as we could. Then a monsoon came in. So windy we gathered up food and asked for the shuttle to pick us up. Shuttle took 3 calls (2 by employees)and 20 minutes before we were picked up in the dust storm. Not a nice way to end our evening. I am not a picky person or someone who complains about hotels...but this was an exceptionally BAD experience at a hotel. We will not be returning and would have gladly accepted a refund, but we booked through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: lovetoholiday2007
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights here and thought it was a beautiful place. Any staff we spoke to were friendly and helpful. Neil in the bar is great and my husband enjoyed a game of golf with him next day by coincidence (he was a solo player who got teamed up with 2 others) The golf course is excellent too. We were upgraded to a suite in the Hidden Valley and thought we had good views until we went up to the Different Point of View for a meal 'Amazing' the food and the views. My only complaint is that we didn't stay long enough to use alll the facilities, but I did manage to fit in a massage in the Spa which was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This place was impressive!”
Reviews.Author: enchantedeverafter
Reviews.Content: I must say that we had an amazing stay. I couldn't believe what a fabulous rate we found. This was a steal at only $79 per night! The room was probably one of the most elegant we have ever stayed in. It was modern but elegant. I loved the Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. I also liked the spacious floor plan of our suite. The honor bar was well stocked, and our room was very clean. The view from our room was amazing at night and there were many different swimming pools to choose from. The one by our room was called the Presidential Pool and it was great! We also really liked the room service. Usually room service at hotels is pretty average but this place has wonderful options. Try the salads and pizza. It took a while to get our food but was worth the wait. There is a lovely spa on site and fitness center. We never went to the large pool area with the slides and waterfalls but it looked pretty neat. The only thing that needs improvement is the parking situation as we drove around for about 30 minutes to try to find a place to park. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a special Arizona experience.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hardrockingirl
Reviews.Content: I am from Phoenix and heard about all the great summer hotel deals that Phoenix hotels have to offer. I thought it would be a nice birthday getaway for my boyfriend's 12 year old son. I saw on the Tapatio Cliffs website that they had a great family friendly pool with a waterslide. The 2 room suites started at $80, but I had the option of adding a $50 food credit for an additional $40. I also was able to "request" an early check in at noon. So this was my plan. My boyfriend, his son, his son's friend, and I would bring snacks and drinks to keep in our room, check in early, hang poolside most of the day, order pizza from Pizza Hut at night, then use our food credit to buy a nice breakfast at one of the resort restaurants. Didn't really work out that way. My boyfriend went to check in at 1230. (By the way, parking for check in was awful.) The hotel clerk said check in wasn't until 3. My boyfriend showed her our confirmation we printed out that said we requested an early check in. She emphasized it was only a request and wasn't a guarantee. Luckily, a room just became available. She apologized about the check in requests and admitted that the website is very misleading and people get angry all the time. She gave him the dining voucher, but told him it could only be used for today, not for breakfast the next day. I called an agent when I first made the reservation and she told me I could use it any time of the day at any restaurant. Mislead again. So we drove to our room and couldn't find any parking by our room. My boyfriend had to drop us off with the stuff and go find a parking spot that was a 5 minute walk (more like hike- very hilly there) away. The room was nice. It was tastefully decorated. I have seen the suites a couple of years ago and they were kind of tacky- southwestern decorated. But they have seen to undergone some renovations and the suite was very nice. There was a bedroom for my boyfriend and I too sleep in with a VERY comfortable bed, and a living area with a pull out couch for his son and his friend. And a TV in both rooms. There was an alarm radio with an Ipod dock which was nice, until I learned the maximum volume is very low and I could barely hear it. My boyfriend set up his laptop to check his email for work and discovered you have to pay for internet. Another good thing was the view from our balcony. It overlooked the main pool area as well as some desert preserve and view of North Phoenix. Very pretty. The only thing that sucked about the balcony, was the suite below us that had (not joking) about 5 adults and 8 kids in it. Thats kind of ghetto. C'mon people. Get 2 suites. We went to the pool area which was very crowded. I don't mind the crowds and I like kids, however many parents weren't supervising their children and some of the kids were quite annoying. We tried going to the Hidden Falls Pool which was smaller and more secluded. Which was great until a family came with their 10 kids and let them misbehave, splash us, and run into us with their pool floats. We went back to the main pool. We took a break and went inside our suite and watched a movie on HBO. It was nice that the four of us sat comfortably in the living area while we watched the movie. Dinner time was an adventure. We planned on going to Cascade Cafe, the poolside casual restaurant, for dinner to use our voucher. I looked at the menu previously in the day and saw a couple of things I can eat on the menu, since I'm a vegetarian. When we got to Cascades Cafe, they did not offer their normal menu, only a limited buffet for $12 for adults, $8 for kids. The only thing vegetarian on the menu was curly fries. I wasn't about to pay $12 for curly fries. We walked to two other restaurants on property and only found nachos at the mexican restaurant for me to eat. So we went back to our room and decided to use our voucher for room service. At least they have salads and pizzas on that menu. We ordered a couple pizzas, wings, and chips and salsa. The pizza was mediocre. I heard the wings were good. So overall- Pros- location is pretty. Nice balcony view. Nice rooms with comfortable beds. Most employees were nice and helpful. Cons- parking, limited menus, overpriced food and drinks, MISLEADING WEBSITE, overpopulated pool area with annoying crowd I would go again, except I would stick to the $80 rate and not get a voucher. I would bring all snacks and drinks, and order pizza or go off location for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A good price & lots of people”
Reviews.Author: sirms
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort over the Father's Day Holiday. We booked at the last minute and got a great deal at $71.00 a night. Once we arrived we were greeted by the valet and they watched our car while we checked in. Since the resort encompasses such a large area it was better for them to watch then to go park it. When we check in, I tried to upgrade to a larger suite but they were booked for the weekend. The front desk was very helpful and really put in a good effort to find a good room with quick access to the pool. Once we left from check-in, we took our car and looked for a good parking place adjacent to our room. However, we ended up parking a good distance to the entry way. They were extremely busy over this weekend. Once in the room, I felt that we got what we paid for "Remodeled but still looked old". The room was clean and I really liked the balcony. The 2 queen beds were nice and very comfortable. I liked that the suite had to rooms and we did not have to hang out in the bedroom the whole stay. They have a small fridge packed with anything you can think of at a reasonable price for a resort. There is no microwave in the room. The rooms are not sound proof and you can hear about anything that goes on around your room. We had room service for dinner and breakfast and would say that it was some of the best room service food we ever had. The prices were fair considering it was "room service". There are plenty of restaurants around the resort and would suggest heading out if you want to save some cash. The pool areas were nice and plenty of different pools to select from. The first day we in the main pool next to the 120ft waterslide. There were lots of people and plenty of chairs to choose from. My daughter and I really enjoyed the slide. If you like fast and the unknowing you will enjoy this slide. The 2nd day it seemed that the cleaning staff did not make it out to the pool area. We were at the pool by 10am the 2nd day and found lots of trash around the chairs and plenty of dirt and other debris in the water. We chose to go to the family pool for the day instead. It was nice and casual. The wait staff were very good and were always around when you needed another drink. The drinks by the pool were a bit more expensive. But worth it! Besides the dirty pool area, everything else was well maintained. For $71.00 it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone loved it”
Reviews.Author: phinz
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to the Tapatio Cliffs. This is about my favorite resort and we travel quite a bit. Yes, it is an older resort, but that just adds to it's charm. We always request a room in the Cliffside section near the Sunset Pool. Every time we have stayed there, Hilton has honored our request. The views are just beautiful. This year we invited our grown children and they loved it as much as we do. All the rooms are actually suites, which give you some privacy. We have family in the Phoenix area, so this hotel and it's wonderful pools serve as our gathering place. The pools are just fabulous and the food at the pool bar and restaurant are very good with large portions. The resort has been repainted in wonderful southwest colors in the last few years. The staff is always accomodating. We were allowed to bring some local relatives into the pool with no hassle. I know there are lots of nice resorts in the Phoenix area, but for the price, I just don't know how you could beat this place. I sure hope we can return next year. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaGirl80
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this location on the last night of our southwest vacation as we wanted to be relatively close to the Sky Harbor Airport (20 minute drive on Sat morning)for an early flight home. We selected this hotel to allow us a little more space (suite arrangement), a pool complex and for the room rate($92). We were very satisfied with the resort. It is definitely an older complex, but they have done a nice job maintaining the property. Our suite was stylishly decorated, very clean and functional. The pool complex was a very happening scene for teens. The resort offers a Friday family night with Wii set ups in several cabanas by the pool. The kids, young and old, enjoyed the interactive games. There was a pool volleyball game going on with various groups all evening in one pool while the other pool was a more relaxing area. There are also other pools in the complex, but we didn't have the time to check them out. I wish they would provide free internet access in the rooms. During our vacation we stayed in six different hotels and only 2 did not offer free internet. I really liked the vanity area being separate from the toilet and shower. The room had a nice balcony which allowed us to have a view for "people watching". The downside to the resort was the parking was very tight since the units are located in a hilly location and you need to navigate lots of inclines/stairs to walk around the resort.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful getaway”
Reviews.Author: tcrosbie
Reviews.Content: From a kids perspective, this hotel was fab! I'd recomend it to anyone with kids ages 7-12. It was one of the best hotels ever. The restaurants were very delicious, my favorite one was the mexican one. The pools are great. The waterslide was the best part of the pool area. The only problem wsa my dad's cell phone signal was a little low, but, i had an exellent trip and can't wait for next time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to relax in”
Reviews.Author: mmm919
Reviews.Content: We flew in from the East & only needed to stay for 1 night in Phoenix. We were looking for a nice, quiet hotel to relax & unwind in. This Hilton fit the bill perfectly. The location is a bit remote but the grounds are very nice to stroll around once the heat of the sun has died down. The staff was great as my sister left an article of clothing & they mailed it out to her free of charge. Would definitely recommend. Loved the food at Macayo's (Mexican restaurant close by), as well as the nearby Einstein Brothers for morning coffee & bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Huskies06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for a week and all and all it wasn't a bad place.There were a few issues with our room the first night and we were moved to a better room the second night. I had requested a rrom off the main floor and in a quite area, they stuck us on the main floor next to the kids pool.Another main main issue we had was that the elevator near our room was broken the first night we were there and we had to lug our stuff down 3 flights of stairs, and after reporting that it was broken no one seemed to care.Also upon check in, we we very quickly given a map and rushed out of the lobby.The property is very big and a map doesnt help you until you can have a chance to explore it on your own. The property is very nice and maintained and the pools are all very nice and clean. The other issue we had was that the restaurants on the property werent all open the week we were there,we kept trying to eat at the Mexican place and it was closed all week, and we were never told about it.When finally a guest relations person informed us that it would be open at 1:30 on Friday it never did until way later in the afternoon, this surprised the guest relations worker.You would think they would know when it would be open/closed. The parking is also a big issue here when it is packed.Well in conclusion I would stay here again because the rooms/property are very nice, ts in a nice location just dont expect much in the way of customer service and good luck trying to find a vending machine if you stay on the upper half of the property,they say they exisit but they dont.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: bettykid
Reviews.Content: I visited this resort in the off season. We had a very nice time. The room was nice - suite with a sitting area that was as large as the bedroom. The bathroom had one sink in a space separate from the shower and toilet - which was great because our party was three women celebrating our 40th bday. We had plenty of room for three women to get ready. Additionally, we had some younger people next door and we were above the pool area. But, neither of these things kept us up, because our room was virtually sound proof! The pools were very nice. We were in the off season so the adult pool had drink and food service only on the weekend (which was a great treat when available). But, during the week, we sat by the family pools and had no problem finding seats that were away from the family scene (this was our goal, since this was our weekend away from our families). We took a hike from the hotel property and found a very challenging hill to climb. This trail had a lot of other hikers, making it safe, but still provided some pristine natural environment to experience. We visited the hotel upscale restaurant on the first night. The view was fabulous! The food was presented well, but was very salty (even my salad). So, I would only rate the food average. The atmosphere was very good. The Phoenix area as a whole is very spread out. This hotel is not near anything, but seeing that everything in Phoenix is a drive, we did not see this as a negative. The staff was great! They were very patient as three women debated their options every evening. They helped us find shopping, restaurants and car service every night. The service in all the restaurants was also very good. They really enhanced our vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “phoenix getaway left us non plused”
Reviews.Author: birdog28
Reviews.Content: Dated rooms, the door stuck to the painted door jam so you had to use your shoulder to open it. I didn't find anyplace outside the room to sit and read. Room did have separate suite with couch arrangement, so it worked for a young man family member traveling with us he had his "own room" and T.V. very good golf course... actually great golf course, best played in November as they overseed in 1st of Oct then its shaggy for a week or two, clubhouse wqs o.k. restaurant : pointe in tyme was $135 plus tip four 4 dinners that no one was impressed with. expensive ** and iffy 2 star

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort Setting for a good price”
Reviews.Author: 16yearsinhotels
Reviews.Content: My father's aunt passed away. He asked if I could travel with him to Phoenix. I did. Not wanting to make the trip all gloomy, my father wanted a nice place to stay. After using Yahoo's trip planner, I found this resort hotel to be reasonably priced. Because the hotels don't look quite the same as their online pictures, I used Google map's street view to scout the area the condition of the exterior and called Hilton reservations. After talking with the reservationist for a bit, he recommended I call the hotel and ask for a special offer. I thought sweet, inside information. But, the clerk and her supervisor stated they had no special. The clerk was not very friendly or warm. This type of attitude always bothers me. A guest should feel a personal connection with the hotel. It even makes the clerks job easier as the guest is less likely to attack someone they know on a friendly basis. I called central reservations back because the reservationist informed me he of a falls view suite at no additional cost - all their rooms are suites. When we arrived the location and property met my expectations. We received the same non-warm service from the desk. The clerk explained the bellman would show us to our room. When we went to the bell desk, he pulled a complicated map, drew an X and gave us brief directions. With no line at the desk, I don't know why the desk clerk could not have shown us. We got lost. The property is spread out and the roads to rooms are narrow - imagine streets of Rome - and parking sucks. The property has a lot of charm and is nestled against a mountain. Our room was a falls view suite. However, the only view we had was a partial view of the pool. A tree blocked most of the view. I'm not sure how they can call these fall view rooms as the falls start behind the view and end directly below. It’s more of a pool view room. However, it was still nice. I quickly realized the AC was not working and probably had not for the previous guest as the thermostat was set to the lowest setting. Maintenance arrived promptly and determined it take a few hours to fix. He called the desk and arranged for another room. He got housekeeping to rush the room and got us in. During our move, the front desk called to say they were getting us a new room and someone would be by with new keys once it was cleaned. Maintenance was WAY ahead of them. He was very engaging and offered the level of service I would expect from the desk. I can't remember his name (tall guy white guy, was in the service). Since he was getting off duty soon, he left us with Roman, the other maintenance guy. Roman was just was engaging and went above and behind to help us move to a room a couple of doors down. I never expect great service from the maintenance staff, but these guys were awesome. The rooms are more mini-suites than they are suites. You have a sitting room and a bedroom. In between, is in the vanity area and bathroom. Both the bedroom and sitting room have flat screens TVs with pay-per-view movies and games. There is a fully stocked mini-bar. Nice, but it left no more for any of our own items. Housekeeping seems inconsistent. Our first room had no robe and was missing a note pad and pen in the bedroom. The rooms were clean otherwise and in good condition. I was very comfortable in this room. There is an alarm clock radio with an audio jack for an iPod or other mp3 player. There is high-speed internet in the room for $11.95 a day. The wireless in the lobby requires you to purchase additional service. The second smelled moldy and at times the vanity area smelled like someone just used the toilet. I think the "crawl space" around the AC unit is starting to mold. I noticed mold in the "crawl space" of the first room when they were checking the AC unit. The resort has four restaurants, one at the top of the mountain with a view of the city, one that is sort of a clubhouse, a Cantina, and a poolside cafe. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby. The cafe was closed during our stay and the mountain top sounded more romantic and pricey than my dad and I cared for. For lunch we ate the clubhouse, Pointe in Thyme. We both ordered the Shrimp and avocado salad. While the shrimp was not fresh in the least bit, it was a very good salad. They weren’t large portions and we paid $12.95 for the lunch menu salad. The bartender was not the most professional person, but good enough. The second day we stopped in, a young man at the hostess counter was very friendly and offered to call the property’s driver to shuttle us back to our room. I really liked the idea of the café by the pool. I could really see this resort as a nice winter getaway where you can go swimming, relax by the pool, have the scenery of the falls, and feel comfortable never leaving. There are many different pools scattered throughout the property. The pool by the falls has a water volley net and many private poolside cabanas free of charge. This would be a good property for a large travel group. Because we were in Phoenix for a funeral, we did not get to enjoy the property as we should have. We paid $139 a night plus tax with no hidden resort fees. I thought it was good deal considering the business class hotels were only $20-40 cheaper. I will stay here again and try to enjoy the property on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and relaxing, good family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: CRSM
Reviews.Content: OK, so I wouldn't describe the rooms as luxurious, but the suites are more than adequate or satisfactory, plenty big, with two LCD TVs. Not that many actually have great views of the scenery, but one of the many pool areas are visable from most. But the truth is, if you are spending that much time in your room, or looking for a luxurious "do not disturb" weekend, you are at the wrong place! The Tapatio Cliffs IS, however, a great conference facility, and a great place to relax or have fun with the kids next to the pool. If you are one of many folks going there for a conference, this is the perfect place to bring along the family to. The Falls psuedo-waterpark has plenty to offer all ages, including chair-side beverage service and cafe with cooling mist-ers. For conference widows, I highly recommend the adult pool, with its Mexican restaurant/bar, and a Starbucks nearby if you are in the mood for hot rather than cold beverages. As at all Hiltons, expect to pay a premium for access to the internet and fitness center, ugh. However, they offer a "resort package" for $2 a day gets you into the gym and a daily newspaper. We mainly ate on the property, which was quite convenient if you don't have a car (or find the parking situation bad, like lots of folks have). Unless you have lots of cash to blow, skip Different Pointe of View restaurant, or maybe just go for drinks to check out the decor--modern, luxurious--but expect to pay $10 for a 6 oz margarita! Pointe in Time is much better and more reasonably priced (although all the restaurants are a tad on the expensive side), has a more Tavern-y bar, and pretty much everything at the Cantina is good--esp. the outdoor covered bar (and cheapest beer on the property). Be aware that the menu at all of the restaurants is kinda limited, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: daver328
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, March 16-19, 2009. The purpose of our visit was relaxation and sightseeing. The staff was courteous throughout, and the room service was completely satisfactory. Our room was nicely appointed and clean. We had a nice balcony view of North Mountain. We enjoyed short hikes to the top to see the views next to the restaurant. Beautiful views! We spent the days, and most evenings sightseeing, and so although we had intended to - we never used the large pool area. The larger pool complexes were impressive. We walked through a few times - and it seems they were used but never over-crowded. We did enjoy two of the smaller pools nearer to the top of the hill - where our room was. We enjoyed the resort and the layout, however, for someone attending a convention - I understand the negative comments regarding the walking required. The resort is spread out and requires walking up and down. Also the layout of the walkways can be confusing unless you study the resort map. This resulted in many people simply walking on the narrow streets - which creates a saftely hazard and requires drivers and pedestrians alike to use caution inside the resort. Also, in the summer months, I can see where the heat could become a factor in the walking required. The use of the fitness center and internet were additional fees, not so much to my liking as I would ceratinly have expected the fitness center to be included in the room fee. You could get those for a $2 -$3 daily resort fee ... so not really a big deal. There was an erroneous fitness center fee on our bill, which they removed. We got the rooms for $99 on the internet via "nameyour own price" - so the value for a resort was one of the main benefits. For slightly more than the price of two star hotels, we were in a nice resort. We had a nice stay and we would return. No big complaints. If we were staying in the summer ... we might prefer a room closer to the big pools at the bottom of the hill. Not a five star ... but for us ... great bargain for the price.

Reviews.Title: “hilton”
Reviews.Author: blackhawks49
Reviews.Content: Well not srue were to start, the rooms are out dated look like 1960's, furniture is horrible. Beds were OK , good location , clean, fair staff. The parking is terrible. Never ate at this facility, many good close places for Breadkfast and lunch it you are around,. Down the street to the fiest strip mall on the left is a great diner and a sports bar,. Down the way is a great little breakfast place called Scrambled very good food just opened. Would never stay at this place again very disappointed, also never told us about a $100 credite that we had ulntil we checked out,.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with the resort”
Reviews.Author: SLM57
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a two-day conference, and I was very impressed with the facilities and especially with the service. Everyone was very friendly and helpful - from the initial contact with bell staff and front desk, to the wait staff, to the pool staff. The rooms (suites) were big and comfortable. All of our meals were catered and the food was excellent. There are several swimming pools. I swam in the large Geyser pool at the Falls and took a couple of spins down the water slide. The resort is built on steep cliffs and hills, so I found the location very beautiful and very striking. They have vans to drive guests around wherever you want to go; however I found it was no problem to walk everywhere on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Location But Rooms and Bell Service not even 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: m3montana
Reviews.Content: I had a five star experience with the conference facility, catering restaurant, and bar, but a three star at best with my room. The food service and bar staff was wonderful. When we asked our waitress in the Pointe bar which way to go to our outdoor conference dinner, she actually took the time to walk us part way there and point the way out. I believe her name was Julie,. As for the hotel itself, I wish I had done a little more research and insisted I got a room more near the lobby that required less hiking to get to. The bellman dropped us off at a unit way up on the hill only to tell us to climb a set of stairs through the landscaping and up two flights up to our level with only a half hearted offer to assist is with bags. When checking out, I called 30 minutes before I needed to leave the room for help getting my bags down, but ended up doing it my elf because nobody showed up. My room was not worth the price I paid. Also wasn't the cleanest, I had to wipe hair out of the tub before I used the shower, etc. I would recommend walking through your room before you accept it. Perhaps I would have been a little more accepting if I had booked through Priceline, as some of the other reviewers did, but I paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort -- great price!”
Reviews.Author: coce50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting my sister. Secured room on Priceline for $50 during spring break. Room near adult pool room a little musty but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star resort!”
Reviews.Author: bgood58
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed from the moment of check in. While my husband was at the check in desk, I talked with the concierge about local restaurants. He seemed bothered by my inquiry, but rolled off the names of a couple of local restaurants. Again, when I asked him if he could write them down, he seemed totally perturbed. I didn't dare ask for location, phone number, etc. When we finally found our room (they neglected to tell us it was in the main building and this is a pretty large resort) we were even more disappointed. The exteriors of the buildings are not impressive, even seemed quite worn. Our room opened to a courtyard and that area definitely needed some updating...wrought iron railing was worn and dated, planters with faded, artificial flowers, etc. The room itself was a two room suite, but I use that term very loosely. The "bedroom" was just large enough for a bed. The entire "suite" smelled musty and was dark and painted a funky green color (and I love green). We had a very small balcony that was almost completely covered with a low hanging awning, keeping almost no light from coming into the room...maybe the reason for the wierd smell. I would never stay at this hotel again. It was not price worthy and was NOT a four star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if you can get it on priceline”
Reviews.Author: jgodic
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here with my family over Easter weekend. We were lucky enough to get a great deal on priceline. All the rooms are suites, which comes in handy if you have a couple of people in a room. There are a few pools scattered around the property. The main one is pretty busy with lots of kids and music, but we preferred the one closer to our room. It was smaller, but had a hot tub and there weren't many other people there. I would definitely recommend a trip up to the restaurant at the top of the hill for at least a drink, it really is a gorgeous setting. Unfortunately we went on a Saturday night when a pretty cheesy cover band was playing, maybe it would be quieter during the week. The rooms were well maintained for the age of the hotel. Service was fine, the staff was very friendly. Since this is on the northern edge of Phoenix, we ended up driving quite a bit to go out to eat and explore the city. But it would be a great spot to plop down if you just want to lounge poolside for a couple of days. One annoying thing was the per day charge of $12 for internet, and it wasn't even wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly & Helpful Staff, Clean Rooms, Top Notch Facility”
Reviews.Author: CourageousChristian
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent a week here. We took morning sightseeing trips in the Phoenix area and basked in the afternoon sunshine at one of many pools. We also used the resort as a base for day trips for Sedona & Tucson. Two small negatives - refrigerator was fully stocked and left no room for our items, and no microwave. Excellent concierge staff directed us to top notch activities (e.g. Phoenix Botanical Garden & light show) and away from others. Easy access to freeways. First class facility to which we enjoyed returning every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 927wildrose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Tapatio Cliffs 14 years ago and we expected the resort to have showed its age but it was in great shape. I laugh when I read a number of the reviews complaining about the charges and the prices of food and drinks at the pool bar, I assume most of the complainers are used to staying at an Holiday Inn Express. If you travel anywhere you can expect higher prices for meals, drinks and services at a resort than off campus. Get a clue! We were on Spring Break with our 3 kids, 15, 12, and 8 and we had a great time. The pools are great and the service is top notch. We paid $134 a night for a clean, updated, 1-bedroom suite that slept five comfortably. You cannot find a better deal and I would venture a guess you can get similar rates on Expedia, etc. If you go on a warm weather vacation and plan to stay in your room the whole day you are a loser. The staff was friendly and helpful especially at check-in. When we arrived the valet was cordial, the reception desk moved us to a room closer to the family pool and even moved us to the 5th floor to avoid any noise. We ate breakfast and dinner out every night and in most cases the drive was no more the 15-20min to a good restuarant. We ate lunch poolside everyday and the food is very good. If you have kids they cater to them and the wait staff is very attentive and friendly. The food and drink prices are reasonable compared to a lot of resorts and at $134 a night I can handle the price of a 20 oz. beer at $6.75. I would highly recommend this resort for families and couples. The couples can stay away from the kids by using the adult pools or the more secluded pools spread out the resort. Don't listen to the whiners this is a great place especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful property...”
Reviews.Author: btworld
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights at this property with my sister who was visiting from the midwest. She reserved our room through priceline. I was very pleased and loved the location. We were right next to a restaurant and the adult pool. It was quiet and beautifully landscaped. Our room was clean and well appointed although we got spotty cell service. We had a wonderful time and would return again if we could get the same rate we got on priceline. I know there were other guests who paid MUCH more than we did so I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton consistently disappoints in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: mdwatkin
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member and a fan of the chain for the most part. However this is my third stay at a Hilton property in Phoenix and it was as disappointing as the other two. The Tapatio Cliffs resort is an old property, and while we heard that it is being updated we certainly didn't see that. Hilton goofed up our reservations which we had made a month in advance and as a result upgraded us to the Presidential Suite in the old part of the hotel, as opposed to the new part that we specifically requested. The image that a presidential suite conjures up is usually plush -- this was very far from that. The suite, bed, bath - the whole suite - were very dated and not special at all. Light switches falling off, dilapidated paint and poor air conditioning were features. Parking was at a premium with limited space. The small and sharp rocks that make up the landscape nicely grated my son's leg into cheese. Room service was way overpriced and the server had to make three trips to get it right. On both of the times we ordered - shame on us for trying twice. The resort pool - while nice and clean - wasn't special enough to make us go back there again. The one bright spot was the person that checked us in; despite the reservation snafu he was professional, personable and very customer oriented. I remain a Hilton fan, but will avoid the Tapatio (and the Squaw Peak and airport Hilton). Best of luck to any other traveler.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place!!”
Reviews.Author: TrishaChambers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times before, but my stay this time was the best stay by far! First off, my fiance is a Diamond member and we had our room upgraded to an Ambassador Suite this time. Wow! This room was the size of a small apartment in New York and was decorated beautifully! The bed was so soft and comfy I didn't want to get up in the mornings and slept really hard at night! The room was right by the adult pool so there were no screaming kids running around. Very quiet and very calm. There are a couple of other pools at the resort, one being the big one with a water slide and water falls. That's the kiddie pool. It's also nice there, but if you don't have kids with you then the adult pool is the way to go. The staff was helpful and respectful and when we needed something they always did their best to satisfy. The only thing bad I can say about this resort is that if you don't have transportation then you'll be stuck paying high prices for food and watered down drinks by the pool and at the other restaurants around the resort. Other than that, I can't wait to go again! It's defiantly my favorite place to stay in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - dated property”
Reviews.Author: traffic_guru
Reviews.Content: I was there for two nights on business. Nice hotel, but somewhat dated. Property is very sprawling. My room was sort of old-style Embassy Suites with a small bedroom, small living room, separated by bathroom and sink area. Funiture and carpets were showing their age. I had a first floor room and I was unable to get a cellphone signal (AT&T is my carrier). Since I was there on business - not having cellphone service in my room was a major inconvience. To much concrete in the walls I guess. Pools are small and dominated by kids.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: srhbluerain
Reviews.Content: I visited here with my Mother for the weekend. She was visiting from Connecticut and just wanted to relax and sit by the pool. I had been to this hotel before so I knew she would love the spacious pool area. The main pools are very fun, lively, and has a tropical feel to it. The drinks and food from the Cascades Cafe are quality but pricy. There are lots of kids in the Falls Water Village so if you're looking for something more low key the adult pool might better suit you, otherwise it's great for families. We also rented a poolside cabana which is a nice treat. The rooms are nice because they are all spacious suites but the decor is standard and I thought the bathroom was a bit cramped and run down. We went to the Point in Thyme restaurant (the more upscale Different Pointe of View was closed for a wedding reception). The restaurant decor has an upscale feel to it and is very dark. The others in my party enjoyed the ribs that they got. My mother and I got the blackened prime rib which we were not happy with, it was really fatty and did not have that flavorful taste that prime rib usually has. The kitchen was backed up, so don't be in a rush when you go here! We didn't mind though. We also went to the buffet brunch at a Point in Thyme which we enjoyed. The hotel is built into a mountain so there are some great sights to see if you walk around the hotel and use some of the walking trails. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it because during peak season the prices are much cheaper than some of the Scottsdale resorts of the same caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: SusanandKevin
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night in Phoenix here before heading out to Sedona and Grand Canyon. The hotel has been recently updated. Our room was absolutely beautiful! The pools were beautiful, too. We loved everything about this place with the exception of the parking. Parking was on the side of a narrow winding road and was first come first served. We were lucky enough to get a parking place close to our room, so no real complaints there. Very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but too confined”
Reviews.Author: gleuny
Reviews.Content: We showed up and the place was sold out. If you are not traveling with kids, best not to stay here. The room set up is stupid, as in the last review. Gorgeous grounds, but again, children have run of the house. Plenty of walking too, steep walking. The surrounding pools are very small, ok for a quick dip to cool off. Fortunately, we stayed in the main building where everything is. The terrace was more like a cave. none of the rooms get much sun. The highlight of the stay is the restaurant on top of the peak 'Different Point of View' NOT to be confused with the clubhouse 'Point in time'. Was worth the splurge eating there. If you can't afford $75 a person, then go there for a drink, or just sit outside and enjoy the view. There is NO food nearby except two upscale supermarkets, and a crappy Italian joint. So plan on traveling for food. Best to stock up before you arrive. The mini-fridge is tight, packed with out-dated items. And this place WILL nickel and Dime you to death., from phone calls to using the tennis court. At least parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Not exceptional but good”
Reviews.Author: HappyHermina
Reviews.Content: This place is good. Not exceptional. Not horrible. Just good. Check out and check in was efficient. Staff were helpful. The suites were okay -- nothing great -- but nothing unexpected or unadvertised, either. They are just as stated on the website. Pretty simple -- a small living room, a small bedroom and a bathroom in the middle, with the tub/toilet on one side and the sink/vanity on the other. The "wet bar' was not wet i.e. no sink. It would be much appreciated if they would abandon the mini bar concept and give us an emply fridge and a microwave. We did not have a microwave which was disappointing. We emptied part of the mini-bar to store our own supplies. There was no charge for that, but I did notice that if you want the hotel to empty the mini-bar they charge $25. The beds were very comfortable and had nice linens. There was one really nice reading light per bed. They were excellent for reading and letting some one else sleep. It would have been nice if there were two per bed, however. There is a nice sized closet in the bedroom. The deck is off the bedroom. Our deck was small and too deep in to the building to ever get much sun. The bathroom was okay, although the shower and tub seemed old and not up to date. At one point, our tub wasn't draining at all, but a call to the front desk resulted in the maintenance man fixing it within an hour. As already stated, the living room was small -- there was a couch (pull out bed), a wicker type chair, and a small (but nice) desk and desk chair, along with a cabinet and a flat screen tv. The cabinet had nice storage. There were also two end/coffee tables that had some weird tin/silver surface but they were okay. In the corner was the bar area, which was functional, but would have been better if it included a microwave and did NOT include ridiculously priced goodies. Maid service was consistent and generally okay as far as surface cleaning. However, they never cleaned under the bed etc. The pools and bar areas were very nice. There are a lot of extra little sitting/tannning areas throughout this resort that you can find if you go exploring. If you want a quiet place to tan, with no pool, there is a big deck off the 5th floor, just overlooking the "Adult Pool". Very nice and very rarely used. The food in the cafe by the falls pool was good. The service there was good. We rented a cabana for $75 one day and are not sure if it was worth it. You get a tv, phone, fridge and a cabana with pool furniture. You also get a waiter to order food and drinks. It seemed a little pricey but we did it anyways. The basetball court area was nice too, for the kids, and there is a big sundeck there. The tennis courts were convenient but again, you had to pay to use them, or to rent equipment. We didn't golf. We had brunch at the main restaurant by the adult pool one day. It was okay (but again, nothing spectacular). That is why I say this place was just "good". "Good", not "exceptional". Nothing about this place was "exceptional". I found the parking was alright. We always found a spot. Yes, we had to walk a bit, but it wasn't terrible. There are elevators, so when you have luggage or a lot to carry, you don't have to use the stairs. We were with our 11 year old son, and for part of our trip, 3 adult children, our brother in law and his adult daughter. Our adult kids found lots to do at night -- there was a wedding and they met people from the wedding party. Our 11 year old enjoyed the pool but would have had more fun if he had a friend with him. Generally speaking, all staff was friendly and easy to deal with. One word of caution is the website. It is very confusing as to which part of the website pertains to Squaw Peak and which part pertains to Tapatio Cliffs. In fact, my brother in law booked at the wrong property through the web site. So be careful -- ensure that you are getting information for the right property. The internet was wired and $11.95 a day. That was a bit of a pain, but we knew about it in advance. There was a fee to use the fitness centre etc. but again, they are pretty up front about that. In the grand scheme of things, not much to complain about. .

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: fatcat32
Reviews.Content: Very nice property but that is as far as that goes. Staff at front desk and concierge are clueless. I was charged and over charged for every thing. To use an hotel facility you must pay a fee (gym, courts). Rooms had a weird set up, sink separate from bathroom. My experience there was not terrible but for the price I could have stayed in new york city facing central park. For a Hilton hotel I expected some much better.

Reviews.Title: “The upgrades are working”
Reviews.Author: nh
Reviews.Content: We have not traveled to the Pointe Tapatio Cliffs in over two years until last weekend. However, prior to that we stayed there every year for over 6 years and I worked in Phoenix back in the 80's and always stayed at this resort. However, when I was there in the 80's I had no idea how to spell GOLF let alone play the game. This resort is continuously trying to get better. The last time we were there (two years ago+) the entire place was painted white. Now they have made over every building to blend more into the desert and have nice earth tones on the outside while upgrading each suite. Yes, this resort is a true suite only resort. For the price you get a bedroom, living room and bathroom. That is the lowest of the low where some rooms have even more.
