The one negative I have about the place is the same I have had for twenty years. The parking and getting to the room from your car. I feel like you are in the back streets of Italy or England. There is barely enough room to get one car down these “lanes” let alone meeting someone nose to nose. You do have to hoof your bags up a set of stairs if you are on one of the buildings' second stories (but that is why they have bell boys). OK negatives all done, let's get to the positives. Staff are awesome, rooms are very comfortable. The restaurants are very warm and comfortable. The Point in Thyme is deep dark wood accents with huge semi-circle booths and tables in the middle with two fireplaces. This is where breakfast is served (buffet or a la carte). You have to try the Arizona eggs benedict, very unusual and very tasty. Also dinner is served in this restaurant and is surprisingly good. The Different Pointe of View is the flagship. Perched on top of lookout mountain it has a panoramic (and that is an understatement) view of the valley. You can drive up there anytime (day or night) and sit in the parking lot and just gaze. Also, there are some trails that start up there which take you even higher. Keep in mind the restaurant is not open Sundays or Mondays. You must go up there at least 30 minutes before your reservation. They have just overhauled the bar on the second floor (the restaurant is on the third floor). What a beautiful bar area and so comfortable. The best thing is the terrace. You go out onto the terrace and you are out overlooking the valley sitting on comfy seats with fire pits a blazing (we were there in February obviously in August there are no fire pits). The vegetation, view, drinks and service make this a wonderful place to just chill out. Once you experience it you will see what I mean. The restaurant manager (Bill) came out to the terrace (which is multi-level and very big) and found us and directed us to our beautiful window front table. We had a very nice meal (beware, the wine is expensive with the best vintage wine priced at $7,000 a bottle). I had a super crab cake and then an awesome Halibut dish, my wife had a beautiful Scallops dish and a very good chicken dish. The staff were awesome as I proceeded to dump a glass of water all over my wife and the table, they were there in an instant and we were moved to an even more romantic table in the corner. (Guys: Hint: dump the water, it worked well)...OK, now to the real reason we really like this resort. The golf course is amazing, the staff again are so cool. This course I do believe is our favorite, you cannot believe the desert around each hole. There is little water but a ton of scrub. This course was in perfect (and I mean perfect) condition last weekend. The fairways look like they are painted with the stripes and the greens are fast and unforgiving. Wait until the 10th tee, check out the view as you are on top of the mountain looking down. Range balls are included. So I have to finish with the best of all. The package deal. If you (and your S.O.) are golfers try this out. Room, breakfast (includes food, tip and taxes) the package says buffet but they are flexible and you can just use the coupon towards any menu item, golf (each day of stay including cart and range balls), one dinner (for two) at Different Pointe of View (they gave us $95 per person for food) including tax, tips (obviously not booze) was an incredible low package price. As I stated earlier, we have been visiting the Pointe for many years and they are really trying to make to make improvements in anyway they can. The only reason for not 5 stars, the parking and hoofing the bags up stairs. It would almost be better if they had a huge off-site parking lot and then gave everyone a golf cart to get around. Trust me, you won't be disappointed with this Phoenix resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: onthemovegal
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults + 2 teens) stayed at this property and loved it. Very nice to have the separate bedroom from the living area when sleep schedules differ. We liked that it was built into a hill, but it did make it challenging to get luggage up and down from the parking area. Great way to sneak in exercise however. We loved the hiking trails right off the property. We were able to visit the sister property (Squaw Pt) and liked their lazy river pool. Staff at Tapatio are very friendly and helpful. Furnishings were newer, clean and color coordinated. Hilton hotel shampoo/conditioner is cheap so I always bring my own. Housekeeping was very good and always discreet. Seemed to know when we were out and cleaned the room in our absence. Did not like that there was no safe in the room, but there was plenty of storage space for all our stuff for a one week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Antedeluvian furnishing”
Reviews.Author: retiredincyprus
Reviews.Content: A badly laid out sprawling disjointed complex furnished by someone from another era.Definitely the worst carpets we've ever seen EVER.The rooms are all next to parking places which with modern cars means you hear the beep of the remote when someone locks or unlocks.The rooms were fairly spacious and comfortable but the furniture predated me!The Different point of View restaurant is beautiful and has an amazing view over Phoenix but we went to a tasting menu dinner there that was probably the worst value meal we've ever had in our lives.The chef told us about his reductions and infusions then proceeded to produce a cold meal(mainly because the plates were cold) of stunning ineptitude and thoughtlessness,for example a mid course of Duck breast on Polenta followed by Lamb fillet on mashed white beans--too similar by far even if they had not been cold.In fairness the place was consistent,the other meals we had were also cold and in both cases not as ordered.Efficient they ain't!The area around the hotel was very nice for hiking though it's getting built up fast.Last but not least there is some good news-down the road there's a smashing little chinese called the bamboo house which is cheap cheerful and serves the best chinese we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: barefootcontessa56
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews prior to booking here for a 4 day stay. As I often see, there are mixed reviews for nearly every property on Earth. After staying at this resort (and it is more of a resort than a traditional high-rise hotel in the city) I still cannot understand the bad reviews written prior. Everything about this place is top-notch and first class all the way! The rooms were gorgeous, the lobby and main entrance breathtaking and the pool area outside of the lobby, simply stunning. There are numerous pools and spas and the service poolside was quick and friendly. The service and staff go above and beyond to make you feel at home. I had a problem with my in-room coffee maker and literally seconds after I hung up with housekeeping, a new one was brought to me by a smiling staff member! The layout of this place is fabulous! It is built into a mountainside. Yes, the roadways are narrow and mostly one-way, but if you can read the simple map that the bellman hands you upon check in, you can figure it out in no time. There are large parking areas for those who can't. The restuarant at the top of the mountain is breathtaking - both inside and out. Stunning views of the city, heaters for chilly, February evenings and even a big fire pit to sip cocktails by. The food and service was one to go into my memory album! I would highly recommend this property to those looking to "get out of the city".

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: SaraCKTaylor
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The room was a little difficult to find but it was very cute and comfortable. We walked around the resort and took advantage of the hill side pool - very private and romantic. We also went up to the restaurant bar each night at the top of the hill to listen to the live music - that was so much fun. We ate at the mexican restaurant - it was ok. We also ate at the bar - had sandwiches / very good. Then we went out for sushi off campus one night with an excellent recommendation from the conceige. We wll definately go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me, it's a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: vws
Reviews.Content: What is there to dislike about the Tapatio? It is one of the best hotels in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and you can get a room for $95.00 until Jan. 5th (and around $220-50 after…good breaks for AAA members). We have stayed at the Phoenician, The Hyatt at Gainey Ranch, The Wigwam, etc. Of all those hotels, we often prefer to go to The Tapatio because: 1. wonderfully friendly staff who go out of their way to say hello or to help you out. This includes the check-in staff, the hotel room-service delivery people, the gift shop people and the whole assortment of the people at the golf course (they could consider hiring at least one woman…just to look as if they had an inkling that women can be pros, too). 2. The rooms are outstanding but not huge. There are two rooms in each suit. The first is, of course, the living room. That is separated from the bedroom by an ingenious systems of doors on either side of the bathroom (The bathroom has a pass-through from the living room to the bedroom…basin and mirror on one side, toilet and bath on the other with a door.) which is between the two rooms…one that closes between the living room and the bathroom and one that closes between the bathroom and the bedroom; this allows people in one room to close off the other room but to still use the bathroom. The rooms are newly renovated…I read the earlier comment about what the writer thought were unattractive color schemes. Those colors are the hotel’s keeping up to date…many of the resorts we have stayed at in the greater Phoenix area, have begun to use similar colors. The beds have feather pillows and feather quilts. There is a wet bar and refrigerator in the living room. 2 wide screen t.v.’s. AND…for readers…a first! Adequate lighting by each side of the bed. It is true that not all rooms are created equal. Some rooms don’t have great views (such as in the main building on the right side… the view is of delivery trucks all day so avoid those rooms). It is a hotel which is built on hillsides (which is part of its charm). If walking is a problem (as noted in one of the earlier reviews) request a room down below. 3. There are several small restaurants and two larger ones. One of the two larger ones is all paneled with mahogany and is very handsome. Good food, reasonably priced for a resort. Great bar. Friendly atmosphere. Then there is their very slick “A Point of View” restaurant with terrific views of Phoenix/Scottsdale. The restaurant has gotten great reviews from food critics. Pricey but that is what a gourmet restaurant costs. 4. You want pools? They’ve got pools. A huge water-wonderland set up with slides, etc. Two smaller pools nearer to the main part of the hotel…rarely busy. One on top of the hill. Fitness center. And here is something outstanding: the hotel does not charge the usual $10-$12 a day “resort fee” which I have come to hate at all hotels. You can buy a special certificate for $2.50 a day for various uses of resort activities…but you don’t have to. Right there you save at least $70.00 a week. 5. GOLFERS! Listen up. The course is terrific. It is kept in first-class condition (with the exception of the 2nd hole’s green…not sure why they haven’t attended to that). The course has been called “the Phoenix areas best kept secret.” The staff was very accommodating. The course climbs up and up until the 9th (at which point you are 3 miles from the clubhouse) where you can see for miles in either direction. There are some pretty tricky holes where doglegs, water and thick desert flora abound. Deep traps. Undulating greens, Fun. I wasn’t paid to be this upbeat about the hotel! I just think it is great place. It isn’t going to all things to all people…but give it try. I think you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Point Hilton”
Reviews.Author: milfodo
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by quality of room and service. Had a nice extended weekend visit.

Reviews.Title: “Like Niagra Falls”
Reviews.Author: NoGuru
Reviews.Content: We got a sweet $99 dollar a night deal for a three-night minimum. The weather was beautiful, the accomodations acceptable, the EIGHT swimming pools sufficiently resort-like, the food okay (except for the Pointe in Tyme Grille and Tavern, which was very good). However, this is not a restful property. It's right in the middle of Phoenix, along busy N. 7th St. Traffic noise is a factor and is masked by a series of fountains that thunder like Niagra Falls. Helpful booming generators are positioned throughout the grounds and collaborate with the fountains for a truly unique auditory experience. Several more irritants: 1) Construction noise on the property's west side 2) Our first night, our room was adjacent to an elevator shaft. Try to avoid this. The elevators are fussy and noisy. 3) Housekeeping staff reporting to work at 6:30 a.m. and chattering at the top of their lungs. 4) A room service employee flinging the contents of the previous night's ice bucket over a railing into one of the main courtyards. If I go back to Phoenix, I'll gladly pay more for a better property.

Reviews.Title: “Another Terrific Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine118
Reviews.Content: We just came back from another wonderful stay at Pointe Tapatio. The hotel is charming, centrally located and reasonably priced. We really enjoyed our room which was a palacial suite. Although the room had a couple of minor issues (the safe did not work and a couple of tiles were loose in the bathroom upon arrival), the response to any issues was immediately and happily resolved. The staff was very friendly and forthcoming. Karen in reception was especially wonderful. The quality of the food and value at Pointe in Thyme restaurant, where we had breakfast every morning was excellent. Although the service was occasionally uneven, it did not detract from the overall enjoyment of the experience. The pool areas were beautiful, pristine and relaxing. We are returning in January for the next production of Phoenix Opera's Aida, and are looking forward to our stay at Tapatio!

Reviews.Title: “Large, remodeled suites inside; Dated infrastructure outside”
Reviews.Author: berchelm
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a business meeting, but due to Homecoming at ASU, my hotel in Tempe was sold out for the final night. I was looking for a mid-priced resort in the hills to relax and maybe do some hiking, so Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs seemed like a good choice. The rooms themselves are very nice. Mine was obviously remodeled, so the furniture was fresh, stylish, and the basic king-bed suite I had was comparable in size to a large Marriott Residence Inn or Hilton Embassy Suites room. Kudos to the room! The property itself, however, is very dated. The buildings look quite worn, and the property has a very claustrophobic feel because the buildings are situated so close to each other. The streets going around the property between the buildings are so narrow that only one car can pass by, and since cars must parallel park along the road in many locations, squeezing through is a harrowing experience. Like other reviewers, I found the food prices excessive compared to most hotels at this price-point, although the room service staff was very quick, friendly, and attentive. To be fair, I came to this hotel based on the pictures I saw on the Hilton web site, so it was my fault for not doing more research. Because I expected a new, state-of-the-art property, my expectations were not met once I got to the location and realized how old it is. I felt like it had a rather dark and dreary feel to it; it didn't have the new and clean look that I've become accustomed to in other parts of Phoenix. Because the room was so nice, it balanced out my overall impression of the property, but I definitely won't return for a second stay or recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: smcalifornia1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Pointe Hilton and found it to be a wonderful place to stay. We have always stayed closer to the downtown area but have tired of all the noise and traffic. So glad we found this Hilton! It's true that it is located "off the beaten path" but that's exactly what attracted us to this resort. There is alot of up and down hill walking throughout the resort but if you find yourself in need of a ride back to your suite, there are benches for resting w/ phones available to call for a pick up. We liked the pool at "The Falls" and the bar area was a bonus although last call is at 4:45p this time of year. We ate at Pointe in Tyme twice and although it's a bit pricey the food was very good. The suites offer lots of space and 2 televisions are provided. The furniture (in our building) is bit outdated but the king bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on! The entire staff are wonderful and friendly. We will now make Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs our "regular place to stay" during our annual trips to Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: NashuaNH
Reviews.Content: I attended a 5 day conference onsite sponsored by an employer. I travel quite a bit on business so I can compare offerings and expectations. There is no complimentary transportation from the airport, so prepare to pay either a towncar or Super shuttle both ways. Expensive and not expected for a large resort hosting business conventions on a regular basis. Internet is not free either and charged daily, whether you need basic or VPN. It was an extra $75 charge for me. Although the resort adverstises many restaurants, only two were open. There was nothing inexpensive and I paid $17 for a cheeseburger. The resort is not within walking distance of anything, so I paid a hotel employee through the conceirge service to take me to the closest supermarket and pharmacy. He was very nice and waited for me so I could get reasonably priced snacks and drinks for the week. The rooms were fabulous with terraces, nice two room suites and plenty of room. There was a mini bar in my suite with typical minibar prices. The elegant restaurant at the top of the hill was wonderful, attentive staff, nice food and a shuttle to your room. Beautiful view. That was a bonus. Another interesting point, I had a very early departure one morning so I went to the desk and settled my bill the night before. When I pulled up my bill a week later, there was an additonal minibar charge of over $50------ If I had not called, my employer would have paid for that or given me a lot of grief about some thing I didnt do. To their credit, there was no argument and I was told the charge would come off right away. So, it was a 50/50 kind of trip. All right but not great. Really too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip for Travel with Toddler & Grandparents”
Reviews.Author: SeattleHotMomma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our family's belated summer vacation. Overall this trip exceeded our expectations. Here are some high points: - Room set up was great for our family of 3 (my son is almost 2). There were three distinct parts- family room, bathroom pass through, master bedroom with plenty of room to walk around the pack&play/crib. - Our location on the property was ideal. First floor, facing the family pool, steps from The Falls. Our rooms were 1045/1046. They were back to back and not adjoining as we requested but in the end it didn't matter. I would HIGHLY suggest this building for families still using strollers or anyone that doesn't want to hike. The downside is you dont get a view from your room and no real balcony. - We got a crib, refrigerator and microwave (pay $15 for the stay for each of the last two items). We shopped at Safeway about 1/2 mile north of the property and ate breakfast and lunch in our room every day before putting my son down for a nap. Saved a ton of money. We dined out at night. - We brought our portable DVD player on the flight and the plug which allowed us to play my son's favorites on the nice flat screen in the living room when we were in the room. -Overall this seems like a great time to travel to the resort. The weekend was somewhat busy with a couple of weddings but no issue finding chairs around the pool. On the weekdays we were the only one in the pool until around 11am when a couple of others joined us. - The Falls pool was perfect for our little guy. The graduated entrance allowed him to play safely while we were able to wade a little deeper or sit down to keep cool. Better than a baby pool as we could all enjoy it together. -While my husband & son were sleeping I hiked every morning. It was wonderful and easy to access from the hotel area near the pool. -We did actually order room service twice and surprisingly it was affordable based on what we were eating. The kids menu is $5-$6 items and good. We got a pizza and it was good and $13-15. I got a open face steak sandwhich for $15 as well. Other items on the menu like drinks and dinner meals were outrageous. Kids breakfast at point in time was also a deal- my parents took my son so I cant comment on the adult food. My only complaints: -The directions from the website take you from the airport on 51 to Northern and then you drive through a really unattractive & rough part of town to get to the hotel. I would advise driving further to Cactus and going to the hotel that way. -The AC went out one day/night but the night manager was especially helpful in getting us a room for the evening in another part of the hotel with working AC and not having us move rooms entirely. In general for the $141 we paid a night I though the value was outstanding. My parents want to return next year at the same time. One other note: I am a huge fan of the Willow Stream Spa at the Fairmont Princess and would suggest if you are looking for a great spa experience I would go there for 1/2 day and get a treatment, workout, relax at their pool, spa lunch and leave the kids home. Its pricey but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: ThePreacher
Reviews.Content: Went there to celebrate our 36th wedding anniversary. There was absolutely nothing to do if you did not want to hang out at a pool or play golf. The balcony faced the balconies of other residents so there was no scenery - we drove to Sedona. Parallel parking on an incline was the highlight of the day. Not our cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Walk, step, walk, step...”
Reviews.Author: glb310
Reviews.Content: For some reason, I really like this place. It’s true that you if you enjoy walking and climbing with no cell phone service followed by more walking and climbing (with 100F) then this resort is for you. The room was above average (except for the tiny bathroom) and well maintained. The only complaint was not being able to use the refrigerator in the room for my restaurant leftovers while the available microwave screamed my name. I also have to add that the front desk personnel were phony and a bit standoffish but I can get over that. Other than that, I recommend this place for everyone but not the mobility impaired. However, they do have “shuttle stops” around the resort for those who care not to hike to the pool. Go ahead and stay here. You will discover something new about yourself as did I.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: Balmain
Reviews.Content: After receiving an email, while we were in New Mexico, from Hilton hotels telling me of a great deal for three nights including a Sunday at two Hilton resorts in Phoenix, as were were on our way to Phoenix (how did they know? - was it because I had made enqiries on the internet before leaving the UK?), we drove to the Pointe Squaw Peak, which could not accommodate us. However, they phoned Tapatio Cliffs, ascertained that there were rooms available, equipped me with driving directions and sent us on our way. The guy at Tapatio Cliffs (I wish I could recall his name) was so polite and welcoming. and even remembered my name (probably because of my English accent) when I went to the lobby later that day. We didn't have enough time to extend our stay until a Sunday, but I asked him for a good deal and we were offered the deal in the email for three nights anyway. Everyting about the hotel was wonderful. We loved all the space in the suite, the views, the balcony, the comfortable bed and the nearby laundry facilities, as well as the smaller, quieter pool in the water park area. One evening we put on our hiking boots and walked up to the nearby hill (just above the restaurant) to watch the sunset. If I have one less favourable comment, it is merely that I would prefer a smaller, easier-to-get-around resort, (the main pools were a long walk from our suite) but that said, it was great to be able to park very close to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you WANT your weekend ruined don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: JRMAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the area and wanted to get away for the weekend, relax by the pool and enjoy what a resort has to offer. After much searching and review reading we chose the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. We booked for a 3 day weekend. They were having a summer special $99.95 per night. We arrive on Friday about 5pm to check in. The front desk lady was nice and friendly but the lobby was over run by children jumping all over the furniture and a big crowd of teens. I gave the desk clerk my credit card. She said oops your card isn't being accepted. Well the cost of my 3 night stay was only supposed to be $333.00 and my credit card had plenty of credit on it. I gave her my debit card and we were registered and on our way. Later I checked my debit card online banking and discovered they put a hold on my debit card for $1200. I find this highly ridiculous. I understand and expect a hotel to put a hold on your card to cover incidentals, however my room was $99 a night for 3 nights, I don't see how a deposit 4 items the amount of the cost of the room was justified. We requested a king size bed. It was just me and the hubby. When we finally found a parking space, walked down a steep incline and found the building our room was in we opened the door to find they gave us a room with two full size beds in it. That was disapointing. Also within about 20 mins of turning the AC on there was a loud annoying clunking noise coming from the sink. We assumed it was some sort of water leak from the AC draning into sink pipe. It was so loud and annoying. We were already starting to get a little frustrated. We went back to the lobby and it was even more crowded than before with children, teenagers, and two weddings and their guests. We decided to walk around the property and take a look then go get something to eat and talk to the desk when we came back. Well.. this property is located on a mountain and the suites are built all up and down the mountain side. You can not walk anywhere without climbing up a mountain path. Unless you are 20 years old and in fantastic shape it's somewhat difficult to walk around the property. Especially in the dead of summer here it's 110-115 degrees. There is also little to no parking. Every parking space next to their nice waterpark, adult pool, family pool etc was filled up. The entire parking lot was filled to capacity so unless you want to wait to be crowded into an over stuffed van that drives you around the property to take you to the different areas of the resort you have to walk them which like i mentioned before is very difficult with all of the steep hilly inclines. So our nice walk around the property ended me being tired, huffing and puffing, and sweaty. I'm obviously not in tip top shape but that was just a little ridiculous. Our room was right next to a nice looking pool overlooking a the area below but we couldn't really get to it. The path to the pool from our room was up a very very steep road. So steep that it was just too much trouble to try to walk to the pool and since the parking is no existent it made no sense to drive to the pool. We went off property to eat and since the hotel is on a mountain we had to drive awhile to find any decent places to eat that were not in the run down part of phoenix. When we came back we had decided to checkout and find another place to stay the weekend. We went back to the hotel and called the front desk and told them we would like to check out early. They did offer to find us a new room but we didn't think we would enjoy ourselves. They told us they usually require 24 hour notice to cancel but they were nice enough to let us checkout the next day with no other charges ( i hope, as of now they have only billed us for the one night stay plus $12 for the use of the internet) So we are thirsty so my hubby said he's going to find a coke machine and get some ice. He comes back about 30mins later empty handed. We have a vending area right by our door but there is no coke machine. He hikes all around this hilly property to 2 different coke machines neither of which are working. He hikes from the hills to the gift shop in the lobby but it has now closed. There is nowhere else to buy a coke except order room service or drink from the mini bar. I'd rather not pay $3 for a can of coke but we were so thirsty we ended up drinking to cans of soda from the mini bar. I'm convinced the have non working coke machines to MAKE you buy the overpriced mini bar drinks. We could barely sleep all night with being thirsty all night ( you can't drink phoenix water unless you want to get sick) the loud clunking noise coming from the ac, the small full size bed for two people and the thought of our weekend ruined. We checked out first thing the next morning and went to the The Buttes Marriott resort in Tempe and that was the BEST decision we ever mad. I will give a review of that fantastic place next. The Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort is a hell hole that I wouldn't tell my worst enemy to stay at. I don't see how they have or keep any of their paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “Tapatio---try Ta-Crappyo Cliffs”
Reviews.Author: xpyc
Reviews.Content: We were given a room that had a view of two parking lots. They claim to have 8 pools and we were closest to the Presidential Pool. There was nothing presidential about this pool that was closer in size to my bathtub then a resort pool. There is a lovely complex of pools but no joke about 10 minutes away, as you have to traverse levels of stairs, bridges, parking lots and 110 degree weather to get there. We changed rooms for the next two nights which made our trek only 7 minutes, and finally checked out a night early when a tour bus of what appeared to be a teen tour arrived. The restaurants are plenty but mediocre (we ate at all four of the dining options). Folks who worked there were nice enough but the hotel had no sense of aesthetic. Most of the views were of parking lots not the touted cliffs--they need a landscape architect quick. You can definitely do better in the Phoenix area, spend your money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise without an ocean”
Reviews.Author: Shangri_la_Seeker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from July 4th trip. Normally I go were there is an ocean. This was a trip to visit friends but made it into a vacation. The Pointe Hilton staff were very friendly. Everyone of the hotel staff would greet you with a smile. The room was clean, but you could see wear in the walls and carpet. The pools were fantastic, the falls area was good for kids. I liked the adult pool in the main complex because you could wade in the pool without the worry of kids slashing. Arrived on a Thurs. and there is construction going on in front that was annoying, Fri was a holiday and very peaceful. Price at the restaurants on site was a little pricey for what they served. $18.95 for breakfast buffet that was nothing special, On Sunday La Cantina was closed for dinner, this left Pointe in Tyme or Different Pointe of View as the only choice for food. Closing the Falls at 8pm seems to be a mistake because they have a terrific place for a night club. If there was a ocean this would be a place I'd want to visit regularly.

Reviews.Title: “OK but can be noisy on weekends”
Reviews.Author: doggone31
Reviews.Content: Between the price I paid for the room and the Hilton name I was expecting an outstanding property. It was nice but not anything special. The good: - Large room, with separate sitting area - Good housekeeping - Proximity to hiking trails. The bad: - Room was a bit shabby (scuffed furniture), had no view, and overlooked the parking lot - Not much close by. You really need a car, although there's a Safeway and some shops about a mile north. - 5 pools, none of which are big enough to do laps in - Exercise room (for which a resort fee is charged) is underwhelming, with a limited selection of equipment - Party destination, not a luxury resort, on weekends. I stayed there Thu-Fri-Sat. Thursday night was fine. Friday night the people next door dumped a whole bag of beer bottles off their balcony. Saturday night, the same room was occupied by a different group who were up doing shots and talking and laughing on the balcony. I called the front desk at 1:15 and 2:15 and it took 45 minutes each time before things quietened down. On checkout, front desk staff were relatively unsympathetic (and the ass't front desk manager was borderline rude), saying, "we have no control over who stays in our hotel rooms". True, but you do have control over how you respond to complaints, especially if your guests are paying over $125 night for your rooms. Overall, it's OK. I guess I was expecting this beautiful luxury resort and it's kind of just an ordinary hotel with a few more swimming pools.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing grounds, room. Extras are extra.”
Reviews.Author: physicx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago for two nights. I would love to go back for the scenery and luxurious room. I met up with a friend who was here on business. Through travel rewards, she managed to get a King Presidential Suite which provided beautiful, condo-like quarters with design touches like high wood-beamed ceilings, a stained glass window in the bathroom and a nicely furnished and inviting balcony off the bedroom. The room was appointed with a fully-functional kitchen with full-sized fridge. When you walk into the room from an outside corridor, you enter into a great room with the high ceilings with wood-beamed ceiling. The decor was southwestern, and although southwestern decor is a little out of date and seemed so cliche for Phoenix, it felt fresh because it went nicely with the room's architecture. The layout: To the right in the great room is a large living room seating area with huge sectional and chairs with large coffee table. To the left of the door was a desk near the front window, and straight ahead towards the kitchen was a gorgeous dining table that would have been suitable for a formal dinner party. A little overkill (who would throw a dinner party at a hotel???) but I'm not complaining. Then, from the front door past the dining table was a kitchen. Although the kitchen was definitely a separate room, it melded into the great room as there was a bar counter/stools behind the dining table, so of course you could see into the kitchen from the great room. When you walk through the great room towards the bedroom, the kitchen is on the left, and then there is a nicely tiled, elegant half bath beyond the kitchen also on the left as you come up to the bedroom door. When you open the door, an expansive bedroom is revealed with large bathroom, double vanities and separate large changing area on the left. Bed on the right, and balcony straight ahead. Our suite faced west from the balcony and the colorful sunsets over the nearby hills were a real treat. I definitely could have lived here, no problem! The grounds were beautiful. It's set up like a Mediterranean hillside village with many small winding streets on the grounds. Walks were very nice, although some might find a leisurely walk a little arduous since it is so hilly. Near our building there was a waterfall in the cliff across the street. If you feel like a real hike you can actually meander your way into some open desert mountain terrain on the property. There are several pools on the property some with outdoor bars which were very nice, though drink prices were kind of steep (and mine were kind of weak). There are also several dining options on the property ranging from casual to upscale. I didn't actually try these places out except for some appetizers at one of the outdoor bars. There are also several well equipped gyms on the property too. The one I went to was expansive, had plenty of cardio, nautilus, and even an impressive array of free weights. It was probably around 1000 sq. feet, and I only ever saw one other person there. I may be mistaken, but I think you had to pay for gym access, but we were covered with my friend's travel rewards. Annoyingly, you had to pay for internet access which was hardwired with the outlet at the desk. This was about a year ago, so hopefully they have come into the modern age and put in wifi. Overall, I would definitely come back and highly recommend this place even though some of the costs are hidden.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the Money!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidS050
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on May 31st. Got an extremely good rate on hotels.com for $109, which made me rate this an excellent stay. Didn't get to enjoy too many of the property amenities, but the staff were courteous and professional. The two-room suite was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. I stayed in building 27, which was about 300 yards from the registration desk. You do need a map to get around this place. I never got to enjoy the large pool area, but the smaller pool behind registration was quiet, clean, and the poolside food offerings were very tasty. I played a round of golf at Lookout Mountain which is attached to the hotel property. If you book room and golf together, the round of golf only cost $50, which was a bargain for the upscale course. I will definitely stay at this hotel again on my future visits to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.

Reviews.Title: “Views that go on forever”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: I was here for five nights in early June attending a conference staying in two different rooms in the main building (first two nights by myself with a king bed and the remaining nights sharing a room with two double beds). I also visited the room of other colleagues in some of the other buildings. Pretty much identical layout for all standard rooms: living room (which included a sleeper sofa). short passage (with toilet/shower on one side and sink on the other) through to the bedroom. There are doors on either end of the passage so privacy can be had. As a standard room setup, this is great! Very comfortable beds. Flat panel TVs in both living room and bedroom. Wired internet in room. Lots of space. Good housekeeping. First, the positives. As other have commented, it is a beautiful location. There are pools throughout the property (so one never far away) and the main pool complex is enjoyable (although describing it as a water 'park' is a bit much...the highly advertised slide is a fun (but short) experience). The views from Different Point of View are stunning. I didn't eat there, but drinks on the terrace at night were very enjoyable. The grounds are immaculate. The staff are very friendly and a problem with our billing was fixed quickly by reception. When I called housekeeping about a missing bottle opener, staff brought the replacement within a couple minutes. They are also flexible about allowing you to stay after official checkout. As a meeting venue, it is fantastic. Event catering was good, the meeting rooms were configurable for different sizes of events and the AV setup was well-handled. The conference center is next to the main building, so very convenient for those staying in the main building. Now, the negatives. It is pretty isolated. The hotel does provide a shuttle (for a fee) to get to the local shopping mall, but you really need a car to get to anything outside of the resort. Without a car you are a willing hostage. Internet is $12/day (although you can print out boarding passes for free and they do offer free printing in the business center from your own laptop). As for the food, I only ate at the Cantina (the Mexican restaurant in the main building overlooking the family pool). it was OK but not great and I could taste no alcohol in my drinks (and IMO was overpriced for what you got). As others have noted, it is fairly spread out/hilly and for those with mobility issues, it can be a challenge. However, the free shuttle service is excellent (one of my colleagues was staying up the hill and the shuttle appeared 3 minutes after she placed the call) and the staff encourage use of the service. The layout is fairly confusing. There are a number of footpaths/bridges that provide shortcuts (so that guests don't have to walk in the roads) but they're not obvious. Again, staff are very good about telling you about them, but I think the signage to these paths could use some improvement. Signage for drivers was very good. I'm not a golfer, but friends that are commented on the great course and facilities available.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff...beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: hrh333
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely gorgeous resort. Things are a bit spread out over a few hills creating great views, but may be troublesome for those who have difficulties getting around. Several small pools and one large area were fantastic. Fitness room was small but sufficient. The rooms were nice sized (we had a suite with a king sized bed and pull-out sofa for 3 adult women--all 3 were extremely comfortable) and very clean and well kept. The absolute standout though was the staff. They went above and beyond at all times and cannot possibly praise them enough. For instance, we had a light bulb in our room that appeared to be wired incorrectly (burning smell) and within minutes of calling the desk, we had a gentleman from maintenance at our door. He quickly organized a room change for us and even went so far as to help us re-pack. Additionally, we were given a $50 credit for our inconvenience. Similarly, we had a waitress at the resturant propping open emergency exits when the air conditioning wasn't working to its full function and again, recieving our drinks for free for what we considered a small inconvenience. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families (great waterpark/pool and spacious rooms), and adults looking for a comfortable relaxing trip (private adult only pools and quiet, spread-out rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: afineguy
Reviews.Content: This resort is often known as a convention hotel. Stayed here for pleasure and enjoyed it very much. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Nice that all are two bedroom suites. Resort was built in 1982 and has been maintained very well. Staff is friendly and helpful. Pointe in Time is good for breakfast. And a Different Point of View is on just outstanding. Dinner is 5star and the lounge has one of the most amazing terraces I have ever seen. The pools are great and if you don't like the sound of happy children, you can retreat to one of the smaller ones located throughout the resort. The resort has cliffs in the title, so you should expect to walk up-hill at times. There is a shuttle service that will talke you around. Overall, I was extremely pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Inside Out" aka "Poor and Pleasant"”
Reviews.Author: GinaL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 days at this resort.. Quick and to the point:: The grounds are lovely and well-maintained. That's the outside. On the inside...the rooms are dismal. I can't imagine why they had a recent remodel and the rooms still look like these do. It's not just dated, it's also drab. I would only stay here if there is a special pricing offer as there are many far nicer places. On the plus side, the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg89
Reviews.Content: This place is sooo BEAUTIFUL!!! you are surrounded by mountains; they have at elat 6 out-door pools, 5 jacuzzi's, a water slide, sauna, steam room, i had a FANTASTIC time. the service was great, the staff at the hotel was very helpful. the restaurants were excellent, maybe a lttle expensive, but that's expected when you dine-in on the grounds of the resort. I went with my 18 year old daughter but next time i will defintiely go with a male companion or just for girls only weekend. i lLOVED this place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service. Beautiful Resort.”
Reviews.Author: mmmmMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a quickly planned 4 day weekend and were thrilled with this place. Our party consisted of one mom (author of this review) a teenage son, and a second grade daughter. This place met all of our needs. My daughter is raving about all the pools saying the one with the water slide was "amazing". My son's favotrites were the golfing and the layout of the suites. We all enjoyed room service. I was very happy with the attentive and gracious staff. The setting on the cliffs is rather unique, and It provides nice little tucked away entrances. The view from our balcony was gorgeous. You must take advantage of the many activities in and around Phoenix. We got to Chase stadium to see Randy Johnson pitch...my high school pitcher was in his glory. We also took a ride up to Sedona and toured the Red Rock area. It was breath-taking... though I will need some recovery time to get over the winding, steep, and very fast travel on those highways leading to and from Sedona.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory at Best.”
Reviews.Author: Travelmonkey_8
Reviews.Content: There are lots of great resorts in Phoenix. I was staying here for business and found the accomodations acceptable, but nothing special. The layout is haphazard and the staff was friendly, but not overly helpful. A couple of examples, the pools in the main area of the hotel, did not have a children's pool. There was a $13.95 daily charge for wireless (I can't imagine the last time I stayed at even a modest hotel that charged for internet acess). I left a pair of shoes at the hotel, and really got the run around as I tried to track them down after I left. One day while sititng in the Lobby waiting for my colleagues, I had to listen to a staff member on the phone talking in heated terms with an ex-spouse. I was staying at the resort for free, but taken in totality each of these negative experiences would have me stay at a different hotel. There are many great resorts in Phoenix and this doesn't even come close to being one of them. It was adequate at best, not awful, but not the kind of place for special vacation memories.

Reviews.Title: “Overall... great stay!”
Reviews.Author: brownfamily08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited as a last relaxing trip before our new baby is born next month. Overall, it was a wonderful and relaxing stay filled with great service and beautiful views. Check in was perfect. Tony led us by car to our Hidden Valley suite and explained everything about the resort and best places to eat while at the resort. Our suite on the top 4th floor was great with a comfortable bed and living room suite. When the flat screen went out suddenly the first morning, they were there with a new one within 5 minutes. WOW... great service again! The food was very good at Pointe in Thyme. We ate there for the buffet breakfast complete with a custom omelette station. The hamburgers there were fantastic as well. Do stay away from the Mexican Cantina... food was not that good at all. We played a round of golf there at the resort at Outlook Mountain Golf Course. It was in great shape with immaculate fairways and greens, course can be very challenging playing from tips. (Just stay on the fairways!!) The spa was probably the most disappointing part of the trip. My husband and I both got massages.... the therapists were good however the spa is VERY SMALL and CRAMPED. There is no "spa-like" experience there so I did cancel my facial for the following day. The pool is great complete with a slide. Although being 33 weeks pregnant I couldn't do it, my husband enjoyed the indoor slide! I loved laying out and getting some great sun. There were children everywhere at the family pool but there are 3-4 other smaller pools at the resort, one being for adults only. The only part I was not happy at with was when our bill came the last morning, they had double charged us for a dinner and added about $5.00 additonal to a tip. When we questioned them, they immediately took it away... just disappointing they do things like that to unsuspecting guests. Overall though, we loved our stay and will bring our children back in a couple of years! Phoenix is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to enjoy the outdoors”
Reviews.Author: awaintroob
Reviews.Content: Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs is built into the foothills in North Phoenix. It is right next to the Phoenix North Mountain Preserve so it is a wonderful location for hikers. The hotel has a waterpark with a 138 foot slide and lots of pools all over the property. The accommodations are very comfortable. I particularly liked the reading lights attached to the headboards on the bed on the side away from the bedside table. I also appreciated the availability of coin laundy machines. My 11 year old son loved the fact that there was always a pick-up basketball game on the basketball court. This is a great place to settle in to enjoy the Arizona outdoors. If the main focus of your trip is shopping or fine dining, you might want to stay closer to the bright lights of Scottsdale since north Phoenix doesn't offer much in the way of shopping or dining. One word of warning--this resort is built into a mountain so there's lots of ups and downs. It would be a tough place to manuever a child in a stroller or anyone with difficulty climbing or descending hills.

Reviews.Title: “~ Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: M&ALongGrove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs over New Year's break, 2008. We have been to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area many times, and have stayed at the Pointe a number of times before: winter and summer seasons. Needless to say, if we didn't like it, I wouldn't have booked this stay. However, I must say that having returned to the Pointe so often ~ probably 7 or 8 times, dating back 12 years ~ that we'll book someplace else, for our next visit. Remembering back to my first stay ~ a business trip ~ I was really impressed with the resort: unique grounds, great facilities, a nice selection of restaurants, fantastic pool area, comfortable and spacious rooms. I can tell you this: if you're a first-time visitor, you will probably love the place. After a couple business trips, I returned there a few times on my own, and actually got engaged at "A Different Pointe of View," the upscale restaurant on the property. So, all things considered, the Pointe will always be special to me/us. On this most-recent visit, we used the Pointe as an "home base." Aside from breakfast, we drove to other restaurants in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area to go "the local route." As you know, it's always fun to try new restaurants, and go back to some local-area favorites. And there are plenty of great restaurants, not more than a 30-minute drive from the Pointe. If there was a negative Pointe on this trip, it would be the breakfast. We got the Hilton's "Bounce Back" Breakfast Deal. For a discounted price, you get to select from the breakfast menu every day. However, be careful here and read the fine print. To be fair, just about everything is included in the deal option; you can get a very inclusive breakfast everyday, including juice and coffee. But, read the menu closely. For example: one morning, my wife elected to order a breakfast entree that actually cost less than what I paid for the daily breakfast meal deal ~ you get coupons to use at the restaurant every day. Along with the entree, she ordered juice. Well, the entree she ordered did not include juice, so we got billed an extra $4.00. That rubbed me the wrong way. But those are the rules/terms, folks. So, read the fine print, or ask the waiter/waitress, before you order. Also, on this trip, a couple of the breakfasts came to us "cool," not hot. Cool eggs. Hashed browns. Sausage/Bacon. It was just OK. I don't usually complain about minor things like this. However, it was sub-par, when expecting a nice, hot breakfast. Other than that . . . If you've never been to the Pointe, by all means, give it a try. If you're a young couple, it's a romantic place. If you have kids, the pool area is special, and there's a place to keep your kids, too. (Do everybody a favor, though. Keep them away from that young couple looking for a little romance!) There's something here for everybody to enjoy. Singles. Families. Young marrieds. Business travelers. Active older folks, too. First trip? You'll probably want to come back again. Like I said above, I did. "We did." Now, for the time being . . . We'll leave the Pointe to you, . . . for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference in March 2008. Front desk was Ok, the consigere told me of things to do if I had the time and took a 30 minute ride to Cave Creek. The Suite Room was clean, spacious and comfortable Plenty of things to do, in the resort. Ran the mountain trails (but I was warned about Scorpions, rattlesnakes and bees), Pool scene is good and there is also a golf course, tennis courts and a few restaurants on the site (La Cantina, the Mexican one, was fine for lunch) A few items that may be of note, there is nothing else within walking distance ot the hotel (in case you were thinking of leaving for whatever reason) If you were to explore the Phoenix area more, be sure to have a car. The only flaw I had, was that I was taking the red eye back and I had to ask 3 times about getting a late roon checkout, but I finally got it

Reviews.Title: “Good location; Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: DC_Runner78
Reviews.Content: Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Tapatio Cliffs. The location is nice -- close enough to interstate to be accessible, but far enough away that you feel like you're not in the midst of a metropolis. Across the street is a desert mountain preserve with trails, etc. that are good for hiking or running. The room was quite clean, although somewhat worn, especially the carpeting and some furniture. The rooms were probably originally built 30 years ago or so, so consequently have had some updating done. Our room had a balcony which was nice. Bathroom was fine as well. The water park and pools were nice, especially if you have kids. Although adults will love the bar service too! Had a pedicure at the spa -- the stylists were very accommodating and helpful. Food service is a little limited -- there is a very expensive Starbucks, a pool cafe, a pricey restaurant, and another restaurant that is more moderate...but you are close to other dining opportunities (driving distance, not walking distance) so it's not so much of a problem. I would definitely stay here again. Not sure if it's worth the $259 that I saw advertised on some websites (we used Hilton points), but it was a nice place in a good location with lots of amenities if you're willing to pay for them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but unpleasant front desk”
Reviews.Author: kascoop
Reviews.Content: The front desk is the "front door" in terms of customer service and it just amazes that some hotels don't get this. I booked one night with my Hilton points and then booked two more paid nights. I did this on the Hilton website and I clearly added comments with each separate reservation that they should ensure I don't have to change rooms when I arrive. My wife and I arrived and checked in and the woman checking in was less than pleasant, and then proceeded to tell me that I would have to come back the next day before 6 p.m. to get a new key, but she kept me in the same room. She said this as if she was doing me a favor. It was just an amazing attitude when I'm longtime Hilton Honors member. I asked her what was the point of me adding the comments in the reservation form? Do you read those or not? Incredible. I walked out to the car and asked my wife if she found the woman rude, and she immediately agreed. Unfortunately, she didn't have a name tag. The rest of the stay was pleasant enough, as was the room, the pool area and the golf course, (and we were pleasantly surprised by the generally good quality of the food at the restaurants, and we cook and eat out frequently) but what do I remember? My experience at the front desk when I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “We will return.”
Reviews.Author: Kris1951
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay. It is located right next to North Mountain which is great for hiking, mountain biking and learning more about the desert at the North Mountain Visitors Center. It was very easy to get around from this location especially nice for heading up to Sedona for a day. The rooms are suites which gives you more room and comfort. Our room was well taken care of and all the staff is friendly. We only ate breakfast at the hotel which was very good. The pools looked great but it was a little cool to use. We'll just have to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: jlw1013
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay, and would give the Pointe Hilton a very high recommendation, especially for the price. The room was clean and comfortable with great beds. We took advantage of the pool and hot tubs, and ate at both of their restaurants. The staff was courteous and helpful, and the food was very good. The location is wonderful with hiking throughout North Mountain park, and a Starbucks and Walgreens are close by for essential items. There is an AJ's Fine Food's near Starbucks which has a great wine selection. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RUBUMN
Reviews.Content: My parents and I spent 1 night at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio on our way to PHX from Sedona. Firstly, the reception crew was less than helpful and had an extremely arrogant attitude. Being a Hilton Gold member, I receive better treatment and nicer accomodations at the Hampton Inns. The rooms were uncomfortable and disfuntional. The layout of the hotel was very hard to navigate. The price we paid per room, far exceeded the value of this property. We were spoiled by an excellent experience at the Adobe Grand Villas in Sedona prior to our stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not a huge fan”
Reviews.Author: jcolem2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Tapatio Cliffs with a friend of mine on a golf weekend, and I will not be returning to this property. First of all, let me note that my friend is a Hilton Diamond member, and we used points for the room. If we had spent a lot of money I would have been really disappointed. The room itself was fine - since I was with a Diamond Member we received probably one of the nicest rooms in the complex - set far away from most of the craziness. If we had been put up in the main building or some of the more crowded areas I would have been very annoyed with the noise. Even up away from the crowds noise was still a problem, as was parking. The large pool was pretty much shut-down, very few people there and the waterslide they advertise with such fervor wasn't even in operation. The golf course messed up our reservations and moved our tee time an hour earlier without telling us. They claim they did not do this, but I had a reservation confirmation showing that they did. They moved our tee time to accommodate a larger group coming in, and didn't have the courtesy to call and let us know. The best part about our stay was the little pool up near our complex. It was quiet and relaxing. Although we had to call to the front desk to get the hot tub heater fixed (it was tepid at best), the maintenance person arrived promptly and fixed it. The worst part about the resort was the food. If you are going to charge ridiculous prices ($15 for a sandwich, $6 for a beer) - the food better be good. The food was terrible. Every meal we had at the resort was mediocre at best, and after the second day we just started leaving for our meals. Way over priced for what you get. We went out and bought a cooler for ourselves and kept beer and drinks on our balcony, and ate meals off-site - probably saved us a good $500 over the course of the week. Overall I will not return to this property - even using points for a free room I will most likely try to find another Hilton to use on my return.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy, Noisy!!! Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: majorfoodie
Reviews.Content: They have taken an older, elegant property and painted it the most garish colors imaginable! The rooms are redone in a very haphazard way - they slapped on some paint but failed to refinish any of the wood items like the beat-up 70's era dressers. There is no refrigerator, so you are stuck hauling ice from another floor to keep any beverage cold. The worst complaint is that we asked for a quiet room - HAH! Right under our bedroom window, at 7am the workmen showed up and started hauling metal ladders out of the back of their trucks, yelling at each other, playing the radios in their trucks, and then the air compressor started and stayed on all day!!! When we complained, we were offered an even noisier room (instead of a suite) near the entrance - no upgrade, no discount, no free night. In addition, the highway just below is very noisy; because this is primarily a BUSINESS hotel, the guests themselves don't seem to realize that other people might be on VACATION so when they come back to their rooms drunk or get up at 6am they think it is perfectly OK to yell at their friends; they have outdoor meetings with loudspeakers that can be heard all over the property; and there is a riding academy by the golf course that smells like guess what? Horses! The beds were HARD - this was the "upgraded" mattress, at a time most hotel chains are changing to pillow-tops. And the pillows were so squishy I couldn't find enough of them to prop me up so I could read. Don't count on getting to eat at the fancy restaurant - it is booked by private parties most weekends and some week nights and is closed Sunday and Monday. The Mexican restaurant is a big joke - $12 for two American-style tacos! They have a captive audience and take full advantage of it. Because this resort is on a steep hillside, you either need to be in pretty good shape or ask for a shuttle everywhere you go. Won't be staying HERE again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice All-Suite Resort”
Reviews.Author: planningzone
Reviews.Content: This resort was a welcome surprise. It was beautiful 20 years ago when I was in college, so I was a bit concerned that it could be very worn down. To my surprise, it was in great shape. It was very obvious that the rooms had been refurbished. My wife LOVED it and wanted to stay a couple extra nights. The check-in went very smoothly even though they had a temporary front desk set-up because the lobby is getting refurbished. The pool was great! There was a water slide for the kids. It was closed when we were there, because it was cold out, but they had a sign in front of the slide saying that you can ask the bartender to turn it on if you want to use it. I thought that was pretty cool. You can drive and park in front of your room. If you get there in the day-time there is plenty of room-front parking, so you will not need the bellman to help you. If you arrive at night, GET THE BELLMAN'S HELP! This is because the parking is very crowed at night and you probably need to park away from your room and walk. I was there on a weekend and at night parking was VERY crowded. I guess you can take a drive to the room to see if you can find a good spot and return for help if it does not pan-out...?? There is no "short-term" parking, so either there is a spot or there isn't. The streets are VERY narrow, so if you try to double park and unload, you will block the entire street. I will be going back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sooner22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from 12/31/07 thru 1/3/08 while attending the BCS Bowl Game in Glendale. Being a Hilton Honors Gold member the hotel gave several upgrades and benefits. Staff was very cordial and helpful. My kids loved the pool area on New Years Day. Rooms were clean, comfortable and very similar to an Embassy Suites layout without the fridge and larger bar area. The only drawback was the hotel layout, hard to navigate and was in chaos on New Years Eve. The breakfast buffet was very good. Nice hotel with exception of the layout, which at the end of the day may be a part of its overall charm.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations.......Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort”
Reviews.Author: RodeTripp
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at Tapatio Cliffs on numerous occassions, I was somewhat disappointed with the recent renovations. The many buildings which comprise the resort used to be white. With the red tile roofs and lush vegetation, it was stunning in appearance and reminicient of a tropical villa on a hillside. The buildings have now been repainted in somewhat bold colors (mustard, red, brown etc.) The walkways between the buildings have also been painted in these colors but not the same color as any of the buildings they connect. The result, a look which reminds of the barrios bajos (slums) of Mexico City. As for the rooms, ours was many shades of avocado green with some yellow. It is unfortunate that avocato was chosen as the new color to represent this southwestern venue. It was also disturbing that the new couch was already ripped and that the new cocktail and end tables had brown cardboard glued to them in various places (packing materials which are stuck to the metal frames). For a once wonderful resort, the aesthetics now leave much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little getaway”
Reviews.Author: Schmengi9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tapatio Cliffs resort for one night after Christmas as a getaway from the family and it was very worthwhile overall. We called ahead to ask for and received an early check-in, which allowed us additional time to make use of some of the resorts' facilities. This was a very nice touch, since check-in is usually at 4 PM, which limits how much you can enjoy a place on a one-night stay. We thought the room was quite spacious and clean overall, with warm, yet modern decorative finishes. The bed was wonderful. There was only one vanity for the bathroom, which was located across a hallway from the water closet itself. The light switch for the water closet was on the outside wall, which was little awkward. The separate living room was fine, but the sofa was stiff and there was no coffee table to set a drink on. It would also have been helpful for the room to have a refrigerator separate from the mini-bar like some other resorts have been known to provide. (We'd heard mixed reviews about the Different Point of View Restaurant and decided instead to stay in with food & wine from the AJ's Fine Foods store located north of the resort at 7th St. & Thunderbird, which was an excellent store and turned out to be an excellent choice! No fridge meant meant creative use of the sink and ice bucket for our wine, cheese and sushi. Ce la vie!) Although it was in the 50s-low 60s the day we stayed at TC, we decided that it was still worth a trip to the water park/ pool. (When you come from the 10s & 20s, 50s & 60s is quite a warm-up!) This area is pretty well removed from the vast majority of the guest rooms and almost needs to be driven to because of the lack of walks along most of the interior drives. The pool facilities were very nice and very welcomed and the Cascades bar was also good. There is a smaller pool/ spa/ workout room in the center of the main guest room area, though it looked largely closed while we were there. One area I would caution guests to was the Point in Tyme restaurant, which is located near the main pool area. We went for breakfast before checking out and it was a disaster. The service was abysmal and the food neither worth the wait or the price (45 minutes and $13 for huevos rancheros!). This was noteworthy because it was definitely not high season when we were there, so I can only imagine what a treat it is in peak times. Overall, I would recommend a stay at Tapatio Cliffs. My wife and I would definitely have stayed another night if our schedule would have allowed and hope to get back for another stay the next time we're in Phoenix. I should note that the resort is in the final stages of a renovation project, which currently has the main lobby gutted and moved to temporary quarters elsewhere in the main building. Some of the parking around the main building was torn up or used as staging, but it wasn't a big deal overall and I wouldn't let it dissuade you from staying at the TC.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustgyrl
Reviews.Content: Suites at this resort are spread out against a hilltop and look like a series of apartment buildings. My suite, which had a separate bedroom and sitting area, was overall spacious, clean and comfortable. The room itself looked modern, but felt cozy with all the comforts of home. I also got a balcony with a fantastic view of the city. Additionally, there was a fridge with a mini-bar (additional cost for drinks and snacks). I didn't use the pool area, but noticed that it was nicely landscaped with plenty of room to play or relax. Staff were overall friendly and helpful. One of the things I didn't get though was enough warm air circulating in the bedroom during the cold winter season, even with the heater turned on. During my stay, they were renovating the propery (the main lobby was closed). It was also a bit of a challenge navigating through this large and spread-out complex with its steep mountain-like terrain. Fortunately, they offered a shuttle to get around. Overall, I had a pleasant stay at this resort and would likely return if I were to visit Phoenix again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Christmas Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point Hilton Tapitio for six days over Christmas 2007. The property is undergoing a complete renovation. The lobby/check-in has been temporarily moved across the street to the ballroom. They were repaving the roads when we arrived so they placed us in the main building, which is a four story garden type hotel. We were on the third floor overlooking one of the pools. When you enter your suite, there is a sitting room with a desk, couch, bar, and a new flat panel tv. Then you walk into a tiled area that has a sink, counter, mirror, and a separate room for the shower/tub and restroom. Two people can easily get ready at the same time in this arrangement. The final room of the suite is the bedroom. Ours came with two queen beds, both with plush down comforters and pillows. This room also had a tv, a closet, and a chest of drawers. I believe each room also has a balcony. The couch in the sitting room did not make out into a bed, so the following day, we asked if we could move to one of their outer buildings. They were very gracious to move us into building one. In our new room, the couch made out into a bed, so the room could accommodate up to a maximum of six people, although we just had four. The views from the balcony are a lot prettier from the outer buildings, although the parking can be a bit challenging. (There are narrow roads between the buildings which has limited parking for guests. If you get there later in the evening and the spaces are full, you have to walk up or down the hill to a parking lot). The hotel was very quiet during the Christmas season, and they were not using many of their outer buildings. The hotel staff was very accommodating, meeting every request we had. They give complimentary papers in the morning. They have a computer where you can check in for your flight if you are flying. There are many pools across this property, a work out room, golf, many restaurants, and hiking and horse-back riding right next door to the property. We did not get to take advantage of all of the amenities since we were visiting family, but the room was perfect for our Christmas stay. The staff is to be commended for their excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travel”
Reviews.Author: rzr632
Reviews.Content: I had a quick one night stay for business. I would not stay at this property again for business. This is designed for retreat and should be booked for that purpose only. The room was large and the bed comfortable, but getting to the room was a hike. Cell phone, blackberry, etc. was out of range. No wi-fi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A little cliff dwelling.”
Reviews.Author: ThadeusJackson
Reviews.Content: The Pointe was a pretty good stay. There was some construction going on, but they did a pretty good job keeping the dust down. Although the layout was difficult to navigate, I really dont mind walking around - and Id rather stay in an interesting place than a box hotel anyway. I had to leave early, so the people at the restaraunt bagged up a little continental breakfast to go. My deck had a great view of the resort, pools, and sunset - and my room was recently updated. Con: I was there on business and wish the internet would have been free. Overall a good stay. I would recommend for a business traveler if they can get a good deal, or for a long weekend rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Great Scenic views! Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: willie55
Reviews.Content: We Loved Tapatio Cliffs..We stayed in Building 23 and our room had beautiful views of mountains and city lights. Staff was great and helpfull. Restaraunts were very good. If you stay here you must go to A Different Pointe Of View Restaraunt the views of downtown Phoenix are spectacular and the food although very expensive is top notch. The rooms are great and the golf course is also spectacular! If your on the edge of booking here just do it you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pools but lacking in customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Gracie99uk
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at this Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs. We're Hilton Gold members and were disappointed not to receive any acknowledgement of this at check-in. Infact we didn't really receive any welcome at all. Check-in agent just gave us keys and a map and told us where to go. Disappointed with room on level two near adult pool - on entering it was very dark and smelt funny. Shower pressure was good however and bed comfy. Woke up after first night with Hilton breakfast coupons under the door with letter acknowledging gold status ... would have been appreciated if we hadn't booked room rate with breakfast included!!!! If you want to relax by the pool then this hotel is okay. The adult pool is next to the hotel's mexican restaurant and you can swim up to the bar and order bar food and drinks. We ate burger and fries and chicken tacos at lunch ... burger was fine but the shredded chicken taco was a bit hit and miss! The best pools are at the falls village. There are two large pools and a slide (fun) and a bar area with food available. The loungers at the adult pool are cushioned and really comfortable whereas the loungers at the falls aren't as comfy! Our biggest complaint with this hotel is the attitude of staff. With the exception of housekeeping who always greeted us with a smile and hello no-else seemed to want to be there. Check-in were just awful, bar staff fairly miserable and our waitress at breakfast was disinterested ... we waited a while for her to reappear when we had finished but she was a no show so in the end we just left our breakfast vouchers and a tip on the table and just left. Other than lunch at the pool we didn't eat at the hotel. There are lots of restaurant choices nearby as well as the Outlet Mall at Anthem if you're interested in shopping!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Nice to Relax by the pool”
Reviews.Author: tsmcarr
Reviews.Content: Looking for a quick 4 day weekend and choose the resort from Costco travel site. Saved $300 over the same exact vacation if I would have booked through US Air Vacations. Check in was easy. We requested a room near the Falls Water Village and they upgraded our room at no cost. Rooms were clean and perfect size for my husband and I and our 6 and 2 yr old. No microwave though. Falls Water Village Pool area was beautiful, lots of room, cabanas for rent. Nice depth for the kids. Big hot tub. another Pool located close by, but was more shaded. Adult pool and family pool are located in the main hotel area and are tiny. Make sure to get rooms near the Falls Water Village. Lunch at the Cascade Falls was good, typical poolside choices. Dinner at the La Catina mexican was so so. Visited the sister hotel - Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak. Not as pretty looking, but more for the older kids. Lazy river, putt putt, kids club. Although I'm glad we didn't stay there because the lazy river is not near the main pool so we couldn't just relax and let the small kids off to play. Not nearly as scenic. Our room was right off the start of a trailhead, kids had a good time on the easy hike. Staff was friendly, rooms cleaned timely, close to airport. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: JFann823
Reviews.Content: I would not receommend this hotel for a business traveler. I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting that was to take place at the hotel. I stayed in the hotel part of the resort. First of all, there was no wireless internet. I found this a terrible inconvienance. The only internet connection was found at the desk which was in a different room than the bed. I prefer to work on the bed. Further, when I tried to connect to the internet, it did not work. After spending 20 minutes on hold with IT, I was told it was a hotel problem and nothing they could fix. There were no vending machines. I am supposing they wanted to encourage you to use the minibar. However, be careful with the minibar charges. I found out on my bill a week later (after looking at my ebill on the website) that I was charged for way more than the water that I took. It took several phone calls to rectify that situation. Another reviewer talked about room service but I could not find anywhere where there was room service. I was forced to eat at the worst mexican restaurant in history which was a restaurant choice at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for people on vacation and people with families. There are pools and a variety of restaurants on the property that would make it very convienant for the vacation traveler. Of course I have to admit that the vacation traveler is what this hotel was intended for. However, they have many conference rooms and business rooms for meetings and I am sure they get plenty of complaints from business travelers.
