Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Tapatio Cliffs for 1 night for business. The was my second stay at this hotel and it was another wonderful stay. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The property is beautiful and unique, built into the cliffs with steep drives up to the suites. While it is a steep walk to your room, it gives you are great view of the mountains around phoenix. The beds are wonderful, and these are suites with a nice sofa, desk, mini-bar and tv in the living room. There is a separate sitting room by the bathroom and I love the spa towels they provide. The location is a little remote but it is a nice place to get away and relax for sure, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pools!”
Reviews.Author: photogurrl
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent lots of time in the pool. It was fantastic! It was hot, (August), but fun. The hotel was really nice and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. Always a smile. The food is good. The buffet breakfast was fantastic. The margaritas were very decent. The views fantastic. All around, a fantastic time was had by all. Family friendly. Would love to go back again in April.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Relaxing get away”
Reviews.Author: JChapma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tapatio Cliffs Hilton the last week of August, and had a really great experience. We arrived on a Thursday night, and were immediately impressed with how friendly everyone was. We checked in quickly (HHonors), and were driven up the hill to our room. When the sun came up the next day, we realized we had been driven about 400 yards, so it's definitely walkable without luggage. We had a very nice two room suite next to the presidential pool; clean and well cared for This hotel has a lot of choices for entertainment with 7 pools, and we spent a lot of our time at the pool all by ourselves. It was really, really relaxing. The fitness center is nice and does have a fairly decent selection of free weights. We hiked every morning from the hotel and there are a couple of different trails to choose from, although they're not extremely isolated (you're in metro Phoenix, so we expected as much). Going left under the highway led to better trails. We only ate dinner at the hotel one night; at the Casades (since it's casual). They have Mexican food. It was ok, but we had a great Tex Mex meal 5 minutes away Sierra Bonita restaurant. The bellman recommended it, and it was a really good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not in July”
Reviews.Author: Mslia
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal because it was JULY! Presidential suite. Extremely nice room. Quite a hike to any pool though. The worst part, and this was true of the other Pointe Hilton in Phoenix as well where we went to use the pool, is the locals! I don't know if the hotels are that hard up for cash in summer, but they allow hordes of local families to crowd up the pool area on the weekends. I swear the pool water was yellow by 6:00 PM Saturday. The family pool was closed, so there were kids in the "adult" pool - so no escaping the pee. When we arrived on Thursday, it was a dreamy, quiet escape for our tenth anniversary. So, if you are from Phoenix and want to take your kids to the lazy river or water slides - skip the water park and go right on over to a Pointe Hilton resort! If you want a quiet, relaxing weekend escape - go anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere for a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suzansmile
Reviews.Content: My friends and I, from a local mom's club, decided to stay at The Pointe, for our bi-yearly mom's night away. All of us are mom of young children and we were looking forward to being away from our families, spending quality time together and sleeping in the next day. When my friend and I checked into our room, we noticed that the bed skirt on my bed was filthy. The bed skirt on my friend's bed was splattered with blood (without a doubt) and I also found that I had a dead bug between my cover and sheets. We phoned the front desk and housekeeping was dispatched and the bedding was replaced. For dinner we went to The Pointe In Tyme. Our waiter was very personable, he offered suggestions and raved over the onion soup. Our drink order was taken and 12 minutes later, our drinks arrived. Our meal, consisting of 2 burgers, 2 soups and 3 salads arrived 40+ minutes later. The soup was horrible. Grocery store, off the shelf soup has more flavor and personality then what we were served. The pecan salads were the size of a side salad. They consisted of greens, pecans and with very little cheese. Though it was very tasty, they were certainly not worth the $8.00 price tag. We informed the waiter that the soup certainly did not live up to our expectations. The waiter tasted my soup and confirmed that it was "very bland" and was probably a pot thrown together, after they had run out of the earlier batch. We were offered a free desert and the cost of the soups were removed from our bill. After a disappointing meal, we retired to our rooms. Sunday morning, yes SUNDAY morning before 9 am, we were woken by the hammering, chiseling, tape ripping and talking going on while the removal of room numbers and application of new ones took place, to our door and the rooms around us. This was not the only project going on. I phoned the manager and was informed that he was not available and he would be calling me back. I did let the desk know what my complaint was and within 10 minutes, the one project (chiseling the numbers off the door) was stopped but there were still other work going on that we could hear. At 10:30 am, my friend and I went to take showers and found there was no running water. I phoned the front desk and was notified that the city had a station down. We were able to bathe and dress in our friend's room, located in another building. Overall, I can forget about the bug (we live in AZ) and the issue with the water, BUT will not consider staying at this resort again. The filth in the room and the lack of consideration of their guests comfort, is incomprehensible. In the end, I was offered a voucher, for a night at the resort, at a later date. I was told that since I had prepaid, I could not have a refund. I did insist on a refund, and was informed I would receive a check in a few weeks.. My friends and I plan on sharing this experience with our friends, family and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: winddancer0104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time celebrating our 2 year anniversary here!!! We were there Saturday & Sunday night. We stayed here last year too & had a presidential suite so when I walked into the king suite this year I was a little disappointed but I got over it quickly. For the price, the room is very nice. The only issue we had was our room wasn't ready until 4:45pm (check-in is 4pm), but they gave us a $50 voucher to be used anywhere in the resort. It was a very relaxing trip. You can chill out in/by one of the many pools & there are different restaurants to choose from when you get hungry. Since we don't have kids we really took advantage of the adults only pool w/ the swim up bar. For the price during the summer I definitely recommend staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “only okay”
Reviews.Author: BermudaKay
Reviews.Content: Once this must have been a plush place but age is definately showing. The suites were large, balcony small, all windows frames need replacing. There are 2 laundry rooms, one washer one dryer in each. Be prepared to sweat because there is no ventilation and they are located in what was for me inconvenient spots. Buy the detergent and softener from the vending machine, it's heaper than the hotel shop, get quarters. Food at the Mexican restaurant was good but there is zero atmosphere. Food, service and plenty of atmosphere at the golf club restaurant. Tip, they do have shuttles to get you around the property, take advantage of this and tip the guys because you can get a serious workout just going back and forth from the room. The restaurant on the Cliff was closed for a wedding and is closed Sundays so I never got there. Really wanted to see their wine cellar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pointe...skip the hotel and rent a Townhouse for less!”
Reviews.Author: t3shannon
Reviews.Content: Try and rent a condo or townhouse on the Pointe property instead! I found mine and rented it for a week on [--] and typed in Phoenix. The Pointe has many places for rent and for less than the hotel.... ..You can stay on and use all the facilities of the property while enjoying all the amenities of home. You want room service ...it will be delivered! All places come fully equipped and have kitchens, washers and dryers and some even have HUGE patios!!! Renting a condo is definitely the best deal at the Pointe!

Reviews.Title: “Fifth stay at a great resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: govan_derriere
Reviews.Content: Our fifth stay at the Tapatio cliffs resort. This is probably our last stay here. This hotel is beginning to show its age. Over the years we have stayed at many better hotels since our first stay here. The room allocated this time was dark. The ceiling was low which contributed to the dark interior. The suite was clean and comfortable. Upgrading work appeared to be going on at the hotel, so it may well improve. The food available in the mexican cantina (can't remember the exact name) was overpriced and poor in quality. The restaurant/bar grill was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jcstone47
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The grounds are clean and nicely appointed, as are the rooms. The staff is friendly and helpful. I am a Hilton Diamond member, so that is always nice. The downside is the hike up the hill to get to some of the rooms. If you are staying here for business, a round of golf or with your significant other, I highly recommend it. If you are traveling with children or friends, I recommend the other Pointe Hilton (Squaw Peak, as it is only about 5 minutes away, but they have a water park and more "fun" activities and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Tea_Meister
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked into the Phoenix North mountains. It has the typical "Pointe" style rooms that are much like an Embassy suites. It is a huge site and sometime difficult to navigate. It has several pool areas that are fun but the "main" pool is a disappointment unless the kids are very young. It has one small slide that requires a 20-25 minute wait. The service here is terrible though. It took 3 phone calls to housekeeping to get the roll of TP they forgot, 3 call and a 45 minute wait to get the 2nd half of a room service order. The buffet was completely out of food at 9:15am causing the restless crowd to sit around and wait. Do not expect any results if you bring issues to the attention of management. Not one of these issues was addressed during my stay or in the 30 days since I was there. The Pointe Squaw Peak has a much better pool area and more competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, enjoyable and fun!”
Reviews.Author: wannabewarminFLA
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. Our children are 20, 17 and 11, and we all loved it. My husband did not want to leave. We got a Presidential room upgrade on an already reasonable rate. And Breakfast at the Pointe in Tyme was also great, although some servers are better than others. The view is magnificent. We also went up to the Grand Canyon/Flagstaff area for a few days, and what a disappointment those hotels were, after Tapatio. They set the bar. Service was extraordinary. Everyone was helpful, friendly and happy. Our room was always squeaky clean as well. We hope to return some day. We also visited the Squaw Peak resort for a day, which is free to Tapatio guests, and all of us agreed that we prefer Tapatio. It is prettier and seems cooler. It is more in the mountains. Loved it! Miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Get the Presidential Suite - and get help with luggage!”
Reviews.Author: GEL1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Tapatio which was at the beginning of our honeymoon, and was a short stay before heading on to Maui. The rates were VERY reasonable, and since it wasn't THAT much more costly, we decided to book the Presidential Suite. The room was AMAZING, it's something like 1200 sq ft. which high ceilings, a fireplaced living room, small kitchenette, and 1 1/2 baths. The bedroom and bath area were gorgeous, and we had a beautiful view of the mountains from our balcony. My complaint about this property was our experience at check in. We were supposed to leave Boston at 1:30, and when we got to the airport we found out we had been rebooked on different flights and had to wait 5 hours at the airport, so by the time we got to Phoenix, we had spent all that time at the airport, and then about 6 hours on flights getting there. We arrived at the hotel after midnight and were EXHAUSTED. We checked in and were given a map to our room, and there was no one around to bring our bags so the woman at the desk said you can "try to park" near the room, congratulated us on our marriage and wished us well. Parking there was MISERABLE, and it appeared to maybe a prom weekend because there were a lot of young people making it a busy place. We drove around forever, and finally ended up having to pull over near our room and drag our luggage up the side of a mountain to our room. I had read this place was hilly, but it makes the streets of San Francisco look like cake. Once we finally got the luggage to the room, we parked on the other side of the property and started our hike to the room. We were trying to find the room in the dark and a hotel van pulled up asking us if we needed help. Instead of driving us to the room, the guy pointed us in the right direction and drove off. So by the time all of that was done, it had been an hour since we checked in, we were tired, sweaty and angry over the lack of assistance. The hotel was beautiful and I would gladly stay there if ever in Phoenix again, however I would recommend to make sure that you receive assistance with bags!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Relaxing weeklong visit”
Reviews.Author: RedSox604
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week in June, for the Red Sox series in Phoenix and just a girls getaway weekend. We had a great and very relaxing stay at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs. I wasn't expecting much, after the registration clerk who checked me in very late Wednesday night was not very friendly or informative, but everything was great thereafter. It is a bit overwhelming at first, seeing the layout and many buildings that are mostly up on the hillside, but the very friendly bellman gave me a map and directions to my room, and I found it with ease. THE SUITES: -All rooms are two room suites: a living room area with wetbar, bedroom, and bathroom with a separated sink area. There was also a balcony with chairs/table to enjoy the view. -The beds were very comfortable, the regular Hilton Serenity bedding type. -The room was very clean, as were the linens and towels. The towels were also a bit more substantial that a standard hotel bath towel. -Bathrobes provided for your use during stay. -Plenty of closet space and drawers to unpack your belongings. -Fairly soundproof: I didn't hear much noise from the adjacent suites, except one evening when a child was crying fairly loud. -Drawback, is that there is no in-room safe for storing belongings. RECREATION: -7 pools total: the large Falls Water Village, which featured two pools, waterfalls, activities, etc., as well as smaller/quieter pools scattered throughout the property. The smaller pools had nice padded lounge chairs, which were a plus. -Ability to reserve a poolside cabana at the Falls Water Village. At around $50 for the day, well worth it. It was sometimes difficult to find enough shade at the regular chairs. The cabana gets you two padded lounge chairs, table and chairs, ceiling fan, mini-fridge and TV. -Poolside service at the Falls Water Village, including food and a full bar. Just raise the flag on your lounge chair and they will stop by for your order. Someone will also come by about once an hour and provide you with an ice cold towel to cool down. DINING: -Enjoyed a late lunch at the Pointe in Tyme restaurant. The service was excellent, and although we ordered only sandwiches and french fries, they were really excellent. -Had room service a couple of times: typical of hotel room service. The menu was similar to Pointe in Tyme, and the food was good, but not as great as it was at the restaurant. They were very prompt, and after waiting only 35 minutes for dinner one evening, the called to offer apologies and brought complimentary dessert (which was excellent!) -Food ordered poolside is provided by the Cascades. It was OK(since I didn't need to leave my cabana), but I've had much better. However the margaritas are excellent. -Coffee, lattes, breakfast pastries and fruit are offered all day in the gift shop. Nice to stop in for a quick latte or snack. -I didn't get an opportunity to try The Cantina: tried one evening, but despite seeing several empty tables, was informed by the hostess that it would be a 45 minute wait. OTHER: Service- The front desk staff and the concierge were not particularly friendly or helpful. The rest of the staff: waiters, bellman, bartenders, etc., were very accomodating. Location- Easy to find, about a 15 minute drive from Sky Harbor airport. Not much within walking distance given the size of the resort, so you will likely need a car to get anywhere outside the resort. There is a Starbucks within a 1/2 mile of the resort entrance, and Scottsdale is an easy drive for finding dining and shopping options. Housekeeping-They did a great job each day, and were quiet while they went about it. I slept in every morning, and wasn't awoken by the sounds of nearby rooms being cleaned. Parking-Not enough parking at the buildings up on the hills. Each building easily had 20-30 Suites, but only 6-8 parking spaces. Since everything is on hills, it can be quite a hike up to your suite if you have parked nearer the main building. View-I paid extra for an upgraded view ($5 based on availability via the hotel's website). I think in some cases, the view from a standard room's balcony would literally be of the back of another building. Business-Just a quick note, since on my last review of a Hilton I noted that their internet charges were excessive, this Hilton also charges for internet use in the room, or $0.49/minute in the business center BUT at least this Hilton lets you print boarding passes for free. Overall - my friend and I really enjoyed our stay at the Pointe Hilton. It was just right for a girls weekend away. If I visit the area again, I will certainly consider staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: MrsBerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hilton 5/31-6/5/2007. The hotel is located about 20 minutes from the airport and we found it convenient to everything. Upon driving up, a very friendly bellman met us and showed us where to check in. We were given a room in the "mountainside suites." The hotel property is laid out up a cliff, so very spread out. I would not agree with the person who said to park first, then check in. Unless you are in the main building, you will need to drive to your room as many are on the cliff. Our room was in building 21 on the fourth floor. It was conveniently located near the work out center and another small pool. We liked the area as it was quiet with great views of Phoenix. The suite was fine with a nice balcony. There is some deferred maintenance in the room and around the property. Nothing drastic or anything that bothered us. We are Hilton Honors Gold members and got breakfast coupons toward the buffet. The coupon covers a continental buffet of yogurt, assorted pastries & fruit. For another $4 you can add omelets, bacon, frech toast, etc. It was a great breakfast buffet! (the bacon was fabulous!!) The pools were nice with cool water and a whirlpool with warm (not hot) water. We thought both were kept at a nice temperature. The concierge recommended a fabulous Mexican restaurant nearby called "Via delosSantos." We ate there 3 of our 4 nights in Phoenix. It was delicious! Try the calabacita fajitas. YUMMY!! We would recommend this nice 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check this place out.”
Reviews.Author: blondeinsf
Reviews.Content: There were so many great things about this resort so let me just warn you about 2 things... When you check in, park first before you get your bags and find out where your room is first. Second, the room service staff are pretty indifferent - seemed like they had something better to do. Since these things aren't that big a deal - Check this place out and enjoy! Food is great, pool nice, and staff at check in are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, one of the best in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: rosedrr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the 4th of July weekend back in 2006. My wife grew up staying here it really wasn't a question of where to stay, she showed me the town! The Pointe is a great place to stay for families and couples alike. They have a separated pool for adults and another for families. The pool area was not always cleaned quite as quick as it could have been, lots of plastic glasses left around the pool. We left a feedback at the end of our stay and were contacted very promptly after we arrived back at home by the manager concerned about the situation. The room was very inviting. Nice living room when you enter with a soft couch and nice office/desk area. The bedroom through the hall was spacious and updated with a very comfortable mattress. The bathroom area left something to be desired, very clean but in need of some updating. The water at the hotel did not have a good taste, not sure if it was the hotel or just Phoenix in general. We decided to dine at "Different Pointe of View" at the top of Tapatio Cliffs. This was the highlight of our stay. The cuisine was amazing and the Fiji water (included in the cost) was a very welcome treat. Our waiter never let us see the bottom of our water glass no matter how hard we tried. The views were amazing and our reservation time was kept. We had requested a window view and had to wait a few minutes for them to get it ready. The cost to dine is very high so don't expect to dine for less than for less than $75-100 per person (with a glass of wine). We had breakfast the next morning at Pointe in Tyme. The facilities were elegant and clean; the cuisine was good but not amazing. We were disappointed that the staff at the Pointe was unaware that they still served breakfast at the Cantina. For the summer rate the stay is well worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Okaye
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend in March at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio with two former college roommates, and the hotel was perfect for us. After straightening out a mishap at check-in (we opened the door to our room to find it was already occupied), we got an even better room. The double room with the sleeper sofa worked great for us. The room seemed to have been recently redecorated and although there were a few signs of wear, everthing was fresh and clean. The grounds are pretty, with different buildings set into the cliffs across the property. We found the staff to be friendly and very accommodating. We loved that they have an adult pool, and spent time by it in the evening when we wanted to relax and talk without any screaming and splashing in the background. We would have liked to try the bar & restaurant at the top of the property, but there were special events going on there each night so we didn't have that opportunity. We would certainly stay here again if we return to the Phoenix area!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, needs some work”
Reviews.Author: CSBSCValencia
Reviews.Content: I had a small business meeting here at the end of April. I am a Hilton Honors member and was pleasantly surprised that I received and upgrade beyond belief! I had a suite on top of a hill and it was so spacious that I was flabbergasted. That is the good news...the bad news is that finding the room was more than a tad difficult. The outside lighting is poor, the streets are not really streets (more like alleys) and the room I was in (26 something) was in building number 25...go figure. The place is not ADA compliant so I had to hike up to my room hauling my wheeled luggage behind me. I called my wife and told her that I did not work out on the trreadmill that day but got a workout just hauling the bag up to the room! The cell phone did not work in the room so I ran up a small bill using the hotel phone. The food was excellent at the lunch and breakfast I had and the people were very nice. I would go here again but I would have my bag delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - Lots of potential downside”
Reviews.Author: OOBDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort for three nights in mid April. My wife and I had a wonderful time, but we did stay on Hilton Honors Reward Points. I am not sure I would’ve had as wonderful a time if I was paying. While physically beautiful, the property is very hilly; so if you have issues with walking and/or dealing with up/down hill grades, this property will be a challenge. Parking on the resort is tough. There are not enough spots near the various resort room buildings for all the guests’ cars. We did not have any issues with this except for the one night we returned to the resort late at night. We ended parking quite a ways from our room building. Smoking. The resort rooms are non smoking, but guests smoke on the decks and patios outside the rooms. There’s nothing you can do about this except complain, and nothing will happen. If you do not like cigarette smoke and you end up in a room above or next to a room where people are smoking on the decks/patios you will be upset. The lounge at the Different Point of View is all smoking. They have a decent jazz band there on Friday and Saturday nights and the view from the patios outside are very nice. But, if you do not like cigarette smoke, your visit to the lounge may not be enjoyable. We got lucky and sat in area where no one was smoking, but there were ashtrays on every table. Breakfast and brunch service in the Pointe in Tyme dining room was very slow. We were told that if we wanted something off the menu, the wait would be an hour. We opted for the satisfactory buffet. Our room was quiet, except for one instance of kids yelling in the Cabana Circle pool later at night. The resort is pretty and is well maintained. The one meal we ate in the Different Point of View Lounge was tasty (and again, we were lucky and not bothered smokers). The Different Point of View Lounge has the same menu as the Restaurant but seating is first come first served. On the Saturday night during out stay, there was a high school prom on the property. We not impacted by this event, but my wife overheard a property staffer tell two prom goers (presumably the two in charge of the event), that if there were any problems, the whole thing would be shut down. We enjoyed ourselves but there are numerous chances for a stay here to turn bad, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Mini-Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: h24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married on March 10 in Tempe (at his mother's house) and were going to stay that night at the Pointe South Mountain but the day before he discovered he could have another day off from work and when I called the PSM to add another night they told me the rate would be double for the second night because of higher occupancy. I only had dial up at my future mother in law's house so it was hard for me to do any sort of detailed search for a hotel. I stumbled upon some details about Tapatio Cliffs and called their reservation line to put us down for two nights. I called PSM to cancel and the rep tried to tell me if I called on March 10th I might be able to add the second night at a lower rate if they had an opening (what part of "it is our wedding weekend" didn't they understand?). I mention all of this because I was worried at this point that my experience with PSM did not bode well for our alternate arrangements. How wrong I was! Staying at the Tapatio Cliffs was wonderful! When we arrived to check in we let the person at the desk know we'd just gotten married (I think the fact that I still had my hair up helped) and he said he would upgrade us from a basic room to an executive one. He also had chocolate covered strawberries and champagne sent up that night with handwritten note of congratulations. The room was lovely, it overlooked one of the many pool areas and it had a bedroom separate from the living room. A tv was in both rooms. The bed was extra comfy and we were at the end of a hall so it was very quiet. Room service was fairly priced and the food was wonderful. While we were there we had cheese pizza, veggie burgers with fries, creme brulee, and as many pitchers of ice water as we wanted. The next morning we ate a breakfast buffet (I had opted for rooms that included some romance package deals like breakfast buffets for two and a buy one get one free entree coupon -- really worth it). The fruit was fresh and the service was wonderful. Later that day we sat by the pool and ordered drinks -- they have flags on the chairs so you can put them up to let staff know you'd like to order something. I'd never done anything like this before so it felt very decadent. The pools were great, we even tried out the water slide. The music selection playing by the pool was good too, a fair mix of old and new top-40 songs. We ate at the Mexican restaurant they have on site and again, the service and food were excellent. I know I read gushing reviews and think things couldn't have possibly been that great but they really were. Well, here are a few critical comments. It was weird was how far away the ice machine was on our floor but we just ordered pitchers of ice water instead. I will also add that you might want to map the location of the hotel because we were happy to be away from it all so I don't know about how close off-site dining or activities are. We did have an experience that could be viewed as negative as on our first night there we had a knock on the door and a plumber said he needed to check the bathtub because he thought it was leaking downstairs. We were kind of annoyed to be intruded upon especially when the gentleman checked the tub and said he'd come back tomorrow morning. My husband asked if we could call and let the front desk know when we were up and about and they could come then and the plumber agreed. The next day we called to let them know we were heading to the pool and when we came back there was a note saying everything was okay. The man was professional and we both felt that it did not ruin our experience at the hotel. There was a moment of panic, however, when we asked if we'd have to move rooms and were told the hotel was entirely booked. Luckily we were able to stay and had a great weekend. We actually live in Las Vegas so we're used to seeing fancy resort hotels but I loved the atmosphere of Tapatio Cliffs. And to be away from the smoke, gambling, and crowds was great too. The service was great and the food everywhere on site was top notch. They really seemed to care about our experience and wanted to help us make it a special weekend. Totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay this time”
Reviews.Author: JLC&N
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and had a less pleasurable experience due to the noise of the main building. The hotel is divided up into separate areas of buildings, each with it's own little pool and amenities. This time, I requested a quiet room and was accommodated. We were put in the Canyon View suites which are located well above the main hotel. This area has it's own pool, jacuzzi, pizza deli and the gym. We were against the rock mountain and on the top floor, which made it a quiet, enjoyable experience. We watched the sunset over the desert from our balcony. We did venture down to the main pool and water slide so my son could play, however, even he preferred the restful solitude of the pool in our area. The little pizza deli is right off the pool and has drinks, pizza, ice cream and sandwiches. It stays open pretty late too. The on-site restaurants seem nice but expensive. We drove down the hill (North) on 7th and dined at other restaurants in the area. There is a Starbucks just a half a mile North of the hotel, down the hill, on the West side of 7th, for coffee junkies like me. Lots of fast food on N. 7th as well as a few little cafes and chain restaurants. If you go South on 7th the neighborhood is a little rough. If you have any difficulties walking, the hillside suites are not the place for you. Rooms are literally in the side of a mountain and while there is a shuttle, it's still a walk to wherever you want to go. Our room was well appointed, the beds were comfortable and the linens and toiletries very nice. Resort gounds are very pretty and staff is friendly and accommodating. I had a government rate which was very good. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: jstjumpin
Reviews.Content: I have to say that Hilton missed the mark again. I was actually excited to come to this resort after reading the reviews here because I really don't have any confidence in the Hilton brand. I believe they are masters at "puffing the goods." It seems that many of the Hilton properties are touted as being the best and when you arrive, you are always short changed. This property didn't differ. I came to this property for a business function. Prior to arrival, I was concerned that I receive a quality room due to the many comments about the rooms being dated. I was assured I would receive a great room and upon arrival, I recieved a room with a view of the adjacent highway. HINT: When a customer takes the time to call prior to arrival, you have a small idea they might be a tad bit high maintenance. A note in the file and a proper room assignment might have been a good idea on their part, but this is absolutely typical of the Hilton brand. Of course I requested a move and only when pushed did the staff offer me a pool view for an upcharge of $50. The staff assumed that because there was an upcharge, I wouldn't pay it. How ridiculous! I accepted the upcharge and was happy to have a better view. The room was spacious and fairly well appointed. I would agree it was dated, but according to the staff it IS remodeled. They did a remodel about 4 years ago on the entire property, so what you see is what you get. During my stay, we ran out of toilet paper. We had to request this from the staff FOUR times. This was ridiculous given that we had put the empty roll out for the housekeeping staff to see. There were other occasions where I needed to call the front desk (usually to request toilet paper) and found they did not answer the phone. I needed to know what time my event started and was quoted a wrong time which caused me to arrive late. I needed to know what time check out was an had to call three times before someone answered. The pool was lovely, the staff were friendly and helpful and provided great service. The property is full of hills (it sits on the side of a cliff) but I didn't mind that. I found a very private pool w/ hot tub called the Hidden Valley pool that was very enjoyable and I never saw another soul there. The property needs maintenance and again I feel they missed the mark in using red, green, yellow and blue lighting all over the property which gives you a sense you might have been transported to the Circus. The Cabannas are a joke - don't waste your time or money. There are small touches everywhere that reflect Hilton's lack of attention to detail which will cause this this frequent traveler to continue to AVOID the Hilton Brand.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Stay”
Reviews.Author: GinnyThePainter
Reviews.Content: Received this hotel from Priceline when I bid $75 on resort in Phoenix North. It was a Sunday night, and the resort did not feel crowded to me. I was traveling with my 74 year old mother and requested a handicapped suite with two queens. We were on the top floor of the main building. The unit was massive - a large bedroom and a huge sitting area. Mom loved the handicapped shower. We enjoyed having two TVs. There were two robes for our use. We also liked the little extras - like cotton balls & q-tips in the bathroom. Broadband is wired in the rooms, and costs $11.95/24hours, but I got lucky in that the last occupant had apparently bought internet late the previous night, and I had free broadband all evening. Staff was efficient, Marion the concierge was helpful, bell desk was very friendly, and the workout room was very nice, with lots of top-notch Precor equipment. The hotel could use some updating, but otherwise it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: gobluegirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a girls vacation and we both loved the hotel. It had everything we both wanted. She wanted more of relaxation and I wanted golfing and hiking. We got to do a little of both, the golf course was fantastic and our guide on our hike was full of all kinds of information. I didn't visit the spa, but my sister gave it rave reviews. It had a small, but adequate gym, I got to get some cardio in each day. The set up of the suites and rooms was very cute, it reminded me of a little village. The room itself was really nice, there was a seperate sitting area/tv area that was nice with two queen comfy beds in another room. The pools were abundant, they included everything from quiet/adult to busy/kid friendly. Lastly, the Point of View resturant is well worth the money, the view was beautiful and the meal was very tasty! I wish I could go back right now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: LeaHJ
Reviews.Content: We recently completed 4 days at the Tapatio Cliffs Resort. It is a great place to stay with stunning views over Phoenix. The rooms are a good size with dressing area, separate bathroom and a Lounge Area with Sofa, TV and Internet connection. There is an abundance of restaurants for every taste. If you can afford to splash out a little, I would recommend dining at the Different Pointe of View Restaurant which is perched on the top of the cliff and has an out of this world view of Phoenix. Please note that this hotel is built on the cliff side so some rooms have a bit of a hike to get to. [the hotel does provide transport around the complex] The staff are brilliant - special thanks to Gabriel at the Front Desk who couldnt do enough for us. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Families”
Reviews.Author: tboyerpa
Reviews.Content: Hilton Tapatio is a very good property for families looking for a fun vacation in the sun. We (my wife, myself and two daughters 5 & 9) just returned from a four day stay 4/10 - 4/13 and had an excellent experience. This resort is a solid 3 - 3 1/2 stars and a good overall value but do not book expecting a 4 or 5 star property. For the $150/night we paid, I was very happy. All rooms are two room suites with a good layout, comfortable beds and furnishings. The furnishings and room were that of a quality 3 - 3 1/2 star hotel. Very nice and functional, not the bells, whistles and special touches of a 4 or 5 star resort. The Falls Water Village has 2 large pools, waterslide, 2 hot tubs, bathrooms and pool side service. While the pool area did get crowded, we were always able to find 4 lounge chairs together and the crowds didn't bother us. Basically families with younger children splashing and laughing in the water. The resort has a total of 8 pools (some very small) and the pools outside of the Falls Water Village seemed more quiet, sedate and an "adult setting". They do have some pools reserved for Adults Only. The pool towels were a bit thin, but we got two a piece and that worked just fine. We found the pool area well maintained and the pool bathrooms some of the cleanest I have ever found. The pool side service was very good and responsive. Just raise the flag on your chair and they were by to assist within a minute or two. Overall, Hilton Tapatio is a very nice property for a reasonable price. If you want 4-5 stars, luxury at every turn and a quite pool area, this is not the property for you. If you are looking for a quality spot with very good pool offerings and a reasonable price (vs. $250 + for a higher rated hotel), then you can't go wrong at Tapatio Cliffs.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not worth a special trip”
Reviews.Author: fastrunningmom
Reviews.Content: We flew into Phoenix to go to Sedona and the Grand Canyon. We weren't sure where to stay in Phoenix, so looked on Tripadvisor for help. I wanted a great pool for my two kids, and decided to split our time in Phoenix between Tapatio Cliffs and the Pointe South Mountain Resort. Tapatio Cliffs is an attractive hotel built on a cliff. There are many pools, the most popular for kids being the Falls complex, with one good water slide, an irregular shaped pool with plenty of play space and a jacuzzi. It was nice, but not spectacular. The rooms were clean and well decorated. I don't like though, having the toilet and tub in a separate area from the sink. It seems crazy to have a hall between them, but oh well. The suite also has a sitting area with a TV, then you pass through the hall with the bathroom facilities into a bedroom, nicely furnished. There is a small fridge in the suite with freezer, and two TV's - one in the sitiing area and one in the bedroom. This was nice for me as I could put the kids to sleep and still read or watch TV in the sitting room. The onsite restaurants were good, but pricey. To be honest, if I returned to Phoenix I would stay at the Pointe South Mountain resort instead, as their pool complex is much much bigger, better and more fun. The Falls pool complex at Tapatio Cliffs is OK, but might bore kids after a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Drenched in Sun and Beauty”
Reviews.Author: gpizzy
Reviews.Content: Congratutlations to Hilton !!! This resort is another example of why I can count on the Hilton Brand. This resort is a high end four star resort. The staff is always trying to help you, and that is hard to do, when almost everything we needed was automatically provided. After an arrival with a "bump or two" we were assigned a great suite. our stay was in mid-March with abundant sunshine and record temperatures for March. We were there to relax and enjoy the Valley of The Sun... Enjoy we did with a Capital "E" Say hello to Shawn at the fornt office. He is the best example of refined hospitality we have encountered in recent years. Get his recommendations for restaraunts in the area that are super. Try the adult pool just off the lobby and enjoy poolside dining from the Mexican Restaraunt serving the pool. The view resembles Tuscany in Italy with resort buildings climbing the mountainside drenched with sun and shaded by Palm Trees. We extended our stay two additional days before trecking off to Sedona. Tip: Make sure to always check the temps and weather in Sedona before leaving Phoenix. Climbing up to 4,400 feet can provide a few surprises. We experienced cold and wet weather after having just leaving Phoenix and a two hour drive. This resort is loaded with pools and fun things to do. Take the mountain hike for great views of the region. Have fun and enjoy ! We did and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at TApatio cliffs”
Reviews.Author: lisatsobo
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the tapatio cliffs resort. We have 2 boys ages 5 and 7 and they loved the falls pool area. They also had kids activites going on for spring break. The rooms were nice with a pull out sofa bed in the living area(not all rooms have this). We got a great deal on priceline for this resort. You can normally have access to the Squaw resort but we were unable to due to crowds at that resort. It didn't really matter as our kids were very occupied at the Tapatio. You can hike and mountain bike right from the hotel. We did not eat at the resort. There is pretty good cheap mexican food at Carolina's, not too far from the resort. The only con was on the night we arrived there was some convention going on and finding a parking spot took a bit of time. We did not have any problems after that. You can not always get a spot near your room and may have to walk a little. I didn't mind since the resort is so beautiful and I enjoyed the exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families visiting Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: OHCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. This was a great hotel for families visiting the Phoenix area. The hotel has several pools and the one large pool area is great for kids of all ages. The rooms are clean and comfortable and are true suites, net great if you have small kids. We ate at both the more causal restaurants, both were good. As other reviews have stated, other places to eat are within short driving distance. Part of the charm of the hotel is the being built up the cliff. But, it is a strenuous walk from the lobby area to the rooms up the hill. Other helpful info: Grand Canyon: It’s 3 hours 10 mins driving time to the main gate. We drove up early, stayed the day and drove back. Was a long day, but doable. What an amazing experience! Horse Riding: Spur Cross Stables is 35 mins from the hotel, near Cave Creek. They were great with both our kids and would highly recommend them. Hiking Trails: There is a tunnel that connects the hotel to the mountain preserve across the street. The tunnel is entrance is near the tennis courts. The view of Phoenix is worth the hike up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a convention”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton for a convention for four nights. The property and location were near downtown Phoenix, a little bit away from where most resorts are located in Phoenix, but a nice area none the less. The rooms were suites and all spacious. They could use a little modernizing, they were well maintained, just a little dated. Service was excellent. All the staff that I ran across were very helpful and nice. I had room service and ate on site at the hotel and both were good experiences. There are several pools around the complex and all are very nice, including an adults only pool area which is nice. If you like hiking you will love the hotel, everything is on a hill and you will be hiking up and down to your room but that is part of the theme of the hotel so I suppose its ok, although honestly it got a little tiring. Overall it was a good experience, comfortable rooms, great staff, nice facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Juno1
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this property for one night, but we wish it was for more! We arrived and hour early and had no problems checking in. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The property itself is huge. There are several pools and a couple of tennis courts. The property backs onto the desert, which has a trail through it that you can access from the resort for a hike, run, etc. Very beautiful! The only caveat I would give is that if you have trouble walking up and down steep inclines and declines, you may have problems getting around the resort. It is very hilly because it is built into the side of a mountain. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are up to par”
Reviews.Author: wynsnob
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest at Hilton-family properties, and although there were some nice aspects of my Mar 27th stay, it was hardly worth the price paid. Good points: very friendly staff, and terrific restaurant Bad points: the room was dated - old rundown furniture, warped bathtub, stained bedding. I was only offered a double-queen suite in the main building, which seems to be the issue - apparently there are much better rooms available - so be careful when making arrangements. Overall, I've had much better accomodations at Embassy Suites and Doubletrees in the hilton family. Next time, I would stay elsewhere in the area, and just drive over to dine at the Different Pointe of View restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MyTravelLog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tapatio Cliffs while attending a conference at the resort earlier this month. The front desk staff was courteous and check-in was a breeze. I was actually able to check-in earlier than the normal time. Although the grounds are immaculate, they can be difficult to navigate; however, the hotel does offer shuttle service to get around the complex. The hotel isn't situated close to anything so I would highly recommend renting a car during your stay. Although not widely advertised, the hotel does shuttle guests to the mall (the shuttle leaves at 11:30am and returns around 3:30pm). I dined at the Different Pointe of View restaurant which was fabulous with a view to die for. Reservations are recommended especially if dining around sunset. Keep in mind that this restaurant isn't for the budget minded diner. There is also a lounge on the first level with live entertainment. I also ate at the Pointe in Tyme restaurant which had great food at a reasonable price. All in all I truly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: IndianaJackie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. March 2 thru March 7, 2007. We thought it was a great place to stay. When we checked in, our room wasn't ready so they upgraded us to a suite that was ready to go. The suite they gave us overlooked the Falls Pool Village. The suite looked like it had recently been renovated. The wallpaper, tile and counter tops all looked new. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was deluxe. The view we had from our room was beautiful. We had no trouble with parking. We parked right outside our room every night. The food was excellent, but maybe a little over-priced. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We didn't get a chance to play golf, but the course looked beautiful. There were pools everywhere you looked. They were all well maintained. The grounds were beautiful. We had a great time and would recommend this resort. We would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: tripmomSanDiego
Reviews.Content: After a long drive, we arrived at the hotel about 11 pm and were quickly checked in by the staff. Some reviews stated that parking was a problem. We never found that to be the case during our 2 night stay. Parking fills up in the parallel spots right in front of the rooms, but large parking lots are on the other side of the rooms. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite w/balcony. We found it large and nicely decorated. We found the seperate living room and bathroom areas a nice touch especially since our child gets up at the crack of dawn. One parent could get up and play with him in the other room with the door closed and let the other parent get more sleep. The room was very clean except the floors. I think they could have vaccumed and swept better. I found the plumbing in the room above us to be very loud in the early morning. We did not need an alarm clock because every time someone went the bathroom upstairs it jarred us awake at 6am. The noise shut off after 30 seconds or so but by then my child was already awake for the day. This was my only major complaint about the hotel. Other than that everything else was better that I had expected. The view from our room balcony was very nice and we overlooked the waterfall which sounded nice as well. We spent sometime at a few of the pool areas and were thrilled at how much thought had gone into the design. There are many water features such as water fountains and waterfalls. The pool closes at 7pm. We thought that was early compared to other hotels we have been to in the past. We had a late breakfast at the Point in Thyme restaurant on the grounds. We found it to have a nice atmosphere. A buffet is offered or you can order from a menu. I was not expecting much based off of previous reviews so I was pleasantly surprised at the taste and quality of the food we ordered. The staff seemed to go out of their way to make my child happy without any requests from us. He ordered the Mickey Mouse pancake breakfast. The meal came out with the pancakes decorated with fresh fruit. The costs of the meal was only a few dollars more than we would have paid at a breakfast chain restaurant. We came back from a day at the Peoria Sports Complex and did not want to search for a restaurant off the premises. We ate at the Cantina which served Mexican food. The restaurant is pretty small and sits on a level above the bar area. The staff and the food were great. We hardly ordered before the food came out. We enjoyed the fried ice cream with strawberries for dessert. In the end, we would not hestitate to stay here again. We have already told several people about it. We got a great rate through Hilton's website at $178/night.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: historyteacher
Reviews.Content: Last year in Feb., we stayed at the Hilton in Cabo San Lucas and I must admit, when we arrived at the Tapatio, we were extremely disappointed. For the same price per night, you cannot even compare the hotels. First, we arrived early on a Thursday and were informed that our room would not be ready until 4 pm. We basically wasted the first day of our trip (and the best weather day) waiting in the lobby for our room to be ready, even though we were told it would be ready by noon. The front desk staff was rude and sarcastic, which made matters worse. I have never had that problem at a Hilton. While we were waiting, we ate at the outdoor cafe, Cascades, and the food was horrible--stay away from the fish tacos which were merely fried pieces of crunchy batter. The rooms need to be updated and they were pretty drab--old couches and furniture--nothing fancy. The bed, however, was comfortable. The housecleaning servce leaves a lot to be desired. Finally, there is nothing to do at the hotel and they are pretty stingy with any kind of shuttle service. We rented a car for the day just to get off the grounds. On the plus side, there are pools and spas all over which are nice, although most of the lounge chairs are uncomfortable and do not have cushions. They also pass out regular, scratchy, non absorbent towels and not plush beach towels at the pool. There is an exercise room which is average-a few machines. The Point In Thyme restaurant was nice and room service was good. We did not eat at the Mexican restaurant. The Spa was nice and the body wrap was a nice experience but the Spa was definitely average and the place and the rooms were small. The view from our room was really pretty, we stayed in building 8 on the second floor and we overlooked the Falls village. We actually did not mind the walk around the resort but a resort shuttle is available. I am not a spoiled princess by any means but for the price we payed, 279.00/night, I definitely expected more luxury. I stayed at a Hilton in New Orleans, post Katrina, for 99$ a night and had more comfort. We also recently stayed at a Hilton in San Francisco for $119 a night and had a lot more luxury and comfort. The reviews on this hotel are mixed and I can see why and I am generally easy to please. I would not stay at this Hilton again, I also have a friend that stayed and felt the same way. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: GreybeardCanuck
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-day stay at Tapatio Cliffs. We booked the hotel largely on the basis of positive Trip Advisor reviews, and were not disappointed. The resort is set out, as noted in other reviews, over 65 acres and is a series of two to four story buildings. All of the rooms are suites (I believe) and have spacious balconies. The suite we had featured a large living room with full-sized couch, TV, mini-bar, arm chair and desk. There were double doors that lead to a divided bathroom, then a sliding door through to the bedroom. This worked very well in terms of providing an environment in which I could work and my wife could sleep undisturbed. The room was clean and well appointed, and featured a comfortable king-size bed and a second TV. The resort also has a large water park with several pools spread over the property. We booked the "romance package" for $219 a night - this included a full breakfast for each of us (valued up to $44 combined), bottle of champagne, a two for one coupon for dinner and free use of the workout room (normally $10). A very good value compared to other prices we noted for similar hotels. The resort is in the northern part of Phoenix (25 min. drive to airport) and is built on a rocky bluff, so some of the rooms are a bit of a hike, although staff will pick you up and shuttle you anywhere you wish to go in the resort. If you want to be close to the Scottsdale shops and restaurants this is probably not the best choice for you. We drove to "old town" Scottsdale in about 25-30 minutes using the city streets rather than freeways. We preferred the rather secluded atmosphere of the resort but this may not work for everyone. There are three main restaurants on site plus a cafe by the main pool- we ate several time at Pointe in Thyme (main restaurant) and the breakfast were fine; average I suppose. We read good reviews of the mexican restaurant (nice balcony to sit on) but did not dine there. The upscale restaurant "Different Pointe of View" has an unbelievable view over Phoenix - even if you don't eat there go up before sunset and see the view. Our meal was excellent but not cheap- lobster with scallops ($42) was very nice and the lobster bisque was as good as I have had. Note: there is also an outside deck one level lower for the lounge, so if you don't want to spring for dinner, this is a good second choice. The staff were very helpful at the front desk and concierge desk. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelfille
Reviews.Content: For me, this hotel was wonderful. I don't know if its because I was forced to check out of another hotel due to lack of cleanliness and lack of service. However, this hotel was a welcome relief. The suites were just spacious enough (I had a basic, guest suite). I enjoyed the marble touches, fantastic view, great workout center, and comfortable beds. It was also very clean. The towels were also fairly nice- they still seemed relatively soft despite the fact that I'm sure they've been washed a million times. The grounds were also quite nice and allowed for leisurely walks up and down the hills. My only complaints are that the internet seemed to go in and out (and after paying $11.95, it really should be more stable) and the entrance to my room was around the back of the building. It was lovely being up against the cliffs, however, since it wasn't well- lighted, it felt a bit dangerous coming back to my room alone at night. All in all though, I think its a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Tapatio Cliffs Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TravelEscape
Reviews.Content: Everyone of the staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly. Easy check in and check out. I was looking for a "true" suite, not just a room divided by a half wall, which gives no privacy. This Hilton knew how to do it right. There were 3 rooms, divided by doors for privacy, which is great when traveling with children or snorers (we had both). We entered the living room, which had a couch bed. The next room had a vanity on one side and behind closed doors on the other side were the toilet and bathtub. We continued on to a large bedroom with a balcony. The beds were super comfortable. We asked Room Service for additional towels, lotions, etc., and it was no problem at all. The casual Mexican Restaurant on property was very good and the cheaper of the more upscale restaurants (I forget the name) had a beautiful fireplace and a good meal. The drinks, however, were not the best, on the night we went. The only downside to staying at the Tapatio Cliffs is that it is all by itself. Not close to shopping, museums, etc. So it is perfect for a quiet getaway but if you want to do more, it's best to rent a car. We used their towncar service one night (rates slightly higher than a cab) and although it was cozy -- Super expensive. The hotel does provide a shuttle for $9.00 to the closest (upscale) mall but it is on a schedule i.e.; leave hotel at 11:30 a.m., return at 3:15 p.m. They also provide shuttle service onsite to your rooms and their restaurants (which came in handy in 30 degree temperatures at night). Just be prepared to tip. All in all, it lived up to the Hilton name. We were extremely happy with our room. It was my first time in Phoenix in the winter and even though outside it was freezing, the central heat worked great and we were not cold inside.

Reviews.Title: “Average Tapatio”
Reviews.Author: BenVernon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs. Overall it was average, the suite had a fantastic view, but we had to put up with two nights of dogs barking in the next suite and the toilet didn't work. The staff was super, and couldn't do enough for us. The Pointe in Thyme restaurant was terrible, service was okay, overpriced and the food was not great. The little Mexican restaurant was fantastic. The great part about the hotel was that there was always a pool/hot tub within one block of every suite. The workout center was fantastic with the pool outside. Overal I would say the 3.5 stars suited the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “affordable luxury at Tapatio Cliffs”
Reviews.Author: dramagrl77
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about what a fantastic 4 days we spent at Tapatio Cliffs. This resort is beautiful. The setting on the cliffs is the perfect backdrop for a romantic weekend. Our suite was comfortable and I loved having a cup of coffee on the balcony each morning with a spectacular view. The restaraunt A Different Pointe of View is stunning and the food is amazing. It is really pricey but worth every penny. The most amazing thing about this resort is the service. Every person you encounter is friendly and bends over backwards to make sure you are getting Hilton service. I was impressed with roomservice, transportation, poolside service, housekeeping, and concierge. There is so much to enjoy at this resort you never have to leave. I recommend this resort to anyone who loves luxury at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terriv
Reviews.Content: Third time staying at the property. Stayed in Mountainside suites, pretty much the same layout as the other rooms, neutral decor. Suite layout much like the Embassy Suites minus the wet bar. Lots of space if you are spending time in the room. Parking and driving around the property is hectic with the steep inclines and limited spaces. Daily charge for Internet connection in the room and charge by the minute for access in the business center. Point in Thyme Restaurant is beautiful, as is the lounge, but quite overpriced. Typical hotel fare and costs: Continental breakfast was about $12, draft beer $6.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: ypsilan
Reviews.Content: Pro's: 1) Noteworthy customer service Every staff member that we encountered was friendly and efficient. They must have tons of employees all over the property because even though the property is spread out, they always addressed my concerns very promptly. After expressing some concerns about the food to our waiter at the Different Pointe of View restaurant, the manager came to talk to us about it and gave us a discount off the bill. 2) Good rooms for the price ($159/night) My suite was roomy and I really appreciated the separate living room area. The rooms are not ultra-posh but definitely nice enough and impeccably clean. It met my standards and was appropriate for the price point, if not better than most. 3) Comfy bed! Con's: 1) The exterior is a little dated and worn. Not enough to bother me. 2) The setting didn't appeal to me. It was just set in some brown dirt hills. I thought the "cliffs" would be more majestic. Maybe I don't appreciate the desert much, but it just looked like the hotel was put in one of the less-nice areas of where I come from (southern CA). 3) Food is not great. Some room service dishes were decent, others were not much better than the Olive Garden. Also ate at Different Pointe of View. I could not understand how my vegetarian dish could be worth $26. Tiny "nouveau" portions and bland, bland, bland. As mentioned above, the manager did address our concerns. The view and the restaurant and lounge itself were nice, though. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again for about the same price. I was very comfortable here for 4 nights. I will recommend it to my friends. I didn't try out the pools, spa or exercise area. Although it was fine for me, I can see where parking might be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend at Pointe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Paris0618
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton was a great place for a girls weekend getaway! We arrived at night, and in the morning we walked the property to get our bearings. The resort is gorgeous! Our suite was on the 'mountainside' area, very quiet and up on the hill. We walked down the hill, found the pools, workout area, and restaurants. Our suite was very nice, well decorated and very clean. The staff at this resort couldn't have been more pleasant, from check in to room service to the concierge. We did use the free shuttle service to get around the resort a few times, and this was easy and quick. We dined at Pointe in Thyme upon our arrival, for a late snack and drinks, and I would recommend it (except for the occasional smoker!). For breakfast, we had bagels and cappucino from the lobby store, and brought these out on the patio overlooking the adult pool. And our last night, we dined at Different Pointe of View at the top of the cliffs. We had early reservations, 5:45, so that we could see the sunset, and watch the city of Phoenix change colors. The restaruant is a bit pricey, but the food and service were excellent, and the view.... perfect! We enjoyed the pools, and went to the Falls pool (a little noisy) and the lower pool (very quiet). We recommend the strawberry margaritas while lounging by the water here. Other recommendations while in Phoenix: hike Camelback mountain early in the morning, visit the Phoenix Museum of History in Heritage Square and have lunch in the Arizona Center close by, visit Frank Lloyd Wright's Taliesin West, and if you're a pizza lover as we are, definitely go to Pizza Bianco, also in Heritage Square! It was wonderful and worth the 1 hour wait!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Peaceful, Pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: BerthasDad
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place. Great, quiet rooms--huge suite, well decorated. Of particular note is the separate living area, great for insomniacs like me, when my wife wants to sleep. In all of our travels, this hotel stands out as our #1 favorite. Perhaps the only place close is Las Brisas in Acapulco, which this place reminds me of. Of particular note is the ROOM SERVICE. The service, and especially the food, were first rate. In fact, our room service dinner was truly the best dinner we had in our entire Arizona trip. No, I'll go farther than that: this was the best dinner I have had in years. And, it was room service! Really, I have not a bad thing to say about this place. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Good family get away”
Reviews.Author: snowdog
Reviews.Content: Nice suite for family. Good location for hiking mt. bikes. Pools look nice but are shallow tough for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “"Love The Hilton"”
Reviews.Author: cuzzin
Reviews.Content: Arrived after hiking the Grand canyon for spa treatment. Absolutely fabulous! The room was a king suite, which most are suites, and was right in the middle of the action, by the falls pools. Clean grounds, clear pools, housekeeping done well. Didn't get a chance to eat in any of the restaurants, just snacked at poolside café...pretty good, and fairly priced. Plenty of ground to cover at this property so ask to be close to action "THE FALLS" or set in a little on the cliffs, for a quieter atmosphere . There are pools everywhere,9 of them, and we tried all of them. Pretty cool. some have food, one has a kids house with staff for crafts, and games. Nice option. Price was great. just ask for specials going on. recommended for anyone. Spa was the best ever! Would I stay here again....yes.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: ruthbern
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night summer stay at the Pointe. At the summer rate of $99 per night this hotel is a great deal and good for families. The 2-room suites are very much in the Embassy Suites style and quality. Nothing special, but nice to have the extra space for either a family or business traveler (I wouldn't call it "resort" quality). We requested and got a pull out sofa in the living room for the kids. It also had a small, but nice, balcony. Perfect for watching the amazing monsoon thunderstorms. The swimming pools are great for kids. The restaurant by the pool is nothing special, but perfect for a relaxing lunch or dinner while the kids swim. They call the Falls a "water park." It's really just 2 big swimming pools and one water slide. Not a water park, but still, a great place to swim for my kids that aren't around pools much and it's easy to keep an eye on them. The resort has a nice little work-out room, but unfortunately they charge an extra $10 per day to use it. The best thing about the resort is that it sits on the Phoenix desert preserve. You can hike for miles, right from the hotel, in beautiful natural desert. Yes, you can also play golf and tennis, but the desert is a real treat. The down side of this hotel is that the restaurants are very expensive. I guess that it to be expected, but if you don't want to spend the money, there many inexpensive places within a short drive (great inexpensive Mexican food just a few blocks south on 7th street).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get over the jet lag”
Reviews.Author: spicerfamily
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere to get over the jet lag after arriving from London and before driving up to Grand Canyon. The Hilton was perfect, rooms were spacious, several different pools to choose from and great food. Room rate was pretty good too at under £100 including tax.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, awful parking”
Reviews.Author: Finaffrey
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton is a beautiful, huge resort - practically a small city. Our room was very comfortable with great views but parking is terrible, La Cantina Restaurant is unbelievably bland and the swimming pools were very crowded. Seems like a great place for families more than couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools!! Relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: summergirl711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort June 3rd through the 9th. We were basically just going off the reviews from this website and had never been there before. We really enjoyed our vacation there. I love the southwest heat and love to be by the pool. This was the perfect place for that. If you are expecting the Four Seasons or the Fairmont, this is not it. This resort is nice, pretty, clean, comfortable, affordable, and above average. We had a suite that was very comfortable. The bed and pillows were incredible! We had a seperate bar and office area in the suite and a nice patio. The pools were wonderful! We mostly went to the pool next to the gym almost every day. They had a small lunch spot there that offered pizza, ice cream, snacks, and best of all, frozen magaritas! That pool was never croweded. We also tried the waterpark pool. It, of course, was a lot more crowded and lots of kids, as expected. They too, had a great lunch spot. We played golf at the course associated with the resort. Get ready for lots of bunnies roaming along the fairways and greens! We experienced a lot a nature that day. It was nice and the views were incredible! (Just tee off early because of the heat) Our only complaint was that the closest ice machine was not working for most of our stay. They had room service bring us ice which was ok. This resort is very convenient to grocery stores, Target, Walgreens, Starbucks, etc. Yes, it is a real hike to get back to your room, if you're staying up high. Overall, we would definately go back. It was perfect for us, and it didn't cost us an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: travelfrmaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on June 22, 2006 for one night. We had a room in the 4000 wing on the top floor. The view from the balcony was of a tent building put up in the parking lot but that was no biggy. The room is nice and large. A queen sofa sleeper in the livingroom, and we had two queens in the bedroom. The bathroom are was a good size. Toilet, tub and shower on one side of the hallway and dressing sink and mirror on the other. The shampoos and lotions were really nice also. You can close off the livingroom area from the bathroom area and then there is a pocket door that you can also close off the bedroom area from the bathroom area. So its very nice and privite for all sleepers. The water park of the resort was nice. The servers there were prompt and very nice. The towels are plentiful also. The water slide was a blast (and Im an older woman) but I had a blast with the kids on that. The pool was relaxing and fun also. Lots of room to roam around and not be crowded. The desk help was great but the bell hops werent that super. They didnt seem to want to do much for you if you werent having them park your car. Beleive me, park your own car though, there's plenty of parking. We ate at the Mexican restraraunt and had great service and it wasnt priced to high either. The other pools on the property were nice too and hardly crowded at all. We stayed here before staying at the Westin in Scottsdale for two nights and we all agreed that the HIlton was more fun for all of us. We will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: gkuta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort during the last week of May. We enjoyed a very relaxing vacation; from the friendly, quick check-in, to the courteous and helpful concierges, the entire week was perfect. We had a mountainside suite that was very clean, comfortable and spacious. Everything from the electronics to the plumbing worked flawlessly, and the air-conditioning was more than adequate despite temperatures in the 100's. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds we've slept in and housekeeping was always completeed in a very timely manner. Finding a complimentary USA Today newspaper at our doorstep every weekday morning and having an ice machine around the corner were added and welcome amenities. The majority of the time we utilized the adult only pool. Never encountered a problem finding an adequate location, sun or shade - although it did get a bit more crowded in the afternoons. Moreover, all chaise lounges in the adult area were fitted with comfortable pads rather than the usual plastic loungers found at other hotels and resorts. The pool water was refreshing despite a blazing sun and temperatures in the triple digits. Although a number of reviewers complained about the resort's steep inclines and their negative parking experiences, neither was an issue for us as we are both physically fit and active and actually enjoyed walking around the resort complex. Granted, individuals with physical limitations, or those who are unfit, unmotivated or just too lazy to walk will find it extremely burdensome to navigate the resort. However, the hotel provides shuttle service for pickup and transport to its various venues. Although we have visited the Phoenix area on many occasions in the past, this was our initial stay at the Tapatio Cliffs Resort and it is now one of our favorites. We will definitely stay at this resort again and highly recommend it to others. We encountered absolutely no problems and found the staff to be very friendly, courteous, accommodating and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “The Pointe Hilton is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Pointe Hilton for a business trip/training. My fiancee went along to enjoy Arizona. When we arrived at the hotel, we found an amazing RESORT that is built along the cliffs; it is NOT AT ALL like a normal hotel...its even better. We booked at guest suite which was $89 with my company discount; I think its more like $125 normally. The room was REALLY REALLY NICE; two queen size beds with better linens than at my own house...the pillows are SO SOFT. Flat screen TVs; yes two of them.....one in the living area and one in the bedroom. There was a fully stocked mini-bar and snack bar in the room; prices are a bit high though. THE POOLS ARE TO DIE FOR; they are so nice! They have a total of around (I think) 7 pools; a big pool with waterfalls and a waterslide....bar, you name it. All in all this hotel is in a wonderful area of town; built on an amazing cliff and the rooms are amazing. I will totally stay here anytime for work or pleasure. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to e-mail me at kuekie83@aim.com

Reviews.Title: “Good place to swim”
Reviews.Author: jolinegk
Reviews.Content: First of all, the place is huge and on the side of a mountain and we didn't see very much of it. When we arrived, it took three clerks to check us in, they kept looking at the screen with worried faces. Apparently, they had overbooked the suite near the Falls (the hotel waterpark) we requested. Instead, they upgraded us to the Ambassador suite, which is right across the road from the Falls. It was a nice, spacious place and it was nice at night to see the lights flickering on the water and hear the marimba band playing at the pool. We were also very close to the family pool, which is a nice place as well. The next day we rented a cabana, which is a great idea if you have klds with fair skin. It provides shade, a fan, fridge, bowl of fruit and water bottles and much better lounge chairs. Plus the service seems to be better here. Be aware that we paid $81 for ours because it was Memorial Day weekend, so it may not be worth the price for some. I liked feeling like we had our own place instead of crowded in with all the rest. The kids loved the pools and slides. I found the water chilly, a little too flecked with leaves and the pool floor rough.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mojo11
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a nice resort but all we really got was an overglorified hotel. We were put in a Mountainside Suite which was supposed to be one of the better rooms.
