There was a big bag of garbage sitting right outside our door as we tried to get in the room. As soon as we entered the room, we noticed a very musty smell and also discovered that the toilet ran. We had a view of the Sunset Pool. Beware, it's very small and there's a very limited amount of chairs around it. We tried to make the best of our vacation by walking around the resort to see if we could find some good in the place. Big bags of garbage were laying around in many of the hallways around the resort and with the heat, you can imagine the smell. First, we stopped at the Point in Thyme restaurant because we were hungry. The place was almost empty yet it took over a 1/2 hour just to get our drink order......and then another 1/2 hr to get the sandwiches we ordered. We then thought we'd check out the spa. Wow, the smell of acrylic nail chemicals hits you as soon as you walk in the door. We moved on to check out the pools in the Falls Water Village. Now granted, we were there during Memorial Day weekend so we had a feeling it would be pretty busy but what a zoo! There were so many people jammed into the pool that they were on top of each other. Even the Grotto Pool which was supposedly the "Adult Pool" (i.e. quieter pool) had screaming kids everywhere. Nighttime wasn't much better. Again, lots of people screaming in the pools or running down the halls late at night. We ordered room service and the food was lousy. I guess if you have kids, then you're used to a lot of noise and this would be the hotel for you since it 's geared towards them. If you're looking for a relaxing, nice resort---this isn't the place. We've stayed at very nice Hilton hotels in Mexico and Hawaii. This place was a dump compared to those places. We left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously water issues on site....”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: The con's: Two separate rooms booked, two toilets overflowed/stopped up. The last day they had to turn off the water (leaving a message at 9:34 a.m. that the water would be off from 10 - 3) and there were 3 Rotor Rooter trucks on site. It ended up being ok, but I had moments of panic when we returned from the pool at 10, got the message and then took the quickest shower of our lives as we had a plane to catch that evening. The air conditioning in the room sucked. We had a west-ward facing room that caught a ton of afternoon sun but I immediately closed the heavy blinds and set the temp at 58. It ran CONTINUOUSLY while we were there but never felt really cold in the room. Our room location (2050, main building) also backed up to the staff/laundry area and we were woken up at 7:30 a.m. by the staff talking and banging as they transferred laundry/bedding to the carts) The food prices are outrageously overpriced. The pro's: The Falls water area rocked. My kids (7 & 8) were in heaven and it was very relaxing. The water slide was fun (we tried it too) and the water was downright chilly/refreshing. We also visited the family pool and it was nice. We booked through Hilton and got the Dining Special so we received 2 $50 vouchers for food per room (2 rooms) so we had $200 to spend on food. We thought it was $50 per stay so that helped offset the food prices and since you have to eat, it was easy to sit back at the pool and order on a tab rather than get dressed, run out for lunch, etc. You did have to use your $50 at one sitting. We ate at La Cantina for dinner (tortilla soup for 2, 1 kid's meal, fajitas for 1 and 3 margaritas + a Shirley Temple) and we paid $12 over the $50 (plus tip). We used another at the pool for 2 iced teas (free refills), 2 kid drinks, a pretzel, nachos, wings, kid chicken tenders and a beer + pina colada. Another for lunch at Point in Tyme (3 beef sandwiches, kids meals + soft drinks) and one for breakfast (not sure what they ordered that time). The food was all good (not great, but definitely edible and convenient).

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort several times over the last several years. Unfortunately this year the resort has taken a severe nose dive and I will no longer stay there or recommend it to my friends. When I go to a resort I expect a certain standard. I'm paying to be pampered and feel as if I am in a luxurious location. I had always felt that way here until this past trip in late May. The resort no longer feels that way and it simply looks very tired and well past prime. The clientele has started the change from upscale to one notch above trailer trash (at least that is what I think of couples who become intimate in the pool in front of 50 others, mothers who allow children to run loose and then scream at them across the pool at the top of their lungs...not once but constantly, and families who check in with more food items than luggage (there are no cooking facilities in the rooms either). This is just a tired, rundown property. The outside needs to be spiffed up, the furniture and carpet in the rooms looks worn and shabby, the water in the main pool did not appear clean, and the staff while friendly appeared pre-occuped. The rooms were kept clean and the food was average. The bad now outweighs the good and we are switching locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: operagirl1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend May 12-15 because of a great deal we got on Priceline. Not knowing what to expect, we were pleasantly surprised by the location, rooms and staff service. We were in one of the mountainside suites, which was located in a quieter area away from the main building. Even though we had a bit of a walk to the main pool area, it was right next to a very enjoyable smaller pool that was much quieter than the main pool/waterfall area if you're looking for a way to get away from the noise of kids (they were packed on Mother's Day weekend). We thoroughly enjoyed getting up in the morning and following the walking trails that connected to the resort near the tennis courts -- very convenient without having to cross busy traffic. Get up early though if you want to avoid extreme heat! The room itself was very clean with modern furnishings and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on in a hotel! Having a balcony was a treat for when we came back from walking or the pool to just hang out and enjoy the mountains in the distance. While there were some spots that looked a tad dated around the resort, it was beautifully landscaped and the staff all had smiles on their faces and cheer in their voices. Because it is built into the side of a mountain, there are lots of hills and a twisting parking lot, but don't let that deter you if you don't mind the exercise. While we didn't eat at the resort, we found some GREAT restaurants within a 15 minute drive (we rented a car). Carolina's is a small short-order Mexican restaurant that is only about a 5-minute drive away on Cactus Road (go north from the resort on 7th St and turn right on Thunderbird/Cactus. I think it's at the intersection of Cactus and Cave Creek.) They had the BEST flour tortillas -- wafer thin, delicate, and huge. I can see why people drive from a distance just to take some home. It's very affordable too. My husband and I ate there on multiple occasions, and each time our bill ranged from $9-$14 for the two of us. For finer dining, we also went to a little place called Coup des Tartes on N.16th St. It's a small house converted into an elegantly romantic French restaurant. They don't have a liquor license, so you're encouraged to bring your own wine, which many people were doing. A grocery store is just north of the resort, so we were able to bring some too. The food was stellar, using the freshest ingredients. I highly recommend their signature lamb dish and the roquefort salad. Be sure to save room for dessert; you'll want their homemade tarts like the lemon tart with meringue four inches tall. Our final dinner was spent at a place called Richardson's that the concierge recommended. It's specialty is Southwest food, and while the concierge warned us that the place would look like a seedy bar when we first pulled up, the food is amazing. He was right! Both places were pricier, but the food was outstanding at both. If you get a chance, take a side trip to Scottsdale to the Frank Lloyd Wright estate for one of their nighttime tours. It was less than 30 minutes from the resort and the estate and architecture school lit up at night (plus the 2 hour tour) are well worth it. All in all, our stay at the hotel exceeded our expectations. We would definitely recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Beware--buy from Priceline and be treated like a second class citizen”
Reviews.Author: ApolloGemini
Reviews.Content: My husband got this room for me and my friend as an early Mother's Day gift. On at least three occasions we told them that the whole purpose of the trip was to have 5 hours of peace and quiet with no children to watch a special DVD miniseries my friend received as a gift. We asked two different front desk employees about DVD players in the room and said to both that it was not a problem if they did not have a DVD player as we would just bring our own. We even had this conversation with the very nice person who checked us in. Needless to say, at 5 pm when we tried to connect our DVD player, we found out that there was "absolutely no way" to connect our DVD player to use the line in on the hotel TV because of the hotel's "contract" with their media provider. If someone had mentioned this to us, we could have planned accordingly and brought our own TV (though this seems rediculous to have to do). The manager on duty (Dan Nichols (spelling?)) was rude to my friend and dismissive. After another call and about an hour and a half, they offered us a solution...they could bring us a DVD player that would work on their TV's, BUT--it would cost an additional $85! You have got to be kidding me? $85 to use their DVD player for 5 hours? Why even offer that? Well...what could we expect for what we were paying for the room since we got it from Priceline? Too bad so sad for us. Why sell your rooms on Priceline if you are going to snub the guests who buy them? If you don't want "cheepos" like us there...don't sell the rooms on discount sites. Aside from the poor customer service, the beds were comfortable and room was clean if somewhat old. Shower head was excellent---finally a shower where I could rinse my hair in less than 10 minutes! "The Works" restaurant and "arcade" was an unattended counter and circa 1983 Centepede and Ms. Pac Man game. We were glad we did not bring the kids for that. Property is very "hilly" which is nice for views, but terrible for parking. Very narrow one way streets require detours around the whole property to get to your room or long walks with luggage. Water falls were nice. Pools were older and not nearly as specatacular as they appeared in photos. I think the usual price for our room was about $250. It was definitely NOT worth that. If you can get a deal, don't expect customer service, and don't mind having the fact that you purchased on Priceline pointed out to you several times as if you might be contagious...then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for this time of year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just return from Tapatio Cliffs last week. We had a wonderful time and we both agree that for the cost it is a great value compare to other 4 and 5 star hotels in the area. The hotel is in a great location approx 30 minutes from Scottsdale and close to many of the activities we enjoy, such as golf, shopping and fine dining. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite overlooking the mountains and our room was clean and maintained throughout our stay. Although the resort is large we never felt crowded. The resort has, I believe 4 pools and one exclusively for adults, which were not heavily attended. We ate at two of the three restaurants and I will admit this may be the only area where the hotel may loss points. The breakfast buffet at the Pointe in Tyme restaurant was reasonable however; go elsewhere for Mexican cuisine than La Cantina. The hotel has two other restaurants however, we did not dine at them. We would stay here again if in the area

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: kardan127
Reviews.Content: After being disappointed by a different Hilton hotel downtown, we checked out after one day and headed north to the Hilton Pointe Tapatio Cliffs. What a treat! The place is just beautiful! Multiple choices of rooms, locations on the premise, and pools! The restaurant Differnt Pointe of View is a must, even if only for cocktails. The view of the valley in the evening against a setting sun is glorious! Make sure to rent yourself a cabana in The Falls for a day. A perfect way to enjoy a great day by the pool. My husband and I travel to Phoenix often on business. We have decided this will be "the" place we return to everytime. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Definetely not for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of staying here for business travel last month. I had originally intended to stay at the other Hilton Hotel, the Squaw Peak, but they were overbooked, so I stayed here because its only a few miles away. Here's the problem. You have to drive everywhere! Once you register at the front desk, you drive up to your building and look for parking. Then you drive to the restaurants (which were fair, although I didn't try the restaurant at the top which is supposedly very good), to the health center, etc. Its not that its that far to walk, but not when you're in a hurry. The room was adequate. There is nothing about this hotel that is designed for business traveler. As far as a resort, I would say this place is alright. Seems like a decent place for kids. Certainly not luxury by any measure. If you're looking for luxury, try the Four Seasons, Ritz or Phoenician.

Reviews.Title: “very nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsinfamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, kids 11 and 9 stayed at Tapatio for 8 nights. We really enjoyed our stay. Room was clean, nicely furnished-newer decor, perfectly located in main building close walking to waterpark pool (The Falls). Food at resort was pricey, but your at a resort not McDonalds. Food was very good, better than average. The Pointe of View restaurant had an amazing view and great food, very pricey but a great way to end our vacation. Staff was attentive and helpful, never had one problem or complaint. Our room was always cleaned promptly and never saw the housekeeper. I guess the previous negative reviews gave me the feeling of uncertainty when we first arrived, but like I said we had a great experience. The resort is in a great location, easy to get to main highway to go to Scottsdale and area sights. The mountain trail hike adjacent to resort was wonderful. We did hit the local grocery for snacks, fruit and bottled water. Kids eat constantly, and mine are sometimes pickey. For the price we paid for this resort I feel it was a great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: WFTravel
Reviews.Content: This is a good family resort. I personally like the Four Seasons resorts but with kids that is not practical. This resort has enough to please everyone in the family. Golf, spa, pools and nearby horseback rides. It is clean and neat. It will not "wow" an experienced traveler, but it comes through for those looking for an easy family vacation. The Presidential Suite is HUGE. Bottom line, if you want a Four Seasons vacation this is not the place. If you want a solid family resort this is a good call. Please note, it is build on a mountain base. Walking to and from the room will tire you out. Do not go here if you are elderly or otherwise unfit -- the walk will really wear you out.

Reviews.Title: “Water, Water Everywhere... !”
Reviews.Author: ManndrakeLA
Reviews.Content: ME: 33yrs old, Gay male with partner, light travel for business. My partner and I were visiting family in the Phoenix area and stayed at the Tapatio. Though our stay was only one night, we instantly felt like we were on a wonderful 10-day vacation--- it was so relaxing! The LOCATION of the hotel is awesome - North Phoenix in a hilly residential area, just a few minutes from the freeway, downtown Phx and a quick drive to shops and restaurants. Though the property is expansive, it wasn't as ominous as it appeared on the map given to us upon check-in. It is, however, quite hilly as mentioned by previous reviewers. As for our ROOM, we stayed in the Cliffside Building in room 6225 (1 King bed suite) high above the rest of the resort. Our building felt very secluded and private, built along the rugged mountainside with a great view from our private patio. It was short walk from our room to the lobby andThe Falls/Water Village (about 6-mins.). We had lots of fluffy down pillows and a down comforter that made the bed a dream to stay in (BTW, a hypo-allergenic foam pillow was inside the closet just in case we weren't fond of feathers). The room was tastefully decorated, clean and in full working order. Parking was fine, except when we came home late night and had to park up by the Differrent POV restaurant, a short but STEEP walk up/down-- I guess I really am out of shape! Though we didn't use the shuttle, there were plenty riding around the property. Probably the best part of our stay was the pool... or POOLS. There were pools everywhere! My partner and I were in the mood to be total loungers and to just relax, eat, drink and swim. After we checked in, we immediate went to The Falls/Water Village for a swim. The Water Village is made up of two big pool areas - one with a waterslide, grottos and a mini-beach (no sand, just an ascending floor) and another more shaded pool with less hustle-n-bustle - both surrounded by beautiful landscaping, private cabanas and numerous waterfalls. The Cascade pool bar/cafe had great 'foofy' tropical drinks, light food and great service. We decided to pull a Burt Lancaster and swim in each pool --- I think there were 8! The great thing about this resort is that there are plenty of pools to choose from, depending on your mood: The big, busy pools for families, hanging with friends or to people watch; separate kid-free adult pools as well as semi- private pools with jacuzzis ('our' pool was the Sunset pool just below our room). All were easy to reach and stocked with plenty of fresh towels. Unlike another reviewer, I liked the waterslide and wasn't bothered by its design--- c'mon, man... it's a perk not a required amenity. Though we didn't take advantage of it, we were told by the Cafe that we also had access to the pools at the neighboring Hilton/Squaw Peak if we wanted. Overall, our stay was awesome: Friendly, knowledgeable staff; beautifully maintained grounds; great location; excellent room; great value for the price. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Firsttimers10
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay with children! The rooms have a perfect set-up (especially for those that still nap), the staff is extremely accomodating and timely on all requests, the food is well-priced (particularly the kids' menus - all items $5), and the family golf lesson was just wonderful! Our room was quite a ways from The Falls (main pool area, which is kids' heaven for swimming), but the shuttles were quick and it is not a long walk (very nice walk, if you like hills). The pool near our room was perfect for a quick swim or to take a hot tub. We even ordered a pizza there and ate by the pool and it was just delightful. The workout room is free, clean, nice, and also has a nice sauna. We hiked North Mountain across the street (even pushed the stroller - trail was paved), went to a Wild Animal Zoo, hiked right behind the resort, did a family golf lesson, played tennis, ping pong, had faces painted, watermelon eating contests, and enjoyed the pool! This resort caters to families of all ages and everyone was so happy there! The only not-terrific event was eating dinner at Point in Thyme. Overpriced, took too long with kids, and the food wasn't very good. Highly recommend this resort to families with children!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven On A Mountain”
Reviews.Author: MissGov
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this resort and wished we could have spent an entire week. We stayed in one of the mountain suites and were not disappointed! Very luxurious and spacious. My husband and I spent early mornings drinking coffee on our spacious balcony - what wonderful views. The staff were exceptional and the shuttle service was great. It was nice having an adult pool without the noise of small kids. There were plenty of other pools for the younger crowd to enjoy. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: swirlinabc
Reviews.Content: We took our 8 and 6 year old daughters on Spring Break for this trip. There are 8 different pools. One is adults only; the others are for both kids and adults. We managed to experience all of them during the trip! My six year old wanted to try them all (except the adult pool for 16 and over). The main pool at the Falls Village was great for families with kids. Lots of poolside lounge chairs, lots of umbrellas. Nearby the water slide. The grotto pool at the Falls Village is nice, but less shade. Other than the family pool at the main building, the remaining pools are small, but suitable for a quick dip and not laps. The best thing about Falls Village is the ability of ordering food and drink by simply putting up the flag on your chair. We were originally checked into room 4052. This room faced the laundry area, making the patio worthless. Avoid the eastern side of the main building to avoid the laundry area and noisy fans. (Fortunately) the hot water was faulty in the shower, so we got moved to 6224 on the cliffside suites. The hotel was also very kind to credit us the price of our breakfast to compensate for the inconvenience. This was a much nicer room (though slightly smaller)with a gorgeous view and steps from the sunset pool. I agree with the previous poster that navigating your way through the resort is a challenge. The maps are sometimes confusing and don't necessarily take into account the hills. However, enjoying a challenge, I eventually figured out the most efficient way to get from area to area. This is not for everyone however. For those who don't like to navigate hills and a maze of paths, the resort does offer several pick up points that will send a driver with a phone call. Food was basically average at best. First morning we had breakfast at the Point in Tyme restaurant. Service was lousy, and food only so-so. The Cascades restaurant at the Falls Village was okay, and convenient to order by simply putting up your flag for service. We had breakfast buffet at La Cantina which was of lesser quality than Point in Tyme. We never tried any dinners on-site because they really aren't geared towards kids. Very surprising for a resort that has such a family draw. We did not try the Different Pointe of View at the top of the hill as this was highly priced and definitely not kid friendly. We did have breakfast twice at a local restaurant called Pinky's just down the hill from the resort on the corner of Thunderbird and 7th. This was very good and half the price of the resort. Other mornings we purchased bagels, yogurt and fruit from the Safeway next to Pinkys and at it on our patio with the great view. Paradise Valley Mall is nearby that has a wide selection of known chain restaurants, including Marie Callendars, Olive Garden, Outback Steakhouse, and Chilis. Overall food review...unless you are transportation challenged, dine outside the resort if you have kids. In summary, we had a great time at Tapatio Cliffs. Service was very nice, pools are very enjoyable. Food really could be improved, particularly if you travel with kids.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: ktom111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 3 nights. The landscaping was very beautiful. There were many pools and it was optimal to be able to choose whether to be at a noisy pool with kids running around or relax at a quiet pool with only adults. The rooms were above average and the beds were very heavenly! Our room was on the mountainside and was peaceful and quiet most of the day and night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurants were a little overpriced (although it's a resort and to be expected) but the service and food were both good. The nature preserve with trails was great and conveniently located across the street. Parking is free and we never had a problem finding a space. The only negative we found was no dvd/cd player and the movie rental was expensive. If going to the Phoenix area, I would definitely return here without hesitation, it was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “4 star Motel”
Reviews.Author: JudyfromBoise
Reviews.Content: My family spent 5 nights here over spring break. I have very mixed feelings about this resort....it is a wierd hybrid of a motel with some nice resort and luxury hotel features. The natural surroundings and landscaping are fabulous. But you can never get away from a parking lot! They are everywhere and spoil the illusion of being someplace other than the ordinary.The pool complex is very nice, but we were very dissapointed with the slide. It is completely enclosed to the exit point into the pool. This prevents you from sitting up at the last minute and controlling your entrance.....so everyone goes under the water at landing. Not my idea of fun. The on site restaurants we slow and over priced.......but room service was really no more money and quicker! The lobby was nice,as was the shop, but once check-in there was no reason to return It wasn't horrible, but i wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jrmarquis
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the Pointe, we were given a room in one of the highest buildings. We wanted to be as close to the main building as possible since we weren't planning on hanging out at the kids pool area. We went back to the desk where she quickly moved us to the main building. We loved our new room! It was a 2 minute walk to the adult swimming pool where we hung out. It was quiet and convenient. We spent 3 nights at the Pointe. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The front desk gave us great advice on places to go and where to eat. The bed was really comfortable. The front room area was dated, but we never planned on hanging out in our room all day anyway. The bathroom was OK - the water pressure a little low, but overall, we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Danny5566
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tapatio Cliffs four nights in late March 2006 and enjoyed it. Picked it largely for the pools and were not disappointed. The steel drum and marimba duo were a pleasant surprise. Lots of fountains--all working. And the landscaping was immaculate. Also, the small "sunset" pool and hot tub closer to our room were very nice and open late at night. This is a VERY hilly property, which helps make it scenic, but I'd be hesitant to recommend it to anyone not sure-footed, at least in the upper buildings. While we were generally able to park pretty close to our room, there were severe inclines to navigate going to the car. As expected, there was a $10 daily charge for high-speed internet, which seems stingy for a hotel in this price range. We were also put off by the charge to use the exercise room. Hilton should realize this kind of nickle-and-diming can take the luster off an otherwise very positive experience. If we return to Phoenix, we'll strongly consider this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful week at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. The resort is set in a beautiful location nestled in the hills of northern Phoenix. Our suite had a spacious living room connected through a two-section bathroom to a large bedroom, and had a balcony with views of the surrounding mountains. The room and whole resort were impeccably clean and the furnishings were nice but not ornate. The staff was noticeably friendly, more so than at other resorts where we have stayed. The workout center is moderate-sized and has excellent equipment. I enjoyed running in the Phoenix Mountain Preserve, which connects directly to the resort, and allows you to experience a real desert environment. We also took advantage of using the sister property at Squaw Peak, which had a larger waterpark, mini-golf, and a larger workout center. We got the sense that Squaw Peak was more family-oriented, whereas Tapatio was more geared for couples and corporate retreats, although both properties were equally nice. On our last night, we had a fabulous dinner at the Different Pointe of View restaurant, which was pricey but did have excellent food, and the views of the surrounding hills and the city are unparalleled. The downsides we can think of were that it was sometimes a little noisy around the resort with all the cleaning (street sweeping, leaf-blowing, etc.). Also, the resort is built on a large hillside, which affords excellent views, but could make it difficult to get around for less fit visitors. My wife and I enjoyed this layout, as it built a little exercise into our day. The resort does offer shuttle service, which we used once and found to be very efficient and easy. Finding parking was never a problem. We enjoyed exploring nearby Scottsdale, but did find it to be a bit far from the resort (about a 30 min. drive with no easy highway connections). We brought our laptop but had to pay $10/day to get high-speed internet access in our room. Also, a $9/day per room resort fee is added to the charges if you wish to use the fitness center and some of the other amenties such as mini-golf. These were minor complaints, and overall, we would whole-heartedly recommend Tapatio Cliffs, and would definitely stay here again when returning to the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjwAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: stayed in a presidential suite for a long weekend in february 2005. really liked the room and the property. we backed up to the cliffs which I really enjoyed. went for lovely morning walks to enjoy beautiful view with coffee in hand. pools were very nice, quiet pool by fitness center was lovely and relaxing. desk manager was extremely helpful in resolving (to our utmost satisfaction) mixup about room locations for 3 couples. i would heartily recommend this property and attempt to stay there again if the circumstances arise.

Reviews.Title: “Lost and Found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hold on to your belongings on your stay at this resort. Pity on the person who has to pay a visit to the Lost and Found room and deal with the extremely irritable, extremely old woman at the desk! Has she forgotten how to smile and be helpful?? Perhaps her face will crack! The rest of the staff was great. Pools were never crowded and the whole resort kept very clean and attractive. The food and service at La Cantina restaurant was excellent. We also found parking to be a breeze. We never had to walk far like some of the other reviews have stated. The rooms were a nice size and we were never bothered by noise. So, hold on to your belongings, stay away from the grouch in the Lost and Found Room and the rest of your trip will be great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to the New Year”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeBob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting for the 2006 Fiesta Bowl. The property is an easy drive north of town ( about 12 miles from Sky Harbour, I think). A nicely different hotel layout built into the cliff sides presents an out of the ordinary lodging experience with numerous detached buildings. A series of walkways and foot bridges connects many of the buildings. The parking, as noted by many others, can be tricky, but is one the quirks that makes the property different and memorable. Enjoyed dining at all the venues at the property with great food and decent service. The mountaintop restaurant was TOP NOTCH in every detail for exquisitely fine dining with a spectacular view. On site shuttle was helpful for getting around the property, especially if your lady is dressed for dinner and walking shoes aren't part of the package. The variety of pool areas offer something for everyone. Only sorry I did not get to try the golf course which got nice reviews from those that I encountered who did play it.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, Huge suite”
Reviews.Author: yatmeh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Friday night before Christmas arriving quite late due to our flight-don't you just love on time airlines who are always "sorry" for the delays. We booked this through Priceline-it was a 1 night airport hotel before our trip north of Phoenix. Since we often do the Priceline/Hotwire airport hotel thing, we've learned to take the good with the not-so-good if all we want is a head in a bed at the beginning or end of our trip. Well, this stay was quite something. The resort itself takes a little getting used to-quite challenging after an 18 hour day. The people here were GREAT, from the doorman to the checkin agent to the gentleman who hopped in his truck and led us to our room through the maze of tiny European-like streets. Sorry, we did not have a room-it was a large 3 room suite with a balcony that could accommodate 8 to 10 people. After being (not always flying) in planes all day, this place was HUGE. We loved the view of the lights from our balcony but the view into the desert the following morning was simply special. We thought about just staying here for a day or 2 but it was Christmas and we did have plans so with much reluctance we left. Those folks working Christmas Eve day were as great as those working the night before. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Keysmickey
Reviews.Content: In town for a couple of nights before planned activities in Tucson. The Tapatio Cliffs was an excellent choice. The front desk was truly friendly despite a Christmas Eve check in. The Concierge was helpful and friendly and the hotel was beautiful. The pool, didn't seem to be a modern oasis but was a very enjoyable place to pass the time. We had cosidered Scottsdale (as I'd stayed there previously) and was certainly happy we chose Tapatio Cliffs.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the shadows of Pikes Peak
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Rock N Roll Marathon Stay - A definate Must Stay for Phoenix Area”
Reviews.Author: CO-TriGirl
Reviews.Content: IGNORE the poo poo remarks from the previous post! This is NOT the place to stay if you are on business but a MUST stay if you are traveling to Phoenix with other agendas! We came the weekend of the 14-16th and it was very crazy - the resort seemed to be booked to capacity and we did not experience a delay in service. We came for the Rock N Roll Marathon and wished we could have stayed longer to enjoy the resort! There were more pools than we could imagine -and still continued to find pools we didn't know about while were departing the resort! (But do check with maintenance about the pool temps! We had to ask to have the temperature increased several times! But they did change the temperatures ASAP!) We stayed in a queen mountain suite - and as the previous post stated - the beds were FANTASTIC and rooms were spacious with AMAZING views! Almost too comfortable! I personally tried out the spa services- and I highly recommend the massage! The only downside to the resort is its proximatiy to anything. We found ourselves driving about 20 minutes to get anywhere (to the race start, finish, scottsdale night life..etc). I significantly rely on tripadvisor's feedbacks for honest and reliable comments. I am extremely picky and my husband usually expects to change hotel rooms atleast once while traveling with me! I greatfully found this to be a top notch - professionally staffed - very clean - very nice resort! A definate must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Golf and Pool location”
Reviews.Author: snowbiz100
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this location in January of 2006. It’s not a location where you will find every detail “perfect”, but I’d say most people enjoy their stay (I did) The good: The rooms are very nice. I had a King suite, that included a separate living space ( TV, mini bar and coffee maker) from the bedroom and bath area. Its similar to Embassy Suite Romm design. The room had a nice view and overlooked one of the many pools. I don’t know exactly how many pools the property had, but there was a large selection of both pools and hot tubs. The staff is very accommodating and my check in was handled quickly and in a very professional manner. There is a very limited selection of restaurants (two). The restaurants are adequate, but your best bet is to go elsewhere. The $179.00 per night rate seemed reasonable for Phoenix in Janaury. The not so good: I was surprised at the number if small issues I experienced: the bedspread was stained, I had problems connecting to the in-room internet and could not get anyone on site to assist (I was directed to an 800 number, with a 20 min wait), the high speed connection is $9.95 per day, one of the room phones had a static and there was a noticeable rattle in the air conditioning unit. On the positive side when I notified the desk of these problems, they were addressed immediately with a follow up phone call to confirm they were taken care of. I was attending a meeting at the hotel and the meeting rooms were uncomfortably cold. Overall – if you are looking for golf, a little hiking and some time in a pool- book with confidence. One warning- The location is HUGE. I if you have any difficulty walking you may want to make special arrangements for a room near the lobby, or if you are with a group make sure your rooms are close together.

Reviews.Title: “My son had a blast! I was very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I visted last spring to warm up from a rather long snowy winter. I had never stayed at a Hilton, but the reviews were good and the price was great so I thought we would try it. I was very pleased with the room. It was clean, nicely decorated, had plenty of room and a small patio. The best part was I never heard my neighbors once! My son loved the pools. They were never very crowded and the staff had pool games they played with all the kids, while I relaxed poolside. The sister resort has a lazy river and putt-putt golf- you can hang out there as well. My son keeps asking to go back! I think we will!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...”
Reviews.Author: justmewonderinginyuma
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had here. We stayed over July 4th weekend, and there was so much to do. The rooms were very cool. I just loved the way the hotel was snuggled into the mountains. Definately will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: Been travelling a ton for business and we were booked in the Cliffs for a two night stay. I was put in an end suite that was tremendous, beautiful living room, bar, 2 bathrooms and a beautiful bedroom w/ small porch overlooking the valley. Had room service the first night and food was great. pools were beautiful and clean, check in was flawless and service wa terrific w/ them driving me to my room in a van. wish the wife and kids were w/ me.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: CatznKidz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort for 5 days and we were extreemly pleased with the room and facilities. The room was very spacious and clean, the pools were clean and inviting and never crowded, and the staff was extreemly pleasant and helpful in giving directions and making our stay very enjoyable. Point in Thyme restaurant was great. We loved the food (especially the breakfast buffets)and the service was extreemly nice. I wish we had avoided the Different Point of View restaurant. The view is not all that great, especially if you are used to NYC skyline views, and we were initially seated behind a post which obsured most of the view anyway. When we asked to be moved, we were grudingly given a new table. The food is ok but very overpriced and the portions are tiny. We had to ask for bread twice and we filled up on that. My suggestion is avoid the restaurant and and the amaturish rude waiters and just go to the lounge or terrace for drinks and music.

Reviews.Title: “Gave it a second chance, would never go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs over the July 4th weekend for the first time with two other families. The rooms here are quite large and perfect for families with children. Parking is a nightmare though. We rented a private poolside cabana for two days, which was great to have with small children. The pool area looks very nice and is clean, but this weekend it was completely overrun with people who were not guests of the hotel. We knoe this for a fact, as we learned this from the people directly. As a result, the poolside service they promised was dismal at best. On more than one occasion, we placed food and beverage orders and had to chase down the wait staff to find out where our orders were. Lunch on the first day took over an hour, only to have the wrong food arrive. It went on in this same vein for the remainder of the weekend, also at the other restaurants on the property. We made the mistake of ordering room service for breakfast one morning and by the time the food arrived, it was cold and we were missing items (like butter and syrup for pancakes). The staff kept offering apologies simply by informing us how busy they were. I ended up writing a letter to the hotel, and I was sent a very nice response with a promise of a free room, if we would give them another try. We thought why not. We visited over Labor Day weekend and it seemed much less crowded. They were checking names at the gate to the main pool/waterfall/slide area so non paying guests wouldn't be able to use the facilities. This was definitely a step in the right direction. We also rented a poolside cabana for the day. The day started out fantastic, but as soon as our waitress went off duty, we never saw another poolside attendant for the remainder of the day. That evening there was a rain storm and as a result, the ceiling in the bedroom not only leaked extensively, large chunks of plaster started to fall on the bed! This was at 10:00 PM-not pleasant, especially as our children woke up at this point. It was impossible to sleep in the bedroom, due to the noise of the water dripping....something like water torture. We called the front office and they offered to send down a cot-which would do what, we wondered as there were 4 of us. We had to move to a new room, which for anyone traveling with small children, wasn't easy to do at that time of night, having to pack up all our belongings, etc. The next day, they offered a $50 credit towards the room (we stayed an additional night beyond the previously comped room) and when I let them know that wasn't good enough given what we had been through the previous night, they agreed to give us the room for the night at no charge, plus the $50 credit toward food. I was pleased. Until we got our credit card bill and we discovered we were in fact charged for the room. Long story short, they are claiming they never promised the free room as they would never have done such a thing-they only give small credit toward the total room bill itself. Given the fact this was our third such poor service experience at a Hilton property, we have since canceled our frequent traveler account with Hilton and would never use their properties again.

Reviews.Title: “Cliffs and Cabanas”
Reviews.Author: xenu
Reviews.Content: The Presidential Suites in the detached buildings are spacious, well appointed and very inviting. I can't speak for the rooms (suites) in the main building; however they've done it right when they built the detached buildings up the cliff and along hidden valley. We were in one of the buildings furthest away from the lobby and remainder of the resort and while the climb may look daunting it is worth every step The Hilton does provide intra-resort transportation between locations such as the lobby, restaurants, spa, pools and the suites. The hotel boasts a number of pools, hot tubs, fountains, water slides and “The falls”. Ehjoy a cabana at the main or grotto pool and be pampered by your private cabana boy. We were situated near the “Sunset pool”, a small pool on the cliff with a hot tub and the concierge’s room. This is a wonderful place for a small group to gather for an intimate meeting, diner, etc. Dining at the Tapatio is amazing. The “Point in Tyme” is a cozy location with an inspired chef. Dinner is indeed their best offering. But if you want the ultimate dinning experience, go to the top of the cliff for their French themed “Different Pointe of View”

Reviews.Title: “Exception Service”
Reviews.Author: MelisM_TX
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Pointe Hilton resort was related to a conference at the same location. Although the location is a bit out-of-the-way to downtown Phoenix and Scottsdale (at least a 20 minute drive from resort), it was very convenient to stay at the same property as the conference. I traveled with several team members and we decided to take advantage of us being in the same place to have meetings in one of the rooms so we booked the presidential suite. The room was arranged with a screen, projector and flip chart per our request as soon as we checked in. And with any request (i.e. a longer phone cord to stretch the phone to the table), someone came to the room in less than 10 minutes to help. This is no small feat considering the property is spread over several levels and waundering roads. The service was exceptional as we were able to order food for breakfast and lunch for 8 people and receive everything in less than 30 minutes. And it was all delicious! A previous review mentioned the Falls area and I highly recommend that as well. It was so quiet in that section except for the sound of the waterfall outside our doors. I enjoyed the suite layout of the room so that I could use my laptop in the living section of the room and keep the bedroom area for sleeping. Although Phoenix was still a bit warm, I was able to keep my room quite cool and comfortable and the bed was very comfortable and inviting. Although we did not get a chance to enjoy the facilities for golf or swimming, those areas looked nice as well. The exterior of some buildings are a bit worn but the interior is clean and very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: RHS1
Reviews.Content: My husband, six year old son and I spent 5 days at the resort from Oct 1-5. Request a room in the Falls Village area, our room overlooked the pool and it was close to the hiking trails. The room was recently renovated and we enjoyed having a seperate sleeping area. The resort overall is very nice. The concierge and all staff friendly and helpful. The Pointe in Tyme restaurant had great food and service. We also went to the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak, our son enjoyed the Lazy River and the Water Slide. Nearby is a Walgreen's, McDonalds, grocery store and restaurants. Overall it was a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the noisy aircon, good rates, lots of children”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely property, a bit spread out, which means tricky parking in the narrow lanes. Some great rates if you prepay. Lots of children enjoying the pools and slide. BUT, watch out if your room is just under the bank of airconditioners in the centre of each block. It sounded like a plane was coming in to land...every 10 minutes throughout the night. We only stayed for 1 night, so didn't bother changing rooms, but it would have driven me crazy if we were there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed August 27-29 on business. Nice hotel, very spread out, which I did not expect. I had asked for a room near the main building so I wouldn't have to walk very far to and fro during the evening. I got a room overlooking the adult pool/cantina bar which was convenient. Nights were nice and warm so I swam both nights in the adult pool. I had the whole pool to myself at 10pm! It was like a warm bath :-) Ate at the cantina one night and was disappointed. For an area that has a large hispanic population I'd think their Mexican food would be great but I was so wrong. Food is totally "gringo" and I did not dig it. Oh well.... The Pointe in Time restaurant is super pricey and I chose not to eat there even though I was on a work trip and could expense it. I ended up just getting a sandwich at the deli up the street. There is a nice gift shop in the main building that sells snacks, drinks and some breakfast items like bagels and croissants. I would stay there again. Interesting location in the cliffs and good service. There is highspeed internet capability in each guest room, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... don't worry.”
Reviews.Author: EscapeMichigan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! Yes it is built in the cliffs... hence the name, that is what makes it unique. If you can get over the fact that it is spread out and you do have to do a little walking you'll be fine. They offer shuttle service if you need it, that would be particularly useful for families or people that do not get around so easily. A couple times we couldn't find a parking space in the lane in front of our suite but I just used the parking lot on the other side of the building... not that big a deal. The rooms are spacious and clean, and seemed to be recently updated. We did upgrade our view, which is worth it, if you care what is out side your window. There are several pools, the main one is called "the falls" most people and families go there, the grotto pool is the other large one which is also beautiful. The adult pool has a swim up bar and was a nice retreat. The other smaller pools are located though out the resort... we didn't even make it to them all. The restaurants at the resort are very nice... we at at the one by the main pool and the one at the golf course, the food and service were great. Apparently there is a very ritzy one with an amazing view... we didn't go there. We had no issues with service or cleanliness. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my colleagues for 5 weeks in July. As part of the well respected Hilton family we did expect to get an upgrade (we were all silver/gold members), but the response was that it would be too unprofitable for them to give us an upgdare - there goes putting valuable customers first! The rooms were OK - they do need refurbishment...particularly bathrooms. And the aircon was a problem for each one of us (there were 5 of us)...so when you check in to your room - turn the aircon off and wait for 20 seconds: in 3 of our rooms there was a terrible bang every time the aircon was switched off...and the fault could not be repaired The pools were another story - they were FILTHY! I almost threw up when I got into the pool for the first time. Im not going to go into details....but I guess seeing flocks of long hairs all around you and the water being slightly yellow in colour says it all! Apparently July in Phoenix was low season (we come from Europe, hence July is THE SEASON!) so breakfast buffet was only served over the week end and during the week it was a la carte....and it was terrible!! each table had 3 waiters: 1 to sit you, 1 to take drink orders, 1 to take food orders - THEY COULD NOT MULTITASK! when you asked the drinks boy to order food you could see hysteria coming over his face! it took us 1 hour to order fruit/cereal and the prices were well over the roof! I must say I expected a lot more from a Hilton....they have another resort nearby called Sqauw Peak - and that's much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Resort for families and groups of kids”
Reviews.Author: audreyliz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this facility for 4 nights in July 2005. I chose this location because I was able to get 2 free nights using my Hilton Honors points. I paid $89/night for the other 2 nights, so I averaged $45/night. Considering what I paid for this hotel, it was quite a bargain. However, I would not stay here again if I had to pay more than $100/night. This hotel caters to and attracts LOTS of kids. There were times that it felt like a day care center. And as is typical of parents on vacation with their kids, most of the kids were allowed to run rampant like wild animals. They even invaded the Adult Pool which is clearly labeled as such and the parents watched as their darlings dove, yes dove, in to 4ft deep water. The kids also took over the restaurant during the morning breakfast buffet and created a madhouse. I even saw a kid pick up a donut, take a bite out of it, and put it back in the basket. Fortunately a server saw this and promptly whisked away the whole basket. Another kid was running his fingers through the diced green peppers at the omelette table and his mother said, I quote, "Don't touch that, you'll get it on your clothes!" So you can see this is not the place for adults without children or anyone who values hygiene and safety. In general, the rooms were spacious and averagly furnished. They do seem a bit old and not well-maintained. The property is very spread out and you have to walk quite far to get places or you can call for hotel transportation or drive your own car. The Pointe in Thyme restaurant is WAY OVERPRICED, and I suggest finding your breakfast at offsite locations. There is a Village Inn about 2 miles north on 7th, a Denny's about 1 mile west on Cactus, and an IHOP about 5 miles west on Cactus. Don't go there for lunch or dinner either. The Cantina was pretty tasty, but also overpriced. 2 adults can share a burrito and be full. The Different Pointe of View restaurant was spectacular and well worth it. If you are going to be enjoying libations poolside, I recommend going to the Safeway down the street, buying your beverages there, along with some insulated mugs, and storing them in your mini-bar fridge. Instant savings! The spa was very professional and the services were luxurious. However, the description on the website of the body treatments, such as the masks and wraps, does not mention that they include the body brushing that is part of the Body Glow treatment. I signed up for both, received both in succession, then discovered that I paid $65 for something that would have been included in my Seaweed wrap anyway. That was sort of depressing, but I figured that at least I got an additional 20 minutes of massage. So, to sum up, only go here if you have kids and want to let them run wild. Different Pointe of View is worth visiting even if you are not staying here. And don't buy a Body Glow treatment if you are getting a wrap!

Reviews.Title: “Nice....but..”
Reviews.Author: Simba-Mark
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my wife three children and I have vacationed in Phoenix. The last twice we have stayed in Scottsdale this time we decided to try the Pointe Hilton. Location was good, check in impersonal have to go from the main desk to the bell desk to ask for directions to room. We were told we had a parking spot outside our room. What a joke! We had to park down a hill, 10 minutes walk away and that was a good day. The parking in this resort relies on good fortune rather that logic. Why are there no room numbers on each parking spot? On a positive note the pool areas are excellent, very often we were the only people in the pool.When my sons and I were stuck in the elevator staff were quick to respond , as when we were flooded by the airconditioning malfunction. The lobby area itself is sterile with a lack of information, leaflets etc on local attractions. Indeed we had to drive to the hotel we stayed in last year in Scottsdale for leaflets, maps etc. Unless I got a great rate I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, OK neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: dave5151
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tapitio Cliffs while in North Phoenix on business. The hotel was great. Its perch on the hillside is very nice. View Suite had nice view of North Phoenix. Suite was very accomadating. Very comfortable bed. Nice bathroom and vanity. Staff was very friendly. Location made parking very difficult. If you could not park on the tiny drive way in front of your suite, you ended up having to climb a ways to your room. Navigating the resort by car was a bit difficult on the narrow drives. Restaurants, and pools were plentyfull and very nice. Main pool area got somewhat crowed but other pools could be accessed easily for a quieter time. The area around this hotel didn't have much to do. Lots of golf courses and trailer parks. If I were traveling for vacation I would have prefered to say near Scottsdale or better yet in Sedona.

Reviews.Title: “Surround sound air conditioners-yikes!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I went to bed in our room at this hotel, we were jarred awake by surround sound humming and vibrations. We called the front desk, who sent someone up, and they said it was all of the air conditioners on the roof. They told us they would move us. It was 11:30 pm. At 12:15 am a woman came to move us to another room. My husband had to lift all of our bags and put them in her vehicle. Because this place is SO large, we had to not only move our stuff, but try and find a parking spot for our car. After settling into our new room, we discovered that they had put us in a room with NO WORKING AIR CONDITIONER. We didn't sleep well needless to say. My request to speak with a manager the next morning went unfulfilled. When we got home, there were unexplained charges on our credit card. My second request to speak with a manager has been unfulfilled. I have sent a letter to corporate and that has been left unanswered. And did I mention that the remote and the toilet in our first room didn't work either. Save yourself the pain and grief!!!!!! There are plenty of other resorts out there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in to this hotel you can see that it is well past its prime. From the hotel food options and gift shop to the spa all were disappointing. The first room we were put into was right next to the elevator with hundreds of screaming children running unsupervised. We asked for something quieter and were place in another area of the hotel, but still had to report a loud party that went on past 2am one night. Guests brought coolers into their rooms and sixpacks of beer to the pool area even as early as 10am. They also open their pool area to non-guests in the summer for extra revenue...people just drop their kids off and leave. The best part of the stay, however, is the restautant Different Point of View (not part of the hotel, but adjacent to the property). Amazing views and wonderful food...would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, wonderful pools, fantastic bellman”
Reviews.Author: Judy1949
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay. When we arrived rather late on Saturday night, June 11, we asked if we could have a room with a view. We were told there were only two rooms left and they had parking lot views. Upon arriving in our room, it reeked of sewage. Our bellman noticed the smell and offered to have the maids come and spray. They arrived promptly, but we knew spraying the room would not eliminate the odor. We contacted the front desk and were told the only other available room had wet carpet. We were tired from our trip from the East Coast and asked the front desk to find us another hotel. Then, after much discussing among themselves, they found another room. Our very kind bellman, Dick, then drove us up the cliffs and carried our bags again in the heat to a suite with a beautiful view. Hilton certainly has a fantastic employee in Dick. He knew we were ready to leave the Tapatio Cliffs and find something else, but he was so kind pointing out all the good features of the hotel. We were so happy with our suite with the view, all our bad thoughts about the resort quickly disappeared. Dick then called us when he got back down to the front desk to assure us that we could have the suite for our 4 nights and not have to move to less expensive room the next day. When we return to Phoenix, we will definitely want to stay at the Cliffs, and will probably pay the extra money for the view. It was so wonderful to sit on the patio and drink coffee early in the morning and enjoy that view. Thanks to Dick for sticking with us and seeing we were happy with our room. Hilton is very fortunate to have an employee who represented them very well (unlike the front staff).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Okay Service”
Reviews.Author: maroulni
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at the Tapatio Cliffs Resort, which were pleasurable, and very reasonably priced, considering the summer rates available at the resort. This resort is very large, however, and the service suffers. We had booked a rate of $89 plus tax through the Hilton website. Though we had requested a king bed, a standard king bedded room was not available at check-in. Rather, we were put in a handicapped accessible room, which, given its functional necessities, was not as luxurious as a standard room (e.g. awkward shower instead of bath, etc.) We requested a room change for the next day, and were accomodated. Because we were going to be spending the majority of our time off-resort, we requested a room in the main building, which was close to the elevators and complimentary valet, which made for easy exits and arrivals. Though the main building did not have the views of some of the other suites, it's convenience was an asset to us. I would recommend the main building for those who might have trouble getting around a sprawling resort, or who prefer the convenience of being close to their cars. The pool areas are diverse, with an adult pool behind the main building, and additional family geared pools scattered around the resort. The Falls complex has a nice atmosphere, with great bar service, and a fun enclosed waterslide. We did have problems with the service. The ice machines were either missing or inoperable around our room, so we requested that ice be brought to our room. Almost an hour later, it arrived. On another occasion, an important fax arrived for us and while the front desk called to tell us they would happily deliver it to our room immediately, it took amost an hour to arrive. Other than these types of issues, our stay was pleasant. We would recommend the Tapatio Cliffs resort for families and easygoing people who enjoy swimming and the added room provided by an all suite resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: egremont
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here last June,first for one night before we set off north for Flagstaff & then the Grand Canyon.We then had 2 nights here before we flew home.The hotel itself is set amongst cliffs and the number of pools is amazing.We had one near our suite but we chose to go the pool with the hot tub & waterfalls.The restaurant Different Pointe of View was fantastic.We had an anniversary dinner there and the views over Phoenix are wonderful.The staff were friendly and efficient and nothing was too much trouble.We also had a complimentary bottle of champagne left in our room on our anniversary.Would stay there again and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: joparke
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is a bit huge and spread all over but it gives you a great deal of options for dining and relaxation. We expereinced very good service and our 1 bedrom suite was always clean and room service was prompt. I partcularly enjoyed the fact that we got a suite which had almost a private pool and jaguzzi in the Hidden Valley area. The service at A different Point in Tyme was good except for one waiter who left us hanging for about 10 minutes, but he quickly came and apologized, althought I still thought it was rude. The lady who took our order more than made up for it. The made lovely drinks at the bar and I think the hotel is situated in a great spot. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, older place with a lot of charm”
Reviews.Author: cathykins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April and the weather was perfect. We stayed in Room 4133 with a "Valley view". The room itself has a very small separate bedroom and then a little living room. There are two t.v.s. I found the room to be a little dark actually, and I have seen that comment on here before. However, the bed was wonderfully comfortable and we liked our balcony and the sitting area. There are a number of different pool areas and one day we used the very quiet one by our room and the next day we went to the more family oriented larger area which offered drink service. Both were nice in their own way. We ate dinner the first night at a "Different Pointe of View" and the view is spectacular and the food was excellent. Really recommend it. The only negative about the place was all the walking one would have to do. Parking is at a premium so you may not be able to park very close to your room. For us, that is no problem but I kept wondering about elderly people. I could see my folks not being happy about it. Overall the service was great (we had two room-service breakfasts delivered hot and on time) and the dinner we ate there was excellent. It is a charming place that meanders up a hillside and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Need Quieter Golf Carts”
Reviews.Author: UCLaw98
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second of two stays at the Tapatio Cliffs, the first was in November '04 Overall, I would recommend this resort. Both stays our room was great - very spacious (suite) for what we paid ($99/night the first stay; Corp. Rate of $129 the second stay), very comfortable beds (down comforter/pillows), extremely clean, great views from the balcony or windows, good sound insulation between rooms. I like the fact that the resort is spread out and is on a hilly area because it lends to more character than a block-building hotel, the buildings are spread out and there are a number of pool areas which allow for more or less relaxation depending on what type of activities you desire. The only annoying thing is the gas-powered golf carts that zip around the resort delivering luggage/people/room service. They are incredibly noisy, kind of like a lawn mower sound, so you don't want to leave your sliding door open while trying to sleep! They are also not that careful about going around the many corners, so you have to be very careful when walking around the resort to avoid being run over! It would be a good idea for them to replace the carts with electric-powered (quieter) ones. The first time we went, we went hiking and there are nice hiking trails (moderately difficult) that are accessible near the tennis courts. The second time we visited, we had dinner at a Different Pointe of View and the view was AMAZING, it was very romantic and the food was great - interesting combinations of ingredients and great service. It is expensive though, so if on a budget, try the bar area for a drink, the views are worth it! They have a shuttle which will pick you up at your room and take you around the resort, which was great because my boyfriend hurt his ankle (and I was in heels), so they chauffered us to dinner and back. The staff here was helpful anytime we had questions or problems. I had trouble finding a soda machine near the pool that was working and when I called to complain, they said that if it was convenient, I could just take sodas from the mini-bar in our room and they wouldn't charge us. It was a great solution and I appreciated that they didn't argue or give me a hard time, but just solved the problem. We stayed there primarily because it's near relatives, but I would recommend it to anyone who finds a reasonable rate and is staying in the Phoenix area. There's also a Starbucks and Walgreens right down the road, which was great!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing - not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: vicki1812
Reviews.Content: Following a 10 day trip driving around Arizona we decided to end with a stay at this advertised luxury 5 star resort, but were very disappointed. Previoulsy we have stayed at the Fairmont scottsdale princess & the Biltmore, both in Scottsdale. Firstly the resort is huge - 585 rooms and very impersonal. People at the check in desk were very impersonal (I am a silver VIP member of Hilton's loyalty club) and mistakes were made on our booking, with no hint of apology. We had booked a romance package which included a premium suite with view, champagne and b/fast. We had to ask repeatedly for the wine and as they do not have 24 hour room service then we missed our pre paid b/fast as we had an early flight, as this resort is a good 25/30 minute drive from Phoenix Airport - don't believe the blurb that is it closer. When we asked the resort staff if they could organise something for us they said no! No assistance was offered with bags and the bell desk was unhelpful and gave wrong info. The room (No.4130) was Ok - nothing special, although it was quite spacious. We did have a view - but we also had a view of the air con units and they were very noisy at night. The bathroom was small & basic and the bath was just a standard issue with very low & small hotel bath - no good if you are over 4 feet. The suite was supposedly recently re modelled but the carpet was stained and furniture scratched, and hard to beleive but all of the ornaments/accesserioes were actually glued or nailed to the surfaces - and as we had booked a 5 star hotel and paid $280 for the package we were insuted that the hotel has pre decided that guests could not be trusted! This resort is called the ciffs for a reason - it is built into the side of a cliff and a lot of the suites are up several flights of stairs and along balconies, there are elevators but they are old and not located next to the suites. Parking is a nightmare - there are main carparks which are quite a way from the rooms but there are not enough car spaces for the suites within a close proximity. If you had a large car or had a lot of unloading to do or you have mobility problems then you may struggle. It took 10 minutes of very careful manovering to try and park our car in a very small space- very fustrating. Whist the resort grounds were well kept, the surrounding area was not great and we ended up traveling back to scottsdale to find somewhere where we wanted to eat. There are no faciities outside of the resort within walking distance and the area to the south is not one you would want to be in late at night In all very dissapointing, overpriced and we will not be returning. If we had another night in Phoenix we would stay at the Fairmont or the Biltmore both if which advertise great deals via their websites or Hotels. Scottsdale is a much better location for the airport and facilities, we are frequent international travellers and would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Tapatio”
Reviews.Author: bakery
Reviews.Content: We just got back from three nights at this resort, and we really enjoyed our stay. We, too, found it quiet (even though our trip coincided with Arizona's March Break and there were probably more families than usual). Our suite was spacious, and not dated like some of the other reviewers have mentioned. Several earlier reviews mentioned a bee problem at the resort. I didn't find it to be a problem at all, although it may be seasonal. The pool with the water slide was great early in the day, but we found it excessively busy into the afternoon so we switched to the family pool in the main building. It was much quieter and made a nice change. We had breakfast there every day as we were on the BounceBack plan, and the buffet had a good variety of delicious food. The location of the resort is one of its biggest assets but also one of its biggest detriments. The upside is that it is beautifully situated, seemingly far from the busy city. The downside is that it is far from most of the good restaurants. (There's an Oregano's located about 15 minutes away that's very good.) Having said that, we had a great stay and would stay at this resort again if we went back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Squaw Peak is better”
Reviews.Author: eaglesrest
Reviews.Content: Nice suites which are let down by poor air conditioning and terrible natural lighting. The rooms are so dark (at least ours was). We stayed at the Squaw Peak a few years ago and this is by far the better hotel in my opinion. One plus is the readily available transportation around the site and the excellent cliff side restaurant. However, Squaw Peak has a great water park, is much better suited for Phoenix's scorching weather and has some fantastic cabanas!

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: PPop54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days while participating in a business meeting. Didn't know what to expect after reading previous reviews. The good news was that the bed was extremely comfortable (nice linens, mattress similar in feel to comfy beds at W Hotels) and the room was probably one of the quietest hotel rooms I've stayed in (maybe we lucked out with quiet neighbors). When checking in, we did request that our room be in a quiet section of the property and we upgraded to a room with a view -- we were in the cliffside area above the Sunset Pool. Room was spacious, OK decor, but it's obvious that the property was built in the 1970s since bathtub, toilet, etc are all of a rather dated vintage. Our suite had open beam cathedral ceilings, which was nice, so I recommend requesting an upper unit. The downside: The resort seems very tired and dated, elevators run very slowly, everything seems a little bit patched together and in need of paint or a good makeover or remodel (I did notice those painted floor tiles in the lobby that someone mentioned, though I didn't think they looked that bad). Service in the restaurant by the pro shop was slow and food was substandard. Fish tacos at Mexican place were OK. Since hotel is built on a hillside, there's lots of walking involved if you are in an upper unit, but we didn't mind that at all -- a five-minute walk seemed better than being housed in one of the dreary units near the lobby that overlooked the parking lot. Another point (or "pointe") to consider: Location of the hotel is not the best for accessing tourist venues (spring training, Scottsdale, etc. ). Overall, the property is dated, but our unit (at least) offered quiet, a comfy bed and a view (albeit of suburban sprawl and hills way beyond). I probably would not stay here again, but the stay could have been a whole lot worse -- at least we were able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It had everything plus a couple of unexpected bonuses.”
Reviews.Author: dardo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 enjoyable nights at The Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. Incidentally it is pronounced "tap" as in ...'Golly, he is a good tap dancer." and "patio" as in St. Patrick. I find that pronouncing correctly the name of whereever I choose to lay my body down for sleep makes my lodging stay all the more delightful. Yes, I run the danger of sounding like a lodging snob but that's me and I can't help it. What's there not to like about the the place? Beats me. I had a suite with a living room with a couch and 2 chairs, a desk with internet hook up, a wet bar, entertainment center with a TV. The vestibule with the bath on one side and the sink on the other led to a very spacious bedroom with twin queen beds, another TV, plus a balcony that provided a splendid view to the north of the valley and mountains. Terrycloth robe too. The staff? ...a more congenial, helpful group you will not find. The only minor glitch is I had a little trouble finding my room initially but that was mainly because I am part of the great fraternity who do not like to ask for directions even though they gave me a map and directions. I've read the complaints about the parking. You're not going to find your typical parking lot here with herringbone spaces on a flat surface. In fact hilly parking outranks flat parking at this resort by at least 2 to 1. . They don't call it Tapatio Cliffs for nothing folks. For people who are not fond of walking a little or flat out hate it..especially uphill..then I can understand because you may have to park a little ways. But didn't I read somewhere where the Surgeon General highly recommends excersize like walking? The farthest I parked from my room was less than 75 yards. I've stayed at other hotels where it seemed that long just getting from my room to the elevator. For me the walking was a plus ...not just for the exercise but walking in a beautiful setting of Spanish architecture in natural southwest surroundings.. I particularly liked the heavy breathing hike to the top of the Pointe where you get a fabulous view of the city. Then there are the swimming pools...they are all over the place. I had one just a few steps from my door. I had come to Phoenix to take in Mariner spring training in suburban Peoria so when I got back after baseball and sightseeing it was a little too cool to take a dip so I can't give you my take on that but the pools looked inviting and they have waterfalls that cascade from one pool to another. There is even a water slide...so needless to say for kids this is a very cool place. There are also tennis courts and a golf course. I liked it that you could walk right off the resort property smack dab onto a desert hiking trail. I checked it out at dawn one morning and met up with some sociable rabbits. Another unexpected bonus..because Arizona had more than its share of rain this winter there was an abundance of wildflowers on the trail. The Pointe is like a Spanish village stuck velcro like on a hillside with fountains, tastefully landscaped, manicured lawns and gardens with all kinds of cacti, trees, and lovely flower beds. The Pointe has restaurants and bars. You have a Walgrens, MacDonalds, gas stations, and two supermarkets less than a mile down the hill on 7th. Unfortunately there is but one sit down restaurant in that neighborhood...Pinky's Cafe. I had breakfast there one morning (I was but one of two patrons in the restaurant ...a red flag I chose to ignore) and my scrambled eggs seemed to take forever to prepare no doubt coming from incompetant chickens so I would suggest you avoid the place.
