On the other hand Eddie and Mike's Pizza next to A.J''s Foods (in the strip mall to your left just before the traffic light at the bottom of the hill) is not only the most immaculate pizza parlor I have seen in a month or so but the pizza is very good and is alledgedly the "world's best". I don't know about that but it is tasty and besides, the poeple who serve you are nice. I thought this was an excellent value especially for families and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. The staff will see my face there again.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights at the end of February 2005, with a family of 4 (two kids aged 6 and 9). The one bedroom suite in building 5 of the Hidden Valley was classy, fairly large, mostly quiet and spotless. It was a bit tricky to find our room, even with their map. We got a package deal thru Costco Travel for around $550 for 3 nights. The beds were extremely comfortable. Be sure to ask for a room near The Falls if you have kids, as this place covers a lot of real estate and has hills and stairs. The restaurant near the pool had excellent food (from the kid stuff, burgers, exotic drinks to the spa-like salads) and the service was above average, especially Summer. The prices were quite reasonable. The restaurant near the golf course had very tasty food, but the service was a bit slow on both mornings and the one night we ate there. They seemed to be short staffed in the mornings. The breakfast buffet was outrageous at $18 for adults, but a steal at $5 for kids. The quality of food on the buffet was very good. We ate at the Mexican restaurant one night and it was reasonably priced, good service, but the food was only okay, not great. It was more of a sports bar atmosphere. The pools were very clean, uncrowded, plentiful and beautiful. We loved hearing the waterfalls. We took one look at the water slide and did not try it. It appeared too narrow for adults, and our girls were not interested in a dark fully enclosed black pipe. There were 2 boys around age 11, who were really enjoying it, however. We liked that we were able to borrow tennis rackets and balls and introduce our kids to tennis. They let us take the kids for a ride in the golf carts, also for free. Both my dad and my husband went for a 4 mile hike around a butte right from the door of the hotel. They said the views were very nice. Down the street a bit is a Starbucks, Target, Chili's, Boston Market, El Pollo Loco, and Sonic Burger. We also did a day trip to the Squaw Peak Point Hilton where there are reciprocal privileges. We had a car so we drove, but they have free shuttles between the hotels available. The Lazy River was as warm as bath water and only 3 ft deep (safe for our 6 year old). The current kept us going for about 15 minutes around the loop. We were not charged for the inner-tube. It was also not very busy at this Hilton. We played some miniature golf, and again no charge. Their water slide was fun for my 9 year old, but she said the water was cold (it was only around 65 degrees air temperature that day). They did not have much pool side service, and the food was not as healthy as the Tapatio. There were nets up for water volley ball. Their wild west theme was pretty cute.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janiekins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week in a Presidential Suite - it was very nice. Staff were very accommodating. Great hiking trails right in back of hotel. Only negative - the hotel is a little dated. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tapitio Cliffs for three nights on a business trip. The staff were extremely friendly, helpfull and eager to please. The resteraunts at the resort are all top notch and the rooms are very nice and clean. The resort itself is in a beautiful setting and there is plenty of hiking and golf to keep anyone busy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay there again when in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Too busy and outdated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night [and that was enough]. there's no room when you pull in by car. Your vehicle is offered to be 'valet' parked. they sent us to our room in a long roudabout way which took a long time to get to. However, we discovered how short a distance we actually were from the lobby, yet it took a five minute walk to get to our room based on their directions. The gentleman that valet parks was rather abrupt and unpleasant and not very professional; you expect at night]. The suite was outdated and old and we paid $199 for one night; which we felt was a rip off. We did find their restaurant [they have several] to be decent and pleasant for a casual dinner. It was too much of a fisasco to get to our car since they valet parked it, and yet we found it close to our room after we checked in. We would not go back again. Maybe 20 years ago it was a nice place but we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Ponite Hilton Tapatio Cliffs was outstanding. We were there for a conference which usually gets the OK treatment. But I can't say enough about the staff here, they were great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Tapatio Cliffs”
Reviews.Author: seinenb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a wonderful 5 day vacation at the Hilton Tapatio Cliffs in Oct '04 due in a large part to reviews on tripadvisor. The resort is spread out with clustered buildings of suites kind of built into the side of a mountain. The views are wonderful from the balcony almost no matter where you are facing. The room was nice and big and well kept. The pool areas were great and the waterslide was a lot of fun (even for the adults). The dining was good but pricey. I would recommend trying it, but then doing most of your dining in Scottsdale. Overall... great hotel for the upper mid price range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs. We chose the Pointe for its location and price and we were not disappointed at all. Just prior to our stay, I had read several very negative reviews of the resort and have to admit that I was a little concerned of what we would find but found those reviews to be completely out of whack. Although, the resort layout is definitely not for someone that may not be willing to tackle a hill or two. Our one bedrooom suite was very nice and we had a nice view of the valley. We had a car while on the property so did not use the services of the resort shuttle, however I noticed others using the service and they had very prompt response to a call for a ride. The resort pools were all wonderful as was the fitness center. We dined at the Pointe in Tyme restaurant and enjoyed our meal. For a truly relaxing vacation, I would definitely choose to visit Tapatio Cliffs again.

Reviews.Title: “outdated and not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First.....it started with what was suppose to be an early check in, confirmed reservations were for 11am .... did not get in room til 2pm...... was a romance package which was to include champagne in room upon check in..... no champagne until 8pm that evening.......package was also to include breakfast ....breakfast was charged to our room. Staff seemed overworked and unfriendly. Presidential suite was nothing more than an outdated over rated suite. I would not recommend this resort nor would we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star but nice”
Reviews.Author: CJThompson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were impressed with the staff, courteous and helpful. The resort is located 1/2 way between Phoenix and Scottsdale, which makes things very convenient. Our room is comfortable and clean, with a nice view of the valley. Problem: Being on a hillside made walking to even simple things inconvenient. You need to call the hotel shuttle, which is nice,free (of course you had to tip the driver) but during busy times you were waiting a while. We were on a "Bounce back" promotion that included a very generous and delicous breakfast. Disappointed that we had to pay $9.99 a day for internet access which is almost common place to be free or at least wireless is free. Ok, but probably wouldn't stay again unless there was a major promotion at $219 a night this isn't a bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews? Here's why!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a huge older property with a variety of accomadation types. At best it's a 2-3 star resort. There are alot of amenitites which will give you the impression that this is a great 4 star resort... it's not. It's carved out of the side of a rocky hill/mountain. There is no natural beauty anywhere to be found. The hillside suites are small, offer no view except of the parking stalls and other buildings. The views you do get are of the burb's rooftops, lots of city lights at night. Hiking trails lead to dirt paths... I have seen the desert, this isn't it. The highway runs right past it... it is NOT REMOTE in the sense of being off the beaten path, it's just inconvenientley out of the way. There are residential subdivisions and strip malls at the bottom of the hill. You might as well be half way up the space needle in Seattle. What ever desert terrain is left is devoid of life. I'm sure at one point, this was a wonderful spot surrounded by natural beauty but unfortunatley urban sprawl has taken over. The resort has not aged well either. The rooms are terribly outdated in decor, layout and size. Even the "updated" rooms have a bandaid feel with their mismatched furniture... this was done on the cheap. Everywhere I looked, I saw cheap fixes... the fountains patched with cement, the lobby terra cotta floor painted over to look new!... layers of paint everywhere...nothing flowed. Now if all this didn't catch your eye AND you got a cheap web rate (perhaps something you would pay at a 2-3 star hotel), you probably gave this place a positive review. However if you paid more than say $99.00/night then you felt ripped off like I did. I could have paid the same price and stayed at the Wig Wam (also an older resort but gorgeous) but was seduced by the phony marketing on the Pointe Hiltons' web site... thinking I was to expect 4 star quality... It looks good on the net but reality bites! The golf course is well manicured but it too has fallen victim to urban sprawl...traffic noise and backyard walls everywhere... too bad...it has some nice holes in the hills. We checked out early after 3 days of sunning and golf (that we did enjoy) and headed east to Fountain Hills. Ended up in the gorgeous Inn at Eagle Mountain...paid less too!! There are just too many better places to stay in Scottsdale and area that provide the 4-5 star experience. I've been on budget vacations and extravagant vacations... I didn't complain about either because I got what I expected. The Pointe Hilton is a fraud and that ticks me off. Stop pretending to be something you're not. You should be described as a larger perhaps upscale Ramada.Go on the cheap or don't go ... I think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “ewwww, very ewwww”
Reviews.Author: ihearttravel
Reviews.Content: like the name, this resort was ewwwwwwww, very ewwwww. I expected a great resort like many others in Phoenix. Boy was i wrong! From entering the lobby, i noticed that it was like a ramada inn or something pretending to be fancy. The rooms were up many narrow hills and 18,000 miles away from the lobby. The buildings reminded me of a motel 6 or soming. The parking spaces in front of your room were compact, and nobody took care of your luggage! Once i entered i noticed the carpet was horrible, the desk was beat-up, and the couch looked like something you'd find in a rotting basement, it was also very uncomfortable. halfway between the living area and the bedroom is the bathroom, some bathroom. The sink's not even in the bathroom, it's in a scary place, and the room with the toilet and shower/tub was extremely cramped. The shower was pretty bad, but the toiletries were okay. I expected a wayyyy better bathroom then what i got, something like the heavenly baths at Westins. The bedroom was quite bland and the bed felt like it was made from super old mashed potatoes, that bad. the mattress even slipped almost completely off in the middle of the night. The tv was ok, like it didn't get many channels, but i guess the ability to play N64 was good, although go to any holiday inn and you get that. The balcony.... had a sorta pretty view of other hotel buildings. but too small, take two steps and you fall over the edge....ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh....................................................................smash. Down at the main pool, i found out it was purty darn not that great. Fun noodles were like 4 dollars and inner tubes were like, 8, to rent. kinda stupid. the service for drinks, pretty good drinks, and food, eh food, was extremely slow, but the cabana was quite nice though a little more cramped than others. The pool was actually very small and everything else was extremely basic. There were other pools around here and there, but they were very travelodge-ish, and required many people to walk up 84,614 flights of stairs to get to any. Back at the room, we had both a scorpion and cockroach, not what you'd expect from a 'great' resort. It's location was inconvenient, far away from much, and kind of around a not too great area, but also still ok. Anyway, i recommend flying out of tapatio cliffs to Sky Harbor, as it is a long drive to anything else. Bottom line, it ain't great-a... stay somehwere betta.

Reviews.Title: “Good pools at”
Reviews.Author: adcosta2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tapatio Hilton from 11/29 - 12/3. Staff were very friendly. Dinners at The Pointe Restaurant were good. The View Restaurant offers live jazz beginning on Thursday nights, but when I went, the restaurant was reserved by a private party. The fitness center ($11/day) offered good equipment, but the tiny co-ed sauna and steam rooms and lack of locker rooms left much to be desired. Though I liked the layout of the suites, the TVs and bathrooms were smaller than expected. I'd try other comparably priced hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the other Phoenix Pointe”
Reviews.Author: Jerri_Blank
Reviews.Content: I had an executive suite, it was very comfortable. Very spacious, nice fireplace. The view wasn't great. Bed was comfortable. The layout was great, the room was well appointed. I'm not sure what the previous review was going on about saying it was on par with a Motel 6 - I disagree definitely. l also stayed at the Pointe Squak Peak the week before, this one is much much better.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A glorified 6 Motel (complete with popcorn ceiling, views of other people's rooms, old dirty and outdated decor - who cares if they're suites when they're as bad as this). If it didn't have great views from its so so restaurant atop the hill it would be no better than a roadside dumper. The Travelodge crowd should (and obviously does) love it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Delightful resort! I was just sorry that I was here for business and could only stay one night. I hope to come back one day with my husband for a thoroughly relaxing stay. Tastefully decorated, immaculate, excellent service, courteous staff, nice touches (a towel rolled up neatly at the end of every poolside lounge chair), excellent & reasonable restaurants (best margarita & salsa I've ever had), attractive and well kept-up health club, and pretty pools everywhere. Kudos to the management of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pointe Hilton from September 2 - September 6 for $89/night. Great place to stay. Our room was right by the Health Club/Pool. We ate at Pointe in Tyme and it was great. Spread out, but there are shuttle busses. Very busy on the weekends and parking is difficult. Can image in the summer it can be very busy with families. If travelling with kids, ask for room by the Fall Pool. If no kids, ask for room by one of the other pools. Even if you don't eat at at Different Point of View (we didn't) drive up to the restaurant and check out the view. Hotel is pretty central to many of Phoenix and the Valley sites. We are planning on going back. Hopefully soon!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Both pluses and minuses at Tapatio Cliffs...”
Reviews.Author: skistopalms
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but I cannot agree with the excellent ratings some have given this hillside property. On the plus side, the hillside European village layout of the property is charming, the pretty entrance and lobby have an upscale feel, the staff is friendly, caring and helpful (5-star quality!), and the suite-style rooms are spacious and clean -- except for patio furniture which was too dirty to use. But, the first room we were given smelled so overwhelmingly musty that we asked to be moved. Our 2nd room was better, but still had a bit of that musty smell, which the staff said comes from the A/C when a room is unoccupied for awhile. Our other disappointment was dinner at their La Cantina Mexican restaurant, where the cheese had an odd (cheap) imitation-cheese taste and texture. If you are traveling with children, then the water park and reasonably priced 2-room suites (we paid $104 on an August weekend) may override any other factors. But, if you're picky, as we are, Tapatio Cliffs Resort may not meet your expectations in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Pointe Tapatio and had a wonderful time with our 3 teenagers. Our room was quite away from the main swimming area but it actually was nice because it was so quiet. The staff offered us another room closer but we decided to stay where we were and glad we did. The work-out center pool (open to all) just outside our door was perfect. We had a wonderful view of the mountains and the nightly lightning storms. The entire resort staff was friendly and helpful. The food was certainly good but it was nice to have a car and enjoy other restaurants nearby. We purchased our trip package through Southwest Airlines and we couldn't of asked for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: WJTaylor
Reviews.Content: This is mighty unfair.....but we came here from The Hilton El Conqistador in Tucson and loved that so much that I can't give this full marks ! However. great Falls pool area and fitness facilities and location nice, away from the urban sprawl that is Phoenix, whilst still only minutes away from downtown if required. On the downside, the rooms had external doors and the balconies were very poor, most facing parking lots and many with big brick walls obscuring view. We like to breakfast on our own patio/balcony when on vacation, but this was not possible at tapatio Cliffs. Very good.....but no El Conquistador !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brockey
Reviews.Content: We stayed there August 22 .The hotel is very clean and lots of things to do. When we arrived they had us way on top of the hill. We ask for another room closer to the adult pool and the gave us a great room. The grounds are lovely. They also have a little gift shop that opens at 5:30 for a quick breakfast you can take back to your room...cereal, muffin and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch family resort!”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to vacation! The standard room is an embassy-suite style standard suite (separate bedroom/living room areas, nicely decorated and very comfortable). The staff if very friendly. The grounds are beautiful and there's tons of stuff to do! This is the most kid-friendly resort we've ever been to... there are free activities throughout the day for the kids and on Saturday nights they have a free pool side "dive-in" movie, there are about 8 pools, a water slide, and water falls and fountains located throughout. The kids get a free welcome gift. The only drawbacks are the cost of food (although this is typical of these types of properties), and parking is a bit of a hassle... but you can valet for the cost of a tip if you chose. They could use a few more strategically placed elevator too (depending on your room location you can be in for a bit of a walk if you need to use the elevators). Overall this was a great experience, and given the great deal we got through Hotwire at $75/night it was pretty amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in the summer if you have kids. You can get a great rate (I think ours was $79) and the pools are fun. They also have daily activities for the kids. We asked for a room in the main hotel because walking from the outer rooms to other parts of the resort can be a challenge due to steep inclines. This is an older resort so the decor is outdated and nothing fancy, but we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort”
Reviews.Author: 2kids2dogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights June 25-26, 2004. We got a great rate through Hotwire. Earlier in the week we stayed at the sister hotel, the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peake. The suites looked identical, however, the couch in the living area at this hotel did not convert to a bed as it did in the other hotel. This made our sleeping arrangements with the children very difficult. In addition, 'children eat free with a paying adult" was adverstised, but did not apply to all the restaraunts on the grounds. We were unaware of this policy until the check came at the end of our meal. The pools were nice but not anything special compared to the water park at the Squaw Peake resort. The pool deck was crowded and we were unable to find even one lounge chair for our towels, etc. I think this resort is not as child-friendly as the Squaw Peake and would not stay here again with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Exciting”
Reviews.Author: milhouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before moving over to The Phoenician. While not bad, it certainly lacks many of the finer qualities of the area's better establishments (Four Seasons, Phoenician, Fairmont Scottsdale Princess). Located in a so so area of North Phoenix. The room itself had a popcorn ceiling and poorly textured walls. It struck me that if 6 Motel ever decided they wanted to go "resort" style this would be the place that they would open up. The comforter and bedding, as well as the entire interior, were all standard Hilton - nothing to connote the southwest (the comforter was a loudy itchy green floral print). The wash basin was also located in the bedroom (not in the bathroom) which struck me as odd and does not help matters when one person is an earlier riser than another. View = My wife and I were given a view which overlooked a parking lot and other peoples balconies. It's a good 20 minute drive to the center of Scottsdale (if you're looking to dine at one of the many fine dining spots in the Scottsdale area). While not bad for families looking to save a little, it is not the luxurious resort for which it bills itself. And it is far, very far, from being even one of the top 5-6 resorts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this Mediterranean style resort. The water areas were beautiful, the rooms were very comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the spa was amazing. The restaurant at the top of the cliff was amazing with live music and a flawlessly prepared meal. Every course was delicious, the view and the patio outside the restaurant were exquisite, and the staff was perfectly trained. After extensive traveling I have to say this is one of the most romantic and charming hotels out there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: PSUDanO
Reviews.Content: Accommodations:4 * Service:4 ½ * Food Service:4 * Facilities4 * The Hilton Tapatio Cliffs is a 4 star + hotel/resort. I have not enjoyed a comparable-quality hotel stay, Priceline or not, for the last two or three years. The facility, while not new, is well maintained and clean (on Saturday I watched janitors clean the men’s room by the pool 5 times in 3 hours). The level of service is excellent to outstanding—the two or three “not so happy” staffers were by far the exception rather than the rule. The pool areas offer a wide variety of clean, well-maintained facilities satisfying both adults and their kids. And the food service throughout the resort is excellent. Tips: 1. If you can swing it, ask for a room in the Hidden Valley area—that’s closest to the Falls Village pool area, and it puts you a couple of stairways away from the Hidden Valley pool—great when you get sick of lots and lots of kids. 2. The Concierge staff here is excellent and straightforward—you can rely upon their advice. They also have a list of bonded babysitters whom they can recommend to you. 3. If you can afford it, try Different Pointe of View—the restaurant is awesome for its view and cuisine. If dinner is too much for your wallet, they have an outside lounge where you can get a drink and an appetizer. This is a great choice to get a real “desert” experience while being close to PHX and Scottsdale. A Keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aurie1020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday (6-7-04)from Tapatio Cliffs resort and had a wonderful time. The Falls Village water park was GREAT! It seemed like there were pools/Jacuzzis everywhere! The resort and rooms were very clean. Request a room by the falls if you plan on doing lots of swimming, otherwise you may have to walk a bit. Also, we went to Walgreens and purchased a small cooler and bottled water for a fraction of the price you would pay on the resort. You definitely need to drink LOTS of water with the high temp. Everyone at the resort was extremely helpful and friendly. The food there was great...a bit pricey but very good. There were some wasps outside of our room so we called to have them removed. They were very quick to respond to our concern and removed them promptly. I would have to give the resort a high rating and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic 4 nights at Tapatio. We were very pleased with the suite, the grounds, the numerous pools, and the dining. We never had a bad meal. My wife and I were on our first trip to Arizona after many trips to Mexico in search of sunshine. The shock of not going "all inclusive" hit us a little, but we were still extremely pleased with our stay there. (There's just something about getting to your destination and never having to open your wallet again!!) We also took advantage of going to their sister resort "Squaw Peak", but were not as impressed with that site. We are already planning our next trip to Tapatio!! ** One note..... it is not close to anything, so plan on renting a car during your stay, if you want to see any of the surrounding area!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but Squaw Peak has the edge...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs May 6-11, 2004 for the first time. The suite was spacious and immaculate. Loved relaxing by the pool at The Falls as did my kids (ages 5 and 8). The slide is a blast. The food and drinks we ordered poolside were fine. There are an unusually high number of bees by the pool, so beware. The hotel is not in the nicest part of Phoenix. Driving from the Skytop airport to the hotel was depressing. Thankfully the hotel is very nice for a few days of relaxation. Visited the sister property, the Squaw Peak, and would have stayed there had we known. In short, everything was better (location, appearance, pool, the mini golf on premises, the tubing down a lazy river, the kids). If you're looking for a more relaxing time go to Tapatio, but if you're travelling w/kids, do the Squaw Peak.

Reviews.Title: “Must read if you are considering this Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I felt I must submit. We have stayed at this resort 3X in the past 10 years. Our most recent to celebrate our 10th Anniv, incorporating a family vacation. The grounds are fabulous. Our room was cliffside with a view of the Presidential Pool on one side & panoramic view toward the west from our bedroom. I do feel the rooms are overpriced - the resort is beginning to show it's age - but I would still go back and always look for a good deal. Older people or anyone who is not physically fit should demand a Main Building room - the resort grounds will be a challenge otherwise. Getting around in your auto and parking are obnoxious - but unique and should be approached without expectations! I love a Diff Pte of View - however, not a family restaurant! My 17 yr old son could not find anything on the menu that appealed to him and the "expert" service made him uncomfortable. Very, very pricey, but my meal was fab. In a nutshell, this resort has something for everyone - romantic or family oriented. The Resort Golf Course is one of the best that we golfed, so do not disregard as an option. I agree with most of the reviews that if you can eat somewhere else - do it. It is very expensive at this resort (BLT poolside is $12 with automatic 18% tip)

Reviews.Title: “Better Places to Stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ltp_tango
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the summer of 2003 because a friend had a free voucher. Visitors to Phoenix and Scottsdale, please note: there are MANY, much better resorts to stay at than this one. This is an old property, with some maintenance problems. The water features are nice, but just average for Phoenix. This resort is kind of far from most tourist attractions, etc. For the money (about $100 a night from Memorial Day to Labor Day), try the JW Marriott Desert Ridge (which is a beautiful new resort in north Phoenix). All of the Phoenix and Scottsdale resorts have water features and most have golf courses, too, so shop around. It is a buyer's market with resorts in Phoenix during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Liars!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelChicago
Reviews.Content: After looking thoroghly at the website and review my family and i were expecting an amazing resort. We were WRONG!!!! The drive up to the resort was nice, lush and tropical. The taxi let us off and we had to drag out luggage into the lobby where we were greeted by a maid. The FD was nice but put us in a room 1 mile away from everything after a constant request to be in the main building do to my sons knee injury. We were then left to find our room dragging our luggage (no bell boys). Our room (pool view) ended up being a low floor room next to an airconditioner with a view of a bush. Then after demanding another room they moved us to a 1/2 way decent room near the lobby and the "adult only" pool. The room was narrow and no where near the "suite size" advertized online. The decor was tacky and cheap looking the bedroom area was so small you could barely fit through. The bathroom go so steamed up during a showee that you couldnt breathe.The "water park" was awfull it was a small pool with a waterfall nothing fun and it was so overrun with little noice kids we stayed for 15min and went to the adult pool. My kids were (15)(13) were depressed. The next day we left for scottsdale and stayed at the four seaons and loved it.STAY AWAYWere ritz people we made and error hope you dont

Reviews.Title: “Love the resort, rooms mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a week at "The Pointe." The pools and the views we all loved especially my six year old. He had a blast. I enjoyed walking around the huge resort. We took SO MANY PICTURES. The Pointe is clean and the pools are abundant and beautiful. The location is great, close to Scottsdale (we went there a few nights for dinner). I was a little disappointed with our room however. I'm really ease to please I usually never complain but we had a running toilet that I had to call about several times. I also didn't love our view. We overlooked a parking lot. The room itself had a bizzare layout and I would rate the actual room medicore. However, the resort, the views, the pools, the lobby, etc etc made the weakness of the room go away. The pools are great for families. In short here is what you should stay away from @ "The Pointe" and here is what you should enjoy. Don't go to there Mexican restaurant. It is a poor man's sequel to Taco Bell and it is pricey. You should order lunch at The Falls (poolside), It is pricey but it is good and the service it great. You should drive up to a "Different Point of View" (Restaurant at the top of the Cliff (great views) take a view pictures up there. Everyone goes to "The Falls" (we did most of the week BUT the secret here is to go to the Family Pool. It is less crowded and it is beautiful. Try to get a room in the Cliffside or Mountainside area.. Don't get a room near the falls unless you want to overlook a parking lot and have your toilet running throughout your stay. In summary it was a lot of fun and I would go back. I would follow my own advice though. If you have kids who love fun in the sun this is a great place to get some r & r. Outside of the resort make sure you hit a place called "Rawhide". It is a hoot (old western town we did there cookout and enjoyed the steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “A great ACCESSIBLE getaway”
Reviews.Author: kadie28
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Tapatio Pointe Hilton Resort. It's a great place for kids and adults alike. There were days we wanted to spend at the resort itself (it has 8 pools - 4 small/fairly private with hottubs and 4 large with hottubs, 2 at the water park, one large family by the lobby and one large adult only pool with bar access). The resort has hiking within walking distance, stables next door and an award winning golf course. The food was tremendous though pricey as you would expect from hotel restaurants. They have a morning brunch that's DELICIOUS! The views, the hiking, the restaurants (four that I remember), the service, and the pools make it a memorable trip. It's also conveniently located - close to the airport, and almost all of the baseball stadiums are within 25 minutes drive. Scottsdale is close enough to visit and have lunch/dinner there as well. The Zoo and Botanical Gardens are about 25 minutes away and the travel is beautiful by Camelback. I would recommend a stay here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My college age daughter & myself spent a 3 day weekend in March 2004. Lovely property. Especially enjoyed the adult only pool, with great food and service poolside. Found conceige to be very helpful with directions for shopping. Also, took advantage of the on-site spa. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “5th time here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th visit to a Pointe in Phoenix - 3 to Squaw Peak and 2 to Tapatio Cliffs. Reading some of the other reviews might make me choose a different location. But some of the reasons we choose this again and again are the very reasons why others disliked it. To each his own, I guess. We love the fact that this resort is on a cliff side - you can go any city and stay in a hotel that has rooms side by side down a hallway with an elevator. This one has meandering walkways and driveways with various sized buildings scattered over the side of the mountain. We actually stayed quite close to the Falls pool but took 1-2 walks everyday just to explore the grounds - my kids loved it and we went a different direction everytime. The kids were never bored there - lots of activities or just playing in the water. We have recommended this place to over 10 families over the years and all have loved it. Also, be sure to visit the pool at Squaw Peak - more of a 'water park' and quite busy - but again, the kids will love it! True, the prices aren't cheap, but we always go over spring break - the prices aren't cheap anywhere Phoenix - but that is what you have to pay to get out of the snow! Mini-bars are what you would expect in any hotel - if you don't want to pay for them, don't use them! Pools are all for no additional charge. The only "resort charge" is for the fitness center and tennis courts. We used both of these everyday - well worth the $9 per room fee! Restuarants are typical hotel cost and quality. Again - what were you expecting? We ate breakfast there everyday because we were anxious to get to the pools and activities for the day. At night, we generally chose to go "off-campus" and experience someplace else. Phoenix is not so big a town that you can't drive to very nice places within a short time - and while you are driving it gives you the chance to see the rest of the city. If you want to be pampered - choose one of the $400 per night luxury hotels. If you want to have a great family vacation and experience a unique location in Phoenix with something for everyone to do, choose the Pointe at Tapatio Cliffs.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and an Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband (boyfriend at the time of our trip) and I stayed at the Cliffs and loved every minute of it. We were there during March, which is a very slow time of the year due to the cooler weather, but we didn't mind that when we came from snow. We rarely saw anyone else and felt like we had the entire place to ourselves! It was so romantic and we had a great time! Like any other hotel, you're better off finding local places to eat and to stop off at the grocery store for snacks and beverages. It was a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long weekend the end of January. I agree with others who rate this resort as average. Our room was nice with views, but it was a long walk to get to the lobby, restaurants and golf. Because the resort is build on a hillside, we had to walk down numerous stairs and take and elevator in an adjacent building. Finally, we just drove to save time. The restaurants are very pricey with mediocre food. I was charged $6.50 for a margarita in a plastic cup and a simple lunch cost us $35 with tip. We recommend you eat out. One reviewer mentioned El Bravo at 8338 7th street and we tried it. Modest decor, but very good food (we eat a lot of Mexican). A local took us to another place nearby called Via Delosantos (9120 N. Central) that was also very good and lots of fun. Margaritas are $2 and better than at the Hilton. The dinner for three was cheaper than a tuna sandwich lunch at the Hilton. If you like Mexican, both are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tapatio Cliffs over the Christmas holiday. Rooms were spacious, well maintained and clean. Service was excellent from front desk to bell boy to pool staff. Location of room was great. Parking was tight. Would highly recommend this location to anyone with children. Our kids, age 9 to 5, enjoyed it thoroughly.
